Then, someone - presumably the manager - came instead of our original server and we were told a new lobster plate would be served 'in just a few moments'...yet even after having the chef come out to reassure us, I did not receive my new lobster until 10:05 PM. I waited well over half of an hour for the new lobster plate. Admittedly, I was slightly pissed when our original waitress came out with the lobster just as we were getting ready to leave, and asked if she could box it up. I felt like telling her to take the box and shove it!

It was simply because by that point, we were very tired and tired of being at the restaurant where things had gone from bad to worse. After having at least four different waiters, three of which were aloof and annoyed, and terrible service along with mediocre food, we wanted OUT. Thankfully, the lobster was taken off of the bill, yet for a less than satisfactory evening we paid close to 80 dollars. 

The bottom line: Do not waste your time at this restaurant. Food is a hit or a miss, unpredictable quality and service! There is NO consistency with service and food at Doc Magrogans. Please save your time and money and go to a refutable and classy restaurant such as McCormick and Shmicks or someplace else decent. This restaurant is best for those who want to mess around at the bar and order apps vs. for a group or party coming for a nice lunch/dinner. (And on a final note, I feel it's good to mention that if you're looking to be able to hear by the end of the night, AVOID AVOID AVOID.)

I was a little sad to know that my local Chinese takeout spot was no longer there.... But am thrilled to welcome a Korean mixed rice bowl takeout!!! I heard there were going to be other new additions to the menu and I can not wait. I got the beef bibimbap and there were all different kinds of vegetables: red cabbage, bean sprouts, carrots, broccoli, mushrooms, zucchini, and cucumbers. I picked beef which tasted like bulgogi (Korea. Style sweet/soy marinated beef) and it came with a perfectly over easy egg on top. The red sauce that was on the side was perfectly portioned (even though the guy gave me extra) i could see it being a little spicy for people who can't handle the heat so just be cautious and taste before you mix!!!  For $5 it is definitely worth it. I'll be back again for sure!!!

Every single thing we had here was delicious! Must try the fried tomato skins, they are something I've never had before and wasn't sure what to expect but they were definitely delicious! The sangria was perfect, from the actual sangria to the cinnamon/sugar rim on the glass, it was just amazing. The pizza was tasty as well, crispy crust with savory sauce and the perfect blend of cheeses. Even the house salad alone was scrumptious. The blend of the oil & vinegar dressing was delectable. Everything was above my expectations and we will definitely be returning on a regular basis.

Last time I was there, It was DREADFUL. We waited 45 minutes to an hour just to get service. I am not trying to be (insert correct nomenclature here) but everyone who was attractive (e.x. looked good, mainly women with big chests and men who looked handsome) Got served. They even brought out this desert thing that, quite honestly, looked great and offered it to everyone else but our party. We finally went to the bar and the bartender was dismissive, he wanted us to get our drinks and leave. By this I mean I ordered 2 oyster shooters, as on the menu, and was about to order more drinks for the rest of my party and he was already talking to someone else. We flagged down a waiter, who was quite friendly and asked us how long we were waiting. He got us our food in maybe 10 minutes, and the food itself was good, so there is that. But otherwise, unless you are a 20 something who is "attractive", don't expect to get served here.

P.S. There was a time previously when we went there and they were DEAD, It was a great time, we got served quickly and had a great time with the bartenders.

Food was good but service was the worst. The front doors enter into a bar area and there was a big crowd, very drunk, and they all turned and stared at us like we were entering a private party. Then one guy tried to fight my boyfriend simply because we looked at the guy. We were then seated far away from that area and were told they were out of bread. It was 8 pm on a Saturday night.  Ok, fine. Ordered meatballs for an appetizer and they were tasty. However, our waiter seemed to drunk and was talking to the table near us about how much he had drank at the hockey game earlier that day. And to top it off, there was a bug in our water glass. Good was good not great and good prices for big amounts. Maybe you will have better service? Overall, not impressed and will not return.

Great food! Omg the sandwiches are giant. One offset is a meal for two days! The bread is great, it's not rubbery or tasteless, and has great texture. First time here and I'm very impressed. They sell all kinds of items in the store from wines, olives, calamari, bread and pastries. Definitely recommend.

Hidden just off I-65, this Sonic seems to come out of nowhere.  The food is standard to what you would find at any Sonic Drive-In across America.  I do like the fact that they have a true drive-thru window at this location.  The food is always fresh.  The staff is always nice.  They wear roller skates, too!

AMAZING FOOD, GREAT COCKTAILS AND FANTASTIC SERVICE


Every single decision made for this restaurant was the exact perfect choice. The food is the best in Philadelphia and the cocktails pair perfectly. The style is inventive with the backbone of authenticity. If I had three meals left in my life, I would eat here 3 times.

First off Roman was an amazing server!!!! The bread is to die for and everything was amazing! We made our own pasta and it was fabulous. The tomato basil soup is also so good!!!!! Highly recommend this restaurant

I had a much better time than I expected given the 3 star rating! The food was delicious and in large portions, enough for two meals. The service was amazing, we had a very attentive server who refilled drinks and took away plates before I even realized that i needed a refill.. I recommend this place over Olive Garden and think it deserves more than 3 stars :)

If you like things healthy, authentic and naturally flavorful, this is your place. I highly recommend the chicken bibimbap and cinnamon ginger tea. I don't detect added sugar anywhere, just clean fresh eats.

I would rate this as my personal favorite bibimbap I've ever had in the US. I've had it all up and down the east coast, mainly in the DC/NoVa area where I'm from.
Great wings, crispy and meaty.  Upstairs is for the younger crowd, downstairs for locals.  2 pool tables and American dart boards.

Instead of ordering delivery from this place make a reservation at a nice fancy restaurant in center city.... You'll save money 

Pizza wasn't bad tho

Excellent homemade ice cream! I had a waffle cone of Cake Batter and wife had a Coffee sundae w/vanilla syrup. Both were fantastic. The line moves fast. We will definitely return so we can try something new next time. Thanks.

Pretty good preparation on the salads BUT the lady that runs it can be very moody at times almost to the point of being rude. Her husband is a sweet heart. One time the women was extremely rude and had the nerve to charge for an extra butter. So when you go inside you pick the size of your salad and then either you can get bread or a banana but this time I ordered the bread and I must say they're bread rolls are really good but the little tub of butter they give you is not even enough to butter the whole bread so when she charged me I was a little taken back surprised to say the least. Love their salads that's why I rated them them a 3. But their customer service I would definitely give them 2. Size of place is nice.

So, I just moved back to Florida from Northern Virginia.  Felt the need for something different for lunch today and popped in to Zio's and am I glad I did!  What to order, what to order . . . homemade Italian sausage (sweet, not hot the first time around) with peppers and onions.  First of all, half a sub is still HUGE and I could only eat half of it; secondly, it was absolutely delicious.  Sadly, this place is too close to my new house - my hips and thighs thank you.

By the time we got here, our bellies were pretty stuffed. So all we ordered were two cookies: the Chai Snickerdoodle and the Peanut Butter Brittle. Both were simply delicious. The snickerdoodle was thick and puffy and soft - and filled with all the warm spices of chai tea. Meanwhile, the PB cookie had rich peanut buttery flavor, but with the sticky, hard crunch of the included bits of peanut brittle. 

We sat outside on their lovely patio and wished we had room to eat more!

Ahh what can I say?  BAP is truly a  hidden gem on South Street.  The food is absolutely delicious and satisfying.  They provide the perfect portion for such a reasonable price.  The sauce they serve is out of this world and keeps me coming back for more.  The owner is the sweetest man-- always friendly and serves with a smile.  I visit BAP every Thursday (sometimes more)!  My favorite, quick, take out meal!  Keep it up BAP, you rock!

Probably my favorite restaurant in Tucson.  The peppers, pasta and bread they give to start your dinner is amazing. I have tried numerous things there and everything is always excellent.  You can't go wrong with this place.  The only downside is most of the dishes are rich so either eat less or accept the calories with a smile. 

I recommend this place to everyone.  It delicious, reasonably priced and not pretentious.

Also their house salad dressing is really good.
Warm and friendly service!  I loves the spinach lasagna and the homemade tiramisu is so gooooood!!!!!!!  The price is unbeatable.

I keep coming back and keep loving this place. 

- Pricing is perfect.
 
- Service is perfect.
 
- Food is perfect.

Good Italian food in Lafayette Square. I have zero complaints!

Doc's has a a great ambience. From the gas lights outside to the warm woods inside it's a place that you admire the details while you eat. The drink selection is good and the menu had quite a few good choices. I recently had the lobster steam. It was well done and tasty.  The service was friendly, comfortable and attentive. Bottom line-  I wold go back when I want fresh raw bar seafood and a good place to enjoy a meal with friends.

Loved it!  Had chocolate overload and it was awesome.  My kids had chocolate mint, cake batter, and chocolate and they all were great. My husband had an expresso and thought it was really good.   Cute and quaint place.
I love this place. I come here probably twice a month. Quick, easy, healthy (relatively) and cheap (once again, relatively).

These two stars are for the outstanding ice cream; our TN fudge and Red Velvet were fantastic. Service gets zero stars. We walked in at about 3:45 on a Wednesday afternoon in December (about an hour ago), so it wasn't busy AT all. No one at all was in front of us in line. The younger guy with a chip on his shoulder and an "I'm SO over tourists" attitude barked at us when we asked what was in the different flavors of ice cream. Again, the place was empty except for us. It's not like we picked a very busy rush time to ask questions (And I'd point out that even if we did, it's not appropriate to be that cold to customers, regardless.) We had our two scoops pushed toward us. No one cared enough to point out where spoons were or anything. In fact, the guy "waiting on us" (using this term VERY loosely here) wandered away and we sort of stood awkwardly at the cash register until another employee noticed us and rang us out. Unreal. On our four day trip to Nashville, we stayed downtown and were treated politely everywhere we went. Except here.

I give the ice cream 5+stars, and the service zero stars. If you go, know that you might get awful service, but at least the product is great.

Not as busy as some of the other restaurants we saw in the French quarter but it should be. The food was really phenomenal and the service was great. It wasn't the fastest but my food made up for it. I got the shrimp dauphin and I loved it. Shrimp, Tasso, artichoke, with a Alfredo sauce spin. My mom got the fried shrimp and homemade onion rings and hers was so good too. We both finished our plates. If I lived here, I'd definitely be back but if I ever come back on vacation, I will be.

Nice pastry shop.   We went in for bubble tea after dinner at Wong Wong and left with drinks plus a bag of savory pastries.   The bubble tea is more flavor and less sugary which I like though my kids have come to expect a certain level of sweetness from their fruit flavors.  The boba were perfect, small & chewy.  The cups were smaller than most places but then again none cost more than $3.  In the evening Monday pastries ranging from $0.80 and up are 2 for $1.00, which is a good deal...similar to ABP's twofer sales.  I picked a variety of savory pastries and they were all tasty the next day - one difference from buns I've had  before is that I could see bits of onion inside the bun but not in the filling.  Will go back.

Went with my girlfriend and grandparents, who are quite hard to please. We weren't interested in the oysters, but definitely wanted some seafood. The crab cakes were great, the scallops were cooked perfectly. The soup was great too. Only negative was the vegetables, as they did not taste fresh, but were definitely edible. The wait staff was excellent(Tony). His recommendations were spot on and very helpful since it was our first time there. Being new to town I decided to sign up for their  Frequent Customer Program, and Tony even sent me a letter thanking us for coming in, which I thought was very nice. Definitely will be back when I want some seafood in town (or some late night drinks).

The Pearl-ein ansprechendes Restaurant in Treasure Island. 

Zählt zu den hochpreisigen seiner Klasse.
Für Heiligabend wollten wir uns das gönnen. Zumal nicht überall geöffnet war.

Die Reservierung war auch gut, ohne hätte es wohl kaum einen freien Tisch gegeben.

Atmosphäre: 4
Essen:3
Freundlichkeit: 4

Die Vorspeise war ok. 3,5*
Die Hauptspeise, die Linguine mit Gemüse, Aufpreis für Shrimps, vollkommen übergart. Bei einem Preis von 36$ nicht akzeptabel. 1*

Auf Nachfrage reklamierte ich das und auch die Linguine mit Lobster meines Mannes waren nicht wirklich al dente. 

Es wurde Nachbesserung angeboten, die ich ablehnte aufgrund des mangelden Zeitfensters. Mein vllt zu 1/4 geleerten Teller wurde dann u.a. auch abgeräumt und bei der "Saalchefin" vorgezeigt.

Auf der nachfolgenden Rechnung war mein Gericht dann gestrichen worden. Danke dafür! 

Hungrig in die heilige Nacht dank der Vorspeise blieb mir dann doch erspart ;-))

FAZIT: überbewertet!
Place is great.Just Andrea seems confused at best when doing cashier work.

Five ladies had lunch here this week.  Two of us had the quiche, others ordered a burger, an omelet and chicken salad.  All were pleased.  I thought the quiche was outstanding.  Actually, the best I have had.  We did wait awhile for the food to come to the table, and the restaurant was not busy.  The restaurant has a formal atmosphere -very nice.

In the middle of Saturday night frenzy of folks, food and music is a brightly colored ice cream shop. The choices of ice cream flavors was just enough to make a good choice quickly.. pralines and cream for me and blueberry cheesecake for my daughter.  So delicious - big chucks of cheesecake , fresh blueberries..  Staff was nice , swift and friendly.

Oh my gosh. The Tennessee fudge ice cream is gonna make you die of happiness. The scoops are huge! They also have chocolate chip cookie cones!! I didn't get it cuz I just had a large dinner but I would have! Next time! The decor of the place was cute too :)

I went in today and tried the make your own Sandwich Bar. The sandwich was delicious I got the pork belly the only thing I needed was some salt otherwise an excellent sandwich a little pricey but sometimes I'm worth it. Nice selection of gourmet food and wine a much-needed addition to Nashville.  Very friendly staff
Tasty place with lots of unique flavors. Decent espresso drinks to complement too. I recommend they move away from the plastic spoons and cups to cut back on waste.

Can't go wrong here. Old school scoop shop with a good mix of unique new flavors to go along with the traditionals. 
Typical was the nutter butter flavor that carried just enough flavor without overwhelming. Worth a visit

I have now been here 2 times. The food is amazing although a little on the salty side the sangria makes up for it! Service has always been with a smile we never felt rushed or forgot about! I have been in the hospitality industry for over 20 years and there is not much I can disagree with there. Keep up the good work!!!! P.S. Everyone rating on service you have to remember that servers and bartenders come and go try just judging the food.... Also TIPS means To Insure Proper Service and if your waitstaff doesn't deserve it don't leave it!

I went with 2 friends for dinner and not impressed. The shrimp in my pasta dish was still frozen and my friends dish came out wrong. We had to wait to remake the dish and then after buying a bottle of wine and dessert the bill was not cheap by no means! Even after talking to the manager they couldn't do anything but half *** say sorry!

MENU: To-go, host gave me a thick paper menu to look at. I was surprised not to see any pizza on the menu. I'm from CA, and the one we have has pizza unless it was a recent thing where they no longer serve pizza. Ordered the chicken marsala (which was yummy) and a new entre cannelloni Bolognese (which I wasn't a big fan of, I thought it would have more meat, but it was basically a cheese and spinach Italian cheesy omelette with some meat sauce spooned on top). Salad to-go was room temperature, lettuce was soft and limp and not fresh and crispy. 

PARKING: outside parking shared with a big outside shopping area across from Petco and a Brewing Co. 

OUTSIDE: location itself is nice in a well developed shopping/restaurant area. Your typical look of a Macaroni Grill. Lots of outside seating on their wrap around patio. Refer to my photos. Nobody was sitting outside though, which was too bad since the weather was nice. I like how to the right of the front door there are nice benches and shade in case you need to wait for a table or for your to-go food. 

INSIDE: like all Macaroni Grills, darker ambiance, but setup and décor was the same. Bar on the left. Hostess counter straight ahead of you. Double door entrance as you come in with a second door to open. 

OVERALL: A-OK. Nice that they have to-go option and curbside to-go option. I was disappointed about the cannelloni, but even more disappointed about the salad. Usually salads are chilled.

We drive by Roman Forum on Dale Mabry, at least once a week since they have opened, about 6 months ago. To be honest, we have been skeptical of this restaurant, mainly because of the appearance on the outside. We decided tonight, the Monday after Easter, to give it a shot. The 

This place is huge inside and VERY clean (and empty -Monday after Easter).  We were immediately  greeted by a wonderful waitress.  We were amazed by how large this restaurant was. There is a meeting area (Civitans were there tonight), a bar area, a children's area, and a lot more seating! 

We ordered the eggplant balls (fritters) and a large pizza. Both were delicious! The fritters seemed to be made fresh and the pizza's crust was very light. Our waitress said that  the recipe was from the owner's family. It was probably the best pizza crust I have had in a LONG time.  The pizza was lightly covered with tomato sauce, and had just the right amount of toppings.

All in all, I definitely recommend this establishment. It is not like any other  Italian restaurant!!

Our experience started by being sat at a table with a dirty tablecloth. The hostess looked at the olive oil stain and shrugged, sat us anyway. 

The server was friendly but slow. My husband and I both ordered the clam chowder unfortunately our waitress had given us the wrong days soups and there was no clam chowder. My husband changed to the roasted mushroom, which was nothing but mushroom gravy in a bowl with added garlic. I was glad to have cancelled my order! 

My penne rustica must have been sitting under a warmer all day! I are not even 25% of it. My husband had a meatball, sausage and ricotta pasta (I don't remember the name). The positive note was although it all tasted canned and the ricotta far a funny texture it was at least edible. 

$54.00 lesson learned, if you want generic everyday Italian Olive Garden will do.

Wawa overall is pretty good, but this location leaves a lot to be desired.  If you are there at night and are hoping to get a stuffed pretzel, forget it.  This Wawa only ever stocks the heated tray items twice per day: Breakfast an Lunch.  The Deli almost always forgets an item for your sandwich, and the workers are not theist friedly people.

Besides those two quibbles, this is a typical Wawa.

For a long time, I wondered how long downtown could be without a legitimate ice cream parlor.  Being a local, I've gone up and down the streets adjacent to Broadway, and there was nothing.

Then, almost as if by magic, one day Mike Ice Cream appeared.  Mike's, I was informed by the pretty girl behind the counter, was owned by the same people who own the Sip Cafe in East Nashville.  And, in fact, most of the ice cream is made in Sip Cafe's kitchen there.

Once you taste it, you know that it is NOT the generic stuff you find at the ice cream places connected to grocery stores of the thirty-some-odd flavors place around town.  Now, it's not Ben and Jerry's either, but they're not trying to be.

Mike's is that locally-owned place that everyone knows they can go to for good locally made ice cream.

The old-style ambiance, the central location, and the good treats make this a place you should be willing to step over to once you're done at your concert, sporting event, or night on the town.

I'm not overstating: this is the best Japanese restaurant I've been in the United States. From the beautiful design to flawless food, including very nice service, it was a perfect dinner. Miso soup is fantastic, the rolls were amazing and the kobe beef niguiri, so good!

Before leaving, the waitress called the owner to greet me and I even got a small dessert on the house. 

The only bad thing about Tuna Bar: it's too many miles from my home in Orlando. I could eat here every week if it were not by the distance.

YUM. YUM. YUM. Really cute ice cream shop around the block from Broadway.

First off, our server was so friendly and patient! He let me try a couple of flavors before ordering, and let me tell you, given how many yummy flavors they have it's really hard to choose. I ended up getting the white chocolate banana pudding ice cream on a sugar cone and it was so amazing. There's lots of chunks of banana, white chocolate, and the pudding throughout the ice cream. It tasted like authentic banana-not artificial banana flavoring (which is key with anything banana). 

My fiancé got a chocolate milkshake and he loved it. Another thing worth noting is their selection of hot chocolate. They literally have every and any flavor imaginable, and if I wasn't craving ice cream so much I would've tried their hot chocolate.

The next time I'm in Nashville I'll definitely stop by Mike's Ice Cream again, and if you're in Nashville and happen to be craving ice cream, Mike's Ice Cream won't disappoint!

Good variety of salads, smoothies, and sandwiches. Not the super-upscale, organic, kale & quinoa type of choices; however, chopped fruits and salad ingredients looked fresh and they had many options, including soymilk, whey protein, yogurt, orange sherbet (but not the wildberry listed), & peanut butter. When I asked if I could substitute honey (which was listed as an ingredient in my smoothie), I was told the smoothie would not have had honey, anyway, so I couldn't substitute anything for it. Smoothie was good, nice texture, not too sweet.

Place is clean, with tables to sit. The older couple that was working when I went were efficient. Refrigerator for bottled drinks. Takes visa/MC/Disc/cash (no sign for AmEx). Nice to see a place like this in town!

I dream about their biscuits now! And the butter and jam they serve them with are outstanding as well. The fluffiest warm biscuit with butter from the happiest cows it seems like, and raspberry jam with a hint of thyme. I don't think anyone does biscuits better than Helena!
Everything we've tried so far is really good, can't go wrong with anything here.

The first time I visited I thought maybe it was me so I figured I would give them another try. Nope  not me. 

The fried pickles and french fries were good. Probably because they have seasoning. 

I heard the fish n chips was good but I normally don't get that at a sports bar. I really had my mind set on wings. I guess the only seasoning on the wings is the sauce. 

I tried twice... ‍

Horrible experience!!! We made reservations in advance, and the table still wasn't ready when we arrived (we were a party of eight). The manager was rude to the first two of our party that arrived and brushed them off when asked about our table. 

The drink order got mixed up and it took over 20 minutes to get a draft beer (the place was not that busy). We ordered two appetizers and all our entrees, and when the appetizers came it was only one. Later the waitress came back and said they were out of the second appetizer. After about thirty minutes half of the dinner orders came out, and then the waitress told us they were out of one of the dinners we'd ordered. Another fifteen minutes later and still half of our party were missing their food, the waitress came back and told us they were out of yet another one of the entrees we ordered. 

The waitress said the manager was going to come and talk to us, but she never did and in fact, it looked like she was avoiding us. Finally, I got up and found the manager, told her about everything that had gone wrong and told her we were leaving. As we were putting on our jackets the manager finally came by and hastily apologized and said she'd checked with her "sub-manager" and they were comping the partial meal we'd gotten, which is hilarious because there's no way I was letting any us pay after all the screw ups on their end. 

Oh, and did I mention that the couple at the table next to our group seemed to be having the same kind of problems, but the manager managed to go over there and apologize and even sit with them for a bit. This is probably the last time we ever try to go here for a group outing (or even as a couple).

Plenty of ice cream flavors to choose from, and plenty of options.  The line may appear long but it moves pretty quick.  Prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly.  Definitely recommend checking this place out when you're in Nashville.

Stopped here on a late night before catching a movie. We all ordered burgers and fries, the food was OK nothing special. The woman behind the counter wasn't friendly at all. They had a few stools we thought we could eat at ..but the place was so cold inside we opted to eat in the car. Like it's the dead of winter an even the woman behind the counter was wearing a coat which is unsanitary. It was sooooo cold the cheese on my burger was not even melted. I'm sure there are other burger joints on main st. Maybe we should have stuck to the pizza!

Love this place! I have been going here since a little girl, and will continue to go there. Best Chinese food in Tucson.  The owners Billy and Ellie are personable, and they remember who you are.  Staff is wonderful, everything on the menu is delicious.  Definitely a great place to go :)
This place has been great every time I've been.  They have a huge selection of pastas (and a lot without meat, which I appreciate).  Their house salad dressing is sooo good.

Phenomenal & worth the Drive from Tampa!. What a find! Cesarina is phenomenal - so good, we went there twice in one day. Our first visit was for lunch - and the sandwiches were HUGE and super-tasty! Mom's eggplant calzone was beyond fantastic!

I hate for the owners to read this, but they could easily raise their prices $2 / sandwiches.

We went back to score some take-home dinner. At $5.99, how can you beat a heaping and delicious serving of traditional lasagna and spinach lasagna. Their red sauce is dee-lish, and the bread is awesome!

We will be back many times! One of the best places in Tampa Bay! Don't miss it!

Terrible Brunch...simply terrible.
We were the first people there at 11 when they start service and we had to chase down someone in the back to seat us even though we had 11AM reservations. Then when we ordered from the small brunch menu 20 minutes after ordering the server came back to tell us the main offering Omelette with Asparagus will need to be broccoli because they never got asparagus. We were fine, After my first cup of regular coffee and 35 minutes later when I finally was able to stop the waitress to ask for more coffee, she brought me a cup with lipstick on it...not mine. When I asked for a new cup 10 minutes after that when I could finally stop her again, I was told there was no more regular coffee only decaf. 45 minutes in we still have no food and now no coffee. And this is the first meal of the day and I have a toddler. When the meal came one hour and five minutes later, my lemon poppy pancakes were flat and rubbery..small and with a side of hard, bitter pineapple. My husband said his omelette was passable but with broccoli which was not as nice as asparagus would have been. We were there two hours and if it hadn't been for the lovely company we were with for brunch or the sunny gorgeous day...I would have put up a stink. Instead...I won't be back for brunch!
They sadly closed today at 4pm. Rip to Tampa's best ny style pizza. Hopefully someone can take the recipes and open a new spot

Mike's is exactly what an old fashioned ice cream shop should be.  He offers the basics as well as ice cream made in-store, sundaes, Italian sodas, coffee drinks and more.  Mike's has free wi-fi access (though it isn't posted) and just about the friendliest staff you'll come across downtown.

Mike's is just a short distance from the Frist, American Apparel, countless of honky tonks, bars, tourist hotspots and countless other points of interest.  In fact, Mike's makes a lovely afternoon treat, and if you're up for a bit of walking, you can hit about a dozen neat spots before your ice cream melts!

Mike's gets a bit busy from time to time, but the ice cream is genuinely good and worth the wait if you aren't in a rush.  While there are probably two or three spots in town that have better ice cream, I doubt you'll find a nicer staff or better location.  Either way, it's a perfect spot to take the kids.

Very delicious ice cream all freshly made, and well worth any wait. I recommend the red velvet cake ice cream. Make sure you know what you want before you order; the place gets very busy at times and they like to move things along.

Food was very good until I found a wasp in my twice cooked pork. I was enjoying my food very much until I found this and I'm not coming back. I would think to find a hair but a wasp? Please make sure this doesn't happen to anyone else!

I have now been to Ricardo's twice; once with a group of aunts/cousins and a second time for a graduation dinner.  Each time, the staff has been incredibly attentive and accommodating.  Both times we had larger parties and they were so flexible in terms of splitting dishes, providing extra plates, etc.  They also allow you to order a half portion during their dinner hours which I really appreciated! 

The food here is delicious! I have sampled their salads (House, Spinach, & Caesar), some of their appetizers (calamari), their entrees, as well as a few of their desserts and have been very pleased both times.  Their menu provides a wide variety of basic Italian dishes.  In my experience, there has always been something for everyone.  Their seafood canneloni is delicious but definitely a little bit rich.  I would recommend sharing a half or full portion with a friend.  I have also really enjoyed the Linguine Louisa, being a big fan of red sauce, mushrooms, and eggplant!  

So, in conclusion, I would say four stars for the food, but five stars for the service and the experience.  The staff has made both parties I was with feel very welcome and taken care of.  We never felt rushed to leave.  Additionally, there is plenty of parking around the nearby Lafayette Park.

I'd definitely recommend Ricardo's, whether for a small or big group!  

**Tip: You can make reservations online ahead of time!**

Been standing here 15 min now. Three people ahead of us, one ordering five subs and four pizzas, line behind us, one employee, poor guy is behind the counter all by himself, making subs, running the register, washing his hands, making more subs . . . is it a good business practice to leave an employee all alone like this and at the dinner rush hour?

Hummmm.......can't decide if I will return here or not. Parked in parking garage and paid $9 for 2 hrs. , so there's that. Line for brunch food was long and moved very slow, very slow.  We had a group of 8 and had to sit in the hot humidity outdoors to find enough tables to pull together. When the crowd thinned out, and sweat was pouring, we all moved inside. It was so noisy inside that we could only visit with the person right beside us.  The iced tea was good (but refills cost and again you have to wait in a long line to pay for that!) as were the sandwiches and chips. The Frose was  basically frozen Rose wine and was nice but small and expensive for what you get.  So, I'm on the fence....sad that I have to choose a not busy time to want to come back!

I found this place near my work not to long ago and I am here almost everyday. If you love Italian food and sandwiches look no further! Great service, all of the employees are more than friendly and ownership makes you feel at home.

Only had the bloody mary, but it was pretty bad.  An oyster house should have a bloody mary that is defined as a meal.  There Bloody was basically Ketchup and Vodka.  Too sweet with no body.  

The bartender was nice and the service was decent.  I will try to go back and have some food, but will avoid the Bloody.  (inside tip: Roots Cafe just a block up makes a killer Bloody!)

Came out tonight for dinner. Split a salad which was tasty but could've had a little more substance. I didn't really see the "crab" that was supposed to be in it. I got the redfish pontchatrain which the veggies and potatoes were really good. Fish was decent. Not sure it's worth $32. My dad had a filet. It tasted good and seasoned to me but the meat was kind of tough for a filet and it was overlooked. The waitress said they would take care of it. We didn't really even complain about it- just gave our honest opinion on the dish. But the check came and it wasn't taken care of. I guess that's where my low rating comes from. Don't say you'll comp something and then not comp it. I thought maybe she just didn't put my to go order on the bill to make up for the steak "comp" but it turned out that she just forgot to put my to go order in all together. So then I had to re order my to go dish for my mom after we had finished dinner and waited another 20 minutes after our meal for it. And then she kindly brought me the check for the to go plate. Little confusing but whatever. Maybe I'll come back to give it another chance.

Really good ice cream spot...such interesting and unique flavors.

This place was so good, we actually went there twice during the trip!  I had the following flavors and loved all of them:

Nutter Butter
Red Velvet
Banana Pudding

This ice cream is rich and flavorful without being too sweet.

This place is so authentic, we've based a lunch taco club around this place.  Many of the local chef's (and some not local) make the trek over for lunch.  

I've got a client in Mexico again, and I tell you with all honesty, this is authentic.  Like I said, forget English, and forget take out.  

Remember, simple taco's are about the sides.  Pile on the sauce, onions, and cilantro!

Mike's dishes up excellent ice cream across a broad spectrum of flavors at reasonable prices, and that's frankly all you need to know. Get yourself in the door!

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

Unlike some of the new-age ice cream spots that have sprung up across the country (Salt & Straw http://www.yelp.com/biz/salt-and-straw-portland-2?osq=Salt+Straw and Smitten http://www.yelp.com/biz/smitten-ice-cream-san-francisco-3 come to mind), Mike's is your traditional ice cream parlor right in line with some of the gems in New York and Chicago. The flavors are on the board, the cones lined up in their stands, and the servers fast and friendly. What more could you want? Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

Very much unlike the new age spots, the prices at Mike's couldn't be more affordable, and my single scoop in a cone, which was sizable as you can see in the picture, was priced at only $3.50. That's value. Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

Before going into my actual Caramel Cone selection, I'll point out that Mike's wins when it comes to flavor variety. Simply too often I've rolled into modern ice cream or gelato spots only to find that I either have basic chocolate and vanilla to choose from or some kale and blueberry goat cheese nonsense. Mike's leaves the gentrification at the door, offering up a huge selection of classics, contemporary flavors, and combinations of the two that are sure to satisfy anyone. 

My caramel cone in particular was very, very good, with the right ratio of caramel to cone and ice cream. Single Star Granted. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

As far as I'm concerned, Mike's is the best ice cream in Nashville, and a classic like this would easily secure my patronage daily. Star Granted.

Oh my!  To celebrate her first teenage birthday, my daughter chose Cheeseburger in Paradise...?  Since it was her birthday, we figured, what the heck.  Arrived and were seated immediately.   Took a while for the staff to realize we were there and it appeared they may have forgotten throughout the night too, thus explaining the very slow service.  Considering there were only a few people at tables, that's the only excuse I think might apply.  Had the popcorn shrimp and queso (not necessarily together)  Not bad but basic.  I had the Baja burger supposedly with jack cheese, jalapenos, shredded lettuce and sour cream.  It had cheese and some mixture under the cheese.  The cheese didn't appear melted nor was the burger hot, warm was even a stretch.  Good fries though.  My wife had the fish sandwich.  She was concerned as it was tilapia but still tasted a little "fishy".  For tilapia to be fishy...?  Same experience with my daughters burger.  When she doesn't even eat half of it, goes to say it wasn't very good.

Just not up to even an average rating.  So many options in the area, no need to stop here.  Oh, by the way, apparently Thursday night is Karaoke night so be prepared.

Really enjoying this new find for breakfast. While it is rapidly becoming our new "go to" for breakfast, it does not come without some flaws. 

The French Press coffee for 2 works well. Good flavor while being nice and hot. Enjoyed  the hash with a poached egg on it. My husband loves the breakfast burrito with avocado, egg, chorizo, cheese and potato.

We strive to find dog friendly, outside areas with shade and this is about as good as it gets in town. Rarely do we have to wait for a table and all outside tables are shaded. 

The downsides- paper plates and plastic utensils..... I am not a prude but this just makes less formal and delish-- also we talked to the manager about the coffee mugs. There is absolutely no way to carry this mug OR drink from it without burning your fingers. We even had the manager try it.  He absolutely agreed and said he would replace them immediately. Nope--- nothing yet and we now wrap our fingers in napkins to protect them.

3rd time ordering out and the sushi was just disgusting. I ordered the spicy tuna roll and the tuna tasted like it had been sitting out in the sun rotting for days. It was not fresh and it tasted horrible. Last time I ordered I felt sick after eating the spicy tuna and I'm afraid I'm going to feel sick again after having one piece. Very disappointed and not going to order again

3 pastries for $1.25 after 7:00 pm!  I love coming here on a Sunday and stocking up for the week with a box full of rolls and custards.  The baked goods here are always very fresh and consistent.  I'm a big fan of the egg custards, which have a layered, flaky shell, and the coconut milk buns.  The cakes are better at Greenleaf's but the breakfast pastries here are excellent.

Came on a Sunday for brunch. First impression was confusion with two entrances and people did not know where the line formed. If you want to order breakfast, coffee, wine, you stand in the front line. If you want to order a salad, walk to the back of the restaurant. If you want to order prepared foods for later, walk to the back of the restaurant. No signage or direction was really given.

Ordered the fried prosciutto sandwich with spinach and poached egg with a side of parmesan potatoes. The hizzy (husband) got the brunch burrito and jalapeno grits. I asked for hot sauce and was told to go to the front to get it. Very inconvenient. They only have ONE bottle of hot sauce for the whole restaurant by the entrance. Not even by the eating area. And it was empty.  While my fresh food sat at the table 75 feet away, I had to wait for someone to refill that bottle. Like had to go to the back and refill. No extra bottles anywhere. The sides were both delicious! Although, jalapeno grits need some spice. I tasted no jalapeno. False advertisement. The potatoes were yum. My sandwich was less than desirable. Not very flavorful. The burrito was very good! Meat filled and a good blend of flavors. Prices were affordable. The huz thought they could have charged more for the burrito, but was happy they did not.

The chairs and tables are so pretty, but the chairs are too short for the tables. Now, I am short so this is exaggerated for someone like me. My husband who is almost 6' tall felt the same way. He actually mentioned it first. It is nice to have pretty decor, but utility should be first for a restaurant. We did not like the flow of the space. That line is really blocking the rest of the restaurant off. It was just awkward. 

Parking is definitely an issue, but if I lived close by, I would totally walk in for a salad or prepared meal. Just be prepared to drop some cash. $13/pound under 3 lbs of purchase for the prepared foods. $11/lb if over 3 lbs. Whole foods and Turnip Truck is almost half this price for the prepared foods. 

Maybe dinner would be a better experience?

Went over to Subway last evening their were 2 employees in the store the guy was just standing their ehile the female waz doing all tbe work I went to the restroom 2 people in line same issue I left the store

Undercook and overpaid! Got a pizza and it wasn't even fully cook, pretty gross. We were between Little Caesar and Dominos, thought we'd pay a little more for a "better" pizza WRONG. Should have gone with a $5 pizza that was cooked.
Ice cream is pretty good and the espresso is ok. I recommend the black cherry. Bathrooms are clean and service is pretty good.

The store itself was beautiful, clean, and spacious. We ordered at the sandwich station and the gentlemen told us where to go to pay, which was so helpful as first timers. The turkey/apricot sandwich and Cuban sandwich were delicious. The dessert, charcuterie selection and wine area were awesome. 

The zucchini sandwich, however, was really disappointing. As (I believe) the only vegetarian sandwich on the menu it should consist of more than just zucchini and cheese on thin bread. I would equate it to a "tea sandwich" or finger sandwich. It absolutely needs something else on it or at least heartier bread. 

I agree with a prior comment that all the sandwiches are on the small side and should come with a deli side or chips considering the cost.
Awesome treat in downtown Nashville. Line moved fast. Kids got ice cream & I got a frozen coffee. Daughter got a raspberry truffle scoop. Really yummy.

I've walked down Race many times, but never noticed St. Honore before. I asked the woman at the counter if they were new, but she gave me a polite smile and no answer - either there was a communication gap or she couldn't believe that I was so clueless (seeing as how Yelp reviews date back to 2008, clearly I am just  unobservant). 

I ordered an Egg Tart and was pleasantly surprised that a baked good was still so moist at the end of the day. The crust was sweet, light, and flaky and the egg filling was the perfect consistency - definitely one of the best I've had in Philly. Now that I know this place exists, I'll be back to try some other baked goods.

I've been going to Ricardo's for years, and am so saddened to have witnessed a steady decline in both service and food quality. 
So if you are one that likes good service you may be very disappointed. Long waits for drinks, bad timing on expediting of food (ie; apps show up just before entrees) have become the normal experience for us. 
Food quality, both is taste and portion size, has suffered too. Meatballs once the size  of baseballs are now more like golf balls.  The hand toss pizza (we had one last night) wasn't hand tossed (so perfectly round and even it couldn't be) but some store bought shell, void of flavor. 
I'm hopeful things will turn around,  for this family ran restaurant, as they are my favorite kind of place.

I love Roast, it's my place to escape during a crazy day at the office. Yes, it's quite hipster but I still love it. The brick walls, the pressed tin ceiling, the local artwork and the reclaimed wood tables -- and of course the coffee. I was disappointed when they took their maple bacon latte off the menu, I think that drew in a lot of people here. But they said it cost too much to keep on the menu, unfortunately.

I still enjoy the chocolate cherry latte, it's not as sweet as it sounds. The pumpkin pie latte is also good, and I hear the chai hot chocolate is a treat too. The toasted marshmallow latte is quite sweet though, just to warn you. For a cold option, I like the coconut frap .. it's nice and light, not too sweet. You can switch between cold and hot for most of these options though.

I've always found their pastries to be delicious and never stale, unlike other coffee houses. The lemon swirl is to die for, if you like a strong lemon taste -- lots of flavour in every bite, with chunks of chewy lemon. Yum! The cinnamon swirl and chocolate croissants are also tasty. I was sad when they discontinued their key lime cookie, those were delicious! Unfortunately it wasn't popular enough so they took that off the menu too.

Go earlier in the day if you want to score a pastry with your coffee, otherwise it's usually just sandwiches left by the afternoon and I'm not so sure about those if they've been left out since morning.
I've been here four times already!  The sushi is fresh.  I really enjoyed the Fishtown Roll.

Working in Ardmore, it was only natural that I'd come across Ardmore Pizza at some point when considering meal options, and I've been consistently surprised at their excellence.

First of all, everything I've ordered from them has been damn good. I'm not big on pizza and their all-around variety is extensive enough to surprise me each time I look through the menu. Having an option to order online is also extremely convenient while I'm working, even more so because I'm a picky order and having a concrete list sent to the business ensures better accuracy with the order. Their delivery guys have always been prompt and courteous.

I read on here that they have difficulty getting people's orders right. I personally don't think that sort of thing should be a surprise; sometimes, a takeout place is going to get your order wrong. More importantly, it's what they do to fix it. On a few occasions my very specific order was improperly interpreted, so I sent them an e-mail. The manager promptly got back to me to apologize, offering for my next meal free. Both times following, my meal was free with absolutely no restrictions or irritations. Customer service like that is why I keep going back.

It's been our favorite Chinese restaurant for 18+ years. Cashew Chicken and Chicken Chow Mein Crispy are both outstanding. The Lemon Chicken and Orange Chicken (ask for the sauces on-the-side) are both very, very good. On any of their spicy dishes you can ask them to spice it to your heat preference/tolerance, so you everyone can enjoy their meal.

Authentic.  Delicious. The Green Eggs and Ham  their signature dish.  Just gobbled up the lemon blueberry scone. Outstanding.  They just need to offer Oat Milk for their lattes and all would be perfect in heaven!

Decided to go see the new C & B.  I have been to the one in Charleston.  Beautiful interior.  A little confusing as to "what is where".  Did not eat but bought some pastries.  My only real complaint is the parking.  There is none.  You have to park in the garage set aside for the apartments.  The apartments are not yet occupied, but I still had to drive to the 3rd floor and try to fit into a parking space that was designed for a Mini Cooper.  There was one small elevator which never arrived, so I walked the three levels.  I can't imagine how parking will be once the apartments, hotel and other retail stores are open.  This is not a knock on the restaurant but getting in to eat or buy food is not going to be easy.  It's just another example of the unchecked Nashville growth getting in the way of good planning.

I would give five stars, but I probably didn't try enough things to qualify. The sponge cupcake was really light, fluffy, and perfectly sweet. I also got some egg tarts, which my boyfriend loves, and he said they were perfect. It's cash only, they have some cheesecakes and such as well as Asian desserts.

I am here today from Atlanta. I was kinda bummed about an exam that did not go particularly well and then the sun started shining and  I found Cesarina's by driving by. I love to visit Italian markets while out of town. I could not check in on my phone though, because it says that they are closed. THEY ARE OPEN and ready to satisfy your tummy!

The food here is phenomenal. I had the lasagna with meat sauce and it is spot on. The bread is perfect in taste and not too crusty or hard. Topped it with some parmigiana that you are not going to find at Publix, Kroger, or any other store around town.

The people that work here are super polite and take good care of you. I have photos, but can't upload them because my phone has all the photos. YELP please fix the phone features for this business. Everyone needs to know about this place. :-)

I highly recommend it. I am Italian, my mom raised me on this exact kind of cooking. I promise you will not be let down. If you are Italian, you know the sauce has got to be right then you can eat it with anything. I could have made a meal out of just the bread and the sauce.

Starting off, the ambiance in this place is amazing for a date. I love the fireplace in the middle of the restaurant. The service was good and friendly. The Bread they start you out with is to die for!! I couldn't stop eating the bread! I ordered Shrimp Fettuccine Alfredo. It was yummy, but not enough shrimp in the dish.

Great meeting place in the mornings.  Lots of available parking and a great atmosphere.  The latte was really good and Roast has several different flavours that I can't normally find in the chain brands.

Service was really good and the drink was made quickly.  Wish they had a paper to read or Avenue magazine but there wasn't anything readily available, but that isn't a huge deal.

Seating is really comfortable and is far better than the mostly wooden chairs you find at large chain coffee shops.  I'll be back again and again.

If you absolutely have to go here for their mediocre food and their mediocre service,  BEG the Host/Hostess to seat you as far away from the bathrooms as possible.  They seem to have a problem with the P traps and every time someone went into the bathroom we were engulfed by the smell of sewage.  

My friend said her chicken cannelloni was quite tasty.  I didn't make it past some bread and a few bites of my chicken parmesean before someone went into the bathroom.  The rest of my dinner had to go home with me (then in the trash this morning...)

It still gags me just to think about it!

Totally rude guy that closes at night. It was not even midnight and when we tried to come in the cashier ran to the door and locked it in front of our face and put the close sign up deliberately avoiding eye contact. If you're open until midnight then customers should be allowed in until that time. At the very least he could have said sorry guys were closing up versus just locking the door in our face!

This is a pretty cool local bar. Went there on a Monday night, not a lot of people there at all. Bartender was good. We just had a few beers. They have a takeout beer section too. Highlights: 2 small size pool tables which were really nice. All the cues were pretty beat up though. They also had a shuffleboard table and dartboard. I didn't eat there, so I'm not sure how the food is. My experience was average. Since then, I've been here about 4 more times, pretty much only to play pool. It's a dive bar but the upstairs is pretty cool when it is open. (Usually after 7pm) They have another pool table up there too.
Update- we come here all the time now, honestly, the experience is hit or miss depending on the the bartender. Most are cool and do a great job, but some are so terrible it makes me not want to come back.

Tonight wasn't our first night here, but it was definitely our last.

I really like the lighting in this place, and that's about it.

The service was extremely slow and forgetful, we had about three different people randomly helping us, and still doing poorly. I got the veal, which was terrible. The pasta that came with it was even worse and I literally didn't take more than two bites.
The boyfriend liked his main course but his salad was warm and full of browning lettuce.
We were both seriously disappointed and wished we'd spent our money somewhere else :/
Their two person sampler is huge and absolutely delicious. A great way to taste different dishes of NOLA. I would recommend a stop for lunch!

I was out in Nashville this past weekend and was craving ice cream.  Without knowing anything about Mike's I walked in and looked at the different flavors.  I decided to go for the cornbread black berry ice cream in a sugar cone. It was so good!!! Ice cream is one of my favorite foods and I don't say that about many ice cream joints. If you're in downtown Nashville craving a late night ice cream, do yourself a flavor and check out Mike's Ice Cream!!!
Great bibimbap--fresh ingredients, well seasoned.  Plus I can walk to it from my house!  My partner and I both had the tofu bibimbap and beef soup.  Delicious!

We stopped in here on a trip to Clearwater Beach after seeing reviews in Yelp. We live in Kentucky but are originally from NJ and Brooklyn. Very much love the Mom and Pop Italian deli!  We got the Veal Parm sandwich and it was soooooo good!!!  Bought some Italian cookies and lobster tails.....thought we were back home at our fav deli!!  Lady at counter was very friendly and chatted with us and almost cried when she heard we just can't get good Italian food in Kentucky. She grabbed my hand and threw in extra cookies!!!  We will be back next time we visit!
Best ice cream. Only bad thing is that it is so crowded there is a line out the door and it takes a while to get your ice cream.  Strongly recommended if the lines aren't too long.
Mikey's is a great little ice cream/coffee shop. I had the cake batter ice cream and a caffe mocha, and they were both great. I highly suggest trying this place if you're in the Nashville area.

After walking all around downtown Nashville, my friend and I were beckoned by the amazing smell of waffle cones.  Feeling like the several miles we had walked earned us a tasty treat, we went right on in.
We decided on the handcrafted Tennessee fudge in a cup with a waffle cone "party hat," as our ice cream dealer called it, since we wanted to share.  It was the perfect balance of fudgey goodness, delicious vanilla ice cream, and crunchy waffle cone.  Absolutely delicious!!!

Make sure you tip them to avoid a mullet epidemic!
Terrific baguette sandwiches and pastries. Industrial funk atmosphere- friendly staff

It was frigid today and I was in need of a coffee to rejuvenate and warm me up! One cafe was closed and I went in here on a whim. When I saw their hot chocolate list I knew I needed to order a mocha. It was decadent, but not overly sweet. So good, and I loved the service that was given!
In town again for work and made sure I saved my appetite for the Philly Delish! Love this place and wish there was one near home.

Roast where have you been all my life! How do I love thee, let me count the ways!  1. Being surrounded by what seems like the most comfortable coffee shop seating in the city. 2. Nice exposed brick of a past era. 3. Reclaimed old wood flooring. 4. Down to earth extremely friendly staff. 5. A good mix of the business, student and everyone else crowd. 6. Cozy gas fireplaces. 7. An all around cool atmosphere. All these factors have a way of making 2 or 3 hours fly by. 

I got med coffee ($3) and a MAPLE BACON cinnamon bun ($3.75). Nothing here is cheap and admittedly the coffee isn't the best in the city. But I really love the atmophere.

My only complaints would be that the music can be a little too loud and that some of the tables are wobbly. However, this is one of my favourite places to meet someone for coffee.

I absolutely, positively, most definitely, unequivocally, with out a doubt, love Roast!

Totally worth it. I got the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake double scoop on a cookie cone! One of the bests everrrrrrrrr.

The chai tea was crap though. Well, not crap. It tasted like summer squash for some reason.... I like summer squash but it was such a highly unexpected flavor.

In town for the day and we were not really hungry enough for dinner so we opted for ice cream. Mikes had so many flavors to choose from but i opted for the red velvet hot fudge sundae, which was devine, and my son had the black cherry chocolate chip and said it was spectacular. They let you try as many flavors as you want and were super patient while we were trying to decide.  Certainly worth the stop if you are in the neighborhood!

I was born and raised in Alton and during high school, Tony's was the 'go to' place for the greatest pizza ever.   I don't live in Alton now and just visit a couple times a year.  Last weekend, 6 of us went to Tony's for dinner in the bar.  My 'local' friends, tried to suggest other places, but I was determined to go.  Since it was Sunday, the restaurant had a great pasta special--salad, pasta and glass of wine for $10.  The ladies in our group got the special.  The guys--one ordered a pizza, another wanted the portobello mushroom sandwich, and the other guy got a sandwich as well.  One of the guys also ordered a beer--from the list located on the wall.  The waitress comes back and first tells one guy- they are out of mushrooms, so he ordered another sandwich, the next guy was told they were out of the beer he ordered, and finally, the guy who ordered pizza was told, they were out of hamburger, so they could not make him the pizza with that topping!    Now how can a restaurant run out of hamburger!  And why was the beer they were out of removed from the chalk board sign?   Anyway, We plan another trip back next month, and I will not be returning.
I'm a foodie and this is a special restaurant. The Mai fried rice: I wanted to hug it and go to bed with it.  Everything is well thought out including the cocktail drinks.

Awesome, friendly service and rich and succulent food! Anything you order will be delish. Even the dessert shooters are great. I lovvvve this place. Would definitely drive from NJ to PA for a visit to Magrogans!

Really neat concept!  There is a small gourmet grocery. A soup and sandwich station, a salad station and a combination beer, wine and coffee bar.  Loved the frozen rose! They also have caviar plates and cheese plates to share.

On a hot day, this is the place to be in Downtown Nashville! Just needed a quick (and cool) pick-me-up, so I ordered the Pina Colada milkshake. Divine!

The place was busy with families, couples, and friends enjoying a tasty treat. Touristy, but definitely something to try!
Just had this pizza for the first time, and I'd say it is some of the worst I've eaten. It reminds me of cafeteria pizza. I'm sticking with Felicia's Pizza around the corner.

Sunset 44 is a true hidden gem. The atmosphere is relaxed yet intimate. Our waiter, Blake was attentive and friendly. The braised short rib ravioli was one of the best ravioli dishes I've ever eaten. I would definitely recommend dining here and look forward to trying the other dishes on the menu.
Amazing ice cream! So creamy.. I had the cake batter flavor it was wonderful..definitely don't hesitate to go here..

In the heart of downtown Nashville, on Honky Tonk Row... visitors and locals enjoy homemade ice cream of all flavors, day and night.  It doesn't matter what time of the day you decided to go, this cute little ice cream parlor is always packed.  Not an ice cream eater? They make great smoothies and lattes too!!  All treats are served with great, friendly service!!

Went here with some staff to de-stress after a long week. It was a good time. The owner is friendly and the cat-minder can tell you what cats are the most playful and who would rather be left alone. My favourite cat was a ten year old boy who liked meowing loudly and was down for a cuddle. 

They have a nice retail section with toys to bring home to to your kitties including cat wine! 

The precise of entrance to the cat room includes a hot beverage or Italian soda. The baked goods are amazing too. I had the sugar free raspberry soda. The cats like to play with the straws too!

Our first visit to Doc's was for Valentines Day Brunch. The atmosphere was fun and the restaurant was clean. My husband ordered oysters as an appetizer. He wasn't certain what type of oysters he wanted and allowed the waiter to choose; he was not disappointed. The waiter brought two kinds, each were extremely fresh and delicious. I ordered the poached eggs and crab cakes with hollandaise sauce. I am extremely picky when it comes to crab cakes and again they did not disappoint. Fresh, not too much filler and you could taste the crab! For desert we ordered the NY cheesecake... It was genuine NY style, with no gram cracker crust! All in all we were pleasantly surprised and will be returning!

While I've never tried their bao (and usually go to KC for that), they have the best egg tart that I have found in Philadelphia Chinatown! Not too sweet and a light flaky, buttery crust. That alone is worth a trip here.

First of all they sat us by the window and then they turned the fan on. The waiter Up sold this "amazing" toro tuna avocado tartar so we got it and then 25 minutes pass.. nothing. They brought us the sushi we ordered before our appetizers. The sushi was average, overpriced and nothing special and they didn't serve the sushi with wasabi or ginger... we had to wait 10 minutes to ask for wasabi. Insane. They then brought us the toro app after our entree and it was horrible. The toro was falling apart and did not taste like an expensive piece of fish should. The waiter had to come back without us even asking and said I'm so sorry the toro was not up to our standards we're taking it off the bill. We then ordered another roll to supplement which was fine. Overall a $108 meal for 2 worth $60. Not going back.

El "Dragon Chino" o "China Dragon" es un pequeño restaurante con gran sabor.
Siendo un restaurante de familia, "China Dragon" ha estado presente por 24 años, (como nos mencionó el dueño) ayer en la tarde que buscábamos comida China de calidad, el lugar es cálido y los empleados son amables, atentos y rápidos.

Ahora, a la comida; es bastante difícil encontrar comida china que no sea muy grasosa, salada o parezca que haya estado en un contenedor todo el día, en China Dragon ordenamos una orden de arroz frito con vegetales, 2 rollitos fritos y una orden de carne estilo mongol, con esto recibimos gratis una orden de frituras con cangrejo y arroz blanco (noto que esto fué para llevar).

En resumen, la comida es muy recomendable, y volvería a "China Dragon" cualquier dia si hay antojo de comida China a buen precio y gran atmósfera.


"Chinese Dragon" is a small restaurant with great food. Being a family-owned restaurant for 24 years (as the owner mentioned) we checked it out yesterday night for some fast Chinese food, however we noticed as soon we got there that the place was cozy and employees are nice, attentive and fast.

Now for food; it is difficult to find food in a Chinese restaurant that is not super greasy, salty or looks like it's been sitting in a container all day. At China Dragon, we ordered fried rice, 2 vegetable rolls and Mongolian style beef (It was very very good). With the order we also received a side of white rice, and crab puffs. (Note we took this order to go).

To summarize, I recommend the food and I would go back to "China Dragon" any time for great Chinese food at a good price and awesome atmosphere!

TL;DR verdict: lovely little place with good food.

Atmosphere: decorations were an interesting mix of tacky and elegant. The music was not the usual generic random-Asian-string-instrument, but J-pop! And artists I actually knew, such as X Japan and Hamasaki Ayumi.

Service: attentive, polite, helpful.

And the food! Yummy. (Yes, I went there.) I ordered an $11 three-roll sushi lunch, with East, Spicy Salmon and Eel Rolls. All were delicious, I didn't even need to wasabi or soy sauce. My friends ordered the cheaper yakisoba and shrimp tempura lunches, which were "quite good" and "great" respectively. The tempura breading was also "fabulous" but the sauce that came with it too vinegary. All lunch specials came with miso soup and salad, which were not outstanding, but satisfying.

Two appetizers, yakitori and beef negimaki, were also enjoyed. Great char on the bottom of the negimaki, and the presentation was fun. We only received two skewers of yakitori, sadly, and had to divide them; the chicken was somewhat bland but the vegetables (green peppers, mushrooms, onions) made up for it.

After our food was finished, or packed up in doggy bags (stapled even! how nice of them) we were handed a complimentary plate of fried(?) breaded(?) banana drizzled in lime(?) green sauce. Well, whatever it was, I ate most of it. Beautiful texture and flavor, especially with their lovely whipped cream.

Even after all that, we ordered a dessert to share- they have quite the selection! Thus, the deliciously decadent chocolate truffle, sized somewhat like a tennis ball. Composed of gelato and cocoa dusting, among other things, and topped with more of that whipped cream and a cherry- mmmmm. Next time, I want to try a bomba- and there will be a next time, if I have anything to say about it.

We held our family celebration for my father's 90th birthday at Sunset 44.The group was 30 adults and 14 kids. The space was perfect. We used the audio visual and had photographs and remembrances displayed. The meal was dinner salad, pork with chutney, with kids having chicken and sweet potato fries. All were served hot and delectable. Service was great. They were there when you needed them but not intrusive. There was a mix up on the cake - we didn't order one - but the staff pulled off a last minute substitution that saved the day. The space allowed the kids to run around and have fun without making the parents crazy. Over all everyone had a great time!

Stumbled upon this little gem after having Pho with my friend from work....I had a slice of cake-- 95 cents! Where in the world can you still get a slice of cake for 95 cents?? It was very light and fluffy, almost like angel food cake with super light frosting.

Outstanding in every way. Kristen was extremely attentive and all the staff as well. Food outstanding and they brought me a sample of the red shrimp dish, all I can say if that for this So Cal girl used to shrimp, it was one of the best ever. Since I can get that at home I opted for the Porkchop arguably the biggest one you've ever seen so it would require 2 to 3 appetites. Again another outstanding dish. Truly everything including vegetables potatoes salad was five star. And then to top it off They had a classic guitarist who entertained the entire time. As a single female traveler it was an awesome experience

I went here numerous times as Chumley's, but this was my first visit as the village tap room. Summary: go for the Thursday night 1/2 off scooner drink special, don't eat the food. 

The beer special is decent with a fairly good selection. The beers are expensive straight up ($6-8), but you can drink a scooner of craft beer (32 oz) for $5. 

This last visit I didn't eat my meal. I ordered the steak burger medium with chipotle salsa (I was experimenting). The steak burger was well done as was my friend who also ordered medium. The buns were the cheap, wonderbread, kind you get in the 12-pack for a block party bbq. The chipotle salsa appeared to just be some salsa from a common brand container. This all cost me $9, which was ridiculous. 

The restaurant was pretty much empty, but I'm not that surprised. Come here for the drink special before it goes out of business!

This place is pretty chill as a bar.  The music isn't so loud that you have to scream to be heard, and there are two different seating areas for different moods (the college kids tend to hang downstairs, the older crowd in the sports bar-ish area upstairs).  It's legendary with WCU kids for its $5 fishbowls, some kind of gatorade and who knows what concoction that gets you good and drunk for cheap.

This is definitely a locals' bar. It was my second time there and we went for a surprise party. The bartender, Betty... AWESOME and so creative! She makes awesome drinks and shots! Everything was reasonable pricing and we enjoyed it there. Loved their wings/pizza rolls. Delish! My friends didn't love this place, but I think it's who you're with to really enjoy to place. Once you get a few Cotton Candy or Dirty Girl Scout shots in, you're having the time of your life!

I like the smell of an ice cream parlor. It is a small little place with not too many seats, but that's what happens downtown. They had several good looking flavors, but I chose a red velvet cake that I actually saw a picture of on here and it looked so good on the picture. It wasn't too bad. Nice little place, I recommend it.

After our disastrous dinner at Sbarro, we decided to stop for some ice cream on the way back to the hotel.  Fortunately, Mike's Ice Cream was able to salvage the night.

From the pleasant ambiance of an old fashioned ice cream parlor to the great ice cream, you cannot go wrong here.  Between the four of us we had vanilla, mint chocolate chip, dark chocolate toffee, and pistachio and all of them were fantastic.

Stop here for great ice cream and a fun experience!

Great ice cream! So creamy! Not a lot of indooor seating but they do have a bench outside where you can sit and eat your ice cream. They have lots of flavors to choose from! Prices are not bad at all! They have lots of other things such as coffee, and milkshakes too. Next time I'm in Nashville I'll be back!

We had a wonderful catfish dinner with fries, cole slaw and corn bread.  The fries were to die for.  Really, one meal would be enough for two if you were not super hungry.  The service was excellent with great atmosphere and great music.  The manager was friendly and made sure everything was to our satisfaction.  Dinner was reasonable for the french quarter.

I tried the tasting menu.  The ravioli were good. It came with a Caesar salad, and fettuccine Alfredo. Tha main coarse was chicken Marsala. I didn't much care for the chicken Marsala. Everything else was good. I usually get the spaghetti and meat balls.  Those are great. I think I am going to stick with that next time.

Here in 3/2012, had the tuna martini to start- very good, great portion size for an app- then had the lamb tagine for dinner- excellent! great service from nick- ask for him as your server n he won't disappoint :) food was worth the extra $

If you plan on eating at Ricardo's, I encourage that you call in a Togo order. The service is PAINFULLY slow. I live in the neighborhood, and I have dined in a few times. Every time, without fail, the service is unbelievably slow. They are not well staffed, unprofessional, and even when I made a reservation specifically requesting a table with less traffic, I was seated at the table in the middle of the room right next to the dining room entrance. While the food is very good, it is not worth the experience.

Ok, yes this review is long overdue.  It is for our Mother's day experience.

Pros:  great wine list

Cons: the food, TV, service

So we went there for Mother's day, because everything else was booked.  This place was PACKED!!!.  we still had to wait 20 min for our table with reservations. PISS ME OFF.  We sit down, and there is a TV in the dinning room. in the bar I can understand, but in the dinning room of a supposed fine dinning restaurant [(TACKY)that is a complaint I have of St. Louis establishment's there are always TV's everywhere, WHY?  I like to talk to friends, shoot the sh**, you know chill, if I want TV I will go home or to a sports bar to check out the game)] . I am back, sorry.  so this is a buffet, but even with the buffet I, took forever to get a cup of coffee, I mean seriously, WTF are you doing?  You can't get me a cup of coffee in a reasonable time?  As for the food, the eggs were overcooked, the desserts were frozen, out of a box, biscuits and gray were OK.  There was a large selection, but I was not overly impressed, for what we paid.  Because of this experience, I don't think I will visit for regular service, sorry.

Went to Mahony's for dinner with my daughter while we were in NOLA. We ordered the shrimp and fried green tomatoe po boy (actually shared it-split in half) because it was huge for just one person. I ordered the spicy potatoe salad and my daugher ordered french fries.

Service was awesome, we were greeted by the lovely hostess and our server Cookie provided us with top notch service and had a lovely personality (southern hospitality).  The restaurant is very nice, classy and modern.  

We also ordered dessert bread pudding with ice cream.  This is not your regular bread pudding. It is made somehow like an ice cream cake with carmel drizzled on top ( I requested on the side).  It is to die for.  Everything on the menu look great and tempting and the portion sizes very large.  We enjoyed every bit of our dinner and can't wait to return in the near future.
Where else would you go for seafood on Fridays during Lent?  Great food, great service.  All of the staff were friendly as usual.  We'll be visiting again soon.

Starting with the positive, the Cuban egg rolls are great, the homemade chips and wings are good (that all comes on one appetizer). The negative is very, very slow service and very pricey. It was $85 for a family of 4 with 3 soft drinks and water, 1 appetizer and we each ordered a meal. The rest of the food was only average. And the menu has changed, so what you see online may not be what they actually have.

Very disappointed! We were so excited to see a Macaroni grill on our visit this time, we had eaten many times at the macaroni grill in the Bay Area and were never disappointed. This time however we struck out! We ordered the lobster bisque and one of the bowls of soup was served cold while the other hot! The soup was extra salty and did not have even a hint of lobster in it! When this was brought to the notice of the manager she kind of blew it off as oh well yes we keep the soup in the fridge so that it doesn't spoil, also saying she had never had lobster bisque with lobster in it!! Then she reheated the soup in the microwave and returned it Luke warm. The rest of the meal was so so my lobster ravioli was also served partly hot and partly cold like it had just been reheated in the microwave !! Not going back to this location for sure! The servers however were polite and did their jobs well!! I think they need a quality check for sure!

Tony's is known for their pizza and it did not disappoint. Great atmosphere no matter where you are in the restaurant. They also had a very decent beer selection, serving craft beer. It was a simple trip, only eating pizza and drinking. But it was enjoyable and I cannot wait to go again. 

I only wish Tony's North served pizza.

The service is phenomenal and attentive! Everyone is so polite and our glasses of water was refilled constantly when I didn't even notice. 

Okay to the best part - the food!! We had the grilled wings with their house wing sauce it was delicious!! It was perfectly grilled and very meaty. Unlike the typical deep fried wings served at other sports bars, these wings are a specialty here and I highly recommend it! We also had the nachos and tuna stack, they were so good and the nachos were served on a large tray it's perfect for sharing. The tuna stack was so tasty for an appetizer I could've eaten that as my entree I loved the crispy wonton and plaintain chips served with it. 

I'm very impressed with this restaurant/sports lounge. It's conveniently located in the Florida hospital center ice, you can watch the ice skaters or catch the sports games on any of the (many) TVs that they offer here.

I am never too judgmental of service, since I have been a server myself for years. However, the service here for my first experience was horrible! No organization! The hostess had no idea what she was doing, so badly that we were standing there for a good ten minutes before I had to take control and tell her to put my on the waiting list. She seemed completely flustered. My server was even worse. It took 10 minutes to even get water, our wine took a good 20 minutes and came two reminders later, bread came halfway through our meal, and the swordfish we ordered was overcooked. I will say I like the atmosphere and the ahi tuna was very good. Overall, not a good first experience and I'm not sure I'll be going back again.

Honestly, the food is very good. The ambience is excellent. My only reason for giving a 4 star is because the staff & bartenders are ONLY dealing with the fellow staff and fellow bartenders!
