I and my wife's first reno attempt at a restaurant and we stood at the host station waiting to be seated or greeted for nearly 5 min a waitress eventually walked by and asked us if we needed anything she attempted to ask the hostess about seating us she shrugged her shoulders and walked away so the waitress sat us no one smiling or friendly it was not packed decor was nice with out door seating avaliable but after being seated in the middle of the room no one around us I liked the separation with the wife but no service employees standing around joking with each other while we sat hungry I read my menu 7 times so we walked out I have never felt so insulted by a restaurant

Walked up. They had 6 employees just standing there. No one was being served. There was one person in front of me just looking at the menu. They told me please go over there and get in line.... So I moved over 3 feet. I asked for a milk shake. They proceeded to talk amongst each other. Oh you shut that down real quick.... She slapped down the milk shake on the counter. I was really close to throwing it back in there face. But I decided to pay and leave. Such a joke. Fire everyone. Everyone. Only the cashier wasn't an accomplish. Hope you go out of business.

I had heard about this place through Instagram and today I got to try it with some friends from my hometown. I love this concept- the interior is stunning and the food was just as good. The avocado toast was wonderful and adding the poached eggs made it even better. And to find a place that carries matcha is rare! I was so happy that this place offered it and I was told that there would be more matcha drinks to come. I can't wait to go back!!

We ate at Tuna Bar on Saturday, June 16, 2018.

Nice location, cool atmosphere, and we had a great server.  The sushi was ok.  Not bad, but not great either.  The problem is the pricing.  Our main entre was the "Large" Sushi Sampler for $60, and a Geisha roll for about $15.  Let's just say we expected a LOT more sushi for that price.  There were literally 7 pieces of sushi and a very small tuna roll on that "Large" sampler.  Simply not worth it.

What a lovely experience! They have sidewalk seating, great for enjoying a lovely night's weather and people watching. The menu was a fun blend of French specialties and Moroccan. I loved the escargot appetizer. Dinner was a seafood bouillabaisse and the lamb targine. Our server went above and beyond to make sure we had a unique, pleasant dining experience. As an added bonus, the cocktails were delicious - not too sticky sweet. Please take your special someone out for dinner here soon!

Mediocre food for caviar prices. Girlfriend and I split the avocado toast and the brunch burrito. Avocado toast tasted like pizza crust from the local late night broadway quick stop and the brunch burrito had limited flavor stuffed with gobs of sour creme. 

Service was fine (hence why I'm giving it 2 stars). $32 for a coffee, (tasteless) brunch burrito and avocado toast is not.
Our waitress Rose was amazing. Made me feel like this was my home bar. Great drinks and food!

We should have listened to previous reviews! Dined there last night and although the service was great and the atmosphere was nice, the food was way overpriced for what you got and really not that flavorful. My boyfriend and I started off with the Calamari, which was very tough and not a big portion for the price. Next I got the Mahi, which for $25 only came with a piece of broccoli rabe. My boyfriend ordered the grilled seafood combo and it came with 3 pieces of small shrimp, 2 very small scallops, a small piece of salmon, a couple small potatoes and broccoli rabe. Again not a lot of food for the money and everything was very salty with not much flavor. We left there with a $115 bill, still hungry and not very satisfied. With so many great restaurants in West Chester, we won't be returning unless it is just for a drink.

Hmmm...confused by the super high rating.  Nothing was wrong with the place, but we just didn't think it was anything special.  We tried a baked good, cold drink and a side (just wanted snacks) and all were okay but again, nothing really stood out to us.  Will maybe try again - get an actual sammie or something - as it is in a great area and the people were nice.

I am not big on going to chain restaurants to begin with, however I received a gift card card and decided to give it another shot this last week. It has been over a year since the last time I went here, and unfortunately nothing has changed. The food is bland and EXTREMELY overly priced. The bar has the cheapest wine you could ask for and they charge crazy prices for a glass. The only positive thing I could say about this place is that the service is friendly. I will not  EVER be going to this place again, despite if I have a gift card or not.

Roast Coffeehouse has a lot going for it.  The ambience is lovely, located in the high-ceilinged Mercer building in the warehouse district.  Charming interiors, quite beautiful furniture, intriguing wall art, Edison-era light installations and what not.  They might have the best ambience any cafe in Edmonton has.  Perfect date place too, I think, with decent music playing and comfortable furniture for quiet conversations.

I've been here twice and agree with most reviewers in that they make interesting latte creations and teas.   I think they briefly had a caramel-bacon latte which sounds really interesting and I enjoyed their salted caramel latte.  They have a collection of craft beers and wines mainly from AB and the Okanagan region.  It's interesting and I'm glad they support local craft brews and wines, though at least on the beer front, these regions are not known for the best craft brews in Canada.

Why the 3 stars? Many might consider me a coffee snob when I say this, but I actually think that for $5, it's only fair that the quality of the actual espresso be far better than something you would get at a chain coffee shop.  This, however, they lack in.  The staff seem to know very little about actual coffee and how to make a good espresso and this disappoints me a little.  It's got a bit of a yuppie feel to it without delivering a quality product.  

I am not sure if I will go back because I know of places that make better coffee. There are many in Edmonton now (Elm, Transcend, Leva, Credo, Sugar Bowl, da Capo etc.) and to open up a new coffee shop and not strive to at least equal the bar set by these establishments, especially when they charge as much (some cases, more) as these other well established coffee joints, is a little disappointing for me.

Come here for an interesting flavored latte, but don't come if you demand high quality coffee.  The main reason for three stars is that they claim to be a coffeehouse first and don't do too well, in my books, on that front.

cute ambience that would be great for date night or even girl's night. i went for a small birthday dinner for a girlfriend, we ordered several plates & shared. sadly i don't remember many of the plates but the only thing that stood out in taste was the crab noodles, they were great. everything else didn't really catch my attention on taste besides the broccolini (spelling?) being salty. the cocktails were great & we ordered plenty of hot sake to enjoy our evening. the main reason why I am giving it 3 stars is because the menu is a little pricey (location is downtown nashville off 3rd) & nothing spectacular stood out for it being a new spot in nashville.

The food here is garbage. How does anyone give this place a good review. The oysters are $$ so I would expect a good size oyster, instead there short. I ordered the fish tacos, and they had nothing but lettuce and some weird sauce. The actual fried cod bits were all bread and what little fish there was in one piece of three, was dry. The lobster Mac and cheese should just be called Mac and cheese. 80 dollars?? Should have went to long John silver for 10 dollars.

Tonight was our first trip to Ricardo's, but we will definitely go back. We had the calamari for an appetizer and steak modega and chicken spiedini for entrees, and everything was amazing. I had seen the chicken recommended in previous Yelp reviews and was not disappointed. It's a great place for dates and semi-fancy gatherings and a nice venture away from the Hill for Italian food. Hit up Square One for a drink before and Bailey's Chocolate for dessert after, and you're set!

On my goal to visit the best ice cream places on each state, my friends and I found ourselves at Mike's.  While there was a big line and no place to sit, we got served pretty fast.  The ice cream was good, not the greatest but very good.

A nice Chinese bakery that gets you the goods. Rather than the shortbread cookie like crust of egg custard tarts at other Chinatown bakeries, St. Honore's egg tart has a flaky multilayered crimped crust (probably full of hydrogenated fats, but life is short). Full range of multilayer cake slices (snowman cake! peach cake!), jelly roll like chocolate roll, sweet pastries (sponge cake like cupcake, almond cookies, coconut cream bun, coconut cocktail bun) to the usual savoury pastries (beef curry bun, bbq pork bun, etc). Most of the individually sized baked goods run under $1 and an extensive bubble tea and fruit flavored shakes menu is posted on the wall.

Several fourtops along the wall if you want to eat in, but I generally takeout and munch in the park etc. If you get a dozen pastries, they'll often throw in two for free.

I used to pop in here almost every day for breakfast or lunch during one summer where I worked just next door. There's always a line in the morning and at lunchtime from all the university staff and students in the area, but the service is swift and the food is pretty tolerable. Prices aren't horrible, either, for being in University City.

Favorite drink from here has always been the Wawa Green Iced Tea... could drink that in the half-gallons it came in! Mac and beef is always a good option, and the thick homestyle chicken noodle was good, too.

The hot sandwiches under the heat lamps... avoid those. Get your sandwiches freshly done. I liked the ability to order your custom sandwiches and soups, etc. at the touch screens. And they're fairly generous with portions.  Fresh Philly soft pretzels in the morning, too.

I love this place. U get a nice meal (I always take away) that feelsssss good after u eat! Fresh and clean and healthy (I get chicken or tofu/brown rice bimibap). The owners are so nice. One day about a year ago my baby was small and I walked there hungry but forgot my wallet (postpartum brain). The man didn't know me from a can of paint, but entrusted that I would return to pay when I could! So I went home with a warm meal, warm baby and returned like a week later to pay up. Delicious, reliable, cheap and healthy! ThAnk u BAP

A friend just told me the Exton place closed. I'm going to check this.
I drove by, parking lot is empty and one car backed up to the front door taking things out.. It's closed.
Great choices and not just ice cream.  Quality of the ice cream and cones are superb.  Great location for sightseeing and people watching.  Try the chocolate chip cookie dough.

We had a cinnamon roll and chocolate croissant here. The service at the counter was harried and sloppy although polite. The two people in front of me were visibly frustrated for different reasons (one ordered takeout and got their order on a plate and one had been waiting a while for their coffee and the wrong drink was made). Our pastries were good but not outstanding. The cinnamon roll had a ton of sweet icing without a taste of creamcheese (I think it was a sugar icing). And not a lot of cinnamon taste either. Croissant was good but standard.

This place is awesome! Ive been there twice and both times were for the Early Bird. If you get ther before 6 you can get a great meal for 10 to 12 bucks. The ambiance is great, not by the water but it is very relaxed. The Crem bru le cheesecake dessert there is phenominal!!!

Food and service has been slipping. I was actually served a potato without a plate.  Just handed it to me.. The food was cold the last time we were in and the waitress was terrible. We will try again but not for a while.

Writing this review before I've even left the restaurant because it's so amazing that I can't wait to do it! This place is a neighborhood gem and south philly is so lucky that it went in! Tonight was the grand opening and they passed around FREE appetizers! Who does that?! Amazing restaurants, that's who. The prosciutto lamb burger is to die for and the buffalo chicken pasta melts in your mouth. BarOne does a fantastic job at Italian bar food and their drinks and atmosphere make me want to come back every week. Bravo, delizioso, mangia!!!!!

My wife and I were vacationing in St Petersburg and were attracted by this restaurant's high rating and rave reviews. I mean to reinforce all of the superlatives. The food was spectacular. My wife had pasta with a rich lobster sauce and I had a dish called La Zuppa, pasta with a pot pouri of seafood. The freshness of the seafood and powerful flavors were unique. No appetizers or dessert. We both ordered a glass (rather generous pour) of Cabernet. Our bill with 20% tip was $95. It was a memorable evening. Very busy on a Monday night. Waitress was busy but still made time to talk to us. Highly recommended.
Love their chicken spiedini and beef spiedini lunch specials.  The house salad is so fresh and delicious.  Haven't tried their lunch buffet yet, but will be back. :)

Yummy! And I'm talking about both the delicious ice cream, waffle cones, sugar cones *and* the yummy youngin's working behind the counter of Mike's! Now I won't go repeating my age, but I can imagine the hotness that I engaged in a flirt-off with last weekend might have been born around the time I graduated high school ... Just sayin'.
Our family FAVORITE for over 31 years!!! Best pepper loin in this galaxy!!! NEVER had bad service...

Roast is new to the coffee house scene in Edmonton, but they are some serious competition. Set in the delightfully trendy Mercer Building alongside Mercer Tavern, Startup Edmonton and FaBLOOMosity ( a flower shop), Roast's second floor decor is comfy luxury. 

They are having some just-opened growing pains that involves installing a new transformer to handle the expresso machine but they are still open for business offering delectable breakfast and lunch options, brewed Verve coffee and some soul-changing loose leaf iced teas. 

After Friday's Social Media Breakfast at Startup Edmonton, a few of us work-tardy folks went down to sample Roast. 

Greeted right away by happy people, they won me over by spelling my name on my cup correctly without any prompts. Oh they know the way to a girl's heart. 

My iced tea was a blend of sun-kissed fields, summer promises and a splash of warm rain and my friend's no-caffeine Italian soda option was made with hugs & kisses. 

Opening at 6 am means they are dedicated to the early morning downtown set. Actually their evening hours mean that downtown just got more accessible.

Monday - 6:00am to 10:00pm
Tuesday - 6:00am to 10:00pm
Wednesday - 6:00am to 10:00pm
Thursday - 6:00am to 10:00pm
Friday - 6:00am to 11:00pm
Saturday - 7:00am to 11:00pm
Sunday - 8:00am to 9:00pm

Follow them on Facebook/Twitter for tea & menu options as well as any specials they have each day.

Soooo could have given 4 stars to this adorable place but the militant 11:00 am cut off of breakfast is just too, well, militant. Totally understand a kitchens need to change over but perhaps offer the simple granola with yogurt or create a breakfast "flavored" baguette to help out the late morning arrivals?? Maybe a fruit and yogurt parfait in the cold case??? Even on weekends if you spent the night out in the funk zone and return the next day in hopes of revitalizing only to be faced with a salad or sandwich at 11:02 am? Honestly it was 11:02. I would have rushed over had I known that s BAKERY would stop serving brekkie at 11:00. Who knew? Well I guess I do now. 
Suggestions to HSB.... help with the transition! I stood at the counter watching what I wanted to order be handed to the person who ordered 3 minutes earlier than me. OUCH! 
Even granola on yogurt would have earned you an extra star from this reviewer. A 3 minute exception to your hard an fast rule would have earned you 2 more stars despite the food only being a 4. Your staff is lovely. They must cringe when the clock strikes 11:00 knowing they can't bend to any pleading a customer might attempt. 
Don't fight the change .... give your customers a little help with the transition and next time we are here perhaps I can give you a star for improvement. 
Thanks for the 11:02 toast n biscuit. Not bad but not enough

Wow, was in St Pete Beach for a week and this was by far the best meal I had. Very good wine selection. The tuna martini was an excellent appetizer. The salad included with the entree was amazing, and I'm not a big salad fan. For my entree, had the fish of the day, Chilean sea bass, prepared in the Tangine style, the house specialty.  Wow is all I can say.  Another person in my group had the lamb shank prepared Tangine style as well.  The meat was falling off the bone, it was amazingly tender.  The creme brulee and profiterole were outstanding.

First let me start by saying I AM STILL THINKING ABOUT THE FOOD!!!! I absolutely love sushi, but when you add an awesome location, fabulous and trendy decor, reasonable prices and outstanding service, you've got a GEM!!! Ok so my sister and i decided to have a sushi lunch date and I'd been hearing about this place and how amazing the ambience and sushi was, not to mention I follow this IG page and the pictorial post are always so mouth watering. Anyway, once we stepped into the restaurant I was immediately impressed and knew we were in for a treat, once we were seated and began glancing over the menu, my mouth began salivating immediately! OMG!!! The options are endless and my inner greedy girl wanted to order EVERYTHING off the menu! We however opted for the brussel sprouts, fried oysters and the tuna tartare as our appetizers, all were to die for delicious! We chose a few sushi roll options to split and as stuffed as i was that inner greedy girl savored every single bite, till it was all gone!!! I could really eat here EVERY day! The sushi is so fresh and good! I can honestly say, the best I've had! What an absolute GEM! This restaurant is good for any occasion (date night, girl's night, single girl night) it doesn't matter, you'll totally be blown away!

Wonderful space with good food. 4 stars instead of 5 because by the time we arrived around 2pm they were out of multiple items on the menu, but I suppose that's not too uncommon at bakeries. Nice seating options both outside and inside. Not a ton of vegetarian food options but the sandwich I did get was great!

This Wawa location is very busy in the morning, but the staff handles the volume very well. You can really see them acting as a team, and one of the ladies at the cash register is like the store mom. Service is with a smile, and I am in, out, and on my way in a matter of minutes. 

The workers seem happy despite the hustle. The coffee is fresh, and the usual selection of Wawa goods is available. As a native to the area, I love Wawa, and this location is no exception.

It was so good ~~ also he is kind...explain ...i order chicken bibimbap and soup which is so good not spicy though..i order to go pancake and japchae ..it is so good to eat for one person ...cuz some place are big dish I can't eat myself ..this place is so great

It is hard to go wrong with ice cream and this place doesn't! I tried the chocolate chocolate ice cream (not really sure what it was called) but it was the perfect amount of chocolate. It was creamy and rich but not unbearable and it was the perfect after hot chicken!

Tsevi's returns to the Southside!  After a hiatius in Florida, owners of a longtime Southside favorite have re-emerged to keep their brand of American/Italian/Greek cuisine afloat. 

These folks have a very large following with local old-timers.  My grandparents frequented The Fountain and The Palms (two cafeteria style restaurants that had been around for MANY years), then they went on to follow them at Tsevi's on Bayless and I visited them when they moved Tsevi's to Concord Plaza before they closed to hit the beach.  

Tsevi's offers table service and "old school" Greek/American/Italian.  The food is solid and a good value.  We ordered flaming saganaki which was good, as always.  But the best value was the Mediterranean  combo that had a variety of Greek items for sample, as well as, a Greek salad.  The platter and salad had plenty of food for two to share ($14.95).  The baklava in syrup is good too!

As our waiter noted, this place has excellent food but the service is horrible! But really, this place has great food, great service, a very nice atmosphere, and is very accommodating to dietary needs. After a rather unpleasant experience at Crabby Bill's for lunch, this was a welcome treat for dinner. Ask for Nick, he'll show you a good time.

As I've mentioned in my first review that we'll be back for another night and we did. We want our last dinner to be memorable as we heading home in Virginia. My family of six has voted to come back to The Pearl as our last dinner. We all went home with happy tummy!
Good steam pot, chowder and crab soup. Not cheap, but a fair price and good service. Hot and tired after skipping lunch and playing steamy outside gig. This hit the spot.

We partook in the express dinner tonight for the first time. The hostess was nice enough to explain how it worked! It was a great option forbus because the price point was good, and we weren't  wanting to spend a lot of time out at dinner, we were just avoiding cooking at home.  Our server was Aubrie, it was her first time doing the express dining but she was great. Her cheerful  attitude made our experience excellent! I would come back again for the service alone, although the food was also wonderful! If you are coming in and wanted a faster dining experience the express dining is the way to go! The food comes in 9 mins or it's  free (I  timed ours for curiosities sake, and it came in less than 3 mins). Overall a great experience!

Took my beautiful wife out for Sunday dinner today Dec 11,2016. Well we ordered the fried pickles which were quite good.  We ordered the Pecan  crusted red fish and the catfish Decatur.   The Pecan crusted catfish was very bland and really Not tasty.  The waiter had the manager come to the table but he only said we will look into doing a better job.  The catfish Decatur was ok but not what we expected.   We will bot be going back and do not recommend to others.

We love this restaurant and eat here frequently!  The service is friendly and prompt and the specials are always worthwhile. 

The Reuben sandwich is my favorite item in the menu; the Fettuccine Alfredo and the gyro wraps are also excellent.

The wait staff didn't come to the table to greet us, the manager did about 20 minutes into us sitting down. Server was polite and manager was as well. We ordered red wine and got brought white, which we took anyway because it was good. The charbroiled oysters were great. We were greeted by the owner, sweet man. Very nice. Ordered shrimp and grits. Not the best we've ever tasted (huge portion for $18), but the shrimp were good. Now taking 25 mins to get our check to go, again the manager had to tell the waiter we were ready to go. The manager helped us out and was great giving us a discount.

Visited Mike's whole at a conference in Nashville. A colleague's suggestion, so we scratched it off his Nashville bucket list. Lay of land: Nice establishment, lots of flavors but mostly traditional ones, and a variety of cones. Decent ice cream, but I've had better (if you're ever in or near Annapolis, MD visit the Annapolis Ice Cream Co.). Warning: You're charged for the cone + ice cream. Not used to that unless it's a special cone. Service was good. Accommodated my needs as I couldn't decide between 2 flavors, so they gave me a 1/2 scoop of 2 flavors = 1 scoop. Negatives: I could've gotten a bigger scoop like my friends who had 1 scoop as well. I felt the portions differed and I paid a higher price because I opted for a cone and not a cup. All in all, it's worth a visit if you're in Nashville and need to scratch the sweet and cold itch. But, make sure you get your money's worth.
Every time I am in town we have Tony's. Have been going since I was a child. Love the pizza, toasted ravs and pepper steak.

Wow! What a cute stinkin' place!!! I love the modern decor here. Like so much. I've wanted to come here for a while and finally got the chance to. Came here on a Wednesday afternoon and it wasn't busy at all so the service was fast. When I saw they had shishito peppers, I knew I had to get that. I've had such an obsession lately. And if you've never had them, you're missing out! They were good. So simple but so good. We also got a basic California roll, spicy salmon, the wentz, and dragon roll. They were all so good. I must say the wentz was my favorite and you could tell everything was fresh! It did not disappoint! I would definitely come back here and try other things.

I've been to this location several times. Every time I go the service is fast & friendly. The beer is always ice cold and the food always comes out hot. The girls are friendly, which is nice. The girls also don't just pay attention to the man you're with, so that's a plus.

What happened to this place? It is like the owners/management just gave up. Very dirty and run-down, mediocre food, and couldn't care less wait staff. This use to be a class act. Now it's just sad. What a loss for the Alton area.

The service is great and the food is good. I was a bit disappointed with the machiatto and my matcha latte -- those were not what we were expecting. The macchiato was like a shot of espresso..I had asked the cashier about that drink specifically because those tend to be made differently everywhere we go (I don't know why) and he did not seem too familiar with the menu, so I stopped asking and I went ahead and order for my wife and I. I was able, however, to just replace my macchiatto with a brewed coffee after I was not satisfied with my drink.

Disappointing food.  

Calamari was good - plump and tender.  It was downhill from there.  

Shrimp cocktail was mushy and a bit "iffy" on the freshness.

Seared scallops were scorched and had a really bad burnt taste because of it.  

Lobster roll was terrible.  Way over dressed.  Drowning in a terrible sour, runny mayo sauce.  I think the lobster was frozen, not fresh.  The lobster was diced very small.  I think all the sauce and the small cut were an attempt to cover up that it wasn't good lobster to begin with.

My husband ate only one of his scallops.  I ate only a bite of my lobster roll.  When clearing our plates, the waitress asked if everything was OK.  I explained that I didn't like the lobster roll.  She came back with a complimentary shot glass of pudding as a consolation prize for the terrible dinner.  I politely turned it down.  The check came and included my $22 lobster roll.  A manager never stopped by to ask us about our concerns.  The waitress was very good and attentive other than not taking care of the issue at the end of the meal.

We would not bother to return to this restaurant.
The ice cream was fantastic. I had banana chip. But whatever you do, don't walk with it. It's very soft. I had it running down my hands in seconds.

Mike's always seems to be packed with tourists and families, but don't let it stop you from coming in to get something sweet when you're on Broadway. I can't remember which flavors of ice cream I've had the two times I've been if that tells you anything - excellent ice cream, but not the best in town. However, the nostalgia you feel upon walking in and the friendly staff still deserves four stars in my book.

This is indeed still one of the best dive bars in town.  Free shuffleboard? Yes please.  They also have 3 pool tables (1 upstairs, 2 downstairs).  They also have darts!  We went here with a group of 8.  Had one entire side of the bar to ourselves.  The bartenders were super friendly, but not the most attentive.  In the past the downstairs tends to be the older crowd with the upstairs being considerably younger.  We decided to stay downstairs and we here for about 3 hours or so.  I've never ordered food here and probably never will, but I did see a fair amount of people with food at the bar.  This is the most down to earth, unpretentious sports bars around.  We were probably the most loud and obnoxious people there, but never felt out of place or threatened.  Will always come back.

When I was a kid, growing up in New York - there was an Italian Deli on every corner (just about).  Not so, here.  Actually, kinda hard to find a good one in these parts.  But, I did.  Cesarina's is a small Deli, that makes BIG sandwiches.  Everything is delicious - they even bake their own bread!  Hot & Cold sandwiches, Salads, Specialties, Pasta, Cold Cuts and Imported Cheeses (which is why the place smells so good) and homemade desserts.  Forget Subway (which is in the same little strip Mall), this place STUFFS their 12" Hoagies and charges LESS than most other places!  You can even get a Muffalata for $5.99!  This is just a great little place.  They have a couple of little tables, but it's mostly take-out.  If you go for lunch, call ahead - or you'll wait on a line!   P.S. If you like eggplant, their eggplant parmigiana 12" is REALLY good!

The service was great and the place was huge and pristine.  I can't figure out how I came at the peak lunch hour and there were more people in line at the cleaners next door!! I was the only person in here for the better part of 30 minutes.  The food was just ok...on the bland side.  Food alone, 1.5 stars...the service improved the score.

Apologies, up front. No photo. I was way too hungry. Ardmore Pizza, Rittenhouse Place. Ordered the turkey salad for delivery. Crisp iceburg and romaine, delicious turkey, special request, American cheese, sweet peppers and light onions, (as requested) Best part? Local tomatoes! You could taste the difference. Everything is so fresh. Creamy french dressing (not the orange kind) and delivered five minutes earlier than expected. They are so, so great--try them if you have not!

Their egg tarts are the best. The crust is flaky and buttery and the custard is baked to perfection- soft, creamy, and jiggly, the way it should be! I love that they're not overly sweet too. Get there early in the morning and get the egg tarts while they're still warm, it's the best thing ever!

Some bakeries in Chinatown get their pastries delivered, I like that they bake on the premises. You know you're getting fresh pastries!

This is some of the best unpretentious ice cream I've ever had. They don't have any experimental flavors that some of the fancier stores do, which I appreciate because it means that it's hard to go wrong with a single flavor there. 

I got the Toasted Coconut and Cookie Dough. Toasted Coconut wonderfully blends creaminess and coconut and even has coconut bits in it, I highly highly recommend it if you go. 

Service was very fast, and the portions were HUGE. I never see ice cream stores on the East or West coast give so much just for a tasting, let along an entire 8oz cup for 2 scoops. It's big, it's gluttonous, and extremely satisfying. 

I'm going to do my best to revisit this place during my stay here.

I've been for both lunch and dinner and The Green Pheasant was exceptional both times. The interior decor of the restaurant is really well done with a unique, modern vibe. The food was excellent. Loved the udon noodles with pork and an egg for lunch as well as the mushrooms and the salmon for dinner!

We came here on a Monday around 5:15 in the evening, and found the place to be very empty, which was a nice change from previous visits.  We were seated right away.  There was something on one of the benches at our booth, so we decided to switch sides.  I then pointed out the puddle of liquid on the floor to the young man that seated me, but he didn't offer to clear the puddles on the floor, he did clean the bench, or move us to another location.  Thankfully the liquid was just far enough out of range to where it wouldn't get on our feet.
We had an offer for a BOGO Pasta Milano dish, and we planned on taking advantage of it.  Our server, Saul?, was very friendly and attentive.  He was sure to bring more bread and water as we needed it and offered fresh crushed black pepper or cheese with each dish that he brought out.  However, he did fail to tell us that we would be charged for ordering soup with our offer, even though we read (we could have misread) that soup and salad was included, but you could upgrade to a better salad for an extra cost.  In any event, the tomato soup was quite good, but the minestrone left something to be desired.  There was plenty of "content" in the soup, but the broth was lacking flavor.
The pasta dish portions were very nice, we both brought home left overs, and it was also very tasty!  If we had one "issue" with it, it was the lack of sauce.

This is a cute quaint Italian restaurant.  We hit it one day during the lunch buffet on a Monday and it was amazing.  Since then we've been back twice.  The food is good, service is fast and the house salad is amazing.

I was really surprised to see there were 2 & 3 ratings!  I have been here 1-2 times per year for probably the last 10 years.  I always look forward to going too because I know without question I'm going to have a good meal.  The happy hour prices are great when the budget's a little tighter and when I'm able to splurge, there's always a delicious Special available.  Their crab cakes are among the best I've had in St. Louis or anywhere!  Great wine list and knowledgable and friendly wait staff.  I definitely recommend this gem.

A group of us went to Tuna Bar per a friend's recommendation. The Mai Fried Rice, Old City Roll, and the Bone In Strip Steak were all excellent. The group loved the sushi and thought it was the best they ever had! For drinks, I had the Saki and the Hana - both were very good. The price was reasonable as well. Definitely recommend trying Tuna Bar!
This is a clean and well run Subway.  When the line gets long during the lunch rush, they seem to process folks through pretty quickly.

Really rude and unprofessional management here.

Long story short, Im 23 and lost my license once so I have a duplicate ID, which understandably gives reason to request secondary identification. Bars usually will accept a credit/debit card, college ID, or have you recite your information to them, but that was not satisfactory for the bouncer here and I had to leave.

Understandable. A job is a job, and I'm all for giving second chances. He told me something with a picture and a date of birth is required, so next week I showed up with my current, valid US Passport.

Nope! Denied again. Funny thing, the bouncer said if I was a non-american he could accept my passport as valid ID.

This was upsetting cause I'm tired of going to the same bars in my town. I decided to call and speak with the owner/manager the next day. I explained my situation and asked what exactly is required for a person in my situation with a duplicate ID? She said the ONLY thing they would accept is an expired license, which I did not have, so I would not be allowed in. No passports no birth certificates no nothing.

To add salt to the burn, when I mentioned how I felt it was an unreasonable policy and will be discouraging friends from going as a result, she (the owner) said "You do what you want, Fuck you" then hung up.

Well, obviously I'm not gunna leave a positive review after this experience. I'm sure the lower staff there is nice and the regulars might be cool, but holy shit, what a immature, disrespectful businesswoman.

Stopped in to see how the remodel went at this location! It is very nice open air feeling no more yucky carpet! Staff seems so much happier in the changed atmosphere. Food was good as usual. Recommend you stop in and check it out!

For my yelpers that love hockey or sports bars  in general. This place is low key and a great bar. It's @ the Ice centre on the 2nd floor. I forgot who the name of the bartender, but  she was really nice and helpful.  But love the idea the Bar is between two ice rink where you can eat and drink, as well enjoy  some hockey. Okay, now for the food, I'll tell you try tuna bowl or any burger. But i definetly had the bowl called the Thunder Chop Chop(Chicken Blackened). My significant other had the Classic Burger that was well seasoned. I will definitely be coming back here really soon. The environment seems real laid back, but  i can see already on weekends the place is pack due to adults and kids coming to skate at the Ice centre on weekends. I think this is best bar in Wesley Chapel period. Especially better than the basic commercialized restaurants.

I'll be honest, it's alright but not great. Typical bar restaurant akin to an R-rated Applebee's. We're glad we tried it, but I doubt we'll be making a return visit.

Whiskey selection was surprisingly large, but as a beer guy, I was left kinda disappointed. Fat Tire is as exotic as it gets.

Got the pablano chicken and the lady got the fish tacos. We both decided they were "meh". If I'm going to go ogle women and drink cheap beer, I'll stick to Hooters Wings.

Sweet bear statue though.

My friend took me here for my birthday. We wanted to go somewhere nice for a yummy meal. And I wanted to go somewhere i never tried. We went on a Wednesday night around 8:15 pm. There was no wait got seated right away and the waiter was very friendly. The menu is a sheet of paper with lots of options, mostly seafood though, my favorite.

For an appitizer we got the cease and desist fries which were fries with crab and cheese fondue over them. The fries were the perfect crispiness and the fondue was a thick, semi chunky cheese sauce. it tasted like crab but didn't actually taste crab chunks at all so must have been very finely chopped up. It was different but really good.

For my entree i decided to get the fresh fish catch. you get to pick from 7 types of fish, pick the way you want it cooked and then pick the suace you want over it. I got Mahi Mahi grilled with lemon butter sauce. There was a good size of fish grilled perfectly but unfortunately i wasn't a fan of the sauce, too much lemon for me so i just scraped it off. My meal also came with mashed potatoes and a vegetable. Masked potatoes were amazing and the vegetable was cut up squash, zucchini, peppers, and snap peas cooked in some type of sauce. they were good, not overcooked.

My friend got the surf and turf with a 6 oz filet and crab cake. the filet was the perfect size and looked like it cut very easily. unfortunately she asked for medium well and it was more medium so had to send it back. The crab cake was good, i know because i tasted it lol. Her meal also came with the potato and vegetables.

Overall i think it was a great resturaunt. I will def go back. very fresh seafood, big selection. yummo!

This was the best ice cream I have likely ever had.  The loaded butterscotch is a previously-Unknown-to-me creation that was absolutely decadent and not a re-hash of something I'd had before. Plus, I ordered a single scoop in the name of self-preservation.  He won't having any of that.  My single scoop was the size of a baseball.  Treat yourself!

I tried Twin Peaks for 1st time today and likely my last. It wasn't busy at 4:00 and I was greeted, seated and waited on very quickly. Since I was working I had iced tea so can't comment on beer selection. I have no complaints with service or server. Elizabeth was friendly and efficient. Very limited menu though. A handful of appetizers, about half dozen burgers a couple of chicken sandwiches and fish tacos. Also a few "dinner" type offerings. I'm not necessarily a healthy type eater but if you are you'll go hungry here. I ordered the chicken ranch. It was very sloppy so watch out shirt front and way over seasoned. It had so much pepper on it I'm afraid I'm going to regret it tomorrow morning. Same way with the fire fries, way too much salty cajun seasoning on frozen steak cut fries. All in all they're just meh. 4 stars though for waitress objectifying, I feel like I have to leave a bigger tip...is there a term for this? I'll have to call A Way With Words.

You simply can't find a better Mexican place in Wilmington.  It's delicious and inexpensive.  Bring $20 cash, and you'll have enough left over to visit their other company, the ice cream place next door (Paleteria y Neveria Tocumbo) for a paleta.  I highly recommend both of these establishments!

So we found this place via Yelp. (Thanks)
It didn't disappoint. 

It's a "one man" kitchen cooking authentic bibimbap with a few sides. Not a big menu but makes it easy to decide. 

The ginger cinnamon tea is good, but beware. If you don't like cinnamon you won't like this. It has a really strong flavor.  

The beef stone pot bibimbap was hot all the way to the end. Super tasty. Very filling. You may not want to share! It's that good. 

Small dining area. Seats 12. 

Final thoughts. Give them a shot.
Being seated and waiting 30 minutes before anyone checks on us. Drinks, bread. A date night gone bad due this fine establishment.

Note:  the food section of this review is for the sausage & peppers sub, as I've tried nothing else.  

Cesarina Deli is a simple but nice dining location on East Bay.   While it looked like most coming in and out were there for the deli sandwich choices, they've got a few shelves of the most popular Italian grocery items.   In the deli prepared food section they carry cured meats, cheeses, olives, about half a dozen pasta choices & and some more cold salad dishes.  They also have several cases with bakery items, bread & cookies.

If you want to dine in there are tables to the left that seat ~20 or so.  But I was here to taste test one of my favorite subs, the sausage & peppers.

My order at the counter was taken fairly quickly even though there were about 5 people in line.  It was well-wrapped in foil to keep it take-out hot and I appreciated that.  And the size of the wrapped sub quickly showed that Cesarina definitely delivers an extremely large sub for the price.

But while it was still hot when I arrived home, when I opened up the foil wrap I found the sorriest looking sausage & peppers sub I've ever seen in my life.  The green peppers and onions were cooked to death in heavy oil to the point they had virtually no flavor.  The oil almost completely soaked the sub roll, and the dry portion of the roll I did manage to taste was not that flavorful and a bit tough to chew.  To top off this sad collection was the sausage link.  While I'm a huge fan of meat in tube form, and I've had many sausages in different ethnic cuisines, most all Italian sausages I've ever found have been a nice mix of  full meat flavor and spice.  But this link was the most bland taste with only spicey hot flavors.  Worse yet, the inside of the link was just ...well, just a disgusting grey color.  I'm not foolish enough to think sausages are made of any prime pork cuts, but hey, if you're going to leave out the flavor at least throw me a bone with some red dye #3 like a hot dog so it resembles something that might be meat related.   Sure, it's a carcinogen, but I'd trade that even up if at least fooled the cro-magnon portion of my meat-eating brain into thinking I was dining on something edible.

Combining the tasteless grey sausage link with likewise sad, soggy sausage and peppers, after two bites I found the entire sub completely inedible and tossed it in the trash.  And I can't think of hardly any food I've ordered in a decade or two that turned my stomach as bad as this sub.

Again, this food review is for one sandwich and nothing else.  And while this experience would normally make me write off Cesarina completely, the other reviews of the cold subs or prepared foods would not stop me from stopping by again and trying one of them.  If I do, I'll update my review and scores accordingly.

My scores on the deli scale are:

Atmosphere:  3
Service:  4
Food:  0....and that may be too high
Value:  0
Very comforting homecooked flavor. Liked it so much my first time I brought a friend, and now she loves it too. Don't put too much red sauce if you're not a fan of heat, though....

So....I want to be fair to Tony's but I also know that I'll be back regardless if I want to be or not.  They have a nice bar and the food is decent.  The danger of sitting in the restaurant part is that you could be seated in a really weird room totally isolated from the rest of society.  Knowing this, we asked to be seated in the bar area where the atmosphere is more casual.

The waitresses were not busy and liked to avoid eye contact.  They were supernice when we were getting tables together but when it was time to order, it was like our waitress forgot that she was a waitress.  We ordered a meatball sandwich and the menu listed that you could order it as either sliced or whole, so I ordered it sliced.  Her response was, "Uhh...what?  No one has ever asked me that before.  Let me ask the kitchen if they can do that."  Listen lady, not only is it on the menu but all you do is take a knife and slice through that sucker like you're cutting a tomato.

We also ordered some unhealthy appetizers, I liked the toasted ravioli.  Garlic bread was huge and cheesy and meh.  I mean, everything was fine.  We wanted to order from the restaurant menu but they made a change recently that you had to order from the bar menu which limited our choices.

At the end of the meal, I gave her my credit card and asked for an itemized receipt after the fact.  The waitress said, "Umm...I THINK I should be able to do that."  Listen lady, you already DID do that because you ran my credit card.  I don't know what you did with it.  I admit, it's a bad habit I have from Singapore but I tell you, Singaporean waiters are shit at taking orders and mischarge you half of the time.

I digress.  Anyway, Tony's martinis are really good.  Don't order the special drink chamboise.  It's disgusting and its chalkboard advertisement should be wiped clean immediately.  I'll be back to Tony's because the fam likes it here but maybe next time I'll take my chances with the restaurant part.

We had a birthday dinner at The Macaroni Grill last night. I have to say that I received wonderful service. Amanda, our server, was friendly, helpful and did everything she could to make sure we had a great experience. We had the manager come over and check on our party, making sure we had a great evening. We even met the head chef, who wanted to check and see if our meal was to our liking, come over and talk with us. Our party had various items from the menu and we all walked away full, happy and so willing to come back again. It may be a chain restaurant, but it really felt like a small, family run business, making sure we felt special the entire time we were there. Thank you for making this birthday party a special one!

Great ice cream with a touch of nostalgia! My favorite is strawberry, but hace never been disappointed by any flavor.  In the winter I always order hot chocolate with extra whipped cream.  Conveniently located to all the fun places in Nashville. It's rumored that stars like to frequent here after concerts, but I've not been lucky enough for aa sighting.
Had a GREAT dining experience at this location thanks to Tina!!!!  I didn't feel rushed, the food was hot and Tina was super helpful!!!

I love Cesarina!  I've just started coming here and I keep returning.  The food if fresh and great tasting.  There's something on the menu for everybody.  Will keep coming back because the food is addicting!

True Life: I'm addicted to ice cream. 

When I saw the unpretentious and unassuming Mike's, I had to try it during my Nashville visit. They have plenty of unique flavors and allow multiple samples. 

Got the banana pudding and tried the blackberry cornbread. Both were outstanding and refreshing. The banana pudding was irresistible, and banana's my favorite flavor, so I had to go with that one. 

Also, their scoops are a big portion, so it's worth the price of $3.60 each. A few tables inside, but I suggest getting some and eating it while strolling Broadway!

Nothing special about this place. Mediocre food with decent service. Waitresses know nothing about the food on the menu, so don't bother asking. This is definitely only here to entertain lonely men. If you want good food, there are plenty of better options nearby.

I'll start by saying that I'm a bit of a sushi snob. I lived in California for a long time and the sushi there was on another level and I've really struggled to find a place in the Philadelphia area that can compare. We live about an hour outside of the city, but we heard about Tuna Bar and had to come check it out. I'm glad we did, this is the best sushi I've had in a very long time and I couldn't be more impressed. The owner, Ken, came to our table and introduced himself and made recommendations for what to try on the menu. We ended up ordering several appetizers and then a ton of sushi to share and it was fabulous. I'm usually just stick with sashimi and sushi, and skip the rolls, and I finally found a place with excellent fish that doesn't need to be drizzled in spicy mayo or eel sauce to taste good. I'll be a regular here now!

First visit today. Everyone was right , sandwhiches were huge! I ordered the half italian sub. 5.99. I was stuffed. Packed with meat. Bread was heavenly. Lady behind the counter seems to do it all by herself. She was extremely friendly and efficient.  We went in around 11 because we heard they get busy for lunch. I could see how there would be quite a wait at lunch time. Go early! I was a tad disappointed there were hardly any baked goods in case. We did take home cannoli's . They were "ok". They have Italian wedding cookies that are out of this world !! The best I have ever had.

Asked for tequila and club soda. Limes were almost rotten. Also they did not have any top shelf tequila. Not even Patron. The bartender said she would still charge me for the lower shelf tequila because she had already made the drink even when I asked for top shelf tequila.

Honestly would vote them less than a star. Ordered from here at 7pm for takeout. First said it would be delivered 7:50. Checked back at 7:50, delivery ETA changed to 8:20. Called at 8:30. Phone number does not work, saying cannot connect from my line, I have at&t unsure if anyone else has this problem...? Finally got ahold of someone from roommates phone, man sounded very unsure saying there was a lot of traffic, and food should be there "in about 30..maybe... anywhere from 30-45?" So we repeated that number back to him, he again confirmed. Called back at 9:15. Man answered saying "look we've just started your food, it's real busy on the roads (side note: other roommates food got delivered from other location around corner from DeSandro, it took ten minutes), should be ready in ten and it'll go out." So I ask again, saying it has been 2 hours. Man says there's nothing he can do the food will be there within 45 minutes. 9:40 rolls around. Still no contact. Myself and roommate drive down to store. Streets are bare, cleared of all snow traffic rain/floodwaters, it took us five minutes to drive there. We walk in to a man yelling on the phone and we ask if our food is there. He begins yelling at us saying the food went out already, refused to show us the ticket, or go back and check on the order. Still yelling that the food went out. We head back home. It's now past 10:30 and still no call from a driver, manager, anybody about any status or even that our food or order has been cancelled. These guys are rude to paying customers, and wasted our evening, not even bothering to just tell us the order has been cancelled, still unsure about that since we HAVE NOT RECEIVED IT.
Horrible. I ordered from here and it was the worst. The food is really old. I looked at it and knew not to eat it because i knew it would make me sick. Stay away!!!

Went here on a Saturday night with three friends. The beer-gut bouncer was rude and creepy towards two girls in my group. The downstairs bar was almost empty and the upstairs was filled. Understaffed, crappy music, and long wait times made us leave early. Only plus was finding a dollar some drunk had left in the juke box... Not worth the time

My wife and I both had wonderful meals served by Kelly at the Pearl. Both means were superbly cooked and very delicious. Love the eclectic menu choices. If we ever return to Treasure Island, the Pearl will be on our to do list.

So I don't know how the other review was double posted, and I didn't notice till now. But here's an update. I don't go here for egg tarts anymore, they are not as good as they used to be. (Go to Zhong Gong if you're looking for great puff pastry egg tarts.) That being said, I still think their tarts aren't too bad, just not the best, and all their other baked goods are still good too.

But the real gem here are the custom chinese cakes. If you like soft, light, and fluffy Chinese cakes, then you'll love the cakes at St Honore. They bake to order, and their fillings, toppings, and whipped cream are always fresh. It's a little more than what you'd pay at some of the other asian bakeries in Chinatown, but you're paying for quality and consistency. Try one for the next birthday!
I thought this place was A OK. It wasn't the best, and didn't leave any impression really. Be cool for a date night, it's pretty and what not, and I'm glad I tried it. Bout it.

Great place, that is now open for lunch every Tuesday-Sunday. We stopped in for lunch before an event downtown and it did not disappoint. Got Baked Penne and it was amazing!!! My friends got Lasagna and Pizza and it looked amazing!!!! Very cool laid back atmosphere in the bar. Although if you are in a hurry it may not be the best place as it took awhile for the service. But the excellence of the food makes up for it.

Food was OK not very good. Would not go back. Server Jamie was very nice! The bread that they give you to start was overpowering with rosemary and salt. Way too much salt. And the pasta was something that an average Joe person can make at home. Save your money and go to Sardinas or Johnny's for good Italian food.
I had a scone, but it was like no other scone I've had before. It was glazed, soft (so soft). I don't know what it was called but it was so good

Amazing. What more do you need in a restaurant than good bap and homemade kimchi? What more do you need in life? Yes, the menu is small, but the place is called BAP for a reason. Sheesh. I'm confident that there's something to please every palate and with rice being naturally gluten-free, those with Celiac's or a general fear of grainy goodness will find something to enjoy.

Definitely cozy with seating for perhaps 12, but the atmosphere and decor are nice (not sterile or uncomfortable like a cheap Americanized Chinese restaurant. Yes, I realize that this is a Korean restaurant, but did you know that bright fluorescent lights are traditional in some parts of Korea?). I never felt cramped and this ended up being a lovely date spot. Just be ready for the very present but enjoyable heat of the kimchi or you'll embarrass yourself. 

Hot tip: try the homemade cinnamon tea.
Plenty of flavors to choose from! Great location and open late for those after dinner sweet craving!

Went out to grab a bite to eat so I hit up my local Sonic 
However there was one thing I noticed 
1. Lack of waiting time
- It took them about 5mins or above just to take my order 
After order was done, payed came back home to see that they had my order right but the drink was not the one I recommend instead they gave me this red drink kinda like a slushie way and the sonic blast chocolate chip cookie dough barely had any cookies in it. It kind of had that weird milkshake vibe to it. If anyone is going to order at this place just remember to skip this place once a night or few because this place needs to step up their game and learn how to take customer order right away and double checked the order to make sure they give it out to the right customer.

Morning breakfast date 

Ordered: cinnamon roll, chocolate zucchini bread, iced vanilla almond latte, vanilla latte

Pros: The bakery is in a shared space with a time tasting place. Its has warehouse, industrial and french vibes. It's beautiful and open! They ah e patio seating and all the seating feels community focused. Both pastry items were delicious, moist and the frosting to cinnamon roll ratio was spot on, the service was fast. The coffee was delicious and sweet enough for me! 

Cons: parking may be hard but that's expected, their breakfast biscuits looked delicious but overpriced in my opinion even for quality, because it didn't come with sides. 

I will go back!
Delicious, clean, comfortable and fast. The menu has like 10 things on it. I think they're all gluten-free.
Great atmosphere...loved the tomato soup and bread...Will definitely return when in the area.

My boyfriend and I call this "our little Italian place."  We adore Ricardo's!  The service is attentive but not overbearing.  The prices are perfect for any pocketbook, and the ambiance is lovely.

I ordered the Chicken Marie and my boyfriend got the seafood cannelloni.  Both were fantastic.  The house salads served prior to our entrees were crisp and not overly dressed.  Ricardo's also offers a lovely wine selection.

I greatly enjoyed Ricardo's and will return soon.

Absolutely love this bakery.  My guilty pleasure after work.  Croissants and raisin buns are so fresh they melt in your mouth.  Prices insanely low for the quality... cheaper than the surrounding bakeries which don't quite cut it like St Honore. Also, the owner is so sweet. She even is honest about how fresh her coffee is; when fresh, it is excellent and also cheap.

This is one of those places where the food is fine but the staff is not.

I had a rather important business meeting.  When we asked for a table away from the hub-bub, the hostess rolled her eyes at us and sort of flipped the menus on a table.  The waitress essentially ignored us.  I had twice to go to the bar to interrupt her conversation to get service -- this was after the restaurant had emptied.  I'd love to be able to give one star except...

The food was pretty good.  

We had the bruschetta which is served hot there.  This causes the topping side of the toast to get a bit wet, but I found it still quite good.  
The large serving ($13) of Pesce alla Elisabetta easily serves two.  The noodles are al dente.  The sauce is nothing astounding but tasted fine.  The shrimp, crab, and clams are present in acceptable abundance.   

I am not sure if they serve bread for lunch; we were offered none.  I asked for hot pepper and was brought a half teaspoon scattered on a plate.  When I asked for more they upped it to a teaspoon.  They must pay dearly there for this spice.

Maybe I caught them on a bad day.  I look forward to perhaps someday amending this review.

On a hot day in Nashville, with the sweat dripping down your back, and a belly full of barbeque - ice cream is the only thing that will do.  This place is an oasis in a desert of ribs and bluegrass.  The fact that the ice cream is so good (and some of the flavors are pretty unique) is just a bonus.

I love me some ice cream.
Food and service were excellent!! Our waitress was top-notch.  The one down-side was the cost.  I found it to be very expensive.  If it weren't for that I would give 5 stars.

Visiting from out of town and wanted a hassle free Christmas dinner. Ordered sausage & peppers, chicken parm, miniature pastry tray and a loaf of Italian bread to serve the family. The food was by far the most authentic Italian food I've had outside my moms kitchen. Delicious! Prices were very reasonable, people were helpful and friendly. Will, without a doubt, return there as often as possible.

Solid meal - but definitely pricey for the proportions. For a little less than 10 dollars, you get a classic bibimbap meal - but I was ravenous and got a portion that was much smaller than I was expecting. The food was good - fresh vegetables, tender meat, and perfectly cooked rice. Expect to pay more for less here though.

I visited the second night they had been open serving and I had the Gumbo as a starter which was a very good and meaty gumbo. My entree was the port loin porterhouse and I have to say it was the tenderest piece of pork I have had the pleasure of eating in a very long time. The service was good considering they were just in their second night. I would take anyone there to eat because it's that good.

I'm home visiting and my fiancé and we're craving some good food from home..

I guess I should have thought twice!

We ordered chargrilled oysters and 2 ( po-boy & soup combos)

40 minutes later all we had was the oysters and not even an apology for the wait!

Miraculously when we asked to the cancel the order because  we'd watched two other tables come in after us eat and leave, our food was ready.

Low and behold, one order came with the wrong soup and we had to take it to go.

The table next to us was confused as well and started to question why no one was told there would be a wait!

$50 / 1 hour and the restaurant wasn't busy! 

Needless to say we will not be recommending this plane and will not return upon our next visit.

Valerie was a top notch server and really is the reason for us coming away with such a ++++ impression. The wings had excellent flavor - we prefer crispier wings but these are grilled and the flavor more than made up for them being less than crispy. The Drunken Sloppy Joe sandwich was great. We will be back!

Banana Chip Ice Cream..enough said.

Okay..I'll say more...I am an ice cream/gelato fanatic. This was one of the best ice creams I've had. It was fresh, creamy and did I mention it was Banana Chip?? Why don't more stores offer Banana ice cream??

The shop is small, but with several tables.  The staff was friendly. They have a ton of flavors to choose from, with/without cones, sundaes, shakes. A great escape from the heat. Eat there or take it outside to go :)

Will definitely be back. Would definitely recommend to all.

i just moved to the main line from center city.i got to say this place has the best philly cheesesteaks ive ever had.hands down.i also tried a slice of my girlfriends pizzab and it was superb.so glad i found this place.cheers guys.

We came to Mike's after eating dinner as we had a taste for a good desert.  This place hit the spot as it had plenty of flavor options, ice cream was refreshing, and it had a great vibe.  The place is located right next to and across from many happening restaurants and bars so  I am sure it is always very busy.  We managed to get a seat right next to the window and we enjoyed watching all the happenings both inside and out of the ice cream shop.

All the ice cream is home made and there were many unique flavors.  The line was long but moved fast and the workers happily gave free tastes 

All in all a good place for ice cream

Great food. Simple service - great owners and staff. Super cozy. Dont expect anything fancy. My boyfriend and I order take out there and the manager is always so friendly. I highly recommend this place!

Decided to give new restaurant a chance since am a west banker. Ordered pasta with shrimp. Was very tasty. Ordered luncheon special and portion was plentiful. Good hot French bread to go with meal but the waitress seemed a little shy. Maybe some training??  She should smile too. Enjoy the job. When my friend and I asked for butter, we only received one pat (packaged) per person per request. Wait time for food was acceptable and quality of food was good. The lunch menu is fairly priced but the dinner/supper menu is a bit over priced. The restaurant is decorated nicely but is obvious it is new. 

Hoping they weather the economy since not too many nice restaurants succeed on the West Bank.

The menu has been fluid in developing into the opposite of all Cysco and other food service formulas AKA sports bars.
The chicken wings stand on there own as a destination dish not simply a bar food check boxes.
Considering the venue overall is know for hockey it is not at all surprising to find Poutine on the menu in a couple forms. If only the curds were yellow and mild, then this could be the best hockey sports bar in Tampa.

On our way after a busy 2 day on the road . Googled restaurant in Wesley chapel and this little gem popped up . Located in a ice hockey rink I was a little surprised at the menu ! Very pleased salads tuna bowls lots of healthy option ! Ordered a martini and tropical salad and waited for 75 south traffic to die down plus hubby got a free craft beer for checking in . Service was great which is important in any establishment so check it out if stuck in 5 o'clock traffic and around the Wesley Chapel area .. very laid back environment

Ignore the outdated decor, the large tacky statue outside, and the servers who are all texting during their downtime, and the pack of cigarettes hidden behind a potted plant.  

The food and friendly service carry The Pearl a long way. 

My husband and I got to the restaurant just after 4pm (strange time, I know) when the doors first opened, and to our surprise, there's an early bird menu, which offers about 5 different dishes, which rotate week-to-week, and a soup or salad for just $10!  You have to be seated before 5:45 in order to order from this menu. 

Our server, who was Moroccan himself recommended the chicken tagine, (which was on the early bird) and the lamb tagine, which was not.  (Note: On it's own, the tagines cost about $20, so obviously the early bird special is the way to go!)

We weren't disappointed with the tagines.  Both came with nicely cooked couscous and veggies, and the meats were tender and well seasoned, but not overly salty or oil-laden.  We left feeling satisfied and happy.  

Can't wait to try this place out again!

We frequently drop by here to get two things...the dry Italian sausage and the pastries.  Both excellent. We'll have to drop .by for some food to take home as I see it and am tempted each team we drop by.

They offer to slice the hard sausages for you which is a nice thing if you don't have a sharp knife


Come try them out...good place to get Italian products
Kodos to a great staff and a fabulous meal.  Sea bass was perfection and my other tastings were all above expectation.   Kristin was great. Appreciated the welcome feeling as a business traveler.

Ok. Nothing really to rave about. I have not eaten at Romano's in over six years and wanted to try it out. They took off two of my favorite dishes, which was the cannelloni and the prosciutto and peas penne. The rosemary bread was bitter and the balsamic vinegar they serve with the bread is really low quality because of the acidity of it. Ok place if there isn't any other better Italian places in your city to eat; however, in Reno, plenty of other places I would recommend.

This place is pretty well-run - it's always clean, they throw salt down outside when it's snowing, there's always plenty of coffee (only 79 cents for a refill if you bring your own mug), and the staff is friendly.  It's a nice option for breakfast or lunch in a part of University City when you're tired of the food trucks on Market between 36th and 34th.

Apple Fritter madness, so good. Egg sandwiches good but maybe a bit over concocted with sauces, veggies etc. How about a good old fashion egg and cheese? They need a greater green tea selection.

Great decor, nice staff-I'd come back.

The service is fine, I have no complaints there, nor anything negative to say about the facilities themselves. 

The food is bad though. I once ordered a chicken "salad", which was a very thin, chewy, greasy bit of (I am assuming) chicken meat, pounded out to the size of a manhole cover, and served on top of some spinach. It was difficult to cut through, using a very large and sharp knife; eating it made me feel sad. I think there were tomatoes? The soggy, yet somehow hard, chicken-blanket overwhelmed everything else. 

I've tried the food here several times. The only good thing I have had is the bread. If I were Romano, I would be molto triste, but I am pretty sure he isn't real.
This is the worst wawa I've ever been to. I've been here multiple times and ordered food and almost every time they get the order wrong.
I never have a bad meal here. Ask for Meredith. Great service.

We were being total tourists.  En route to Chicago from Orlando, we stopped in Nashville and wandered around this area near the Country Music Hall of Fame and ended up at Mike's.

On a street lined with souvenir shops, bars with live music, and boot shops we found Mike's because of yelp.  It's busy in here!  From the outside to the decor within this is an old fashioned ice cream shop.  What's not so old fashioned are the flavors in the cases:  horchata, red velvet, moose tracks, etc etc, ad nauseum.

You can also get flavored cokes, egg creams, floats, and coffee.

The line was long the day we stopped by, and apparently it's always busy.  We were outside the door when we started waiting...but got to the counter in under 15 minutes.  The people working here are hustling and pretty darn friendly for the crush of humanity screaming for ice cream.

I thought it was pretty good, but one of my daughters raves that Mike's has the best peanut butter ice cream she's ever had.  I believe she had Nutter Butter, actually...either way, high praise indeed!

Worth a stop if you're in the area.  I don't know that I'd pay the high, tourist-y, parking fees just to come to Mike's though!

The bibimbap is delicious whether it's chicken or tofu. The mix of veggies, spicy sauce, protein, and rice is interesting and refreshing without being overly filling. Worth stopping by if on South Street.

Super cute little shop. Have a ton of flavors on what to choose from- ask for samples! They also have coffees and espressos- didn't get any but there were a lot to choose from on the menu. 

Def a nice night ender.

Loved this place upon arrival. The food I ordered was not warm and I was super disappointed in the staff who was not at all friendly. While I was waiting for my food a woman actually brought her food back up to the counter and asked the staff if they would mind warming it up because the center of her sandwich was cold. Maybe they're still trying to work it all out since they're still new but this was my first impression.

I came here with a couple of locals and it was a first for all of us. We sat oin the bar and the service was very good. We found the food to be prepared well and generously portioned. The desserts were fantastic as well.
Great pizzas and great service.  Love the order on-line or order by app feature.
Delicious food, strong drinks. The one missing star is because of the prices and serving size. Shrimp and grits are a must! Fried pickles are a must!

Perfect spot to cool down after walking around all afternoon. I tried a few of the flavors and decided to get the salted caramel. You get a decent amount for the price you pay. I did wish they had peanut butter to add as a topping.

Transcend, Credo, and other such cafes are obsessive about their coffee. Roast is practical about it, but not as practical as Tim Horton's for example. Roast serves coffee from the artisan Verve Coffee Roasters. I don't know much about them, but the coffee is surprisingly non-bitter and smooth. You pay for the quality: $5 for a large latte. But included with that is the environment.

Like the Mercer Tavern next door Roast takes advantage of the old warehouse in which it is housed. It's spacious, trendy, and comfortable; an atmosphere well worth a $5 latte.

Roast also has some prepackaged quality food, I think from various downtown restaurants. The salads are small, but not too expensive. You can pay extra for your choice off protein (small containers of various meats or tofu). My friend seems to enjoy the baked goods.

I prefer Transcend coffee and philosophy. But I come back here as often as I do for the non-pretentious atmosphere. Oh, and they start serving wine at 2pm.

I LOVE this place! A co worker of mine told me about this place and I can't seem to stop eating here. It's a cute small place, don't let that fool you! The husband and wife who run this place are so sweet and make the best food! I usually get the veggie with egg and it's delicious! If you get a chance to come here, please do! It is worth your time!

Ok so I grew up im NY/NJ in italian neighborhoods and i certainly know good authentic pizza and this place is joke.. The only people stupid enough or care enough to eat here are all the drunk people across the street when the bar lets out. The three times i ate their was awful. I had the chicken parm.sandwhich and there was barely any chicken. It was dry and no sauce. I went there just to order a small salad and the owner told me i cant buy a small salad unless i buy an entree. I laughed and walked out. This place seems desperate and simply does not put the care and passion in italian food. There are so many delicious places to eat in manayunk right down the street on main. Take the extra 5 minutes of walking and enjoy yourself.

Tasty ice cream, not wide selection and it's even good! I don't like when it's 25 flavors to choose from and I don't know what to pick. 
Waffle cones are tasty too.

Did not know what to expect.  We were just hungry looking for a decent mix of food.  Couldn't believe the HUGE menu they had.  I was completely torn as to what to eat.  I ended up going with  their Greek menu and my Dad went with their Comfort Food.  How different can you get than moussaka and country fried steak?  :)  We both loved our meals and salads. The bread was super fresh (I love my breads) and delicious.  We are totally going back to try more items on their HUGE menu!

Tried them for the first time and disappointed we didn't give them a shot earlier!! We ordered the burgers and nachos. Both were absolutely delicious! I will say the sauce they put on the nachos is quite spicy so be careful. The most awesome part was we ordered it for our kids and because we were unaware of the spiciness and they could not eat it, the waitress actually had it remade for us at no charge. The burgers were super good, hot and fresh. Lastly they have an orange beer which I also highly recommend with awesome specials. Give them a try you won't be disappointed.

I don't know where to start, The Peacemaker Po-boy is amazing! The debris frys are a must! I could get all wordy but what's the point, that would waste your time...time that could be spent eating here!!!

Hands down the best and creamiest ice cream I've ever had. Loved the creative flavors and especially the heavenly waffle cone! It was like a wafer with a lovely vanilla/cookie taste to it. Try the loaded butterscotch, caramel cone or pralines and cream. They all have variations of crunchy nuts, caramel and Oreo.

First time trying the Twin Peaks breastaurant. Wife and I found the place after lunch time, after most of the Bros had checked out, so the place was pretty laid back. Toni was polite, and took care of us like a good host should, and looked great to boot. Beers were ice cold (great for this obnoxiously hot and humid summer!) and the selection covered a lot of beer types. Wings were pretty good, better than B-Dubs for sure. French fries on the side were kinda bland; they should just invest in a fry slicer and make them fresh, it isn't hard to do. Plenty of TVs everywhere to catch just about every sport you could want to watch. Would go back next time we're in Indy.
Great service, good food, beautiful atmosphere! The fried pickles were delicious! Also, I had the shrimp po'boy dressed and it was very good.

Subway has tasty lower-fat sandwiches for Brentwood. This one is in the Kroger shopping center. Newest item I tried is the Sweet Onion Chicken Terriyaki sandwich which I enjoyed with their Dannon natural yogurt. I also was good  by having the baked, not fried, potato chips. I was surprised the baked tasted as good as the fried ones I was used to. They have seven other "Fresh Fit" sandwiches like veggie, roast beef and turkey on their new low fat Fresh Fit menu, as well as the classic Subway favorites.

Ordering from this place is a nightmare. I work for ubereats and they "missed" my order. I lost 30 min of work time. They look very unorganized and don't seem to have a lot of communication between the chefs and the servers. Also the manager did nothing to help. An employee asked her a question and she responded rudely to her own employee.

Half Price Wine... say what?  
Are you kidding me, $2.75 for a glass of their house wine?  #SOLD

Keeping in mind that I had never dined at a Macaroni Grill before..
I ate at this Macaroni Grill last week and sat at the bar.  The service was stellar, met two nice employees and enjoyed my Chicken Parmesan.  The food came out  quick, was a big portion and had a nice atmosphere.

I enjoyed it - and am taking my staff here next Friday for our holiday dinner.

Give them a shot - a nice in-between considering Olive Garden or Carraba's.

All-fruit smoothies, frozen cappuccino, really nice spot to just sit for a minute and get out of the sun.

Everyone was getting the "superhero" ice cream which was all sorts of bright colors. In waffle cones, no less.

I can't remember the last time I had a catfish po-boy with fish that tender...probably never! Lots of flavor as well. The bread also had a beautiful crust. The onion rings were so good that I may be picky about my onion rings from now on. Sliced thin and battered well - nice and crunchy. Please try them!

I was a regular on the first C&B run and was crushed when they closed.  I am so very happy they are back!  This was my first trip back and they did not disappoint.  Their asian tofu....delicious.  And when you add to to one of their incredibly fresh salads...one of my favorites anywhere.  My friend tried the sandwich of the day, smoked salmon, and loved it.

Please welcome them back with open arms...make multiple trips.  Nashville needs a spot like this and I'm so grateful they gave us another chance, let's not let them down!

Doc Magrogan's happens to be many people's go-to oyster/clams/overall seafood place whereas for me, Doc serves as a lovely place to get crunk-a-dunk.

I have not frequented this place during any hours that would be suitable for lunch or dinner so I don't have much to say about their food selections- with that being said, my friends and I are mostly found sometime past 10 when the place is pumping with some good jams and flowing with $5 fishbowls and a whole lotta college kids and or yuppies.

The DJ on deck is surprisingly up to date with the music, the bartenders are friendly and accommodating and the place is pretty spacious.
