Unfortunately, the food is mediocre and god knows where the fish comes from!  Doc charges high prices for farm raised fish and defrosted vegetables which end up on your plate.  I would expect this quality from an "applebees" or another big chain franchise...but not from Doc Magrogans.  Very disappointed lately.  I hope he can turn things around as we won't be dining here any longer.

Are you one of those people who have a hard time deciding what to order? If you're new to Korean food and want to get a staple - Bap is the place for you. No more flipping through the endless menu debating on three different things. Bap has one main entrée - bibimbap. You can choose your protein or simply just veg it out. We ordered the chicken and beef bibimbap. The owner was very nice, the food came out quickly, and the seating area was well maintained. 
While I enjoyed my meal, it wasn't outstanding. The veggies and beef were just okay. Unfortunately, I think they were overpowered by the sauce - which was a notch spicier than I wanted. I also think that $9 for beef bibimbap is a little high for the amount of food I received. Overall, I would say give them a shot if you're in the area.
We were seated right away! The short rib po boy was amazing! Great, friendly staff! Delicious food and clean restaurant!

Ok, so I'm normally not a fan of chain resturants.  To me it is much more fun to find a local place with ambiance that is unique to where you are.  This way you can support local buisness and try something new.  As far as chain places go though, this one is my favorite.  Here's why...

1.  The cheese raviolis with pesto sauce and grilled mushrooms, basil and broccoli.  YUM!
2.  All the food is pretty good here, and I like that the meat-free options have lots of add on veggie options
3.  They will bring it out to your car when you order to-go
4.  When dining in the ambiance is great...fireplace, nice music, nice lighting

yeah, i gotta go, I am craving Italian now ;-)

Our first visit for a casual late lunch with cocktails. Restaurant has a lovely courtyard that you walk into prior to entering. Once inside space is clean and very nice. We are greeted and seated promptly. Water is served very quickly. Waiter shows up a bit later to take our drink order.  We asked a few questions about menu and our waiter answered and seemed knowledgeable about menu. We ordered crab devil eggs and fries for app. Both were very tasty. We asked if dinner menu was different and asked if we could just look at one, for maybe dinner in future. We never got one. I ordered smoked chicken salad club sandwich with no tomatoes. It came with tomatoes .  After I removed them, it was tasty. Another had grilled cheese with tomato basil soup and really liked it. Another had veggie sandwich and said it was okay, more cheesy than veggie. Had to ask twice for another wine. Also did  not get itemized check, just total on table side machine. We all did love powder room area. Food and cocktails were tasty, restaurant was nice and laid out well. Service could have been better. We will probably give it another try.

While I truly like Ricardo's food, the poor service makes it doubtful that I'd return. We waited 45 minutes or more for one appetizer. The waiter took our order, still no appetizer. When the appetizer arrived and we commented on the extreme wait, he offered no comment at all. We had to hunt him down to get drink refills. All of this happened on a Thursday night with the restaurant only one-third filled. In his defense, I never saw any other wait staff except a girl who looked lost when she refilled drinks. 
I realize any restaurant can have a poor night, but on previous visits, two of us encountered the same slow service. 
There are simply too many good restaurants to ruin a night on a bad one.

Ok so this place is a pass. Mainly because the food is pretty horrible. Surprisingly bad. I'll start by saying it's a super cute place, it has the atmosphere, a pretty good ordering system and great drinks. We didn't have trouble ordering or finding a table even though it was super busy. We ordered coffee and OJ both were good and I ate a chocolate croissant that was amazing! 

However, two of us ordered omelettes, they are $10 and come with one small side. I got mine egg whites with the spinach, tomatoes and goat cheese, I couldn't believe when they brought it out firstly it was tiny secondly it didn't look good it looked like one of those rubbery omelette made in the rubber mold in the microwave. I got potatoes as a side they were awful, super dry and drowned in Parmesan cheese and a cheap cheese. The plating was horrendous too for such a cheap place they stick your omelette on a paper plate with nothing else (it looked sad) and gave you your potatoes in another paper container. Why are they using paper and not real China? It's bad for the environment and made my $10 meal look like a $4 mall food court item. My friend ordered the omelette with whole eggs and grits as the side. Hers looked exactly like mine like it came from an "As seen on TV" rubber mold and she had grits on the side. Also she said it was bad. Our other friend ordered the quinoa bowl and mid way through stopped eating it and asked her why, she said they haven't cooked one or two of the vegetables they are still raw and it's not good. 

The service is lackluster, I ordered a side biscuit (which by the way was not good) they don't bring it with butter or jam you have to request it and they send you to wait in the line at the bar for it again. They also aren't friendly the people bringing you the food not the ones at the bar those are super nice. Their water was out so we had to wait for them to refill and that took forever. 

Would recommend going to see the place, order a coffee and pastry, sit and enjoy the space but don't go for a meal.
Definitely one of the best pizza's around Haverford! Superb quality and speedy delivery = 5 stars in my book.

Gamsa Hamnida!

This tiny place serves up a mean bibimbap - so tasty! Just the right ratios of foods in the bowl, it was the perfect stop right after the bus ride in from NY. Great value, too.

I would have liked my bibimbap a little hotter though - we were the last customers but it would have been nice to throw it in the pan one more time to make sure its piping.

I'm basing this review largely on one incident that was partly my fault but still left a bad taste in my mouth.

I came to this location after my work shift so it's a little after midnight and regardless, this Wawa was packed. I only wanted a hot latte so after putting in my order I braved myself to stand in the line, which only had one cashier and was at least 12 people deep because everyone had to buy their cigarettes. That could be a whole different review, but the cigarette buying process is an endeavor in itself.

My latte was made fairly quickly and the line had not budged so....whatever, I leave my place in line to pick up my drink and go back and wait. The surly drink maker looked at me like I had roaches coming out my eyes when I went up to her and asked if this were my latte, can I just have it while I wait in line, so nobody mistakes it for theirs and takes it?

I know the Wawa rules but it wasn't like I was gonna book it out the door as soon as I got my $3 coffee. Instead, this lady does not give me the coffee and rudely tells me "why don't you go back and wait in line" with such a nasty attitude it took all my might not to tell her to f off. 

So I waited in the long time. While I was waiting, a guy went up to the coffee counter, looking a little confused, and took my latte off the counter.

I'm not dealing with this. I left the line and went over to the 38th street Wawa. Had my coffee and out the door within 5 minutes. 

Anyway like I said, I knew the rules and "broke them" but really, I don't look like a thief. This place just ain't great with customer service and the lines are always long.
You can't go wrong with breakfast here! It's all fresh and interesting. Service is also great. I had a biscuit sandwich and a chocolate croissant. Yummy!!!

I felt that I didnt have enough time to sample all the flavors that I wanted to sample, and ordered the flavor that didnt satisfy my ice cream craving during my time in Nashville.

Sorry for just the 3 star rating but my salted caramel ice scream was just okay.  After looking at what others got, I guess the red velvet ice cream is pretty popular and thats what i should have gotten but didnt.  So i was as salty as my salted caramel ice cream for not getting it.  

I felt the pressure of the long line and was trying to be courteous to others behind me and felt hurried in my ice cream flavor decision. 

Although I would like to say that my 1 scoop was a heaping one scoop of ice cream, big enough to be a double scoop in my eyes.  So kudos to the server for that.

Red velvet - I'll be back for you.
Mike's is the go-to place downtown for good ice cream and excellent home-made waffle cones.

Great shakes and ice creams. Open late. Butterscotch shake was good. 

Can get very crammed and expect a line always, though short.

This is a great, low frills bibimbap spot w a few focused additional offerings. 

Their prices are on point, while the meat is cooked to order and their veggies are marinated / cooked rather than salad like, like at other fast food Korean spots in center city.  Additionally, eggs are perfectly runny to aid in mixing and gelling of all the ingredients in the bowl. 

Tip - if you're afraid of heat, ask for the sauce on the side.
Best Sandwiches anywhere, hands down!!  The prices are great and they are very generous with the meat.

Amazing!!! 
This was my first time here. I felt very comfortable with the girls working there. They were very nice to each other and seemed to have great relationships. Lindsay was the bartender and she was great! Very sweet and very knowledgeable of everything they had to offer. The store was very clean and the staff knew exactly what was expected of them. The bar back assisted the bartender and they had great chemistry.

I noticed this spot a while ago because I love bibimbap and finally had a chance to try it out. I asked the person taking my order which was more popular, beef or chicken...he said chicken so I ordered that to go. He was done making the food in about five minutes which was impressive. There was a variety of fresh, cooked veggies (broccoli, carrots, cabbage, mushrooms, cucumbers and probably some others I'm forgetting like assorted greens),  the spicy red, Korean Gochujang sauce, a fried egg, chicken and sticky white rice (I love that kind of rice!). I thought the chicken could have had a bit more flavor but enjoyed the veggies accompanying it although I wish there were more of them. I want to try the beef next time!

Quaint little ice cream shop amidst the bars on Broadway provides a refreshing break from all the craziness.  I love that Mike's Ice Cream is open late because I had a craving for ice cream at 11pm after an outdoor concert.  I ordered one scoop of Rocky Road in a cup and it hit the spot.  The combination of vanilla ice cream with chocolate peanut butter cups is heaven.  The employees are all friendly and efficient and make me want to come back if I'm ever in town again.

I will give it two thumbs up. It was right around corner from hotel. 

I was not sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised. I will back! 

I had the barge. Only because I wanted to try the shrimp, oysters and catfish. The hand cut fries were cooked to perfection And tasty too. 

The shrimp in my opinion needed to be soaked in milk to get rid of the iodine taste. It was cooked perfectly, the breading was just right. It could just be me and my taste buds. I have had shrimp that doesn't have that iodine taste and prefer it that way. 

The catfish was great  as were the fried oysters. 

I know it said barge but I really didn't expect the barge to be as big as it was. Two could defiantly share this one. As there were ample fries too.  

The place is clean and the staff is very professional and helpful. As this was my first time being here. 

They have a fair selection of beers and other adult beverages. 

Defiantly need to give this a try

Mike's is a place you can walk by twice a day for a week and always pass over. It's easy to ignore, but they actually have delicious ice cream. The flavors aren't too crazy for the most part, but what they make, they do it well. Tried all sorts of things. My favorite was the Almond Joy, which basically tasted like the candy. They also have a digital frame showing all of the celebrities who have been through, which is a considerable amount. They're also open late, so you can fill your drunken sweet tooth.

I went here on Saturday to try the free(!) brunch and LOVED it. The space is cozy without feeling dive-y and the artwork adds a character that is unmatched. We ordered the breakfast sandwich and tiramisu french toast and both were delicious. The nice selection of local draft beer and specialty cocktails will keep me coming back. Very excited to try the dinner menu!

We had an amazing holiday dinner for my company here. The food was amazing, but what sets the Green Pheasant apart is the vibe, the service and the cool places to hang throughout the evening. Their bar was great and the private dining rooms accommodate a variety of meeting/dining needs.

Super cute little hole in the wall! It can only seat a handful of people but it's super worth it. I ate there when only the husband of the owner duo was working. It's inspiring seeing how hard working he was. He ran the whole thing---granted there were only 5 customers including my boyfriend and me----but was still super attentive and kind. 

I ordered the beef bibimbap. It was very delicious and looked gorgeous. The portion could have been slightly bigger, but then it would have given you the super stuffed feeling. It was the right portion size. It's pretty decent priced. I also had the ginger cinnamon tea which came in a nice home-y mug, and it was warm-in-my-belly nice. If you're looking for a decent Korean place and want to support small businesses with hardworkers, give BAP a try.

Bad service. I went during the weekday , which  means they're short? After being seated we asked the person, that was clearing the table, for water. He said you'll have to ask the hostess. 10 minutes later the hostess took our drink order. Then the the waitress took our meal order; I'm not sure why they don't cross train for shortages This place was highly recommended by the front desk at our hotel. It was late by the time we left & we were starving, if not for these reasons I would have left immediately. Horrible customer service & over-priced sandwiches.  BTW it was another 10 MINUTES before 4 waters were served & 30 minutes for fried seafood on a bun. The place was crowded, but not without empty tables, so I guess the shortage applied to the kitchen as well.

My wife and I went to Mahony's on Iberville Street for lunch yesterday the food was amazing, presentation, flavor and temperatures were on point! Ashley J was our server she gave us personalized service felt like she was our auntie the was she took care and looked after us during lunch. This 5-star review is really to highlight Ashley J. Thank you so much, we'll be back with our son before we head back to DC

The 3 stars are for the new Ginger Spritzer, which I could never get enough of, & the Italian lessons you get in the ladies room, lol!

I've had a couple of dishes here. 

The eggplant in the eggplant parmigiana was sliced really thick. I'm used to thin slices, so I can't say I loved it. 

The crusted sole was my least favorite dish here. I'm not sure if it was simply a fluke, but it was SOAKED in grease (butter or oil, not sure & don't care). There were maybe 5 little capers on top & I did ask for more, hoping to salvage the taste of the least greasy portions.   

The orzo with the sun dried tomatoes was YUMMY.

This was just a strange experience. Walking in you feel the identity crisis. The prices are outrageous even by Nashville standards. The quality is exactly what you would expect from a place trying to do too much. My sandwich was warm around the edges and refrigerator cold in the middle. Cool concept. Cool name. Cool area. Poorly executed.

What a lovely place!
I found it by accident having visited the camera store across the street. The cats a very friendly and chatty and all different personalities. Oh and the coffee was nice too :-)

Well it's turned into one of those CLOSE TO CAMPUS places. The person taking the orders was not very smooth. But the DEAL BREAKER was the food POISONING. That's Right food poisoning. I spent the rest of the day between the couch and a little boy's room. Won't be back to this place. I might add it either came from the eggs not being cooked or the additives. If you're under 30 you might like this place if you're over 30 save yourself an illness. YMMV.

Food wasn't great... they didnt have much of the menu. 

Service was poor... and they weren't super busy either. 

They overcharged us for our beer and when we pointed it out, they acknowledged the error as a system error and fixed it. So make sure you check your check! Def not as good as Chumley's. Probably not coming back.
The local mule was absolutely delicious. Shrimp Po-Boy and creole slaw was amazing. The restaurant itself was fantastic with great vibe and really nice place to sit at the bar. Highly recommend
One of the best places in Ardmore.  Many an order placed here back in the legendary days on the main-line.

First time here! And this place I feel like I was in a different whole new state! My friends and I just came here for drinks and we got the frose' . Very cute place , and definitely will be coming back to try out more stuff!

I scream for Mike's Ice Cream! We happened upon this ice cream parlor when walking through downtown Nashville & are so glad we stopped in. Make sure you pick an ice cream from a square box because those are the homemade flavors. Being a huge fan of chocolate peanut butter combinations, I chose the peanut butter cup ice cream and might have just discovered my favorite version as the ice cream itself had a great combination of chocolate and peanut butter rather than just chocolate ice cream with globs of peanut butter in it.
My friend tried the cookie cone, and while not sure at first, said it ended up going really well with her Rocky Road ice cream which she loved because of the abundance of ingredients.
You will definitely get your money's worth with the nice size scoops served here.

Came here and had the best sandwich ever! Service was great and friendly staff. Decided this will be the last meal before leaving New Orleans. 
Came in today and it was the complete opposite!
I ordered the Peacemaker and a tea. After a while she set my sandwich down and walked away. By the time I realized she gave me the wrong sandwich she was nowhere in site. It took 15 minutes to get her attention and I asked her "what is this?"
She said "it's the short rib".
I figured she would remember right when she said it. I guess she thinks I said "short rib". 
Anyway she offered to remake it but because it took so long I had to get to the airport. It's nice to be social but you need to check on the customers from time to time.

As a bar, this place has almost everything you'd want. Ping pong, small table games, couches, lots of space for standing and sitting, and also weekly trivia and a huge menu of food and beers! But coming in on Thursday, the crowd didn't meet my expectations. The food was pretty pricey, with a $15 burger coming with a side of chips (which no one at the table ate, the flavor was off or burnt or something). The french fries we ordered were a hit, just wish we asked for more aioli. The hush puppies were huge and came lightly citrus-tasting, which was enjoyable to some, and just alright to others. The burger was perfectly cooked, with delicious cheese and toppings that might make it my favorite burger I've had in a while! But not cheap to eat, as the price doesn't include fries. The chicken sandwich, the same price, was pretty good, but the volume of food doesn't make me want to order again. I really loved the mac and cheese after adding some salt and parmesan. I will be back again and maybe try a salad, but I'm glad I tried everything and can say that I've given Craft Hall a good go! I'm hoping they can attract more people to this cool space, and maybe start catering towards large groups, because they really do have something cool to offer.

The bartender was friendly I. And 10 minutes before happy hour was about to end and she charged me full price .  I did mention to it when I first came in I asked what was in happy hour beer.  Oh well maybe next time blondie with the purple hair will charge me happy hour price :)

Recently visited New Orleans for a extended weekend. Three out of five of us were excited about the bottomless Veuve Clicquot Rose they offer for brunch. Regretfully, after they pour you the first drink you have to chase your server down for a refill. Be prepared, just trying to set expectations appropriately. I also wanted to mention the over all service at this restaurant is below standard. That's the issue, no service. Our waiter Nikolas would spend more time standing around talking and playing on his computer that he takes orders with, than helping the table help (assistant). We had to ask for things 2 and 3 times. It was quite annoying. I wanted to forewarn you the food is EXTREMELY salty. Be prepared for some flavor. Two of the five of us in the party left with stomach aches due to over salting/seasoning. Lastly, double check your bill. Our server once we were done with brunch came over and gave us our total and didn't supply us with a copy of the bill. When he told us the amount, we all looked at one another and thought it was high. Sure enough after asking for a copy of our bill were charged for one more bottomless Veuve Clicquot Rose. It felt very unethical honestly. Though portrayed as an error, something didn't seem nor feel right. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to friends, family or colleagues. There are many choices in New Orleans, good choices... My reasoning for giving the two stars is because Nikolas's help really worked hard and did all he could. That young man should be the ones giving orders to Nikolas... I am confident one day he will be.

I've enjoyed this place and have always had good food and service.  The only caveat to this would be the environment which is a very "child friendly" restaurant where families seem to go out with other families while their children run around the restaurant creating chaos and ruiniing the experience for anyone trying to have an adult conversation.  Apparently the restaurant realizes this clientele base thus does nothing to curtail it so if you want some adult time, it might be better to go to another restaurant or go here later in the day.  Anyway, back to the food which in my experience there has always been tasty.  My mother gets a hamburger and fries which she has always liked and I get the fish sandwhich which has always been good.  Service good as well and I'll be back.

We enjoyed an outstanding meal at The Pearl last night.  The food was exceptional.  The wine list very broad.  The service, while pleasant and friendly, could have been more attentive for the quality of dining experience.

We shared the bouillabaisse and a seafood crepe with a champagne sauce.  The seafood in both dishes was delicious and perfectly cooked.  The broth and the champagne sauce were both sublime.  The tuna martini appetizer, sort of a tuna cervice on seaweed salad, was a tasty start to a complete gourmet meal.  We enjoyed the Pinot Grigio wines that accompanied our dinners and the grand finale dessert consisting of small eau claires filled with vanilla ice cream and topped with chocolate and whipped cream.

Overall, a very nice find (although they are well established) on the beach.

Like the Terminator, I'll be back.

Ate at Ricardo's Saturday night with another couple.  Looking at the menu beforehand, I was prepared for a mediocre experience.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The atmosphere was great for a date.  I would say this is an excellent place for a business lunch or dinner, too.  We had an opportunity to sit and chat with the owner while waiting for the other couple, then for four of us had a drink at the bar and continued the conversation.  She was very friendly and helpful - obviously willing to do whatever it took to make our visit enjoyable.   

The menu is pretty standard Italian.   We had Lasagna, Cannelloni, Chicken Parmesan and Eggplant Parmesan.  All of the appetizers looked fantastic and the two I tried were great.    A big plus here is they have two sizes for their pasta dishes.  The smaller size is just right for most people and most are priced UNDER $7, so it's an amazing value.  Red wine by the pour was from $6 to $8 - very reasonable for a nicer restaurant, and the pours were very generous while not so full that you couldn't swirl the wine. 

One complaint that keeps this from being a five:  the house salad was only okay - light and vinegary with not as much cheese as we would like.  

A big bonus of eating here is that Bailey's Chocolate Bar and 33 Wine Bar are on the same block, so you can visit either for an after dinner drink or dessert. 

Lafayette Square is my favorite date place in St. Louis, hands down and I'll be recommending RIcardo's a lot from here on out.

I visited Caviar and Bananas on a Monday at 9:45am. 
First the positive:  the interior is bright and fun.  The space is large and can easily accommodate groups meeting for lunch.  The lunch counter is open at 9:45 am. 
 The staff was nice. 
The negative:
The line at the coffee bar/breakfast line had about 7 people in it and others were standing waiting for their food to be ready.  I wanted to try the ricotta toast but I did not want to wait 30 minutes for toast. So I ordered lunch. 
My roasted chicken wrap had plenty of chicken which was nice. There was also plenty of arugula. But that was about it.  There should have been tomatoes, red onion, cheese and a spread. One bite had a taste of a dressing/spread.  Also, there was at least 1/3 of the tortilla left once I ate the filling. No chips or side item or drink. The wrap cost $9.50. I believe the menu is overpriced for what I received.
Maple bacon ice cream was to DIE for. Lots of other great flavors. Homemade and local ones which is nice to see.

April 2, 2011 Saturday - Dinner 5:45 PM
2 people (1 kid and me)

Atmosphere - 5 stars
Food - 4 stars
Service - 3 stars

Background - Been here many times in the past but do not remember how long it has been since the last visit, more than a year easily.

Atmosphere - Dimly lit restaurant chain with a rustic "Italian" feel.  The restaurant was full and half of the customers were prom goers.  While waiting to be seated I just my daughter the cart of logs being hauled in, which led to the conversation about the wood oven they have in the corner of the kitchen.

Food
Appetizer - The free bread they provide before the meal was piping hot, the steamed poured out after pulling it apart with my hands.  The second loft served during the meal was the same way.

Dinner - I had order the Roasted Chicken Cannelloni.  The cheese filling was excellent.  The sauce was not too sweet, just right, but there could have been more.  I would have loved to dip my bread into the sauce.  The chicken had little to no flavor; it could have been very firm tofu.  I would have preferred that the cannelloni be served on a plate instead of a flat wide bowl; it just made the use of a fork a little challenging, as the bowl served no purpose to hold anything in.

Dessert - We skipped this as I had planned on another location for this treat.

Service - The hostess indicated that was a small wait as they were cleaning and prepping the table, not an issue as I was expecting a wait.  A minute later she indicated that she was ready.  While walking to the table half way there we had to turn around as the table was not ready.  When we did get there the table was set up for four people, strange.  Our waitress was very sweet and attentive.  My daughter received an adult sized beverage, I figured she was getting older, so I was comfortable and did not send it back even though she order from the kids menu.  So the bill arrived and her drink was on the tab, as it should not be as it is part of the kid's meal.  They charge $2.20 for a glass of Sprite, really?  I brought this up to the waitress, she looked at the bill and then the class quickly, and instantly she knew what happened.  She indicated that I was correct, and in less than a minute it was corrected with a new bill.

Stopped in here tonight for an early dinner and was not disappointed. I started off with a Yuzu Sour, which was great. One of our guests doesn't drink and the bartender prepared her a delicious alcohol-free mixed drink upon request. All the food was outstanding, but the Brussels sprouts were the best thing I ate - the sauce was SO flavorful and just a little sweet. My only complaint is how the dining area is laid out. I'm no expert on this matter but as a party of 4 our only table choices were right in front of the entrance, or at a small round table oddly wedged in a corner. Wouldn't deter me from coming back, though. Service and food made up for it!

I tried placing an order online tonight, but it did not go through, so I called to check. Upon placing the order on the phone, there was some confusion and a delivery order was placed rather than pickup (I planned to pick up). I went to Ardmore Pizza to get my order and soon realized the pizza was being delivered to my house. Despite the confusion, the owner offered to give me a pizza right there and turned the driver around. I really appreciate their accommodation and kindness! First time eating at Ardmore pizza and it was great! I'll be back again for sure!

Exceeded my expectations. Bring a small group son you can sample the most. I tried so many things it was all great: tebasaki goyza (stuffed chicken wing), sui goyza (steamed dumplings), chahan (fried rice with egg), spice crab noodles (watch out they are spicy), and a pancake thing that I couldn't  find on the online menu to try to remember what it was. The Ambience was trendy and cool. I really enjoyed it.

Phenomenal evening with clients. Owner was present and by the table several times. App specials were to die for and the lamb dishes second to none. Every time I've been back there are new things to try and they just keep getting better and better. Cigar bar next door after desserts works well too!

What an experience! Talk about magical dinners! Yesterday was my first night at Tuna Bar and I can't wait to go back. 

We had made reservations in advance and were seated in what I think is the best table of the restaurant - a small table just for two by the window/glass doors. The weather was nice so they had their sliding doors open in which you could feel the breeze and the environment from the outside but also feel like you were part of the upscale dining environment in doors. From either end of the table you got views from the restaurant and from the outside which I thought was magnificent. 

The restaurant per say is beautiful, it has very chic. modern and elegant decor. They have leather booths and small tables and a nice design throughout the restaurant. The music is audible but not extremely loud that disrupts your conversation. 

The service was also very good and our waitress was very pleasant. 

As for the meal everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. We tried the shishito peppers which were perfectly seasoned and the fried Brussels sprouts which were also perfectly crunchy. For our main course we ordered both the Fishtown and Old City sushis and they were SO SO GOOD I'm still dreaming about them. The desserts were also good but not mind blowing (this was the only ok part of our meal). We tried both the Green Tea and the Tree Cake and they were traditional Japanese Sponge Cake which was very good but not exactly what we were expecting as our dessert. 

Our glasses of wine and proseco were also very good - I just wish they offered half bottles at a more convenient price. 

Bottom line is, If you are in old city and looking for a place to dine don't think about it twice.

Mike's is perfectly placed for ice cream after you have a few drinks on Broadway. 

Located around the corner of the main Broadway street.

Long big shop. Plenty of seating inside. Big ice cream menu.

No line when I came but when we were ready to leave, the line was 10 people deep. 

Staff were friendly. I got to try a few samples. 

Double Scoop - $4.95 - Pistachio & Pralines & Cream - Flavors were good. Very creamy. Melts fast when outside. Eat it fast!

We were pretty disappointed in this meal. The staff was friendly but unhelpful in trying to pick dishes to fit our tastes. Though I'm not sure it would have helped. We tried 6 dishes. The first was basically cold potato salad, pretty much the same as I could pick up at Kroger. The dumplings were bland and flavorless, the curry udon was basically a bowl of mush, and while the trout was good, it could have been trout from any southern restaurant and didn't ring of Japanese flavors at all. The only dish that we enjoyed that had the expected flavoring was the Broccolini with rock shrimp, which was pretty good. 1 for 6 isn't great.

The drinks were fine but not particularly special at 14 bucks each. The waitress described the atmosphere as a neighborhood Japanese pub but it's just another upscale dining establishment in a town full of them. The ambience or atmosphere is the same as any other in town.

Overall, it was not a terrible meal, but not really a good meal either. Just kind of a dud (and an expensive dud at that) in a town full of much better restaurants. We probably wont return.

Tuna Bar is a great place to come for a date night with your boo, friends or gals. The ambience is reallly chill- dimly lit in some sections and decent lighting in others. The decor is relatively simple but very clean and modern. 

We had the tuna tartare & wagyu egg rolls to start. The tuna tartare was delicious- very refreshing & the flavors were amazing. The egg rolls were good- nothing too out of this world but still very tasty. 

We also ordered the Fishtown roll, salmon/avocado rolls & the peppered tuna roll. The Fishtown roll is just the right amount of spice to it. The avocado in the roll was creamy and delicious. I wasn't a fan of the peppered tuna roll but my boyfriend really liked it. 

A few rounds & a few rolls will cost you a few dollars, but definitely worth it for a night out with loved ones.

Will def be back!
Good chicken wings, waitresses have a great attitudes went there on a Saturday night, lots of families and good sports, founders all day IPA on tap
Great sushi and love the atmosphere. My favorite is the mirror on the ceiling by the sushi bar where you can watch them prepare your sushi
Beer was extremely cold, so made it Amazing lol .  Service was super nice and food.. if u get the wings bone in there HUGEEEEE TRY THE JALAPEÑO BUTTER

I don't even know where to start with this restaurant. I can remember going to Tony's when I was a very little girl. The place was always standing room only and it was a super treat to go. Over the years this is the place that my family would always go when we got together in Alton. Over the last several months I have been in town quite a bit and have been to Tony's no less than six times in two months. However, every time I go I feel worse about the decision. While the pepperloins are still top-notch I cannot say the same about other items on the menu. The veal is pre-breaded frozen patties and tasted like it was over-cooked after being freezer burned. The spaghetti was cold and over-cooked. The pizza used to be the best anywhere around. For some reason they have changed the crust and now is just so-so. The staff, while usually friendly, are inexperienced and in 6 trips in two months we have never seen the same waiters. Not sure why there seems to be such turnover, but this prevents them from knowing the basics, such as what brands of alcohol are available.

Perhaps the biggest shock here is the recent attempt of Tony's to change the menu format. The create your own pizza/pasta gimmick is not the tradition that I have come to love from this restaurant. 

I will not go as far as to say I will not go back, as I have long loved this place and hope they will return to their former traditional ways.

This was a 2nd choice as our first choice in Tucson proper was packed.

I had the spaghetti with meat sauce which was pretty decent. It was a homemade sauce with lots of meat and even chunks of real tomatoes in it. The sauce was not sickeningly sweet and actually tasted pretty decent.

The bread was fresh on the table and the cold antipasti was excellent. Salads were fresh and not from a bag and the dressings were decent.

A loud atmosphere inside and the crowding of the tables inside would be the only downfall. Also, they sat a party of four at a table that at most could fit 2 comfortably.

Service was decent, but not exceptional. There were times our table of four was ignored but drinks seemed to be refilled on a regular basis. Hostess staff was not impressive and seemed to be bored or uninterested and seemed to spend most of the time flirting with the waiters as they ran their tickets next to the host staff.

From my two local Tucson natives, this location is better than the one on Broadway I believe.

I wanted this to be a 4* review but due to the few shortcomings it will have to remain at 3. Not good for groups due to the small, crammed together tables and relatively few booths.

Typical mall parking situation.

Romano's is usually very consistent and that's a good thing when traveling.. Trying new places in Reno hasn't really been good experiences so we decided to go with what we know. 

Our server (Sinead) was very pleasant, friendly and seemed like she was enjoying her job.. It was a Friday evening a little slow so we had time to talk with her as we were her only table. 

The food was spot on with our favorite dishes. 

One of the hostesses (Megan) stood on a chair and sang a beautiful Italian opera song which was very nice. We've never had experienced this before. 

The place was spotless. I don't know the managers name (mid age white female) and she didn't stop.. She was on the go the whole time doing whatever needed to be done. She stopped by to ask if everything was ok.

Several of us had lunch there, the pasta was so under cooked you could use it for tires.  The Alfredo and Pomodoro sauces and the pasta were all but cold, lukewarm would be a stretch.  Very unpleasant, we won't be back.  Not much has changed over the years.  When they first opened years ago they were good, not so much now.

As a regular at the New Jersey Restaurant, Yokahama, we stopped to have dinner at the new restaurant here in Phila . Start to finish everything was excellent. Ken has done a great job with ambiance and excellent fresh meals. Service was great also. Parking was a bit of a challenge though.  Good luck Ken.

We went  Saturday  February 11. My husband ordered  blackened lobster with pasta. The lobster  was not  blackened. It was tough . I ordered the filet mignon. The meat was very fatty. I don't think it was really a filet. We had heard that they got a new chef and the food was much better.  Well it is not. Very  over priced and I don't think the meat is of high quality. I think it is very over priced low quality food. I could have gone to Outback and got a better quality steak and come home with change in my pocket.  I would not recommend this place. Very very disappointed.
Terrific Japanese cuisine with great service. Lovely ambience in super location. Excellent value too. Will upgrade to 5 upon next visit I'm sure, couldn't stay long this visit.

If zero stars was a possibility, that's what I'd give them. If you want a terrible pizza (seriously, how do you mess up pizza- little Caesar's is better), a sad simple syrup heavy, vodka light martini, mediocre service at best, this is your place. In order to choke down the pizza crust, we ordered a side of ranch, it was watered down at least 50/50. How about Caesar instead? Nope, watered down as well. I seriously don't get how this place is in business. It has gone so so so downhill. Sad, I'll never visit again.

First time here and it is great! Huge open space with a variation of places to sit (ie: couches, high top tables, bar). Bartenders are personable, attentive and cocktails are fantastic. Jeff made an amazing manhattan for me. Fabulous beer selection, will be back!

Don't be afraid of the location!  Absolutely great food and service. Probably the best shrimp lettuce wrap I've ever had. All made from scratch. I consider myself a foodie and and I will be back even though we live in NC!

How fun and mod is this place? Something for everyone. It is modern sleek and something like a very upscale choose your own food. You may choose from breakfast items, amazing salads or sandwiches. Each in a different area. You take your pick and pay at a central area. If you want to be waited on ... not for you. If you want very healthy interesting food .. perfect. The sweet chili Brussel sprouts are to die for. Cuban sandwich nice too. I liked it.
Best and most creamy ice cream ever!!! Many flavors to choose from. On 2nd Ave just off Broadway.
We were seated right away and the food was great as well as the service we received from our server "Tina", we will definitely be back again!
We had a fantastic breakfast here! Everyone 's food was super and the service was brilliant. I looked in the window to see a lady crafting bagels by hand, awesome!Thank you

I enjoy the atmosphere of this place. The bartender, Jessica, was amazing and very nice and seemed interested in conversation. The beer I ordered came out fast and was ice cold. The food was amazing too, no issues with it and was a speedy delivery to me.
Very disappointed with my experience. I could go into details but I'm too upset to sit here and write about it since it was just a few minutes ago. Would not recommend

I actually really enjoyed this place! Service was very fast and everyone was friendly. This place was tiny but packed! I don't remember what flavor I got to be honest but I had a milkshake which was thick and delicious. I also tried all my friend's ice creams which were just as good. I don't think you can go wrong here.

Woohoo!  Yelp does it again!  What a fantastic place!  I tell you, I am no longer afraid of going places I'm not familiar with anymore because Yelp has yet to steer me wrong.  If you have a smart phone and you do not have a Yelp app, or do have it and don't use it, what's wrong with you man??? (-in my Chris Tucker voice!)

This place is what local legendary places is all about and what Yelp has helped me to discover.  The atmosphere in this area of town is great, somewhat, touristy, but authentic.  The place itself is about as big as a chicken nugget, but the place itself is clean and well organized.  Not only is this fantastic ice cream, but also a full fledged coffee shop with all of the foo foo drinks you could want.  They have some neat little displays and murals on the wall.  One is a fountain that looks as if it's poring into a soda glass from the soda fountain mural.  Quite inventive and cute.  They also have their own T-shirts for sale as well with their famous logo and location of Nashville, TN. I bought one.

Finally, the ice cream itself here is great.  It's not too frozen so it melts while you eat it tastes better.  Doesn't have any of that freezer burn smell or taste to it.  They also have some pretty crazy flavors, including a banana flavored one that went fantastically with a scoop of chocolate.  From what I understand, the ice cream is hand made, and you can taste the quality of the ingredients.

Well, if we journey anywhere close to Nashville anytime in the future, I will have to stop again here.  There are just too few of these legitimately local places that are too good here in the heart of the USA to pass it by.  You will not regret any time spent here!

It's always crowded in here! I came here early in the day and again at night on the same day and the lines were endless. I ordered the coffee and triple berry, which was the only vegan option. The portions are huge! They have so many cool flavors and I wanted to sample so many but because of the long lines I didn't get to. Bummers. I ended up going with my safe choice, coffee, and I was super satisfied. The coffee taste wasn't too strong or weak and it was so creamy! The portions are huge. Well, not for me, but for the average human.

If you want a feel for a Up North Italian deli you have found it! Recently moved to Largo and we thoroughly enjoy everything we've had here. Customer service is awesome and aside from amazing dishes and subs try their pastries made from scratch and yummy good.

Excellent place. Came here when we discovered Killers Po'Boys wasn't open on Tuesdays.  Glad we did.  We liked Mahony's better.  Selection was huge. Service was great.  Lots of clean, comfortable seating just one block away from the Bourbon Street chaos.  Wait staff knowledgeable and helpful.  They get their bread from Leidenheimers Bakery.  My suggestion is the Grilled Shrimp on Fried Green Tomato with Roumalade.  This combination was invented at the Upperline in 1992 but Mahony's does it justice. Awesome place. We will return.

Icy cold draft beer and nice service.  I felt a lil creepy at first here as we came on "Lingerie day", or what my people call "Friday ". After a while you settle in and it's just a good, massive sports bar that serves high-end bar food. 
The venison chili was surprisingly good. Nice layers of savory gravy and the perfect meat to beans ratio.  Go off the reservation and order the buck. 
My dining tastes tend to be a lil bipolar, so from there I ordered the meatless Imposter Burger. This was really strange for a veggie burger.  It was really juicy and meaty - almost too wet for me, but you gotta try this one for yourself.

Having read other reviews on yelp, I didn't have great expectations heading into this place but all in all, it is not that bad.  The burgers will not knock your socks off but they are better than average.  Nice assortment of appetizers- I loved the chicken nachos with banana peppers and asiago cheese.  On a cold gray day, it was a nice place to visit to get my mind on the summertime!

Was so excited for this place... but I believe the leadership & execution here, particularly in the Kitchen, needs some serious revamping.

I've eaten at Caviar & Bananas in Charleston, and we had the most amazing sandwich! Their ingredients were fresh, the menu well thought out and even better prepared, and staff was sharp and knowledgable.

At this new Nashville location though, I was missing those things.

The location, layout, decor and ambiance of the restaurant gets an A+, it's one of the nicest in Nashville. But the food, was sadly very disappointing. 

The sandwich we got had Arugula, Egg, Turkey and some other stuff, and it looked amazing... but it had weak and cheap tasting bread, and cheap tasting Turkey. I'm not sure what they use, but it was very disappointing and reminded me of cheap packaged deli meat... especially for the price this was a shock. We also got avocado toast which reads great on the menu, but again thin / cheap bread and an old (dark green) avocado spread that didn't taste fresh at all. We love Avo toast! So this was a bummer.

We also got a Quinoa Kale Veggie Breakfast bowl, but the overall taste of the quinoa and veggies was slightly undercooked and the ingredients weren't prepared to compliment each other. The eggs on top were fine... The staff was very sweet, but wasn't sure what one of the items in the dish even was... they did refund the dish after I talked with them about not enjoying it all, which was awesome. Then i ordered the recommended Chicken Biscuit instead, and it was unfortunately worse. The cheese tasted cheap, the scrambled eggs were soggy, and the chicken was thin and soggy itself, which was crazy. I was actually so surprised because Nashville is a great Fried Chicken town and this was the worst piece of Chicken I've had here... A $3 Chicken biscuit from Chic-Fil-A or Zaxbys would have been much much better taste and better quality chicken (I know, strange)... and this cost $10. Also, I ordered it with Parmesan Potatoes which might have been okay but sadly they came out cold and not fresh... like they had been sitting on a counter for 45 minutes... 

We did order a croissant with strawberry jam and it was amazing! So props there... 

For what this place could be, it has a lot of improvement to make. They have a great foundation, beautiful space, sweet people, and awesome croissants... they just really need to up the game on the quality of the food! And please do! I would love to come back and enjoy C&B at its fullest potential.
omg i had babbies while eating this stuff......try the rasberry cheesecake or something along the lines of this & nutter butter!....it will make u cry of joy.....
Hidden away but a great find.  The place was clean, the air delicious and the food tasty. I good bet. A short visit with Mark the manager affirmed my feeling. We will be back.

I'm so excited when I get to give 5 stars. Listen people. This is the best potato salad you will ever have. It's the best ever!. The seafood gumbo was solid and how the hell can you not order the fried chicken liver po boy. There is talk of making this into a franchise. Well I want in. Call me.

Did I mention the potato salad?

I love places that aren't afraid of bold flavors and spices. Cant wait to go back.
Ashley is the funniest and best bartender I have ever been around! Oysters were great and the wings made it onto my top 5. Definitely a favorite in my book!

We stumbled on this place which was next door to our hotel. This restaurant is really nice. It has nice sports cars inside the restaurant! Ok... I was supposed to talk about the food. The food was excellent!! We ordered the Alligator Sausage Po-Boy & Seafood platter! It was the best Po-Boy in town! The food is so much better than anywhere I ate here in French Quarter. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Great atmosphere! I highly recommend this place! Will definitely be back when I am back in town!

Everyone loves Wawa. That's a fact. That's science.

Which makes it all the more surprising that this Wawa has a lowly 3.5 star rating... Even more surprising yet is the fact that a couple of the 3 star reviews actually seem fairly laudatory. Are these reviewers comparing this University City oasis to some suburban Wawa ideal? The world may never know...

I find that there is very little not to like about this Wawa. Yeah, they could stock a few more cereals and I really wish they carried Double Stuf Oreos, but they can't have everything... Because then they'd be a grocery store. 

I also wish that I didn't order gross sandwiches while drunk so often, but that's not exactly their fault... Though perhaps they should consider adding a confirmation page that asks, "Are you sure, dummy?" when you order something greasy and gross between midnight and 4am.

Those minor quasi-complaints aside, I love this Wawa. It's always open, it's clean and brightly lit, and it has an excellent selection of Ben & Jerry's.

Great chow.    Authentic.  Excellent service.  Booze selection is awesome.   VERY affordable.  Fun atmosphere.   Right near the action.   Big surprise after a dozen trips to New Orleans.   and I will definitely be back!
Beer is not better at 27.5 degrees! The servers were clueless! Only 2 sizes for beer- 10oz and 22oz? Don't expect much from Twin Peaks, the 'Peaks' weren't that great.
Excellent service! Wait time for meal was not long. Continually checked on by server. Food was cooked perfectly! Very satisfied.

Very nice dinner last night. Went with two friends and we all had the tagine dishes (2 Sea Bass and one lamb). It was delicious. Great flavor and good portion. We also tried the Brie special whcih was wonderful! For drinks I had the pineapple refresher (delish!) and my friend had the berry cosmopolitan. She is not a big drinker, so it was a bit too strong for her...she likes it very sweet :-)
Service was great. Attentive and nice wait staff. Only issue was needing to ask for bread twice before it was brought out. Definitely coming back! 
Noise level was loud only because of the party at a table near us. Even after moving, we could still hear their loud laughing and conversations. The guitarist was very talented and added to the nice feel after the loud party left.

Myself and a friend had no idea what to expect coming here as the menu doesn't give away too much. However, we chose our meat, hoped for the best and weren't disappointed.
To be honest, I had no clue what half of the stuff in the bowl was... but it was delicious.
Great service too by the sweet old man who owns it and runs the shop. Would recommend it if you wanna try something new!

36th and Chestnut Wawa, why must you keep your tampons in a locked glass case? Do you know how embarrassing it is to ask a sales associate to open the case, then have the sales associate yell across to the store to a co-worker to bring him the key, then stand by and WATCH as I pick out my box of tampons? Are these particular tampons made of gold, or perhaps the rarest cotton in Mozambique? It eludes me.

We don't have too many good inexpensive Italian restaurants in the area, at least I didn't think so. then I found out about Ricardo's in the Lafayette park area.  This was the second visit to the restaurant, and it wont be my last. 

we were there for the dining out for life event and it was nice that we were seated pretty quickly with our table of 7.  it didn't take the waiter too long to make it to the table introduce himself and take the drink order. a few minutes later he returned and we ordered our food.  They have a nice sized menu, and the prices are very reasonable.  I ordered the half order of cannelloni with a red and cream sauce and a house salad with their house dressing.

The food arrived quickly and hot, and I was not disappointed in the least bit with my order, I wasn't a fan of the dressing but that was just me, please come to your own conclusions with the dressings, I imagine they are tasty judging by the people at the table that did eat it.

I noticed that they had a nice lunch menu and I would really like to try them out for lunch sometime.. would I return to this restaurant for another round of dinner? yes you bet I would.   you get good food at a good price, and in this day and age, a good deal is always a welcoming friend...

Glad this NOLA institution finally found its way to the French Quarter! They are renowned for their po-boys, and my to-go catfish version early in our weeklong visit did not disappoint! That was accompanied by a generous order of their thin-cut onion rings, and I now definitely believe the "voted nation's best" claim. Both items made me look forward to a weekend return with some local friends, where we sampled several more items, and enjoyed attentive & thoughtful service (which is especially important to me, since most of my kids have been servers, including a couple in our party). I was particularly pleased with the fried shrimp on my platter, definitely very jumbo and lightly breaded, and the comparable po-boy was wolfed down by a younger table mate. Another tried the Grilled Shrimp Remi, and was similarly pleased. There are no shortage of other traditional and specialty po-boys, over 20 by my count, several other seafood platters, plus multiple Cajun staples, like the red beans & rice polished off by another of our crew. The drinks that were sampled were all very well received, from the mojito to the root beer float, and the bananas foster ice cream was chilled goodness. This has just risen to near the top of my go-to NOLA joints!
Food, drinks, and superior service. John S. Is the best server! Check this place out.

If not for the tedious wait this would be a 5 star ice cream joint! The nutter butter, mint chocolate oreo, and chocolate peanut butter cup are delicious. You can tell the ice cream is well whipped and homemade.

Copper Vine has a pretty legit happy hour, and their lunch special during Coolinary New Orleans was really good. I've been consistently impressed with the food and drink, though the service leaves something to be desired (mostly just the speed and occasionally the accuracy). I love to order a glass of wine at happy hour and sit out on their patio, which is the stuff of my dreams: literally, just plants as far as the eye can see. My favorite lunchtime order is the fried shrimp poboy (their pepper jelly and pickled okra are SO GOOD) with a side of gumbo. They have a huge selection of wines and I've only tried a few of them; one was excellent, and the other (the house red) wasn't great, but I didn't have super high expectations for the budget blend. Overall, this is a great place to get lunch in the CBD (especially if you've got extra time to kill).

Great food, great service, and pretty environment. This place has one of the best "rice" free sushi options I have had called The Geisha! It comes in rolled cucumber and is phenomenal. Also recommend getting the fried oysters...slightly embarrassed to say we ate her twice in one weekend - parking is almost non existent in old city and at this place so I would recommend taking a Lyft or walking.

Went here yesterday for a lunch. Sat outside; it was a beautiful day. Staff were super nice and accommodating. I had the avocado toast and added tomatoes. It was SO delicious! (Would order again). My sister had a buttermilk biscuit egg sandwich that she loved too. Would definitely return and highly recommend.

This place was packed last night when me and my boyfriend went to get a pie. We went around 1 ish and omg! Its was like walking in on dinner for schmucks. Pizza was good, took about 30 minutes for our food...oh but what a show. There was this drunk girl ordering food in front of us...totally holding up the line. When the counter girl asked her to move over so she could take my order, she wouldnt...the drunk girl was completely obnoxious...one of her friends had to come to the counter to tell the douche bag to sit down...
Overall, I like this place, but sometimes it gets a little annoying when you have to deal with drunk customers

Looks like a nice place from the outside, but the Bubble tea really sucked. If you are going to blend ice into it, at least do it so it's smooth and not gritty or rocky. Also something is wrong when you Green Tea Bubble Tea looks white and not green. Bubbles had the wrong texture too. Yuck!

We also ordered the egg tarts which were good.

Based on my experience though, I have no desire of coming back.

Hoagiefest!
6 inch 2.99 subs can't be beat.

The ordering system for the hoagies may take the uninitiated by surprise at first but it is fairly intuitive.  The coffee at Wawa is also extremely underrated, especially the mocha iced coffee. 

Wawa is the king in Philly and Southern Jersey for comfort food on the go.

We wandered by this small little hole in the wall and decided to stop in. Best homemade icecream I've ever had! Great prices and a HUGE selection. Plus an adorable if you don't tip a child gets a mullet sign. Any place that can make us laugh like that deserves a tip and a review!

Totally hit the spot on a late night pizza run after the FAMU Classic football game. We got the two slice special with a drink and added hot wings. Delicious NY-style pizza with the perfect amount of cheese and sauce. The wings were hot and crunchy, the way I like em'. 

We got our food to go because it was late and the strip club is next door.

39 North has to have the best clams in white sauce in Delco. Tuesday nights is special all you can eat clams for $14.95. The first plate includes spaghetti, and salad or soup. The clams were the very small cockle type, perfectly cooked, every one of them open. Most important, these clams were CLEAN! not a speck of sand. I didn't count, but there were easily 20-24 clams on a reasonable amount of spaghetti. The white sauce was in a light butter and wine sauce, with plenty there to dip warm rolls into. Service was excellent, nicely attentive as they took away empty dishes & brought a second order of clams and sauce on time. A nice surprise in what appears to be your average Delco sports bar from the outside.
The shrimp po'boy is so good. Ty is a good server. Highly recommend this place. Omg, soooooo good.
Friendly service, great atmosphere, drinks, and food!!! Very clean. Would definitely recommend this place!
This is a very interesting spot for specialty items and local items like that delicious Nashville fountain of juice. This is a great place to grab coffee, dessert or a salad / sandwich for lunch.
The dry-rub wings (that isn't the actual name) are the best wings I have ever had. Ever.

Parking lot was dead we came right after lunch. Seated right away but took awhile to see the waitress. Sweet Tea had a different taste than normal. Ordered fried pickles they were good. The fish and chips super greasy and the chicken fried chicken was also. Mac and cheese had no flavor. The only good was the waitress was nice.

Great all around experience.  The ice cream is top-notch - creamy, decadent, and a large variety for all different tastes.  The staff was warm and friendly even inspite of being very busy.  The prices were fair and the place has a great ambiance of an old-time ice cream shop.

I met a friend for dinner tonight at 6 pm and was greeted by several friendly staff members. We were quickly seated by our server named James who was a delight. I had the Mushroom Ravioli which was perfectly prepared and served within 20 minutes of ordering and my friend ordered the Chicken Marsala and said it too was delicious. Due to last minute Christmas shoppers it wasn't as crowded as most Friday nights.  Perhaps the low ratings were given by people who want to keep the crowds down, but we were very satsfied.
A hole in the wall with excellent po-boys! Cash only but they have an ATM on premise.

We went to The Green Pheasant for the first time on January 5. We knew we were in for a treat when we heard the Two Ten Jack was branching out to a new restaurant concept, and boy, were we not disappointed! I personally think that we were so excited that we ordered too much food, but it was worth it. We ordered a wide variety of foods from their rotating menu and loved every one! In particular, we ordered a selection of raw fish on a bed of sushi rice first. This was the most expensive item we ordered, but it was worth it! Next, we ordered the dandan shishito, the friend rice, the shrimp and asparagus, and the stuffed friend chicken. Everything was phenomenal.  This is definitely a pricey meal - we spent $100 without buying drinks, but it was well worth it for a fancy night out.

First time after so many recos from good friends and family.  Heck, I've even recommended Doc's to people based on their reputation alone.  They did not let down.  Wow, the oyster variety was amazing.  I had the Bluepoints, the Great Bays and the Chesapeakes.  All of them were fresh, juicy and beautiful.  The Chesapeakes were the least exciting, but still delicious.  The Cherrystone clams were perhaps the best I've ever had.  My friends had muscles - red and white.  Perhaps the best I've had outside of South Philly.  The red sauce was a bit thicker than I like (I prefer a brothy sauce) but the white sauce was outstanding.  In fact, if my oysters hadn't arrived I might have filled up on bread and broth.  A little Patron Silver was perfect w/ the oysters and clams.  Ideal with the lemon and tabasco.  I finished up with a crabcake sandwich.  The roll was amazing.  The crabcake had minimal filler and was very good.  I'm hooked.  I'll be back again and again.  Wi
Nothing but excellence here. Good service. Great ice cream. Good hot beverages. Definitely a go to for ice cream lovers. The blackberry cornbread was to die for

Sorry no pic, we sat on the balcony at night and i couldn't snap anything good. But this place is pretty cool. The atmosphere was pretty noisy but its bearable. Pretty large selection of wines not some much on liquors ( which is understandable it's a wine pub). Good price points on everything no complaints. As far as the food! I tried my first impossible burger (plant based)and it was AMAZING! It didn't leave me with that I'm super stuffed feeling. They also have unlimited popcorn with various seasonings to snack while your waiting. I like this place the food and the drinks. Great place to hang out and catch up with friends.

Went there with friends for a last minute dinner last night.  Was outstanding!  Service, food, ambiance.  I had the Short Rib pasta - PERFECT!  The only thing that keeps it from being 5 star is that I just wanted a small side salad - (like one I saw on the online menu, but not on the menu that night).  Wasn't possible to 'create' - oh, well.   I'll be back!  It's also a great place to eat alone at the bar.

House salad was good, that's all. First ordered the Strawberry Salad and was told they were out of strawberries. My spouse ordered lasagna with Italian sausage. Meal comes and no Italian sausage. Waitress tells us first she'll go check on it, then she comes back and says she forgot to ring it in, but they were cooking it now. She did offer a beverage on her. Sausage never did come and she never brought it up again and we were frustrated so neither did we. All parties at the table ordered pasta and Parmesan cheese was not brought to the table until we were all almost done. It was not busy so no justification. This is not the first time we've had had bad experience at Tony's, but it will be the last.

I have to rave about this place. We had a reservation for a large party and unfortunately things got complicated because the rain took the courtyard out of the equation, but the staff handled it beautifully. They offered us a free appetizer and a complementary bottle of champagne without us even complaining and got us seated as soon as they possibly could. Our waitress, Rose, was so sweet and served us really well. Not to mention, the food was fantastic! I would recommend this restaurant to anybody in the New Orleans area.

So we discovered this place on the rush of the night and it turned out that this place was bought out by another establishment. So we were shocked to see a full restaurant and bar set up there. We walked in just in time before closing. You could tell the staff wasn't too excited to let us in as they were closing in a handful of minutes but the hours online didn't say that. We were trying to be nice and took them to go. We know how the restaurant business work and people wanted to clean up and go home. Good solid sandwiches. They hit the spot. The one that I recalled was the gator sausage the best. Totally worth it.

Decided to give the new restaurant a try. First thing I can say is that the staff was attentive and helpful. 

Started off with the cocktails and the Martinis were very good and the Beer was very cold. We had the calamari and the spinach dip. Both were very good. 

Dinner came quickly there after and the portions were large and delicious. Make sure to leave some room dessert. 

We had the bananas foster cheesecake and the white chocolate bread pudding. Huge slices and tasty. 

The over all experience was good but what really stood out was Sydney. She was excellent. Very knowledgeable of the menu, prompt with a great attitude. 

We will be back and will be asking for Sydney again.

Ambiance: 5 stars
Food: 4 stars
Service: 2 stars
Price: 2 stars

I had the chance to try Tuna Bar for the first time with my husband and my cousin. We were all really impressed with the decor and atmosphere of the restaurant (even if we did get blasted with cold air every time someone new entered).

We started with the pork gyoza and fried oysters. When we asked our server how many oysters came in an order, she said 2 per order. We ordered two so that all of us could try an oyster. When the plates came out, there were three gigantic oysters on each of them. So, we really didn't need to order 2 at all. The oysters were OK, nothing special. They mostly tasted like breading. The gyoza were disappointing. They really didn't have much flavor and tasted basically like plain ol' pork sausage.

The actual sushi itself was really good, though. I got some salmon sushi, a yellowtail and chive roll with scallion oil, and a spicy tuna roll. I loved the sushi - it was so tender and melted in your mouth. I also can't say enough good things about the yellowtail/chive/scallion roll. It was...really unique and delicious. I would definitely order that again and advise that you try it for yourself!

Overall, I enjoyed my meal here. I thought their cocktail list left a lot to be desired and that the price for everything was too steep for what you actually got. While I won't be making any grand effort to return, I wasn't dissatisfied with my meal here.

I just walked in to this random bakery to order a birthday cake for my family member's birthday last week. I picked it up this afternoon. It was beautiful fruity and cheap. I only paid $27.00 for  pretty big size cake. The most important thing is it was DELICIOUS !! I can't believe it !!. It was not too sweet, it was just perfect. Just perfect for the birthday party. I willing to try another kind again for the next birthday party.

I honestly have never been so impressed by a restaurant in my whole life. We arrived at about 7pm and were quickly seated. We then had to wait over 15 minutes for someone to even acknowledge us. When our waitress arrived she was frazzled,(not fault of her own). We asked for a manger and quickly Troy, the kitchen manager, arrived. He instantly stated our wait was unacceptable and took our order immediately. He made us laugh and made us feel important. He instantly went and put in our order and consistently came back with our food to ensure our service was prompt and delivered with a smile and friendly attitude. Troy is the definition of what a great manger is. He made sure that the guest was completely satisfied and that the staff was supported. I'd come back for no other reason then Troy. You are doing something right here in Reno and have made a lifetime customer.

We've been in New Orleans almost a week and we've had a lot of oysters, including from several mainstays here and these are by far the best ones we've had.  Fresh, clean, wonderful.  

Get this Bloody Mary man...
Had a great time at this restaurant! Dana (Knoxville)was a wonderful server! Keep up the great job!! We loved getting to know you!

4.0 - 4.5 star Review. I compare all sushi restaurants to Philadelphia's best - Royal Sushi at 5 stars. Tuna Bar may be the cities second best option in terms of the variety of fish offered and quality.

Nice modern restaurant in Old City located on the main floor of a condo building. Service was excellent on both my visits. You can take your time and enjoy the meal, have a drink or two. Nice laid back atmosphere.

A few appetizers stood out for me - Wagyu beef spring roles, Seaweed salad, Sashimi salad and I loved the Grandmom's wonton soup.  

The Tuna Bar is at its best serving fresh sushi / sashimi.  I was with larger groups so got to try many of the house rolls which were mostly good but I was happiest ordering from the Sushi A La-Carte section of the menu. The fish was incredibly fresh and not the same boring pieces (i.e. Salman, Tuna, Ebi etc....) served at the 100+ sushi restaurants in Philadelphia.   

Loved the variety of fatty tuna options (Toro and Otoro but no Chutoro when I was there - different options available depending on the day), 1-2 Uni choices, Maguro, Kampachi, Striped Bass, Hamachi and Unagi.  

If you want above average sushi options / quality, give the Tuna Bar a try. Prices are above average but to be expected given the variety and quality. 

Recommended

BK

Stumbled in after a great first Friday in Old City, attracted by the decor and the strangely shaped building it's in! Pricier than most sushi places in center city but the interesting roll flavors were worth it. Truffle oil in the appetizer was a bit overwhelming but if you love truffle oil, shouldn't be a problem. 
We enjoyed sitting at the sushi counter! There are mirrors above to see all the sushi making action. Servers were attentive and lovely. Clientele were hip and expensive looking, we felt sorely underdressed in our first Friday art seeking garb. Probably would need a reservation too; it was a cold day and we just got lucky.

This place is great - a bit pricey- but well worth it. Everything we tried was amazing. We tried fried oysters, tuna tartare, gyoza, shumai, wagyu and toki highball drink. It was all amazing! Great atmosphere, great food.
Awesome place for families with kids under 8.   Went there with a more than 10 adults and 5 kids. Plenty of space, good brunch menu.

Great and I mean great ice cream yummy! However apparently customer service is not a must to work there. The people (all the guys working) behind the counter looked miserable and extended their miserable feeling onto you the customer. Again ice cream is great however don't expect warm and fuzzy customer service.

Admittedly as I am not much of a coffee connoisseur, I judge a cafe based on how it makes me feel when I step inside. When I pay $5 for a fancy coffee, I want to feel like I'm indulging in some sort of fantasy world outside of my day-to-day reality.

And the combination of tasty drinks such as the maple bacon latte (well, it's essentially a latte with whipped cream and a piece of candied bacon on top) and urban warehouse decor takes me to a trendier, more urban place than Edmonton.

I like how they're making this an all day establishment and look forward to checking out their wine list.

Preface:

Penn State reunion at a friend's housewarming party in WC. Daylonging beforehand, and finally making it out to the bar around...9pm? 10? Umm...

This place smells like fish when you walk in. Or, rather like a fish tank that needs a good scrub. Upstairs bar = much better. Apparently the thing to get here is Fishbowls, which is basically one of those plastic fishbowls (imagine that.) filled with liquor and mixers. They remind me of the fishbowls at Bar Bleu in State College. My only issue is, just like at my favorite Penn State bar, you are  likely to get diabetes following consumption of this concoction. The blinking lights everywhere was a nice touch.

I ended up ordering Diet Cokes and water here though, since the last thing I needed at this point was more booze. However, just because I don't need something, doesn't mean I didn't want it....

Onto the next bar!

Eh; there are three counters to order from all with different menus. The presentation when the food was served was less than stellar on paper plates and my chicken breakfast biscuit was a large portion compared to my friends but was really salty. No refills on coffee

Doc's is awesome! Love the buck-a-shuck Mondays and the 2 for $25 Tuesdays.  Their cocktail and beer specials are normally good. Nice atmosphere and service is normally great. 

Only downfall is the menu lacks some charisma as it doesn't yell I gotta have that!

Oysters are amazing!  Blue Points!

I had an awesome time here. One of the most fun meals of my life. We got the 4 lbs seafood boil out at the "Shore Shack", which is their back patio. Everything in the seafood boil was amazing. We also loved the oysters and the fisherman's stew. 

The winner was probably the cease and desist fries. The fries are super crispy and they are covered in a mixture of cheese fondue and crab meat. We about lost our minds. The hush puppies were excellent as well. 

All and all, great food. I will have to go back one day and give the regular menu shot.

I was here for a wedding rehearsal dinner and Ricardo's was excellent.  A great beer selection to start the evening off with very courteous service.  The appetizers were well constructed; their shrimp on a stick was the best.  For dinner I had the filet and it was prepared perfectly (medium rare) with a great mix of vegetables and potatoes.  The upstairs is perfect for an event and it was very trendy and perfect for a nice night out.

Went out for a beer with a family member. Figured we'd give Sharkey's a try. The bartender was a bit rude, as if she was rushed to give us our beers when the bar was not really that busy. When we sat to drink them I quickly noticed why. She was busy dancing, singing, and shaking her butt in an attempt to get a good tip from two men who were there.
I understand when a bar is busy and buzzing you may have to flag down the bartender to refresh your drink. My company wanted another beer and instead of being aware of the patrons she waited over 5 minutes to get her attention to get another beer. Ridiculous. She acted as if it was a bother to have to do her job!
I hear the food here is great. I do plan to go back at least one more time to try their food. Hopefully service will be better this time.
I also noticed how unkept the woman's room was... Sure, people write on the walls and it's an adult establishment, but I would embarrassed to own a place with such awful things written ALL over the stalls in the bathroom. Not to mention there was toilet paper all over the floor and it seemed a bit dirty. On a busy night I can understand the bathroom being overlooked a bit, but not one employee stepped into the bathroom the whole time we were there to even check if it needed to be cleaned a bit. It made it seem that this is the norm. I'd hate to have to be there on a busy night! I couldn't imagine how gross it gets when it's actually busy if thats what it's like when it's not. 
It was also a cold, icy night when we visited and the parking lot was very poorly salted. There were give ice spots near and on the walk way, as well. Very dangerous, especially with inebriated people leaving. I wouldn't be surprised if someone falls and gets seriously hurt one day. If the owners are reading this please do a better salt job in the winter months. People are sue happy now a days.
Thumbs up for use music. I have to say it was a decent variety and more to my taste. No hip hop/rap. Stuck to the classics and that was the best part of my experience there.
I'm hoping when I try again things are better. If so, I'll change my review, but for now 2 stars is where it stands.

My Wife and I stopped in for lunch before heading to a New Year's Eve Party.  The place was pretty dead for lunch, but it was probably going to be busy for the college football playoff games. 

The hostess wasn't that friendly and didn't seem to be happy that we were there.  Always a good start....

There are more BIG TV's than any place I've ever visited.  There are almost too many if that's possible.  It was a little annoying that even though all of the TV's were the same size and model they couldn't sync the color adjustments so it made for uncomfortable viewing.  At least the feed was all in sync timing wise.
