But the food is so good and authentic that it's worth going regardless of the day.  Even on a busy day the service is fast and it's all fresh and handmade.  When you order they bring out a tray cilantro, assorted onions, salsas and limes all in molcajetes.  Any order that comes with tortillas will be served with warm freshly handmade tortillas.  It's to die for, I highly recommend.

The service tonight was super slow. Server didn't come back and offer us second bar drinks until our food had arrived so the wine came after dinner was over. Chicken parm was rubbery. New York Style cheesecake was hard and dry.  I seriously thought at first with the fork it was frozen. Nope. Just dry. The bread was good tho but took a while to come to us. And it was expensive even with a discount coupon. We won't be back.

I ordered a cheesesteak for lunch. The bread sucked, the meat had bone chips in it (almost cracked a tooth), and overall the flavor was lacking. I picked up and the order totaled $18 for a plain cheesesteak and a small plain pizza. This may be the worst option in the area.

First time here. The food looks very good. Good display. But the seasoning wasn't so good it was very light.... wish it was better. Wasn't satisfied with the good at all and out server didn't come back to ensure we were okay she could have done a better job with checking on us. She didn't give any suggestive drinks nor inform about any specials. Truly disappointed.   I was expecting much more for a girls night and hungry day.

Our first time here on Sat 12:30pm, not many people, in fact we are the first two people in the restaurant. However, the servers are nice and it's pleasant to see people skating and practicing hockey from above. oh, boy wings are awesome and I love the tuna bowls, seems like many more options I want to try next time. This is a hidden gem in Wesly Chapel.
I ordered food from grub hub from here. Took 2 1/2 hours to get here. Good was cold, soggy and couldn't even eat it. They refused to refund me my money. Will never do that again not eat there.

Excellent meal excellent end to the day! The October specials are fantastic! Wait staff exemplary. With a party of nine we walked in Saturday night tried , late and disappointed our first pick that eve had turned us away. The staff here more than made up for it! Autumn was friendly fast and handled our rag tag bunch like a true pro. The kitchen produced an excellent meal. I recommend trying out what for me is a new favorite.

Stopped in here for water and didn't try any ice cream (it was 11am - is it ever too early?). They also have coffee and tea which I passed on as well. 
It was one of the few places open when I was waiting to start the trolley tour. Friendly staff and reasonable prices would entice me to return when I am back in the area (plus their ice cream).

~ Shame on you, Ventimiglia's! Tony's is an Alton landmark restaurant that you have shamed because a family member could not keep it in his pants! Family or not, this woman should have been paid MUCH more than a measly $75k. Shame on you!

http://blogs.riverfronttimes.com/dailyrft/2010/11/dry-humping_manager_costs_alton_restaurant_75k.php

Best hot dog shop in Madison, TN! Been here for 30+ years, it's pretty hidden away. You either just stumble up on the shop, or you know where this place is, you have been here before. It's a little ole small hot dog joint, have your choice of regular or super size dogs. Worth coming here!

My best friend and I were in search of a morning kick-start when we walked by Mike's Ice Cream.  Which would you like?  Caffeine or sugar, they have both!

I walked in and felt as if I was thrown into a scene from Grease.  There's so much fun going on in the decor, it makes me want to throw a sock-hop here one day!

I ordered a frozen coffee which they blend themselves and it was deliciously strong and perfectly frozen.  YUMMERS.  I also got a taste of their Red Velvet flavor which is something I'll be SURE to order when I go back again.

Morning or night, hot or cold, if you're craving a sweet treat then make a stop into Mike's, you won't be disappointed!
The food is great as well as the atmosphere. It was a lot of fun being able to enjoy good company and watch some hockey at the same time. You can't go wrong with 81bay beer either!

Tony's Resturant is my favorite  place in Alton , Illinois. 
I love when we have our family gathering here.
Our servers were friendly and very accommodating for my vegetarian needs.

They went up and beyond to make our family feel welcome while having very delicious food.
Every year we gather here to talk and laugh with excellent food and adult drinks.( we  are always kicking it old school)

On our visited  we placed about 20 orders of food with delicious drinks too.

I love charm of the old school Italian Resturant with many amazing rooms for your gathering and more. 
In the front of the restaurant there is an opening area for those who don't have a private party.

Everyone was so happy with all of the food and drinks.
I love the private parking lots.

Thank you for continually to sharing the love for our family on every visit. 
This restaurant open their doors in 1949 while still upholds  their amazing excellent customer experience here. I will return.

Gloria~

Awesome food...great atmosphere...ok location...but unfortunately  the service gets zero stars.  Horrible service! .Staff doesn't get it...too bad because this place could be awesome!   If you do go, get their bacon appetizer, it is amazing!

Definitely a spot I will be returning to. It's always nice to find somewhere to sip and chat. Sadly, I was only there for a few glasses of wine and did not get to taste any of the appetizers or meals. The wine... wow. Never would i have thought wine on tap would be a thing but I'm sure glad it is. Very cool idea and definitely trendy. Decor is spot on. Staff is spot on, enthusiastic, friendly, and entertaining. The bartender, JR, definitely kept the bar entertained and lively. He had great suggestions. I tried the Hook & Smith along with the Grenache/ Cinsault; it had a nice sweet taste to it. Full bottles for happy hour came out to only $20; that's a pretty nice price for good tasting wine. Win win situation!

Nice little ice cream place. Nothing pops out as special.  Ice cream was great.  Went with a standard cake batter ice flavor. Many different options with the standard flavors and a few unique ones thrown in. Would eat here again if I was in the area.  
Not a very large establishment. Don't know know packed it would get on a really busy night. Prices were good. Nothing outrageous for being in such a popular area.

I came to the Tuna Bar to interview a candidate for an executive job at my company and left a huge fan of the Tuna Bar.  We ordered the steak and a variety of raw and cooked fish.  Everything was prefect, but the highlight for me was the scallops.  A must go to place in Philly.

Literally the best ice cream I've had in my life and I am an ice cream junkie!! And I loveeee corn bread as soon as I saw they had ice cream with it, I had to get it, and let me tell you....AMAZING. The nutter butter ice cream was also great! I was only in Nashville for 3 days but the two nights I was there my family and I got Mikes both nights! So worth it. I WISH that I could order tubs in bulk and have them sent up to me in NY. Because I am CRAVING that blackberry cornbread ice cream!!!!

Tonight was one of Bar One's opening nights offering free apps, 10/21. It was crowded but that's expected when a bar is giving out free food. I was able to try their chicken and waffle, buffalo chicken pasta, lamb slider, and pork and Buffalo chicken spring rolls. They were all fabulous. The food is really amazing here. Think Bar food with a classy twist. They had live music (one guy with a guitar playing covers) which had a good vibe setting the mood all night. Their draught beer list comprises mainly of local craft brews. They had 4 big screen TVs showing the sports game. This is a new age neighborhood bar that I will definitely come back to. Definitely glad to see a new bar at this corner.

Such good food and Cookie was our waitress and she made our whole experience super fun!    Our teenagers loved her.   We all loved her!!  We would come back because she was so engaging!   Best part of New Orleans!!  Do not miss this place!  The catfish, shrimp and grits, and the shrimp were all excellent!   Oh and the cornbread (Sweet!) All so so good!

Such a cute little shop!

With one taste of my mint chocolate chip ice cream in a cake cone, I was instantly transported back to when I was a little kid. No mix ins or anything exciting-just simple and real.

Sucks. Sad hospital food on paper plates.

Went on a Sunday at noon. Music was so loud we couldn't hear the cashier. We ordered two coffees, both with room. Both were filled to the lid. When my wife asked again for room in hers, the baristas laughed at her and told her to "chug it."

$10 meals arrived on small paper plates. Poached eggs were hard, solid blobs atop cold sweet potatoes coated in cinnamon. "DYO plate" was overcooked scrambled eggs alongside a hard, dry biscuit and tough bacon.

Place looks cool inside. Could get a better meal literally anywhere else.

We ordered the Chahan fried rice, spicy crab noodles, fried trout, and the chicken wing dumplings. The wings were amazing and must-try if you like wings. Fried rice is a little on the salty side but was very satisfying. Spicy crab noodles had really good noodle texture. Fried trout came with steamed bun but to be honest the fish was a little bland by itself and the combo of bun and cole slaw with fish was a little strange to our tastes. Bill came to 140 after tips so a little pricy, but it's a nice place to try Asian fusion food in SoBro.

The Green Pheasant came highly recommended by some colleagues, so I made a point to visit. I sat at the large wrap around bar and ordered the Dan Dan Shishitos (spicy!) as well as the Broccolini with shrimp and cornbread. Both dishes were packed with flavor and enough food for a night for me. I was so tempted by the jidori chicken and salmon, so I'll have to go back to try those!

It's like Hooters on steroids. They have a good beer selection, decent food, and of course attractive waitresses. I like the giant log cabin feel of this restaurant and it's usually a good place to grab a beer after work if you are wanting to get served quickly.

This was hands down the most tasteless ice cream I have ever had.  Cookies and Cream and Caramel Cone.  I literally threw most of it away in the trash bin on the southeast corner of Broadway and 5th Avenue.  Don't waste your money.

we were pleasing pleased with the Green Pheasant.  good restaurant design. interesting menu.   its a dining experience. shared plates allow you to navigate the many wonderful plates.  Kinoko-mushrooms,  chahan-fried rice, curry udon-noodles  , chirashi-sushi, pheasant dumpling, tsukemono cucumber and wagyu.   absolutely try as many as you can, because its delicious.  parking next door ..........

Meal was good. We came for dinner.  I had the spaghetti and meatballs. I like the way it used to be with two large meatballs. They were hand packed here and made fresh. Now they are small and give you more like 8 little ones. They are frozen and processed. Not even close. I don't like when chains try to cut corners and go cheap. They sacrifice quality. Some damn bean counter came up with this.  I will never order this again.  Not worth it. I can do better at home. When I go out for dinner, I want something I can't get at home.
Everything else was good.

The Pearl is by far the best restaurant in Treasure Island and the Pinellas beaches.  Karim the owner is an excellent chef and host.  The tapas are amazing, I recommend the tagines and the lamb chops.  Also not on the menu but worth asking about is the blue cheese pate, it's incredible.  The entrees are equally delicious;  huge lobsters, seafood wellington, seabass, and ostrich stand out.  To finish get a cheese plate or the chocolate souffle.  If you have not been I would recommend it as your next destination.

# of Times: 50
Consistency: Excellent
What a gem of Santa Babara! I love the freshly-baked goods, high ceiling and open seating areas.

I REALLY wanted to love this place. I have been trying to get there for a while as I am local. I was dying to try those shoestring onion rings and a roast beef poboy. Finally got there today when family came in to visit. I was so disappointed....when the waitress came to give us our menus I knew right then that I wanted a beer but she said she would get that order after she brought our water??? When she brought our water we order our beers and our food. After about 15 min our food came out and I asked her if she forgot about our beers and she uncomfortably said yes. She went to the bar and came back and told us that the bartenders had just changed shifts and it would be a few more minutes for our beers...at which point I told her nevermind....The food....those onion rings I couldn't wait to try were cold..The roast beef poboy was good but I have had better. There are many poboy restaurants in New Orleans so unfortunately, I will not be back to this one.

I would give 0 stars if I could, took togo person 10 minutes to even acknowledge my existence, 45 minutes to get my order, restaurant was totally dead, customer service is terrible here, always is and always will be

Decided to come to try this newly opened restaurant with friends when saw it on instagram the first time. We came in with reservation on pre-Thanksgiving night and there were many people. They have valet parking, and you can also park at the garage nearby and get validated from the front desk. The inside is cute! Our wine is awesome, I really like the cute glass. We ordered a bunch of food just because we'd love to try everything that sounds delicious. The broccoli appetizer is delicious. Was really surprised to find Japanese A5 wagyu in Nashville the first time. It's quite oily and tasty with medium-rare. 6 oz is a good portion for share. The biggest win I would say is the curry udon, so so amazingly good, simple looking but awesome. Love the sausage in the fried rice! The shishito peppers are great with pork! End up having no room for dessert lol. Overall, there's one thing that's a little bothering, every dish is too salty for us. Our waiter explained that it's their first time cooking Asian meals and they did not know if soy sauce is being used, no more salt is needed, and said they will improve next time. Except for that, everything is awesome.

Definitely 5 stars!  We have been to many restaurants in the area over the years -- thanks to the good reviews for The Pearl on Yelp, we finally made it here. Our server recommended any of the Tagine entrees.  My husband and son had the lamb Tagine and I had the fish Tagine.  Both were beyond excellent!  It is a more upscale restaurant but worth every cent. Service was great, atmosphere was relaxed and very nice.  We will be back!

There are better Po-Boys in NOLA, of course.  But this joint gets it done and is right in the French Quarter.   Waitress was awesome and friendly.  I had a shrimp po-boy and it hit the spot.  Crawfish Etouffee was tasty.  Very clean and spacious.   Can't go wrong.

Yum. Not much to add that hasn't already been reviewed. 
Communal seating. Very delicious food and coffee. Lines for breakfast on weekend. Staff friendly and helpful. 
Banana bread, salmon bagel, bacon egg biscuit all extremely tasty and well made.

We just had the most awful experience at this restaurant. We walked in to check in for our reservation, and the rude hostess alerted us that her system was telling us that we had canceled our reservation. Uh, no we didn't. We proceeded to tell her that we did no such thing, and that the system had made a mistake. Instead of being apologetic or even just polite, this woman went on to be extremely rude and condescending telling us that her system was not wrong and that we had canceled our reservation and they would not be able to seat us. She did not try to mediate the situation in any way, but told us that we had to leave. I can't even properly put into words how rude and unaccommodating this woman was. We will never be returning here ever again. This restaurant won't last in the packed Philadelphia dining scene with disgusting behavior such as this. Please - if you are looking for a quality sushi restaurant in the area with respectful staff, head somewhere else.

Cute little Ice Cream parlor right on Broadway. They have pretty unique flavors, my favorite was the Red Velvet! It was delicious! 

The staff are nice and it has a laid-back feel to it. A lot of locals come there and we were able to talk to a Nashville native about the changes that have been happening on Broadway... that was fun.

Super fresh sushi and sashimi. Great interior design. Service was fantastic. We had several rolls (the broad street was a standout), lobster fried rice, sashimi, miso soup and salad. Our waitress  gave us a free piece of green tea cake. Delicious!!
Great place and even better staff. The atmosphere is perfect for sports fans families and fun with friends. And the food is great.. not just bar food.

We have tried many of the bakeries in Chinatown and beleive that this is the best one. The quality of their pastries is superior and their deserts are also more attractive than the other bakeries. This is my go to for a chinatown bakery.

My family and I went to Twin Peaks for the first time. Not only was the food delicious and exceeded our expectations, the atmosphere and drinks deserve  nothing but 5 stars. Our waitress Mckenzie was so pleasant and tentative, service was great! Manager Emilio checked on us to make sure we were having a great experience. We appreciate this kind of service and will definitely be returning! Great job Twin Peaks!

Fantastic Peacemaker Po Boy
Great crawfish etouffee
Drinks were good and service was friendly!

So I'll call this a 4.5 out of 5 stars review.

It really would have been perfect, except the online menu was wrong.  The key points:  you can get whole wheat and gluten-free pasta.  Cool!  I call to confirm.  Aaaaaaand, nope.  No wheat or gluten-free pasta.  Bummer, dude.  At the end of the day, none in our party NEEDED these, but I was very excited about some wheat pasta.  And the menu had changed and they hadn't updated the online menus.  Alas.  This would have been a much bigger deal to someone who is gluten intolerant, like one of our best friends.

That being said, the meals were delicious.  Lasagna?  Perfect.  Mannicotti?  Yes.  Cannelloni?  Oh hell yeah.  And Penne Michelangelo?  Yes yes yes.  We also had the Beef Spedini, which was good but not great (not the tenderest beef, but hey, it was still good).  All in all, excellent Italian.  Would do again.  Almost perfect, save for the menu glitch, which the guy on the phone acknowledged immediately.  Great local Italian joint.  Last note:  we had take-out, not dine-in.

Great spot to either stop in and grab a cup of delicious coffee or sit down and get a bite to eat!  The staff is always friendly and welcoming.  They have an awesome patio to sit down and relax on a sunny day.  Anytime I need to spend some time getting work done on my laptop, Caviar and Bananas is my go to.  Their menu is diverse and has great options for whatever mood you are in.

This place is where my family celebrates. We come here because we know the staff is friendly, the restaurant is warm and inviting, and the food is delicious. 

I do wish there were a few more vegetarian items, but what they do offer is prepared well.

If you're looking for a place to host a party or a large family gathering, this is the restaurant to go!
I got the mint chocolate chip ice cream in a cookie-cone and it tasted like most other mint chocolate chip ice cream I've ever had. Wasn't bad at all but not amazing.

Genuinely can't say enough good things about this establishment. The food was sublime (And I say this about sandwiches; seriously, sublime) service was very friendly and prompt, prices were more than reasonable, and my wife and I ate our meal seated next two not one, but two Ford GTs. Seriously, how?!

I'd eat every meal of the day there. We will definitely go back before we leave New Orleans. Fantastic experience. Go. Just go.

A wonderful experience all around. The quality and execution of both food and drink was excellent and the interior is absolutely lovely. The wait staff felt a little green (no pun intended) but were friendly and professional. My table enjoyed sampling the entire cold menu and several of the hot menu items. Everything ranged from good to fantastic, which is a difficult feat to achieve. If you are looking for a contemporary izakaya experience in Nashville, I highly recommend The Green Pheasant above all of the other similar restaurant concepts that have popped up in town.

Went to the Mother's day buffet.  What a disappointment, food was cold, not the best selection.   For $37.00 a person expected to have eggs made to order. They were overcrowded   And not setup for this.  Could have done better at Denny's.  The food was about the same.  It's a shame, because I have had their regular menu and it's been excellent.

Come to bar with the porch for all your game day needs. There's a dynamic duo named kelsi and kaylee and their the bomb.com... cheesy but for real, its a good time, in a great atmosphere where they make a Texan feel right at home. If somehow you don't have the best time, hit up Brian. He holds the whole place down. So, i guess you could say the terrific service is an extension of his great management. Come see for yourself.

If you're deciding between Jeni's or Mike's, then let this review help you. Go to Mike's. Easy as that. Why? Because it's the truth. Jeni's is just a hipster flavor Paradise but lacks that creamy consistency ice cream should have. It's as if they just didn't want to spend more money on ingredients to make it more potent. Mike focuses on the rich creamy texture of the ice cream. Flavors are more standard (although you must get the blackberry cornbread). But it just wins every time. So take the time and walk on over to Mike's.

We dined here on Valentine's Day, which can sometimes be a disappointment when places are slammed with so many customers. For that reason, we made a reservation well in advance for 5pm. When we arrived, they were not busy at all but the hostess led us to a very small table for 2. We asked for a larger table and got a bit of a look and a sigh, but fortunately we were given a larger table for 2. Sorry, we don't enjoy spending money for a nice dinner out only to be cramped and uncomfortable. We started with the Mediterranean appetizer and a couple of cocktails. It was a large plate with different spreads, olives, lentils and pita. Everything on the plate was incredibly delicious and we will return based on that alone. We ordered a bottle of wine. They have a really nice wine selection. For the main we tried the pasta specials. Mine was lobster in a light garlic and oil over pasta. He had the grilled chicken Mediterranean pasta and he loved it. Mine was pretty good, but a little too bland. 
Overall, it was a really enjoyable dinner, service was great and we will add this place into our rotation of area restaurants to frequent.

Escaped the bubble of business travel and happened upon this Chinatown bakery early in the morning. Buns are standard Chinatown freshness and deliciousness but prices were amazing. Maybe I have my SF goggles on?

I enjoyed my dining experience here. I will say, it's a bit pretentious inside, but the wait staff and bartenders were friendly and our meal was good. I went with 2 other people and we ordered 7 things to split so we were able to get a good sampling of the menu. I'd highly encourage sharing here. I will be back for my favorites (below) for sure. Of note, their bathroom had a bidet and heated toilet seats! #fancy

-ikinari steak - amazing! I would come back here just for this
-Dan Dan shishitos 
-Okonomiyaki - very tasty
-sunomono - for the fish lovers (very fresh)
-mochi - not nearly as chewy as others I have had; I could tell they were much better quality and the flavors were pronounced
-The Japanese-Japanese drink was so good! I would definitely recommend that as well. 

Whatever you do, do not order the ohitashi. It was a veggie dish that tasted fishy. Non of us liked it. Also, the sui gyoza are very bland and not worth it.

My husband and I went to The Green Pheasant for dinner before attending the symphony this past Saturday, and we were both impressed! 

We had a reservation and were seated in the upstairs area of the restaurant after we walked in. Our waitress was LOVELY. She walked us through pretty much the whole menu as well as explaining some of the drink options as well. 

I started with a sake that the restaurant had on tap, which was wonderful. my husband tried one of their cocktails and then stuck with his favorite Manhattan after that. 

We started with the okonomiyaki (a Japanese pancake, at Green Pheasant made with ham, bacon, scallops, potatoes, and various traditional okonomi toppings). It was good, but not my favorite thing we ate. Next we tried the shumai (at Green Pheasant, made with lobster and spot prawn - and served with clover ponzu) - these were okay, but definitely my least favorite thing we ordered (they had a slightly strange flavor to me, but that may be because I'm so used to shumai made with shrimp only). 

Next we had the spicy crab noodles (with crab butter, sweet red crab, and tobanjan), which were very good. Lots of crab on the dish, and it was just the right amount of heat! 

But the Ikinari steak was my favorite of the appetizers or entrees we ordered! The steak was American skirt steak with corn and onion and miso brown butter and j sauce, served in a hot hot hot sizzle plate like is traditional at the Japanese steak restaurant chain Ikinari (picture a fajita platter at a Tex Mex restaurant). The steak was great (perfectly cooked); the corn and onions were charred where they had touched the hot sizzle plate; and the miso brown butter was just the right richness for the steak. I'd come back to Green Pheasant just to eat this again. A great dish.

But we didn't stop there. We ordered two of the desserts as well. I ordered the ginger creme brulee which was SENSATIONAL (I might be back at Green Pheasant again soon - I want to sit at the bar, order some sake or shochu, and eat the Ikinari steak and the ginger creme brulee. Quite simply one of the best desserts I've had recently. The ginger flavor was amazing, and the creme brulee was so smooth. I LOVED IT. My husband has about 10x the sweet tooth I do and he ordered the tempura fried slice of chocolate cake. I tried a teeny tiny bite, and it's just WAAAAAAY too rich and sweet for me, but he enjoyed it (definitely for people who love sweet, rich desserts only). 

We had a couple more drinks (including a shochu cocktail that was DELICIOUS). The service was excellent, and the restaurant pretty nice (I do think sitting downstairs is probably nicer, because upstairs is pretty sparse compared to the decor on the main level). We thoroughly enjoyed our meal. I think we'll be back.

Came in here with my boyfriend on a Friday night. We were seated along the back wall next to the kitchen which was kindof cool. The service and sushi were amazing.. love the ambiance in here. Only con was the price of the dinner.. but its great food!

I honestly would never thought that a place located in this area would serve good food. The fried cat fish taste just like the fish you would eat at a cookout. It is fried to your liking. The Jambalaya is cooked how the vendors at the French Quarter Fest and the Jazz Fest cooked theirs. It is so delicious to say your mom or uncle did not cook it. There is always a table available so you hardly have to wait. The to go orders are always hot and ready like Little Caesars. The managers are always on the floor greeting each customers. There is a special each day. The hours isn't early bird friendly, but it'll do if you ever want to meet a few friends and family there. Stop by and ask for Sydney, she is a great waitress.

The most authentic Latin food place I have been to in Delaware. This really truly is a gem. It is a small menu but it is all they need. Everything is delicious and very inexpensive. Not to mention the service is super friendly and you can order in either Spanish or English. And I love how you get a big try of condiments. Definitely my new favorite!

A great addition NOLA and the CBD. The wine selection is great and the wait staff suggested a wonderful light and fruity wine to go with my lunch. The gumbo was delicious and I can't wait to return for more wine. Happy that you arrived and took over from previous company and must success with Little Gems.

We were in New Orleans last week for the first time and came upon this place. We went because I like wine, but my partner was intrigued by the crab deviled eggs. It was a nice day so patio seating was available (highly recommended). Our waiter Christopher was awesome. Not only was he easy to talk to, he gave us a list of places we should try while in New Orleans. I really liked the choice of being able to order 2.5oz./5 oz/ carafe/ bottle of wine, especially since I wanted to try a few. The food was delicious. We had the crab deviled eggs, fig and goat cheese flatbread.  We came back for their weekend brunch before heading to airport. Crab cake benedict was mouthwatering delicious!

I'm extremely sad that this place is closed, this place was the best after eating subs from here I can never eat a sub from subway or any of the other chain restaurants ever again. Really wish this place would re-open.

Went in last night for my first visit.  We were seated outside on a Friday night without waiting.  Throughout the meal our server Sean was friendly, attentive, and quick.  

We started off with the lobster mac to share.  The sauce and pasta were perfect!  

For a main course I had the fish and chips.  The tartar sauce was the best I've ever had, and the aioli with the chips was light and flavorful.  

She had the mixed plate with salmon, scallops, and shrimp.  Everything was cooked well and delicious.

Oh, their dinner rolls with butter were hot and fresh!  Our entrees came out piping hot so I know they didn't sit in the window.

Inside, they nailed the decor and ambiance with thousands of little touches that added up to create a gorgeous whole picture.

Highly recommend!
Good place to stop and take in the atmosphere, cool cars and good food. Loved the pimento cheese.

Everything we ordered was really good, the fried shrimp poboy, the ham and swiss poboy, and the crawfish 3 ways. The etouffee in the crawfish 3 ways was a little cold, but still delicious. Our server Jasmine was helpful and really nice. Decor is interesting. Overall good meal, we plan on coming again! :)
Can't comment on food. Had to leave bc in essence this is a high end sports bar with sports blasting on their multiple TVs and speakers around the restaurant.
This place was awesome! Our server Izzy was tentative, polite, and made our experience wonderful! The food was fresh and delicious, definitely will come back!
Stellar croissants and quiche! Warmed and welcomed!

This place is expertly placed next to Mons Venus. There's no alcohol served at Mons Venus just boobies, but Joe's Pizza does serve beer, a most important libation.

And they serve a pretty mean slice of pizza. 

The cashier/server was pretty funny and insanely patient with us at 1a on a Friday night.

The actual facilities are okay, kind of gross.
Cristina (TINA) made my evening. The food was awesome and the service was outstanding.  This was a great visit.
Delicious ice cream and coffee!  Perfect for after lunch. Bring the kids and people watch. Friendly staff is a plus.

We were admittedly being lazy since this place is right across the street from our hotel, but it was also independently recommended by our Lyft driver. It was a bit early for dinner so it was not very busy. We were seated quickly, our server was friendly, made recommendations, but not in a pushy way. The food came out stunningly fast, was fantastic, so much so that my husband went back later in the evening and got another one to go!

I had a pot roast Po-Boy which felt kind of sacrilegious, but was tasty. My husband had a half dozen oysters and their Peacemaker Po-Boy. We each had a cocktail as well. Mine was fine, my husband's first try was pretty awful but our server was quick to replace it with something else. 

The only potential negative, and even this isn't a big deal, is they use hand held devices for ordering and processing payments and the server stood there as we swiped our card and added a tip. Kind of awkward.

Completely unrelated to the food, they also have a Ford GT in their window, if you're into that kind of stuff.

While wandering the strip in Nashville (in 30-degree weather) and happened upon this ice cream shop, which was exciting because it was around 10:00 and we really wanted dessert but had despaired of anything being open. We didn't have very high expectations, but this place was surprisingly great. The staff were really chill and friendly. My $4 sundae turned out to be the size of my head, for serious. 3 scoops of ice cream on top of a warm brownie with hot fudge, whipped cream, nuts and a cherry. It was so incredibly good. You should share it with someone, since wasting this felt like a crime. It was impossible to finish, though. 

They also advertise "hot chocolates from around the world," so if it is the middle of winter and you are NOT crazy, you are not stuck having ice cream for dessert. Win-win for everybody.

We went to Macaroni Grill last weekend, and really enjoyed it. 
The bread and peppered oil here is  - 5 stars YUM. 
We started with fried cheese - delish 
I had a Caesar salad - it was awesome 
I had the honey grilled salmon with rice - it was amazing REALLY amazing! The fish was PERFECT.. 

Our server kept our glasses full - love Cate!!! She even wrote her name down on the paper table cloth so we would know her name. 

My friend had the chicken Parmesan - it was SO good, he couldnt stop saying "ummm this is SO good" which takes a lot to get him all excited about his food - I really thought he was gonna go make love to the chef! 

We shared a slice of New York cheese cake at this point my gut was about to bust but I managed to scarf down a bite or two - WOW it was yummy too! 

$65.00 for 2 to eat like a couple of pigs on really good food, with great service ***clapping clapping**** 

I LOVE YOU ROMANOOOOOOOOOO 
*blowing kisses* 

p.s. parking is a bit sucky - but you will need a little walk after you stuff your face so stop complaining just walk the 20 extra steps!!!!

This is a great place for a date night or group dinner. 

The concept is Japanese small plates that should be shared. We got to sit in this awesome red believer half booth and people watch everyone going by outside. Our waiter gave great recommendations for both food and drinks. 

We started with chilled sake and pheasant dumplings. They were perfectly crispy and floral and had a little spice to them. Next was lobster and corn dumplings which were very much my favorite dish. Next was mushrooms with miso, which I also recommend getting. We got the spicy crab noodles as our main dish. These were great and very rich. For dessert we got the mochi. I love mochi and I've had better mochi at other places. I'd try something else. 

The atmosphere was cool, the service was amazing, I'd definitely go back.

Nice job at the softball invitational this week folks!!! The wraps we got were outRageous and fresh ! I had the margarita with fresh basil  legit  cheese and fresh  my god team you rocked it.  My husband got the Hawaiian which was spectacular.   I didn't get them but dayum their basket of some crazy Parmesan fries was ginormous and looked amazing.   I'm a nice size and can eat but my gosh the wraps were huge!!! I forced it down because it was so good !!! I might stalk them now

We ate upstairs and it was a serene and lovely respite from the wild honky tonk of Broadway. The food was very good. I had swordfish and ate every bite. The creamed spinach was the star of the show. The wedge salad was fresh and good. I would recommend this if you are needing a delicious meal and some quiet time.

A delightful experience both times I was here. Kind, attentive staff, beautiful outdoor and indoor space and very tasty food. I am a bit spoiled with divine dining selections in New York, and Copper Vine did not disappoint. I highly recommend sitting in their outdoor space and trying a flight of wines. My friend and I joked that we were transported into a tropical forest--greenery was everywhere! I stopped for one last glass of wine and charcuterie/cheeses before my flight back to New York. The variety of the meats and cheeses was abundant and filling, and I really enjoyed the wine.

Fantastic Korean Bibimbap just around the corner from my office. I have no idea how I've never been here before, and I'm glad I finally stopped by because the food was fantastic. I got my beef bowl to go, and not only did it come out super quickly, but I got to watch the owner put everything together and it's all fresh! 

The food was to die for! If you like Korean and I'll definitely be getting lunch here again, I actually might get it again today! getting hungry as I write this. I also tried their house made Ginger Cinnamon tea. It was good, and not extremely flavor packed, yet still very enjoyable.

I had a phenomenal experience at twin peaks this evening. Our server, shayla, was a lot of fun and my burger was delicious. I came in with 9 friends (who can get pretty rowdy) and shayla handled all of us exceptionally. I will definitely be returning!!

We've been here a few times in the past. It l had always been been enjoyable but things seemed to have moved in a downward direction.  
I ordered the calamari appetizer and a spaghetti with meatballs main.  The calamari was served warm at best, definately not hot right out of the fryer and was a little more chewy than properly prepared squid. It came with two dipping sauces but one was so dense as to be useless.  The pasta dish was just OK, nothing to write home about.  
Wait service was pleasant.
I don' think I'll be returning.

Get the chocolate chip cookie cone! Mike's is especially great if you're wanting to experience Broadway, but aren't into visiting the bars. It has an old-fashioned vibe and so many classic flavors to choose from.
I ordered an iced caramel latte, waited for about 15 minutes and was given mostly iced milk. Took one sip and threw the drink away.
Missed this place since they closed down my local spot. You still get crayons and a paper table cloth, bread and olive oil and self pour wine by the glass. Food was all good. Service decent.
Our favorite taco shop with homemade tortillas, tamales, we love the Tacos Pastor, Lengua, Carnitas. Can get pretty crowded on weekend.

This place sucks. I just ordered on Grub hub right after opening and the food is impressively bad. The sushi tasted old and they skimp on the soy sauce. Got through 1.5 small rolls before running out. The wonton soup at first I thought was cabbage soup because the outside is paper thin and shredded up. The wantons are not in soup, they are just in hot water. It's not even salty hot water it's literally just water. Soba noodles were adequate so that's why it gets a 2/5 not a 0, but even though they taste alright, I now have abdominal discomfort after eating them. Worst place I've eaten from in a good long while and very well not worth the exhorbitant price.
Very good lunch and well located- little pricey and they'll charge for every soft drink- no refills!

We were told there would be a 30-minute wait, even thought more than half the tables were available.  Once seated, the service was slow, with a disinterested waitress, but I can live with that if the food is really good. Far from it: the minimally-boiled sausage in my pasta was cool to slightly chilled; the overall pasta dish was served barely warm.  This, plus my wife's dish and a couple bottles of water, came to almost $50.  Mediocre, low value food and indifferent service risks your going back into bankruptcy--my wife and I certainly won't be returning anytime soon.

Super unhappy with my latest experience.  This place has a great vibe and decent food BUT.  Some examples - ordered a Basil Hayden bourbon on the rocks. Listed at $15 on menu. Getting the check, I noted it was $18.  The bartender said it was $15 in a mixed drink at 1 ounce but on the rocks they charged $18 for 1.5 ounce.  Two things.  Deceptive to list lower price if you can charge a higher one and secondly, who the heck serves 1.5 ounces of liquor?  I have lived on the east coast for years and know the average pour is 2 ounces.  Another thing is we were told they serve inferior grade fish within the rolls compared to the sushi or sashimi...strange but in the hundreds of Japanese restaurants I have been to, I have never heard that!  Won't be back.

Amazing and delicious salads , flatbreads, and sandwiches.  The coffee is really great as well.  Open all day and a perfect place for breakfast, lunch and dinner!  They offer a catering program as well with great options.  Fun staff and a fun environment! 5 star.
Mahony's was great! The food was delicious and drinks were great too. Our server, Jared, was fun and very attentive. It was a very busy Saturday night, but our food still came fast and was amazing!

What a great place and it's inside an ice rink!! Great appetizers and specials. I had the tuna bowl and the tuna was amazing! Very fresh! Sam our server was incredibly nice and you can tell it was real. Will go back next tome I'm in the area.

I eat out in nashville restaurants 4-5 week for lunch and dinner. The GP is new on the scene and as i understand it also own TwoTenJack. The food is really good especially the American Waygu and sashimi platter. Tough to get really good sushi and they did it. But what I cannot stand is for a restaurant to be so pretentious that is ruins a meal. 1)Sitting all the older couples in one section of the restaurant 2) pretending its very busy when half the tables are full. 3) saying that we should preorder when they haven't taken out drink order 4) the server not know what a gin martini is 5) server telling us that the meal will be served at a leisurely pace and everything come out with 15 minutes of each other. 6) charging 12 dollars for valet parking. 

The server was nice enough but obviously the staff was at the direction of Managment to turn over tables on a Saturday night when it was slow. 

You got the impression they want to be the hip version of two ten jack from the east side in a downtown environment. 

Not sure that attitude will work very long.

The service was average and the food was horrible. For a resturant with hamburger in its name, one would think that the hamburgers would be good. NOPE! The hamburgers were not even fair. Will never visit again.
Excellent all around from the bread/dipping oil to the appetizers to the main course. As an out-of-towner, I was happy with my choice!

Probably the best subway experience I've ever had, simply because of the costumer service experience. I think the dude's name was Shane... But he had an excellent witty/eccentric/dry commentary that was extremely amusing. Shout out to that dude.

The sandwich is good, too. I mean. It's Subway. Pretty consistent fast food sandwich.

Huge brewer with restaurant seating! We came here for a birthday party/happy hour with coworkers and this place did not disappoint. Adequate table and seating for our large group. The beer was great and the food was even better. We were very into the outdoor seating option as well! You can just literally go out to the outdoor tables anytime you want. They also have a kid section or game area, which has a good amount of stuff to do. It's a neat place! I guess it's great for adults with their children in the DAYTIME. Not necessarily the night, but there seems to be quite enough for kids to do. I do mean older kids, not sure about babies haha. Bathrooms are very clean and spacious! This is a little cooler than Goose Island, only because of the additional space and games ( video games) they have here!

Stay clear! I got the chicken and it was grey!! Veggies were soggy the egg was too runny.  I got it to go so didn't realize until I got home and I don't live close by.  When I bit into it the chicken tasted old and made my stomach turn and the veggies tasted like they were drowned in butter.  Waste of money!!

Yup, tourist trap for us tourist peeps...been there, done that.  I get it, it's in the heart of downtown Nashville, people come from all over to visit.  When it's hot and humid, we want ice cream, perfect location.  The cashier emphasized "homemade" ice cream.  Okay, what else is spectacular about homemade, I felt it was steep (touristy remember) for stingy scoops.  My son and I both asked for scoops in a cup, yet we saw more of the cup than the ice cream.  Overall, it's ai-ight...back to the land of Three Twins Ice Cream for those who know what I mean :)

I've had food from here 3 times now and have been disappointed every time. My most recent experience included a McDonald's type nugget soaked in buffalo sauce. I know that still counts as a "buffalo nugget" but it really wasn't what I expected. (And they certainly not for 9 dollars) Also, my fries were soggy and wet... my only recommendation is to find another pizza shop!

The food was actually pretty good here I couldn't believe it. A lot more flavorful than I thought it would be. But it did taste extremely processed. Our service was excellent and the scenery was great as well. But I don't want to come back... but I get why guys go there lol  not mad at yeah

Ralph's Italian restaurant was totally booked, so we took a chance on Bar One, directly across 9th st. As we walked in, I loved the corner bar atmosphere.. staff was wonderful... then I looked at the menu. OMG my heart sank...... just weird for an Italian market eatery... my friend ordered Bucatini, at $16, they could have added a few more noodles..... it looked like a side dish... hopefully these guys didn't invest their life savings in this place

Appetizers came out in only a couple minutes. Best shrimp/grits in the world. Po-Boy's were great, and Cookie is probably the best waitress in NOLA. You get what you pay for; great service, food comes out quick and is all around high quality.
Yummmyyy!! Coffee fudge!! Delicious coffee with a generous fudge swirl. The chocolate looks hard, but is actually very smooth and a great compliment to the lovely coffee flavor. What a treat!

Well it was another night I didn't feel like cooking. So I thought we could try this place out. We the Mrs and my self arrive with no other expectations other than getting some food and a few drinks. The server Annie was Awesome very professionalism prompt with any request or questions we had for her... she made us feel very welcome as I could go on-about our server. The food was excellent as if you read any of my other reviews you'll know that I am honest and will tell you what my true dinning  experience I had the all you can eat mussels and they were so good I had to force myself not to eat any more. I highly recommend this place if want some great food and service as for Annie and you can't go wrong.

Friendly staff! Located conveniently in broadway. I was surprised by how creamy the ice cream is and how generous of a scoop they offered me. Black raspberry chip is always a bomb flavor but here it was extra bomb because it had a subtle tartness to it, which most ice cream joints neglect to deliver. Bravo!

I must be missing something. The hostess is more interested in checking her smart phone than seating customers & there is no sign or hostess station so I didn't know where to go.They have a new bar but it seems unfinished. The restroom(ladies) is in need of updating, cleaning & the ceiling is falling in. The dining room needs some updating also. Maybe they are just having issues with their cleaning crew. Good help is hard to find. Bar service is good but the bartender is running around also doing busboy duties. So I guess staffing is a problem. Table service was ok but the waitress is poorly dressed. Uniforms should be clean & freshly ironed along with being well groomed. Food is good for the price point but it is hard to overlook very bad customer service. Perhaps I went on a night that wasn't going smooth. Maybe their business is so good they don't need to worry about it. When you walk in you can tell it is a neighborhood place, everyone turns & looks at you. A separate entrance for the restaurant & bar would be nice. I might try again in the future, but they could try to improve perception & customer service.

2.5 stars for Mike's Ice Cream.

The green tea candied orange ice cream gets 5 stars - Delicious!

The largest cockroach I've literally ever seen scuttering past my feet gets 0 stars.


I don't feel like Mike's is an especially dirty establishment. After all, it's right downtown and the whole lower end of Broadway is no doubt crawling with other Texas-sized insects and worse (i.e. drunk frat bros). 

So if you're really hankering for some ice cream while bar hopping, it's probably your only option. I think I'm good though.

Order:

Two Miso Soups 
Wagyu Beef Spring Rolls
3 Roll Lunch Special 
     Spicy Tuna Roll
     Spicy Salmon Roll
     Salmon Avocado Roll
The Rittenhouse Roll

The food was phenomenal, but the appetizers were super overpriced. Whoops, sorry--just opened the check. EVERYTHING'S overpriced. It was a great experience and delicious food, so I guess it's worth the bang of the buck. Will come back, but gotta wait until my next paycheck!

Honestly I was against the advertisement before they opened, j thought it was going to be a strip club.  If they wouldn't have advertised making the place look sleazy they would attract more patrons. I rarely enjoy the food at most restaurants but YUM, the fish tacos are much better than Bonefish and the salsa is warm and absolutely the best in town.   Upscale bar food! Our server Jenna & Christina cute cute cute and their outfits are no worse than you see in any summer day.  Service was excellent.  Not a big deal ladies. Food is awesome!

A great new place in indy with over 40 craft beers on tap.  They also provide a decent menu of typical pub style food with a twist.  The best part obviously is the scenery and friendly customer service. If you are a sports fan there are also plenty of TV's with every channel playing.  Try the "ghost heat" wings... They have a kick!!!

Steep prices for alright food. Don't get me wrong, the food wasn't bad. I would even argue that it was pretty good. But it feels like you're paying for the fact that there are two expensive sports cars in the dining room rather than quality food. And on top of that, the service wasn't really that outstanding. Overall, there are far better places to visit in New Orleans.

This place used to be one of our go-to's. It recently closed and reopened, and we were excited to go back and try one of our favorite lunch spots.

Whatever new ownership there is has absolutely ruined the menu. I ordered what turned out to be the worst salad I've ever had here; the lettuce was flavorless and wet, the chicken was absolutely disgusting, and they were out of multiple of the ingredients but charged me the full value of the salad before telling me. Used to be one of my most recommended spots in Nashville, now I'm just waiting for it to close again.

This was one of our favorite spots in this part of town. A lot of places were closed due to mardi gras. Copper Vine was not only open, but had a high top table free for us. We did the deviled eggs, which came with three halves for some reason. Haven't really figured that out, but they were good. We ordered a bottle of malbec. The bottle didn't have a label on it, so I'm not sure what that was about either. The food was great. Compared to other places in the area it is reasonably priced and much better quality. The staff was much more attentive and responsive than a few other spots nearby, too. Would definitely go back if we lived in NOLA.

Real hand-made tortilla which is totally atypical to find at a Mexican food restaurant, salsas "the heart of the taco" are magnificent! But still not "mild" lovers, good "carne asada"...

Small place, get easily crowded but worth every minute you wait for the real Mexican food.
The food is lovely. I was in heaven! We just happened to pass by it and we were starving. I would definitely come back again. A great restaurant to go to. Lovely atmosphere

Just left my birthday dinner at Twin Peaks and it was awesome. Alyssa and Bre made us feel like we had been friends forever. Great service and really good food. I had the Philly cheesesteak and it was amazing. The twin peaks sundae was awesome too!  Thanks Bre and Alyssa!

LOVED  LOVED LOVED. Cheese steak, chicken biscuit, and even vegetarian options were great. Decor was adorable and staff was helpful. The layout was a little confusing for our first time but staff was more than happy to help us.

Everyone at Ardmore pizza is like extended family, they know all their customers 
Just writing this makes me want to order!!!

One of the most delicious cafes. semi upscale, but also very casual with community tables, self service on coffee prep and local hot sauces, silverware self service, and water to grab at the front. BUT the food is AMAZING. i had the green bowl... phew. tasty and wholesome. also the iced coffee. and a pastry. the pastry was delicious but extremely small for 4 dollars.

Ate at Mahoney's this past Friday night. First, are waitress was wonderful, very upbeat and on the ball however I have to give it two stars based on the food. It was rather uneventful. With all the other restaurant choices (even the place across the street that we ate at the night before), I'd pass this one up. We ordered the taste of Mahoney's for two.

We usually go here for lunch at work and I know a bunch of regulars that like to stop in on Friday's to get their fix. Sandwiches have always been good but I think I am stuck on their muffaletta! It looks like a pizza, with its round shape, if you order the large and is pressed like a panini. The thin layers of capicola, ham, pepperoni, salami and cheese are delicious with the olive salad and crispy crust! Some of the side salads are not bad either. Definitely worth taking a look...or two ; )
Great food and times.  Surprised with lower reviews.  Awesome cold beer 29 degrees cold!  Solid food.  Section that seats/accommodates larger crowds and great service from Melanie!
Love this place! Sushi is my favorite type of food and this place is great. Really liked the rock shrimp and the miso soup. The fried rice was tasty as well. Will be coming back!

Beyond words. 

Awesome venue close to the sky bridge. 

We came for happy hour and stayed for an amazing meal--and called our friends to join!

The wedge salad is fresh, light and crunchy, the seaweed salad is highly recommended for those who like REAL seaweed plucked fresh from the ocean with a light dressing. 

We then had the shrimp stuffed chicken wings and spicy homemade crab pasta, ramen and it was delish. Our friends got sushi and loved it. 

The staff here are amazing--our bartender was so sweet when she heard that the concert we wanted to go to was sold out she tried to make some calls to see if she could get us extra tickets!

You will not regret coming here :) 

Also they have quite a Japanese whisky selection
Well priced, and perfectly portioned, this is a Bibimbap spot you don't want to miss. The aluminum bowls are the perfect size and shape too. I highly recommend this hole-in-the-wall spot.

Saul did a marvelous job very kind and attentive and patient and recommended dishes and drinks  that were very delicious the food was excellent as well as our drinks this is our first time coming and we will certainly be back!

My family and I ate here to celebrate our Christmas Eve dinner. I was very disappointed to have selected this restaurant given the occasion we were celebrating. Service was very poor. Our server, Gwen, was inattentive and slow. We waited for very long periods for our food and drinks and when we commented about the length of time we had waited for our dinner, Gwen's comment was "It's been a rough weekend". She wasn't apologetic nor did she attempt to increase her attention. After our meal she didn't bother to offer us dessert, which we had wanted to order initially. We ended up deciding to leave rather than having to ask to be offered dessert and due to the wait time it would've taken to get dessert. The only reason this review gets two stars is because the food was actually very good. However, in saying that, I think overall the food was over priced. I will not be returning to this restaurant nor would I recommend it to others.

I am in love with this place: from the design (asian contemporary with mid century modern mixed with a little great Gatsby vibes), the music (from eminem to imagine dragons on instrumental), the food and drinks, to the excellent service, TB is going to be my new favorite happy hour and dinner spot in old city.  I am always on the hunt for good sushi in philly and almost every place I've been to left something to be desired.Tuna bar served fresh sushi and well seasoned soba noodles that not only satisfied but had my friends raving about their next return. You know it's a good meal when we are talking about our next visit!
Since we had a 5pm reservation we were able to partake in their happy hour specials which included drinks and $5-$7 sushi rolls. It was a great deal considering the quality and ambience. For the sushi we went with the classics spicy tuna, spicy salmon and the salmon avocados. They were able to accommodate for my friend's wheat allergy but giving her gluten free soy sauce. The waiter was very patient and thorough with making sure my friend did not encounter any wheat products. Besides our sushi, my other friend got the chicken dumplings and the avocado ginger salad, which were both excellent. We also happened to come on a particularly beautiful day so the doors were open and they had a photographer take pictures of their new menu items. One of which is this stunning cocktail called 1912 which is inspired by the cherry blossoms in DC. The bartender sprinkled hibiscus dust on top and garnished it with beautiful flowers. It was light and refreshing and not too sweet. It also doesn't hurt that it is a beautiful work of art!
Lastly we had our sweet ending with the dark chocolate sesame ice cream. The chocolate was overpowering the sesame to be honest, but I enjoyed it nonetheless. My only qualm was that the bowl and plates are a bit uneven so it's not ideal for serving. Otherwise, this is a must try!

Handcrafted ice cream right in the heart of Nashville. The place is always busy but worth the wait. The line goes pretty fast & they have specialty flavors you can get a free taste test (spoonful) of. I ordered a hot fudge sundae & it was about $6 but huge & was the best ever! 
The service is really friendly.

Ordered a Footlong Chili Cheese Dog. Waited a good 5 minutes in the drive through specifically for this item. When it was given to me they advised me they gave me a second one for free since it had taken so long. NEITHER of these hot dogs were cooked through. What took so long if the hot dogs weren't even cooked??

High recommend going!!! Caviar and bananas was delicious. Not only was the food wonderful, the coffee was also amazing. The atmosphere is warm and exciting from the moment you walk in the door. I would highly recommend trying the Waldorf salad, the Cobb, or the hot chicken salad!! If you're looking for something different, try the the roasted zucchini or roasted pear flatbread. They were both amazing. The fire kombucha is also unique and definitely my favorite! For a sweet craving, try the butterscotch blondie, the black and white brownie, or the coffee cake.
bun is sucked here and the waitress was really mean and cheap... will never come anymore... I really think that the review above 3 stars are fake

Mean service, but there Chinese I get it....

that's not the bad portion... the beef and broccoli was weird. The beef was covered in fuzzys and hairs and tasted like fish...

Cooked to order my ass

This place is fantastic. While we waited for our food, it was clear looking around they take great pride and joy in their establishment. We got the beef bibimbap in a stone bowl. It was humbly presented to the table still sizzling. The kimchi is complex, spicy and sweet and we poured the whole thing in the bowl. Shrimp Pancake was also om nom nom gone, much like a latke with shrimp embedded within. The house ginger cinnamon tea was also a delight, unsweetened, a little spicy, crisp and refreshing. Will be back first chance we get!

Delicious shrimp po-boy and hush puppies.  We debated sweet potato fries and decided not to get them.  A few minutes after enjoying our food Lori Beth comes back to our table and kindly gives us some complimentary sweet potato fries. Seriously how sweet and great was that?

I got a peacemaker 10" and a bloody Mary. My bill was $44. I think that was with tip.

The Po boy was great, but got a bit of sticker shock after paying $4 bloody Mary's at the other places. 

Peacemaker was great though. I dunno if I'd go back though for that price or if it was worth it. I guess the search is still on....

I can only comment on the cakes but my cake experience has been great. They are not pricey by any means. I think a 6-inch strawberry cake for Mothers Day cost me only $12. Don't think that because it's not pricey that the taste will be bad. We all loved the cake. The cream was light and the cake moist and not too sweet, which I appreciate.  We've tried the taro one before too. I was skeptical about the flavor but it was terrific too. They'll write what you want on the cake on the spot. They gladly wrote "happy Mother's Day" in Chinese on it for me. I'm not sure if they make custom cakes.  I've never tried their other things but I'm going to try their sponge roll cakes next- just 4 bucks if I remember right. Give their cakes a try!

Excellent staff here!! Everyone from the valet staff, the host, the restaurant manager, the servers were all nice! Our waiter had a great knowledge of the menu! The restaurant is beautiful with modern decor! We were lucky to be seated in a private room. The staff helped us get set up and I can't thank them enough. We all loved the stuffed chicken wings. The drinks were delish!!

The entrees are really not shareable because most items are bite sizes like the 4 dumplings you can eat in 2 bites. 
The only complaint I have is about the pricing on the Japanese wagyu which is very misleading. It was Amazing but absolutely not worth the price. It's $26 per oz for a minimum of 4oz in very small print!!! We had a party of 10 and all of us read the menu wrong. That adds up to $104. We had 3 to share in our table so imagine the shock when we got the bill. $416 for 1lb of wagyu is highway robbery!! If we return I'd like to try the American wagyu. 

PS If you visit be sure to use the restrooms. I know silly but I was so tickled by the Toto high tech toilets lol.

This is a cute place that combines a bakery with classic warm breakfast items and a wine tasting bar.
It is located in the middle of a street tucked in the back surrounded by other tasting rooms representing the different wineries of Santa Barbara.
It was Sunday and the bakery at 11:30 am had sold of nearly out all bread items. My plan of a simple warm sesame bagel with cheese was replaced with  the soup of the day : cream of mushroom a little heavy on the cream accompanied by 2 wedges of buttered sourdough.
I added a Cuban sandwich which was good but unfortunately , the same buttered sourdough was  used making it for a very heavy meal .
For the price, I would have  liked a salad on the side.
The flavors were good and the atmosphere inside was nice and cosy but minus one star for the heavy hand on the butter and the cream .

Pretty good restaurant, but honestly the over an hour and a half wait to be seated and for our food to come out was almost unbearable. The fried shrimp po-boy was delicious! The Mahony's platter for 2 was a good portion and was great because we were able to try a lot of creole classics! The gator sausage was surprisingly one of my favorite things on the platter! The rice and beans, and the crawfish were really great too! The gumbo was a little too fishy for my taste. It was good, but nothing amazing and a ridiculously long wait time.

This place is cheap with a capital "C." Though most bakeries in Chinatown are very affordable, what made this place great was the service! The woman behind the counter chatted us up and helped us decide on which bubble tea to order. We went with the thai tea which they prepare themselves earlier in the day. The thai tea was tasty but could have been a little sweeter. I was tempted to try out some of the treats since they were only a buck but I was stuffed from dinner. Next time I'll try to the egg tarts.

The food here was phenomenal. We ordered the green breakfast bowl, which was unique and the sauce added a delicious flavor. Loved it. The turkey panini had jalapeños baked into the bread and it was very crunchy and delicious. The atmosphere both inside and on the patio was very nice and cute. Loved this place for a casual brunch.

Bap is run by a very friendly elderly couple that, coupled with the cozy decor, really make it feel like we're in someone's home.

The wood floors and tables are a dark wood and the warm lighting is dim. There's no music playing and it's often empty. In sum, this makes for a great place on a cold winter day to grab hot soup or dolsot bibimbap.

Prices are reasonable and you'll see from my photos that I got a filling dolsot tofu bibimbap and traditional ginger cinnamon tea.

I'd come back again for a casual meal and suggest you do the same.

I've been here a time or two before and did not think much of it. It's pricey and a bit too "frou frou" for my taste. I really just thought this place was another West End over-the-top restaurant. While in the area again, I figured I'd give it another shot, because everything deserves a second chance.

I've only dined in for breakfast, but have heard people rave about the lunch and dinner menus. They had salads, sandwiches, wraps, and other great options. They had a plethora of unique side options that looked so dang good--from chicken salad and kale salad to Thai meatballs and chicken tenders. It all looked (and tasted) so fresh. They have options for all sorts of diet restrictions and allergies, and a small shopping section with fun & unique juices, chips, and snack options.

The Thai meatballs and kale salad were TO DIE FOR, so fresh and so delicious--a must try...kale lovers and kale skeptics will enjoy it. I ordered a chicken wrap that was funky and soggy, and not the best--I threw it out because it just didn't taste nearly as good as my sides. The ambiance here is very cute, matching the food, a perfect place for that perfect Instagram snap.
Ordered the 5.99 deals tonight. I was able to feed the family on only $30. Great delivery time & great food! Thank you!

Y'all, this place is the BOMB! We ate here for the second time. The food is amazing! The spicy crab noodles, chicken wings, Caesar wedge salad, mushrooms, the skirt steak with miso butter, WOW! Nothing like it, plus the atmosphere is amazing! We visit lots of Nashville restaurants and all I can think about is when I'm going back!

Keeping in mind that it was lunch and my friend and I had small plates, the score is based on everything from ambiance to presentation to service. I will be returning for dinner and for other samplings. 
Sui Gyoza, perfect beginning. The tuna tartar was elegantly presented and spicy special. We also enjoyed the wedge salad with hibachi dressing and the (very yummy) japanese fried chicken. 
Our server, Alex was top notch and steered us correctly to a dessert to share. We went with the tempura style chocolate cake with both leche and chocolate sauce,  dangerously delicious, but honestly, best shared. Special food, special company. Time well spent.

idk what it is about the way they make their pizzas but they're always insanely gooey and cheesy and delicious. They're kinda small unfortunately but it balances out. They also sell fries, cheesesteaks, etc. which are all good, except for the burgers.

When this place opened up down the street my husband and I were super excited that the neighborhood was starting to fill up with nice restaurants. We went in to check it out last night and we were not disappointed. Everything was amazing! The staff is super friendly, the ambiance is really beautiful, modern and chic but still comfortable and the food is out of this world. I mean, seriously. We've been to tons of other sushi places in the city and this was the best of the best. We had a bunch of sashimi, scallops, fried oysters (omg, so good), fried lobster rice and rock shrimp. The scallops were my husbands fave, I really loved the oysters and the rock shrimp. Everything was so fresh and so full of flavor. The sashimi was so fresh and "melt-in-your-mouth" that it sort of seemed insulting to put soy sauce anywhere near it.  We also had really great cocktails, I highly recommend trying the gin-cucumber-wasabi drink. (I can't remember what it's called, maybe Winston Heat? Wilson Heat? Something like that) I really can't wait to go back to this place, it's so perfect for date night.

We really enjoyed our meal but I was incredibly surprised to see a $2 charge for WASABI when we ordered the chirashi (raw fish).  I understand charging for "extra" wasabi with dumplings or noodles or something but it's pretty standard for wasabi to be included with chirashi.  Lol wtf

Went to Tuna Bar for lunch on a Sunday. Sat at a table next to the window and it was beautiful. The view was very good and so was our waiter. However, the food took a very long time to come out and we were starving. Other than that this place was awesome.

Think of your typical Friday night in your hometown... you want subpar food that offers nothing but average. This is the place for you. The food is acceptable and service sucks. This place is going to be your worst eating experience when you are in New Orleans but hey that's good enough for some people. They are just monopolizing on the name po-boy without actually delivering anything close to the quality a po-boy usually brings. Never will I recommend this place- but it provides food with no wait time and I appreciate that.
Fried shrimp po boy and fried green tomato pimento BLT with friend pickles was amazing!
neatest little family owned place around. I really enjoy their food. nice and quiet even when full and great staff

Okay, Wawa is actually really good. The sandwiches are better than most chain shops like JJs, Subway, etc. and excellently toasted. They are also pretty cheap and don't forget about free coffee day and all the other deals they have.

The oreo flurricane is on another level. If you have ever been disappointed in a Mcflurry as I have, this is the order for you. The flurricane is everything a Mcflurry ever wanted to be. Loaded with oreos and well-mixed, Mcflurries can only dream of becoming flurricanes. They are also huge- while they cost about as much as a Mcflurry, they are over twice the size I want to say. 

Overall: Break up with your partner? Flurricane. Rough exam? Flurricane. Want an ice cream dessert? Flurricane. Dissapointed by Mcds? Flurricane. The only thing the flurricane cannot do is bring my grandparents back.

Best hidden gem. I always get chorizo and egg. The tortillas are fresh and handmade. I think they make all the difference.

~Lauren

I'm sure the bartender is selling drugs. She does not want to get you a beer. I think her name is Lisa she drives a black Jetta. Sometimes a white ford pick up. The only reason I know that is I saw her seller selling drugs in the parking lot across the street. Avoid this place Unless you want drugs.   

Don't eat anything at sharkys you will get sick.
Great sandwiches, coffee, and service. Tennessee Trio was unique and had bacon onion jam.

I love this place in different location, but this one on South Virginia has to be the nastiest I have ever ate at. The chef over cooked the food, the waiter never came back to check on us or ask for more water. The food took almost an hour to get to us, the bread was cold and the waiter said they are fresh and coming out the oven, but how is it cold? When it came out the oven The cruton in the salad was so overwhelming with burnt taste. My little brother order the mama trio, and that lasagna with wine, was so overwhelming with the bitterness of the wine, to the point he couldn't eat it, because they did not reduce the wine down.i will never ever go back to this place. Maybe you should hire a real Italian chef who knows the culture food, instead of a sloppy Mexican chef who doesn't care how the food comes out

This place has oat milk! And I don't mean that in a hippie dippy way, but coming from LA, oat milk is delicious and a great way to enjoy lattes. All that to say, this place is cute, rustic, the food is delicious (I recommend the ricotta toast) and is a perfect way to start your morning for breakfast or brunch!! Highly recommend this place!

On vacation to New Orleans and this wine bar was FANTASTIC! I absolutely loved the menu and food, but the service was second to none. Justin was fabulous. He constantly checked on us, provided new wine suggestions based on my tasting experience and truly made the visit to Copper Vine memorable. We have to return before we leave NOLA. If you love wine, Copper Vine is a must.
Great ambiance. Food and drinks were good.  Server was super funny and attentive. Only drawback is the kitchen was a little slow.

This place was awful. We were waiting 1 and a half waiting for our food. The waitress would ignore what we were saying and we would then have to ask a different waiter or we would have to repeat what we were saying. She claimed that the"computers weren't working and lots of other excuses. But there was another waiter who served his customers before us when we arrived before them. In conclusion I would not recommend this place one bit, we were so mad that we just walked out of there.
Best Chinese food I've ever had. Way better than PF Changs! Try the lemon chicken!

3.5

I am a japchae fiend.  I can eat gallons of that stuff if it's in front of me. I was excited that this popular and well-reviewed place was close to my office.  It's a tiny place, so they purposefully only offer a few signature dishes, all under $10.

I finally had a chance to pop in and ordered the japchae with anticipation. I think it was just under $9, a bit pricy in my opinion for a vegetarian japchae with a small scoop of rice. It didn't have that much flavor, to be honest.

Friendly gentleman who took my order, cooked and rang me up.

So sad I used to love this place sadly on my last visit I ordered my favorite  eggplant parmesan which is usually a pretty big platter, instead I got 3 golf ball sized pieces of eggplant. I was disappointed in the size and when I took my first bite I tasted a charcoal flaver ALL of them had been burnt to a crisp!!! then flipped over and served!!!!!!! We alerted the waiter who just brought us more eggplant 30mins later by the time I got it everyone in my party had eaten! and it was under cooked this time raw eggplant is not delicious, then they expected me to PAY for that!!! This branch has gone down the drain
The spinach artichoke was to salty., shrimp pasta was over cooked , good oysters , bad Bloody Mary- bacon at bottom .. Slow service .. But waiter was nice ... Won't be back though ...

Let me tell you, if you are over 65 years of age on a Monday Night, this is the place for you. They've got the old man that only came for dessert and has probably been here for 3 hours. They've got the two older men watching sports and talking too loud because one of them cannot hear and the other has all the things to say. All the things. And last, but not least, we've got the older lady in the bathroom shoving paper towels in her purse.

All and all, it was okay.

I thought they were closing soon because the waiter came back in minute and a half intervals to if we were ready to order. Come to find out she was just super attentive because it is after all a slow Monday night. She was actually really nice. She's the reason this review is a 3 star instead of a two. 

I'm one of those people who look over the menu searching for something new to try and inevitably get what I always get: in this case, chicken fettuccine Alfredo. I give this dish effort for trying. I wasn't creamy, just oily, but it was still flavorful, so that was cool. 

My significant other got the truffle mac n cheese, which he was all about. I wasn't that into it, but as you can see, I'm kind of a turd. 

They had Coca Cola, which made me happy because I dislike Pepsi very much. They also give you a free square loaf of fresh bread... but no butter knife, which pretty much sums up the experience.

Saturday night - service was absolutely awful. There was no one but me & my brother. It took 30 minutes to get our food, there's no reason why it took so long. Food is very mediocre - you can get the same quality food at wawa. Do not come here, avoid at all costs. This place does not belong in a nice place like manayunk.

I just ate ice cream at 10 in the morning, and Mike made me do it!  

This quaint and cute, old-fashioned ice cream parlor hails back to the days when quality service mattered.  Each of their twenty-something ice cream flavors is "handmade" (although I'm not...quite sure what that means), and their frozen cappuccino is freshly composed each day, in house.  Pastries and touristy-treats are also available, although those are provided by outside vendors.  Service does take a little while, since each drink is made to order-- I guess you could say, "with love."  The ice cream is worth the wait, though!

Perhaps Mike knew that I was a tourist, or, perhaps I am just that cute *wink*, because I was served a scoop of Tennessee Fudge so generous that Texas would be jealous!  It was smooth and creamy, but not gluey, like some other gourmet ice creams can be.   I also sampled the Pistachio, Red Velvet, and Moose Tracks, which were also delicious.  

Yes, it was still so early in the morning that people were just barely arriving at work.  Didn't matter.  I was on vacation, and on vacation, what girl doesn't enjoy a fun and indulgent treat?

Great place to eat and hang out! We had some drinks outside in the patio area and then went inside for dinner. The service is what made me give them 5 stars, the chef was outside hanging out with everyone, seating, chatting, asking how we were doing. So many people checked up on us that I couldn't keep track. Food was great and the atmosphere was fabulous!
