After I finished it I had a bigass smile on my face.  

I was so happy with my Wawa hoagie that I stopped off at another Wawa on my way home and got a 6 inch Meatball hoagie ($4.89 total).  That was also pretty solid too.  I also got a medium coffee ($1.65) and 2 kit kats for $2.  I'm definitely a huge fan of Wawa now.

Every time I walk into Mike's I feel like I am in that movie Pleasantville where everything turns black and white and is fantastically 50s. The ice cream, true to the setting, is great and though I'm not a big ice cream float person (now that I'm all grown up) it's the only place I have had one in the last decade. Something about the place just makes you want to see an ice cream scoop float in some soda. If you can grab a window seat, do it, because there is no better place to people watch!
This was our first time at Tuna Bar and we were very impressed. The food was amazing and came out super quick. The cocktails were creative and delicious. Can't wait to go back!

I would have given Top Shelf 10 stars if I could. 

I am a regular at this establishment and decided to order catering for my office for the first time. Not only was the process so simple, but the food was incredible. We got the house wings (which I think are the best), house chips, cuban (OMG) but the real shining star was the pasta salad which was the best I have ever had. It was so full of flavor in every bite I just had to have seconds. Portions were great for price and the food was incredible. If you have not eaten here, RUN! Certainly best food in the area. WOW!

Went here for a Saturday night out to catch some sports and listen to some live music (which was going on from 5-8). 
The place was pretty crowded in the bar area, not so much on the table/restaurant side. 
Our Waitress Jess was very nice and helpful. It seems as though many people there knew each other which indicates there is a local element to the place which is fine, they obviously have a base clientele. 
We started with a few appetizers, the cheese steak egg rolls were good however one of them was a little overdone. They had good flavor with a little spicy kick. The other appetizer was a fried seafood sampler with Calamari, Shrimp and Clams Casino. This was very good and cooked to perfection with a nice portion. 
We decided to split a meal since we were pretty full from the appetizers. We went with the Chicken Marsala and again the portion size was generous. The Marsala sauce was tasty as were the green beans and mashed potatoes that came with the dish. No big complaints about the food. 
The noise level in the place is pretty high, probably because the place is wide open. This noise was apparent even when the live musician was playing. There was a DJ that started at 9 and he did a great job of mixing up the music genres. The crowd really picked up around 10 and the age group of the crowd was pretty diverse but leaned toward the 20/30's group. 
Overall this seems like a fun place to hang out or have dinner. The noise level is high so if you're looking for quiet/intimate then this isn't you're place. 
I will add that since it is winter we found the restaurant seating area to be pretty cold. There are 2 exit/entry doors on that side of the building and every time the door opened the cold air rushed in and there was no protection from it. The heat didn't appear to on very high so the cold drafts made it tough. We actually moved tables once to avoid the cold from the door opening. 
Overall the experience was great and we would definitely consider going here again.

Stopped in with the wife and kids for Sunday brunch. And wow!! Cool spot for the kids to play, great brunch menu. Wife had mimosas while I drank the local lager!! 
Chicken & waffles, biscuit & scrapple, and crafty breakfast all delicious and so fresh! Will definitely be back.

LOADED with shrimp.

I had another po boy at a restaurant and wasn't wowed. I wondered if there wasn't much to this simple sandwich and just had to accept it. After ubering to Parkway... ON A TUESDAY we sadly ubered it back to our place- because they were closed. I stumbled across this place on DoorDash and ordered the shrimp poboy and was amazed at the side and amount of shrimp in it- at half for lunch and the other half for dinner. 

My husband had the hamburger po boy and he said it was really good as well.
Fried duck with gumbo debris poboy was delish!  Onion very good also.  Wife had roast beef and she liked it .

Mike's is bomb.com - there's just no getting around it.  I'm from the West side of the Mississippi and I have no idea how Nashvillians eat Jenni's Ice Cream... blegh! Mike's is that Midwest, hometown, ice cream shop feeling. Their staff is always friendly, happy to provide samples, and getting people rung up and out the door. Just wait in line like everyone else and get you a double scoop, because, YOLO. And while you're yolo-ing, opt for a waffle cone - they have the perfect batter mix - enough to hold ice cream but not too heavy and never stale. If only one could order ahead at Mike's and just go pick up - maybe someday!

If you're looking for high quality sushi at a reasonable price, this is the place! I am a sushi snob having lived in NYC and Singapore for years, and this is the only place I've been to in Philly that remotely compares aside from Morimoto and Tomo. Their tuna is very fresh and high quality, the salmon and yellowtail are always very good and fresh too. They do a spicy tuna roll 'the right way' with little mayo and big pieces of sushi, as opposed to the mushy, orange paste-y consistency of most spicy tuna rolls I've had in Philly. The lobster fried rice is also very good with a fresh flavor but a little light on the lobster. I haven't tried anything else as of yet.

What sets this place apart is their happy hour and daily specials - you can't beat it anywhere in The City! Salmon avocado, spicy salmon, or spicy tuna toll for $5! You can also choose from chicken and shrimp gyozas and a couple other items for $5. Drinks specials are $5 for the cocktail special and about $4 for beer and wine. Tuesday is Tuna Tuesday where you can get tuna tartare for $7, and Wednesday is hand rolls for $5. 

The service is definitely one of my favorite things about this place. The bartenders are friendly and prompt and super professional. The atmosphere is really cool, a mix of rustic with an Old City feel. They've been open for a year, but I wish I'd found them sooner!

We ordered hurricanes and they were so sweet we could not drink them. We told the waitress who told the manager. The manager came over and was rude to us. He asked us how we ordered a sweet drink then complained that it was too sweet. Poor customer service.

I love this place and I'm a frequent visitor. The first time I came here, they had a Wasabi Oyster special that they haven't had since. It blew me away and I keep coming back hoping that they will serve it again some day.

Besides that, the atmosphere is wonderful and the food has been consistently tasty. They have two fun oyster drinks as well: Slurp-a-burp which is an Oyster with cocktail sauce and lager or the Oyster shooter which is the same, but with vodka.

The oysters I've gotten there have been high quality and good-tasting. For the squeamish - I've never gotten sick. And on top of that the other dishes have been delightful.

The only problem I've had is that some nights they don't have enough people shucking the oysters which can cause really really slow service. But not to worry, this has only happened once in the several times I've been with family and friends.

Thank goodness for Yelp reviews.  We take the 101 many times from SoCal to the Bay Area and are always looking for a place to stop for breakfast.  This was a perfect choice for us.  The restaurant has both indoor and outdoor seating and the decor looks industrial/funky.  They have some nice breakfast options and we enjoyed our choices.  The only problem was that they took a very long time to deliver our meals and when my eggs arrived they were not hot.  I sent them back and kept an eye on the kitchen.  I had to go up to the cashier to ask if the eggs that were sitting on the counter in the kitchen were mine.  Yes they were and fortunately I saw them in time to enjoy them at the right temperature.  It may have been a bad day for the servers and we will definitely try it again.
DELICIOUS! This is my absolute favorite neighborhood spot. The food never disappoints, and the owners are extremely kind and gracious. I highly highly  recommend!!

Stopped by Craft Hall today and boy was I surprised....This place has had a total overhaul and just opened today! Soft open, but all was in place, great service from the bar tenders, really good beer! And had some fantastic bites from the kitchen...go for the BBQ pork it's awesome.
What i really liked was that place is that it has a great hang out space to hang with friends but that it also a great area set up so that "friends with kids" can also come and hangout. You have gotta check this place out....seriously! Yea and great music too.

We had a reservation made plenty early but waited for 30 minutes past that time to get our table for 4. The chicken parm with pasta was delicious but unfortunately with the late seating we had to run to our appointment and couldn't savor the meal as anticipated. Server worked to get us food in the time we had so that was appreciated.
The service is impeccable & the lady's are Gorgeous... Great job with the training too Morgan is doing great

We had a coupon for buy 1 get 1, so my husband and I ordered of the senior menu.  It was surprisingly a generous portions and tasty. I had the country fried steak and my husband had the omelette. The waitress was attentive. My only complaint was she didn't understand I didn't want lemon with my tea.
Great ice cream. Creamy, smooth, Interesting flavors. Chocolate raspberry truffle? Yes please. Service with a smile, provided samples willingly.

BIG thank you to China Dragon that catered lunch for our teachers and staff! It made our teacher appreciation lunch a huge success. The food was delicious and your service exceptional! We were very happy with our experience.. we'll see you again!

Food is good, but overpriced. Disappointed that they only serve their ramen dishes at lunch, not dinner. For such an expensive place, the fact they refused to split checks was ridiculous and infuriating as we had a party of four and had to spend ten minutes trying to figure out which dish was whose and how much each person owed (the dishes are small so you order multiple ones which adds to the confusion). When the waiter told me they don't split checks, I thought he was joking and I literally said "are you serious??" out loud to the dismay of my poor husband. Service is also poor and they only check on you once or twice. When we went for lunch, the place was empty, yet we had to get up and find our waiter just to get our check and get out of there.
Very good! Great food in a beautiful space. Highly recommend for a date night, happy hour or lunch with friends if you want something yummy and stylish!

This amazing find on south street is worth a try. Small Korean eatery run by a husband and wife, with close to 7 menu items there not too many ways it can go wrong. The hot stone bowls are healthy and delicious. We tried the shrimp pancake and the japchae, also yummy. Portion size is slightly small but it makes up in the taste. Slightly expensive, but it's worth the taste. Do try this place next time you are in the mood for some good Korean bowls.
Great service and coffee. The breakfast sandwich had the fluffiest eggs. Mouth watering and tasty

I can't believe I ordered from them again and once more I regret. 
Will keep it super short this time. 
Ordered two pizzas one plain one white with onions. I've got two pain instead - one with onion. They did get Part of it right!!!
GREASE!!!!!!!!!!!!GREASE!!!!!!!!!!!GREASE!!!!!!!!!!!! AND HELL LOTS OF SALT!!!!!!!! NEVER AGAIN !!!!!!!!! Even if that was the last pizza on planet !

Went in on a Sunday evening and it was very quiet. Nice bar with approximately 15 tables for seating. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were super friendly. We ordered spiedini and sausage and pepper spring rolls. Both appetizers arrived hot and both were delicious. 
Next up was the papardelle with short ribs topped with Arugala.  Absolutely outstanding!!  Highly recommend Bar One aka Barone!  Can't wait to try the Brunch menu too.

This place is really good. It isn't your all-you-can eat or $4 roll type sushi spot so be prepared to spend a little more but in my opinion it's totally worth it. Aside from the food below the place is really comfy inside and super swanky. 

My girlfriend had a real California and a shrimp tempura roll, I had a real California and the small Omakase (which comes with a tuna roll as well) and we both had the gyoza to start. Both the gyoza and sushi were the best I've had in Philadelphia for sure. The Omakase nigiri was absolutely phenomenal, every piece was perfectly formed and just delicious. Real sushi chefs behind the counter. Gyoza was flavorful, pan seared just right as well. 

Service was good, albeit a *tiny* bit slow but we were also there an hour before closing on a Friday night when there are tons of people there at the bar and sitting outside -- our waiter was doing the best he could. He was also super friendly and knew everything about what was being served. 

2 drinks and the food above - $105. Very worth it.

Great place for a romantic date.

Was able to get some one-on-one time with my girl. The woman singing opera was amazing. I was really not expecting the dimmed lighting but was very impressed with everything. Outdoor seating would have also been great since they have heaters.

The bread was so good. I really enjoyed the Pasta Milano but saw some other great choices on the menu.

Expensive and not the money.  Smug service and an overpriced breakfast sandwich with only one egg.  Wouldn't recommend, cute space in a nice neighborhood but better options for food considering the price.

Look, I don't leave reviews on Yelp, but my boyfriend is from a korean family and we've been on the hunt for the best korean food in philly for a while now. This place has our hearts. 

Just a married couple with a small menu, but flavors that pack a PUNCH. Some of the most authentic Korean food we've had in Philly and easily the cheapest too! 

Great hospitality, great food. We're regulars.

So delicious!! Everything we ordered was amazing except the calamari (ika karaage), which was unfortunately very bland.

Keep in mind that this is a tapas style restaurant so be mindful that you'll be sharing and ordering small plates. 

Also, they have a cake fee. I think it was $25 to have them store the cake in the back and also cut and serve the cake for you.

I grew up around the corner from this place and I have to say, the delivery guys knew our address by heart.  

I am not a huge fan of their style of pizza, but its greasy and its good.  Where they deliver (pun intended) is their cheese steaks.  In fact, this last Christmas, I took a road trip to Michigan to visit family who had been from Philly.  Ardmore style went above and beyond packing up steaks seperately for the long road trip.  They survived and the fam was happy for the tasty philly treat.

I think they have platters on their menu that come with fries and a salad...its been awhile since i got that, but I remember the salad being tasty.  You don't exactly go to a pizza place for the salad, so that says a lot.

I think they are open really late on weekends too!  

Ardmore style has a special place is my family's heart...I hope it never closes!

Casual restaurant serving up hearty servings of Big Easy classics. Came here for dinner after a long day of walking around New Orleans, and walked in around around 5:30. We got seated immediately with no wait. The menu has a lot of different New Orleans classics, and we got three dishes to split amongst the four of us. The Peacemaker Po'boy has fried shrimp and fried oysters alongside thick cut bacon and melted cheddar cheese. It was super hefty and my favorite. The crawfish 3-way was a good way to try multiple iterations of crawfish (including Zapps Crawtator chips, which we planned to order more off amazon when we got back to LA). The crawfish etouffe was buttery and so comforting. The fried crawfish tails were a little too salty, but they came with a cocktail sauce and a tartar sauce you could dip them in. The fried chicken was decent but not memorable. The hurricane was just the right amount of sweet and came with a cute lil straw. I liked how the owner came around the tables and asked how we were doing - it was a very nice touch. Overall, the food was yummy and the ambiance is chill. It's a nice spot to come for comfort food off of Bourbon St.

We have been there twice. Once a few weeks ago and again today. Honestly the food is not only amazing but the service is at least seven stars. The first time we went we had Rose who not only made us feel welcome but also so informative about the menu. She led us to to an amazing brunch. Today Ari (spelling) ? Made us amazing drinks and again made us feel so welcome. Our number one brunch spot in the ENTIRE city of New Orleans!!!

I am a crafter and was doing the Manayunk arts festival and this restaurant was right across the street so I decided we would get lunch there. First off I was told they were only serving a limited menu that they had on a chalk board above the counter. So I settled for what was on the menu and ordered and paid. Then while I was sitting there waiting for my order I proceeded to watch the counter guy take orders for things not on the limited menu. I asked him about this he said "sorry man". Then on top of everything they got the order wrong and the food was just okay. If you are thinking of eating here I suggest you step 30-40 feet down the street to mikes. We ate there the second day on someone else's recommendation and even if it looks a little like a hole in the wall the food is great as is the service.
The worst food we have ever had.  Feel sorry for our server, not her fault the food was not edible.  Too bad because we used to live going there. Never again

To call this place a Japanese restaurant may be one of the bigger insults. I am a fan of Two Ten Jack and was excited about trying Green Pheasant. Boy was I let down. When we walked in the music was positively blaring. When we said something to our server he told us that we were not the first, but the fourth person to complain. When they turned it down, it hardly made any difference. I started with the tuna tartare with crispy rice. We thought they brought out the wrong dish because the tuna was unrecognizable, looking like chopped liver on rice. (See photo). They charged for soy sauce and for wasabi which I have never seen before at a Japanese restaurant. They are trying to get rid of the American influences so did not have the American whiskies on the menu. The food was doused in butter and you could hardly taste the Japanese flavors in any of the dishes. My lips were puckered because the food is so over salted. And to seal the deal, we found a hair mixed into the rice of our chirashi. I will not be coming back. At the end of our meal, the a server came out and let us know he saw our review. Rather than apologizing for the poor service and our bad experience, he could not have been more unkind. One of the wait staff walked us out of the restaurant telling us how pathetic we are. To call one pathetic is incredibly rude, especially to customers in the service industry who simply voiced their opinions of a bad experience on yelp.

The waitress was very nice and knowledgeable.  The dishes were very heavy and overly greasy.  We ordered the chicken wings gyoza which was ok but greasy.  The hash browns we drenched in BBQ sauce which was overwhelming.  The fried rice was ok, but again with the sausage.  It was just greasy and heavy.  We really wanted to like it.
I had the grilled hot sausage P boy fully dressed. It starts with the French bread unbelievably fresh. The sausage has just the right amount of spice dripping fat all over the place delicious.
What's not to like? Authentic Italian food at dirt cheap prices. The canolis are out of this world!

Three of us stopped in and had an amazing dining experience! The hostess, Megan, greeted is joyfully and seated us quickly. The menu was different than I'd ever seen before. Each item we ordered served four people and it was so delicious! The tomatoes, mushrooms, lobster... It was all so yummy. Our waiter Michael explained all the dishes well and made great suggestions! We will definitely be back. We do recommend making a reservation to guarantee a table! You will not be disappointed!

Yummo! Homemade ice cream with homemade waffle cones = night made!! Visited this shop on a Monday night and it was packed... that's always s good sign to me! We waited maybe 15 minutes in line, but this gave us time to decide which flavor we were going to get as there were maybe 15 to choose from! I was torn between red velvet, salted caramel, caramel waffle cone, and birthday cake. I ultimately went with the caramel waffle cone flavor in a waffle cone and was not disappointed. I would have gave this joint a 5/5, however the seating area was cramped And difficult to get around.

This place is good for people that are having a party they give you a cake for good deeds!! The food is overall REALLY DAMN GOOD the pizza cruft is really soft and cool! We really liked it here but it was my first time going here I thought it was like a really bad place but I was wrong! This is amazing the people are really nice and I hope the get some good luck for 2019-2020! You good customer Jorge I'm from the north east side ok bye! Ok

Really really really good. Stopped here on a whim for breakfast and wasn't disappointed. Bustling with good inside and outside seating. Got the toast with peanut/cashew butter, sliced bananas, and rosemary. Husband got the whipped ricotta and honey toast - amazing! Also ordered a loaf of fig and rosemary bread (seriously super dense and beautiful) and it was incredible - so soft inside and freshly made! Do make a visit. Very cool spot.

Amazing on all fronts. 

Guys, park in the self park garage and get it validated for free. Don't pay $12 for valet, silly!

We were seated immediately by a friendly hostess and given warm eucalyptus towels which were SO nice on a cold night. What a nice touch. 

We had the sonomono, shumai, chahan w/american wagyu, and the ora king salmon. Each dish was flavorful and delicious. The sonomono is like ceviche but better. For dessert, we had the tempura chocolate cake - my husbands choice because I usually don't love cake but this was excellent.

The japanese old fashioned was probably one of the best I've ever had. My husband enjoyed his cocktail too - the green chartreuse gave it a complex flavor. 

I'm looking forward to trying more items on the menu next time.

Sorry but we were very disappointed in this place. We came there off of a Yelp recommendation but found the food to like taste and the portions to be small. I've had better bulgogi and smaller cities. The place is small which we liked and the staff were friendly but the food did not seem fresh and was not desirable we both have to beef bulgogi.

Tasty food, lovely outdoor patio service, great wine selection and Cemille was a wonderful server. My friends enjoyed the Wagyu burger and their side arugula salads which were huge! And I enjoyed a cup of the new French shallot soup and the blackened tuna Niçoise salad. Our bottle of Tempranillo was lovely, and the outdoor patio seating was sweet. Sadly we were too full for dessert!

I came into twin peaks with my friend to have a few beers. We sat at main bar with Kaylee and Sammie. They were very attentive to our needs and answered all our questions. I highly recommend the smoked wings tossed in the spicy Thai sauce.

Note: don't forget your Costco card, $100 value for $79.99.

My wife decided to bring me here for Father's Day. It was a good choice, I really enjoyed it. It is been over 10 years since I've been here. Couldn't really remember why we didn't return, 

The service was great, the manager sat us and was very friendly. For Father's Day, it was not that busy. However the server did tell us that it was really busy earlier, before we arrived, and they are shortstaffed. We saw none of this.

What we ordered:

Drinks
Top shelf margarita, on the rocks, no salt.
Peach sangria
Lemonade for kids

Dinner
Father's Day menu
Steak & potatoes, medium rare, 
Garden salad
Shrimp Portofino
Kids meatballs with spaghetti
Kids chicken with broccoli

Dessert
Decadent Chocolate cake

The garden salad is a $2.50 ad on, however if it is unlimited refills. It arrived and was very tasty, made with bib/butter leaf lettuce. It was missing tomatoes. I asked her for another salad as it is unlimited, but I asked her to add tomatoes. She came back and said it was a very busy day and there was no tomatoes. So she took it off the bill. The dinner also came with a small loaf of bread, that was tasty. It was topped with fresh butter and Parmesan. A little on the salty side.

The steak was cooked perfectly. It was also very tender. Probably one of the best steaks I've had in the restaurant the last few years. The potatoes were baby red potatoes, roasted with a Parmesan cheese. It was powdered cheese, kind a like the Parmesan shaker you get a pizza joint. They had a nice caramelization, tender, yet a little crunch. Can't ask for better. The broccoli that came with it, had a nice rich flavor, but was a little too al dente for me. I think that's just a matter of preference though. 

My wife's shrimp was also cooked perfectly, it came with angel hair pasta and mushrooms. The flavor was a little bland. I think it was a garlic butter, but just not enough flavor for me. But she didn't complain lol. She did like the pinenuts in it and the green leaf vegetable in it.

The kids dishes had good flavor. I think the chicken was about 2 ounces, as well as two small meatballs for the kids meals at six dollars. Lots of pasta in it and marinara sauce. I do feel the kids were a little bit short changed. Not very much protein at all, tons of pasta for six dollars. I was able to share my steak with them so they were happy. 

The decadent chocolate cake was perfect. It was included in the Father's Day menu, and very large. We were able to share it and still not finish it.

We had a Mother's Day dinner of 8. We had reservations but there was no need since there was no one really in there.  2 of us got our food 10 minutes after everyone else. It took another 5 minutes for the last person to get there food.  The manager or the server never even apologized or offer any type of discount. Horrible customer service.

I ended up stopping here twice during my trip. Once for happy hour and another time for brunch. Their happy hour includes a great wine flight and discounted appetizers. I got the Brussels sprouts and olives...amazing! For brunch, we did the bottomless mimosas, filet mignon brochette, chicken sandwich & the burger. We enjoyed our entire meal!

I hadn't had Dominos for at least 15+ years so when I moved to Whitehouse, we gave them a try.  I'm pretty sure that a frozen pizza would have tasted better!  Even a generic store brand one would have been better.  I ask for extra sauce but what I didn't know is that when I ask for extra sauce they must have misunderstood me and thought I said extra grease.  I had to use paper towels to soak up all that grease before I could even make an attempt to taste it & there was barely any sauce on it & what little bit there was, had no flavor.  The cheese tasted like it was not even real; the imitation stuff.  The pepperoni was dry & curled up around the edges where they were laying in all that grease I suppose.  I got through 1/2 a piece and the entire thing went in the trash, my husband couldn't even eat it.  I just couldn't do it.  I won't even get into the price! OMG!  It was around $26 for an XL pepperoni pizza, nothing else on it.  I went to the WH pizza shop on 31 and got one loaded with toppings and it was about the same price and it was delicious!  Dominos is horrible & I will never go back, skip this place, save your $$.
Great food and Great service!  Our first time in New Orleans and I can say that the next time we are in town, we will definitely go back!

The pint comes with three flavors of out choosing so we got the white chocolate banana pudding, caramel cone, and toasted coconut. The favorite out of the three was the caramel cone where the bits of the crispy cone added texture. But, the other favors were also delicous.

Food is slightly above average. I had a weird waiter at the bar area that kept asking for me to pay in cash or tip him in cash even before the food has come. Is this the service standard in NoLa or did I get a waiter reject? He just said "I only got one dollar all night and scolded me how I needed to tip in cash."

It takes a long time to build a loyal customer but just one has experience to lose them. 

I was also told that since I'm allergic to shellfish that he can ask the chef to fry the catfish in a different oil but I would need to pay for the meal in cash. What is going on here?

I can't imagine giving this place anything less than 5 stars.  Sometimes you're downtown for an event and it's 11:00 PM; you don't want to go home yet but you don't want to weave your way into a honky-tonk either.  Don't get me wrong, I'm not too "I'm local" to be above enjoying some honky tonk time; we always end up at Robert's, Rippys etc when we have out of town guests.  But when you don't feel like that scene, or you need a cherry on top of a fun evening, enter Mike's Ice cream.  We've been here no less than a dozen times...from the heat of summer when it's packed with out of towners to a winter evening when you just.want.ice.cream.  The folks that work there are speedy yet fun and friendly at the same time...and you just know they must have to deal with some real jerks in the course of a day.  The ice cream is top notch..it's not Jeni's gourmet, but it's not Baskin Robbins either, it's pretty perfect in fact.    They know how to move people in and out too...you can almost always get a seat if you want one.  That place is a gold mine.
Place is so good. Highly recommend. Went with a large group and every loved what they ordered which is rare.

We had a fairly large party of 12 for dinner.  The waiter seemed like he was new or wasn't very good at his job.  We waited about a half hour for the salads and soups to arrive.  After the soup and salads were finished the food was brought to the table....well most of it.  Three people didn't get their food until most of us were done eating.  The food was okay, but most of it was barley warm.  The bill was also a big disaster.  It was like a comedy of errors and the entire time this was going on (2 1/2 hours) the owner/manager didn't come over to the table to apologize or even acknowledge we were there.  I would never return to this restaurant.
Coffee and Pistachio were my favorite! The best part was that you can do 1/2 a scoop of one and half a scoop of another. Their scoops are pretty big for the price!

Ridiculously overpriced for food that borders on terrible. My husband and I both ordered sandwiches (caprese and black and blue) that were completely flavorless and tasted like they were microwaved. I used to come here often under the previous ownership but after this experience we won't be back.

We had so much fun today! We went with several families with little ones from 15 months to 2 years went for the afternoon and had a blast. The playground was crowded with kids (many different ages) so we had to stay close to our daughter as she ran around but in general it went really well. The beers were tasty and we liked the food a lot. The pizza, soft pretzel and wings were great. We'll be back! Love what you did with the space!

Bottom Line:  Very expensive but good food

Like a lot of places in the Funk Zone, this place is kitschy, filled with hipsters from LA and very expensive.

I have to say right off the bat that the food was good - we defiantly enjoyed it.    The thing is, it was so expensive that I'll never be back.  I love riding in new Mercedes but I would never own one as I simply cant justify the cost when I can have something else for 1/4 the price that is essentially the same and its gets me where im going in similar comfort.

We got the Burrata sandwich which was $15.....um, what?  $15 for bread, cheese, bacon - and it was delicious but $15?  Frankly, I resent the normalizing the $15 sandwich.  $10-$12 is already pushing it for some of our local hero sandwich shops and those are almost certainly good for two meals and I'm 6 foot 3.

We also got soup and a pastry.  Our bill with tip came out to more than $30

We also got there almost exactly when they opened and my wife had to fight to keep our seats as I had to go change our daughter diaper.  People - quite rudely actually - kept trying to physically take our seats as they we not occupied by humans but by our things as we were going to come back.  I get the feeling had we all gone to the bathroom at the same time, our things would have just been tossed onto the floor.

Lets not even discuss the parking situation.

Honestly, the LA hipsters can have this place.  It's good but not good enough to justify the cost or the trouble

Great place to grab a bite. Food was great, service was awesome and beer was super cold! Miranda from hogwarts took great care of us. We where super excited to find out they had dart boards and pool tables at this location.  We will be back next year when we come back into town.

We had an amazing experience here.  With covid, and puppies and all that life throws at you, it's nice to get out, drink and forget it all.  Copper vine is that place.  Amazing social distancing and COVID preventative methods, along with an amazing staff (shout out to Jen/Gin/Jin dang it you all know who she is.). She was an amazing host, very attentive and related well to us and even conversed with us, which we loved.

We found this place to be fairly disappointing. Maybe we just ordered the wrong stuff? There were several different breakfast sandwiches on the menu. We were looking for just a quick bit. Simple pastries, donuts etc. The place calls itself a bakery, so I assumed the croissants, pastries, and donuts would be very fresh. This was not the case. I had a ham & cheese croissant, which was ok, but not that fresh, flakey etc. My daughter ordered the "seasonal donut" which was $4.00. It was just an iced cake donut with colored sprinkles. Nothing more than you'd find at a cheap donut place for $1.00 or less. My wife had a blueberry danish. Again, it was OK, but not great. This place says it is a bakery. Am I wrong for assuming the baked goods would be fresh and better than average? If you're going to charge me $4.00 for a donut, it better be the best darn donut I ever ate. Next time we're in town, we'll try somewhere else.

This is my new favorite place for happy hour! Half off all tap wine! By the glass, carafe, or bottle. The atmosphere is wonderful and open. The food is to die for! A MUST order is the mushroom pasta, just wow. Side note, if you're lucky enough to get Chance as a server, makes the experience that much better.

Absolutely not! Walk away from this overpriced, disgusting place! The poor service set the tone for a lack luster lunch service. There are reasons this restaurant was nearly empty. Issues:

-Server brought three dinner rolls for all ten people to share, then dripped balsamic vinegar from the broken container all over the table and menus.
-Kitchen was extremely slow  with over a half hour wait
-Server informed me my meal was not available, just a minute or two before bring the remainder of the meals to the table. One person finished their meal before mine arrived.
-Others noticed their plates of pasta were not hot, just lukewarm
-Spaghetti noodles mixed into a plate of fettuccini
-One of the mussels in my meal was so undercooked the shell had not even opened - SERIOUS HEALTH HAZZARD
-The restroom had a dirty diaper and a religious brochure in the stall; from the horrid smell, it's clear the diaper had been in the bathroom many, many hours. Possibly overnight

There are far too many disappointing facets of this restaurant to consider returning.
Went there for the first time Saturday. Unbelievable!! I even had our waitress give much compliments to the cooks. Food was unbelievable!! Can't wait to go back!

Tuna bar is an awesome addition to our city that already has some awesome sushi spots.  I love the ambiance, the decor and the cozy feel.  Its modern and very cool inside.  The food is outstanding, we ordered EVERYTHING and cant wait to go back so we can order more. They have a bar with a nice drink menu that compliments the sushi perfectly.  So glad to have a new neighborhood sushi bar around the corner and wait to come back!!!

Kyo Hin sushi is awesome! The fish is fresh and generous portions. A wide variety of special rolls. The presentation is gorgeous. I always leave satisfied. Just stick to sushi when you come here - that's what they're best at. The rest of the menu is just ok which is why I can't give 5 stars.

Went in with a very large party.  Paid an entry fee for nothing.  Was not seated and was refused refund after sub-5min in the restaurant.  You'd figure a place would care about potential customers.  This particular location does not, which is unfortunate.  Our party rewarded another restaurant that wanted the business of 20+ people.

The food is kinda flavorless and small portioned, unless you order a bucket of seafood. Even then it's not that great of a portion. We actual got served undercooked fish the last time we went, which coincidentally was the last time we will ever go back. Our server was AWESOME though, but the manager definitely wasn't. She tried to blame him for our food being bad.
Christina is absolutely amazing. I go here all the time, but this was definitely my favorite visit. She is so sweet and on top of it.

OOOO BAP. I love restaurants that only make 1 thing, but they make it right. Bibimbap is one of my favorite things in the world. With that said, you can choose a vegetarian, tofu, chicken, or beef version here. I like mine extra spicy, so I always get extra sauce on the side.

So why not 5 stars?

My wannabe Korean roots tell me that this should be served in a hot stone bowl if I am eating in ( FYI: only 6 seats in this establishment) . I love to here that sizzle of the rice cooking. However, cute old korean men cook it in a hot-stone in the kitchen and reassemble it in an alternative bowl. So, this was a disappointment. However, the flavors are all there.

Sometimes, they also have a beef bone soup for 5 dollars.  Don't forget to get some cinnamon ginger tea too!

Ordered online and the catfish poboy was sooo good! The bread was soft, the fish was still hot and tasted fresh, and it was just bomb all over. The fries were fries, but back to this sandwich. I heard other people complain about the slight abundance of mayo and there is. I just happen to like that. But if you're not a big mayo fan then I'd suggest asking for light mayo. My only regret is not trying the roast beef but unfortunately/fortunately I only have one stomach  :/
Ton'y is an Alton icon, so it probably gains points for that alone. The dinner menu is kind of expensive. We used one of the back rooms for our wedding and the buffet options were pretty good.

Visited this place with my 2 nieces to catch up and buy them lunch since they drove all the way up from Fernley to visit and were excited to check this place out and were pleasantly surprised to not only see how empty it was but also how the decor seemed to be on the "fancier" side for a chain restaurant and we actually felt underdressed. Our waiters name was Alfredo, I believe it was. His demeanor was pretty strange whenever he would come up to the table he would interrupt the conversation, make a strange joke and then before leaving he would take my nieces empty specialty drink glasses and bring refills without asking so throughout the entire meal we assumed that the refills were free. They both ordered the Alfredo with chicken added and I was told they were pretty underwhelmed by the under salted Alfredo and the dry chicken; for $14-17 per plate Its safe to say I expect a proper Alfredo. I ordered their "signature" truffle Mac and cheese and I didn't find it to be good at all; too much truffle oil, not enough salt, pepper or cheese.  When i was given the bill i was unpleasantly surprised to see we were charged for SIX specialty kid drinks for each time our waiter so kindly refilled their glasses without asking or informing that refills were full price or else I would have verbally declined. For 1 appetizer, 3 entrees, 6 specialty kid drinks and a water for myself was just under $95 after tax not including a tip....Woulda spent less if we went to Texas Roadhouse and all got 2lb steaks. Keep your options open when suggesting this place to take your friends or family

This used to be my favorite restaurant for Italian food. Unfortunately though, over the past few years, the price has gone up and the food quality and service has gone down. Way down. 

The last two times I've been there the waiters have been absolutely terrible. The first guy was on speed or something and made it obvious that he was annoyed when we asked for bread and other simple requests. During this same trip we waited there for over an hour for two simple salads. 

During our next visit, it was clear that the waiter was hung over. In fact I think he may have been still drunk from the night before. He even knocked over a couple of glasses at different tables. He would constantly repeat his introduction even though he had already been by to take our order. Finally after 30 minutes our salads and soup came. The soup was ok, but the salad was old and the croutons were so disgusting that my girl friend spit them out. They were beyond stale. Our eggplant Parmesan took over 1 hour and 45 minutes to make. We literally were getting up to walk out when it arrived. To make matters worse, the red sauce was so cold that parts of it were still frozen. The eggplant was disgusting as well, we needed a steak knife to cut it. Then the manager came by as she could tell we weren't happy. Her attitude from the very beginning was very defensive. We explained our frustration with the salad, wait time, staff, and entree. She immediately tried to justify the wait time by saying eggplant takes at least an hour to cook. She then claimed that the croutons were made about an hour ago - clearly a bunch of BS. She concluded with "I'm not supposed to tell you this but our eggplant is very earthy". Whatever that means. I've had eggplant at other fine restaurants and it never takes longer than 30 minutes to cook nor does it take much effort to cut. Bottom line is the manager needs to go and maybe Mac grill can be saved. Otherwise this business will not survive with her at the helm. She simply isn't manager material, has little to no people skills, and really is a disgrace to the reputation of Mac grill.

We used to come quite often. The kids menu has changed.  They don't give the kids ice cream anymore after their meal.They used to have the best honey mustard. They don't have that anymore either. The portions have gotten smaller.  The servers wear jeans now instead of black pants. Service is not as good.  Alfredo is a good server. Hopefully you get him. If not, good luck! Food is good. I recommend the Parmesan crusted sole.

I've been to NOLA before, but wanted to ensure this time I really enjoyed the flavors of this region. So a Po boy was on the list as a must have. Of course there's so many places to choose from, and how the heck do you really know what's really good. Reviews are fine, but it is simply a persons opinion. I saw Mahony's, read the reviews, and then looked through the menu. There's a litany of options, but the liver and slaw caught my eye. So while I enjoy fried chicken liver and have eaten it many times, I was reluctant that they'd do it right. They certainly did not disappoint!! I'm sitting here now at 9 in the morning wanting to go there when they open for another. It was fresh, crispy, and the slaw made all the difference in contrast and moisture - so pleasantly pleased. My wife enjoyed the catfish version as well. We were too full afterwards to try dessert, but the Po boys are certainly worth it.

3.5 stars (3 stars for food, 4 stars for price, service) 

BAP is a no frills traditional Korean food establishment that has been doing takeout this pandemic. The menu is just a few items long and largely consists of different types of bibimbap, all under $10. Ordering was really effortless -- I called ahead with my order for a vegetable and chicken bibimbap and it was ready within 15 minutes. Pickup was also easy and done at a window in the front of the store with a really nice elderly man who I assume is one of the owners. I was pleasantly surprised to find that they gave us free coffee packets which I have since used (I love me some Vietnamese iced coffee). 

The food itself was okay. With the price point, the speed of service, and the no frills menu, I assume the bibimbap is meant to compete with other fast food options, and as a result it should be critiqued as such. Within this category of food, BAP provides a light, healthy, and balanced alternative, which I appreciated. However I think the portion size of the vegetable one was a little small and the flavor slightly bland. You'd do better with spending that extra dollar for additional tofu or meat. Overall, though, it was fine for a $9 bibimbap if you're looking for it. If I lived in the area I could see myself going back if I needed a quick healthy meal and wanted to support a small local business.

I came to Mahony's with my friends for Brunch one Saints Sunday. When we got there it was a little packed but it was to be expected because it was brunch time on Magazine and it was gameday. It didn't take us long to be seated. When we got there we walked in and took out seats. Our waiter was really cool. Beware super friendly and nice. I ordered a roast beef poboy. Yeah, interesting choice for brunch. But i didn't mind. I really wanted something hearty and it was a poboy spot so why not. I must say, the food was really delicious. I loved every bite of it. Not to mention, we had bottomless mimosas. That's literally one of my favorite things about brunch to be honest.
Gumbeaux did not have any flavor. There was more rice than gumbeaux in my bowl. My salad was delicious.

Been here a few times now. Every single experience has been wonderful!

The food and service has been exceptional each time. This last visit we enjoyed live Italian style opera singing. It was very unexpected and fun, definitely not something you typically see at a restaurant chain. 

Every time we've come we couldn't leave less than a 20% tip, these waiters and waitresses are not just nice they are truly genuine. They aren't over the top, with a cheesy "hello and how may I help you's" only to scurry from the table as quickly as possible. They genuinely smile and make conversation, have impeccable timing and attentiveness even on a busy Friday night, and know how to make recommendations from the menu. Really wish we could note all their names individually to give them props. 

The food is fully flavorful, not just salty. The bread is warm a loaded with rosemary flavor, I always request balsamic with my dipping Olive oil. Each dish has a unique flavor profile not just your typical Italian style chain where the only options are salty cheesy or salty tomato. People have complained about portion size/cost ratio on other reviews but honestly, I have never left here anything less than STUFFED with left overs for lunch the next day. We typically spend $55-$60 on two specialty drinks, two appetizers, and two entrees (my choice usually being a seafood/lobster dish) at dinner, not shabby at all when you consider the customer service, atmosphere, quality, AND quantity at that price. 

If you suffered a bad experience here, I am strongly advising you give it a second/third shot and even mention your last experience to your waiter when you come in, I'm positive a place like this will make it up to you. This is probably my favorite restaurant of the moment. Totally worth the five star review I'm giving it.

While visiting in Nola my husband and I were in need of a good ole boy boy! I checked out the menu and was like "yep" we gotta go there!

The appetizers looked so good we never made it to the po boy lol. We ordered fried pickles, buffalo oysters and etouffee fries! They were all delicious. We both ordered drinks and the fish house punch is the bomb!!!

Jaz was our server and she was super friendly and amazing. I wish most servers had her personality. We would definitely return!!! The atmosphere is super welcoming and chill.
Affordable, delicious AND the best service we received on our week long stay in New Orleans. Kayla was friendly, polite and kind! Manager walked around to make sure everything was great.

Nothing overly executed well on an ENORMOUS menu, which is always a red flag for not fresh...using canned mushrooms on your pizza is a HUGE no no in my book. This place seems to be a fading alton staple, but they have cheap drinks, lots of choices, but could be done a lot better, you are better off at bossa nova down the street, that place wont make you poop in your pants

This place was recommended by a foodie blogger. Didn't think much of it before until I tried it. Their house made buttermilk biscuit is so good and salty. The bacon is really good on it as well as the fried egg. I came here twice on my 2 day trip in Santa Barbra. I couldn't imagine having a different lunch besides the great buttermilk biscuit that I won't be able to have until my next trip. Also the red Pap dish is really great. My friend ordered this dish and the pastries are perfectly crispy. Completely inspired me to try to make them at home. Also, everything was perfectly salted, highly appreciated that. I will definitely be back for more. Until then, I'll currently fantasize about the oatmeal raisin cookie I bought to take home. Can't wait to get out of work and have some

Went back on a Tuesday and were able to get a table for 8 easily. We want Barone to be our neighborhood spot, but they're making it hard to do so. My friend ordered the mussels which were delicious, but when she asked for bread they told her they only give out bread for sandwiches. Bread. Sarcones is right across the street. 
We will come back because we understand that it's new and they may be working out the kinks still. Fingers crossed.
Eh use to be good wish they hadn't changed but what can you do? I'll give them some time and see if they change back

Very good ice cream.  Unfortunately for me I discovered my stomach is unable to handle ice cream any more...I have developed a little bit of lactose intolerance...darn.

Still recommend a visit for some deliciousness.

Stopped by around 11 on the other night. The man who I assume was the owner was so arrogant I felt a bit threatened by his glare. Everyone who I was with felt the same. Myself 2 girls and a guy all dress approiate completely sober. To say the least the pizza was so bad we threw it in the trash and walked next door to the other pizza place I think Mikes.
Gia the Trainee was off the charts amazing. One of the kindest people I've met in a while! Will definitely be returning to the business thanks to her awesome attitude!

The food here was amazing and the restaurant is super cute inside and outside. Our sever Justin is what really made our experience enjoyable. He gave us many recommendations on the food and beverages. We are also here on vacation and he also gave us recommendations on things to do for the rest of our time here. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone and will be back before we leave.

I have been here twice in as many years and felt I got a fairly decent meal here both times.  I came close to having their pizza but they were closed on Monday so that might have pushed this to four stars.

I have had pasta on both visits and this weekend I even ordered it slightly different from the way they listed it and they accommodated me to a T.    Their meatballs were also very good.  I feel the salad was kindof tired and uninspired, that could definitely be improved but my dressing was on the side just like I requested.  

Our waiter was very patient with my 90 year old father. that meant a lot.  I would not make a special trip here but will definitely come again next time I am in Alton.  And I will try that pizza!

My husband and I plus our 1 year old son rarely get out so when we do it's a big deal! We came here based on the great reviews but we were both very disappointed. Perhaps we just ordered the wrong food? Either way, it was extremely overpriced and the food was bland and actually bad tasting. Will not be returning!

Not much to say about this spot except that it has become a staple of downtown Nashville. I'm embarrassed to say that this was my first visit to the new location since they moved off Broadway. The inside was nice and blasting A/C which we appreciated after strolling downtown in the 90 degree heat. I went with a waffle cone and a single scoop of coffee ice cream, which totally hit the spot. This is one of my favorite spots in town to grab a sweet treat

I want to start out by saying the waiter was very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately my fiancee and I went to split a chicken parm and the meat in the middle was completely raw. Which is terrible thing to discover and could potential got us sick if we had not cut our food in half to share. The staff was very helpful and nice about it. Gave us percentage off our meal.  But it really did ruin our meal. My two friends food was fine. Poboy wasnt average. And the seafood fries were good. The wait wasn't long either. I'm not sure if I'd return given the experience there. Maybe for drinks but a bit weary about the quality of cooks there.

One of the better places in Philadelphia Chinatown for rolls and egg tarts (multiple layer crust here!).

Service is generally faster if you can speak in Cantonese, though... I tried to use Mandarin and it's still faster than English.

Teas here are okay, although probably better elsewhere.

Limited baked good selection, but they do everything almost equally as well, and they're very consistent about it.

This was the best overall dining experience I've had in Nashville in years. The staff was kind from when we were greeted at the door, to when our awesome waiter walked us through the menus and took great care of us. The vibe inside is modern and stylish, the food was delicious, they have tons of sake options, and the prices were decent! Two Ten Jack is owned by the same people, and both restaurants know what's up!

I always enjoy going to Twin Peaks, and this is a nice one. There were lots of televisions and my wife joined me this time (so I didn't feel bad). 

My spicy chicken was awesome, and I felt like it was kind of healthy. The scenic views were nice, but we were actually there to watch football. Our server was friendly and the food came fast. She made the dessert with . I'll go back.

Said To be a less well known part of the menu, Tuesday night sushi. And not your typical rice filled sushi with mayo, fried pieces and saucy rolls. Chef creates the roll based upon the local fish ordered and his taste that particular day. Probably not for everyone to blindly order sushi but is worth the little adventure and surprise. 
Our table consisted of 3 rolls, that we believed to all be slightly different but did not stop to ask. Diving into fresh fish, asparagus, seaweed and multiple other smaller flavors paired excellently. 
The room is on the darker side so being able to see the sushi was a challenge to distinguish the rolls from each other. The chef spent time outside the kitchen interacting with various friends at the bar and dining room. 
Deserts are all sourced locally including a few made in the kitchen. Carrot cake was soft, cool icing and perfect with chopped nuts on the back. Yum! 
Great location just off the main strip of Gulf Blvd inside a small shopping strip but still easily accessible from the beach or mainland.

Meh. I came here based on the many good reviews, but I was pretty disappointed. I sampled a few flavors - they tasted average, nothing really stood out to me - so I ended up ordering a scoop of the blackberry cornbread, since that was at least a unique flavor. The blackberry part of it was quite tasty, but the cornbread was very dry, and I wished the cornbread bits weren't there at all.
One way you can tell that the flavors are artificial - look at the color of the pistachio ice cream. Mike's was a bright green. Real, unadulterated pistachio ice cream is much more of a dull green, almost brown color. I guess I should have just left when I saw that.
The space itself is also quite depressing. Maybe it's the awkwardly large tables, or lack of decor. But it wasn't a relaxing, or energizing, or fun place to sit while eating ice cream.

Delicious ice cream! Ordered the coffee fudge and chocolate chip cookie dough in a cup! The servers however weren't very friendly and gave us chocolate chip instead of chocolate chip cookie dough. It was still tasty though! Also good seating and music selection!

Thats was Thursday night after hurricane in New Orleans. Place was packed, so it caused a little waiting time on everything. Friendly hostess helped me to find a spot inside, because outside was pretty chill. I tried few items there, and I can't say that it was something special. But I really like exterior and interior. Place looks so cool to me. I really enjoyed being there.

Look everyone comes to Nashville for the BBQ and Hot Chicken however, after a few days of that your mouth needs a different flavor.  We had a great meal at the Green Pheasant.  Authentic and modern, the dishes were all hits except the chicken gyoza.  Didnt love those.  Nice drinks and great asian flavors

First day back in NOLA in a while and what better start than a fried oyster Po-Boy. I would never eat this any other place than NOLA. I tried Mahoney based on yelp, and I had the 6 inch dressed with fries. It was perfect. Now I have to eat healthy the rest of the trip but it was so worth it.

My family stopped in for some ice cream while we were downtown. The shop itself is small considering the amount of customers that come in and out. Despite the smallness of the store, the service was fast. They had plenty of servers behind the counter and the line moved quickly- almost too quickly to decide on which of the almost 45 flavors to chose from- but that's not a serious complaint. 
The prices for the ice cream is pretty reasonable all things considered. As of 7/27/14 it was $4.20 for a double scoop on a cake cone or dish, with waffle cones and sugar cones of course costing extra. The ice cream itself was delicious, although nothing incredibly groundbreaking or special. It's really soft and drips all over the place, so be sure to grab a few extra napkins. Long story short, good ice cream, reasonable price, cool atmosphere, definitely worth a try! 

Tip: don't buy the drinks out of the cooler! $2.50 for a bottled water?? Outrageous! Go the the karaoke bar across and down the street about half a block that has an outward facing shop where you can purchase cold drinks and bottled water for $1.

Meh. The food is alright - service is awful. The associates who work here act like they do you a favor waiting on you. They don't listen to orders - ordered a latte HOT and came iced down. OK. Just poor attitude in my opinion. It's a shame could be a step above McDonalds if they put any effort into it. Gave it three tries - I'm out. Not on my list next time in Nashville.

Amazing, inventive cuisine. The salmon is mind blowing, literally best salmon I've ever had. Another of my favorites is the crab noodles. Super comforting in this cold weather (but I'm sure I'll eat it when it's sweltering out too)! The American waygu is amazing- almost melt in your mouth. The sake on tap is nicely rice-y and feels like it has the tiniest effervescence. And then for dessert, don't miss out on the strawberry chocolate chip mochi if they have it!
Food took forever soup was cold. Manager was touching people's food bare handed. Food receipts on top of salad while waiting to be served. Waited forever for food that was cold

Great place with tons of potential but ultimately they need a lot of work. Food was ok, service was poor, drinks were weak, and they do not honor there happy hour on saints Monday game days. This should have been explained when I booked my reservation being happy hour was the reason we were dining here.

Wonderful food and a great chef and owner.

I eat here several times a week.

You cannot go wrong with the beff bowl.

This place is outstanding. Family owned. 
We ordered on a Thursday afternoon and it was quick and fresh. The Italian sub had a generous portion of meat and ingredients such as lettuce, onion, tomato, banana peppers, and housemade oil and vinegar. The bread is also made fresh daily in house. 
We also ordered the manicotti which included homemade sauce. They also have pizza by the slice daily.
This place is a must for anyone in the Largo area.

Soooo could have given 4 stars to this adorable place but the militant 11:00 am cut off of breakfast is just too, well, militant. Totally understand a kitchens need to change over but perhaps offer the simple granola with yogurt or create a breakfast "flavored" baguette to help out the late morning arrivals?? Maybe a fruit and yogurt parfait in the cold case??? Even on weekends if you spent the night out in the funk zone and return the next day in hopes of revitalizing only to be faced with a salad or sandwich at 11:02 am? Honestly it was 11:02. I would have rushed over had I known that s BAKERY would stop serving brekkie at 11:00. Who knew? Well I guess I do now. 
Suggestions to HSB.... help with the transition! I stood at the counter watching what I wanted to order be handed to the person who ordered 3 minutes earlier than me. OUCH! 
Even granola on yogurt would have earned you an extra star from this reviewer. A 3 minute exception to your hard an fast rule would have earned you 2 more stars despite the food only being a 4. Your staff is lovely. They must cringe when the clock strikes 11:00 knowing they can't bend to any pleading a customer might attempt. 
Don't fight the change .... give your customers a little help with the transition and next time we are here perhaps I can give you a star for improvement. 
Thanks for the 11:02 toast n biscuit. Not bad but not enough

Industrial atmosphere... Cody and very nice. Food... I would love to say it was great but... not quite there yet. We had 3 different orders and all came " just " as a thick slice of bread topped with our selection (I had Huevos Rancheros, the others had avocado and cinnamon). Would go back to give a chance to something different than the thick bread option...

This place is incredible. The beers are excellent. The menu is huge, which to me, is a good thing. I liked that it was family friendly but not to the point of it being obnoxious. 10/10 would reccomend anyone to go there.

During the Nashville summers the heat can get pretty unbearable and I was looking for places to cool off. Mike's ice cream is right off Broadway so there is a good chance it will be busy when you go in. 

I ordered the single Tennessee fudge ($3.75) on a chocolate chip cookie cone ($1.50). There were so many huge chunks of the fudge! I loved eating the chunks in one bite. I wasn't a huge fan of the cookie cone because it was really crunchy and hard to bite. I can understand why because it has to hold the ice cream up but I was worried I was going to break my teeth. It did taste like chocolate chip though.

My ice cream was melting so I went to town on my ice cream after I took my pictures. It was pretty good ice cream.
My husband and I tried their double cheeseburger and chips. It was an amazing burger. The hubby says a burger that he will never forget. The place is clean and atmosphere so warm and inviting.

Another wonderful meal at The Pearl. Short ribs were unbelievable and Kelly was terrific as our waitress. Second time during the vacation we've eaten at the Pearl. If we're back in this area again, we'll return

This was by far the worst dinner we have had in a long time. The portion of Lasagna was not worth the price, just a small piece on a plate with nothing else with it...no salad, had to ask for a slice of bread. The bread tasted like old stale over seasoned shoe leather. The bread came with a small plate of seasoned oil...awful...not olive oil! It was rancid I'm sure of that! Also ordered a bowl to tomato soup. I had one spoonful as well as my husband. Both of us said no way! I told the waiter we can't eat this and sent it back. It looked and tasted like you opened a jar of Spaghetti sauce and poured it in a soup bowl. Just awful! My husband managed to eat the Lasagna. I drank my soda, which was all I had for dinner. I can't even tell you how filthy the restrooms were, especially since everything is to be sanitized these days. The floor under our table was sticky, hadn't been washed after a soda that had been spilled who knows when????  We would  never go back even if it was free.

I'm about giving establishments a second chance so that's what I did recently.  Overpriced mistake.  Rubbery eggplant parmigiana, garbage spaghetti and if you want a salad, oh that's extra.  Save your time and money and go elsewhere.  I just can't figure out how this place is still in business with the garbage they put out.  I hate to be negative but I've tasted better frozen "Italian" food than the pathetic plates this place puts out!!

Twin Peaks in located in Castleton right by I-69 on 82nd Street. Parking is free with a large parking lot in front of the restaurant. 

Everything appeared handicapped accessible from the parking lot, entrance, restaurant, restrooms and the firepit on the patio.

We were seated immediately on the patio as requested at a tall-top table. The view was the parking lot but it was still nice to sit outdoors. We were just a few feet from the community fire pit where several folks were hanging out having a few beers.

Twin Peaks has daily drink specials from drafts to shots with $5 Happy Hour Bites and Drinks. They serve 29 degree beers if you enjoy ice cold beers. Many drink specials so check out the online menu. The restaurant is a great location for a meal, watch a game whether football, basketball or a fight but especially the upcoming Olympics. TV's are located everywhere and there is a pool table, a man cave and games.

The menu offers all your typical Pub food plus more. Several types of Pub Fries are available (recommend Hickory Smoke Pulled Pork or Brisket Chili), Wings, Fried Pickles plus more. A lunch menu is offered Monday -  Friday from 11:00 - 3:00pm. Burgers, tacos, ribs, salmon, pot roast, chicken are also on the menu.

Our food was good, the server brought our appetizers well before our dinner and she checked on us several times. We had a great time on the patio and will return.

Got the chicken Bibimbap and it was delicious. Fresh veggies, nice sauce, perfectly fried egg. Was large enough that I was quite full by the time I was done and very tasty. It was also a very clean restaurant!

Me and my boyfriend stopped in here on a random stroll through New Orleans on our way to Bourbon Street. We ordered the buffalo fried shrimp, the shrimp and grits and the fried oyster po-boy. The shrimp and grits were our favorite, absolutely delicious! The broth was savory, the bacon salty, the tomato with a bite of acidity and the corn added a nice crunch. I can't stress enough how much we enjoyed it. 

The buffalo fried shrimp had great flavor as well and didn't have too much heat which was wonderful since I can't handle too much spice.

We also ordered a couple of drinks and they poured on the heavy side which was pleasantly surprising. To top it all off, their customer service was superb! "Z" was a wonderful server who was attentive and gave us some good local suggestions. The manager also came by our table and exchanged some friendly conversation. 

Highly recommend!

Well upon my visit to Nashville while walking on Broadway this place caught my attention. It was a little hole in the wall ice cream shop with a long line to get ice cream.

Being not a big ice cream eater decided what the heck let's give it a try as everyone said it was the best in Nashville. 

The line was long and the place was not that big but let me tell you no one cared. The other thing was that the temperature was about 40 degrees and people were still lining up and eating ice cream.

They had a huge selection of home made ice creams and like all other ice cream shops they would let you try if you so please. I tried the vanilla chocolate chip as well as the roasted coconut, let me tell you I am from the Caribbean and coconut ice cream is always popular, I never thought that I would have to go to Nashville to have the best coconut ice cream ever.

I had asked for one scoop because I did not want much, their one scoop is very generous I must say. The prices were not bad as well, for one scoop was about $4.00 or less which was worth it.

The staff was very friendly and was very helpful, I would definitely recommend this place to any visitor who wants to try ice cream in Nashville.

This use to be my goto bakery for coconut buns. Then I became a freak about my sugar intake and I stopped getting most baked goods.

I remember Linda N.'s review about them and ventured there during my lunch break. I didn't want a drink but saw they had a sign for custard buns, my childhood favorite!!!  I go in and look for their steam machine thing... But nothing is in it. I ask for the bun, and they said it was frozen. I assume for take home orders. Womp Womp!!  

I felt weird leaving without buying something so I got the egg custard. I'm glad I did, it was pretty bomb. Well done in my opinion. Can't beat price, 80 cents. I'll try the hk tea next time... Didn't realize they sold it in ice lol.. Didn't want hot since it was hot outside.

I ordered so many cake from here for our family's events.
They all came out good. Easy to communicate with the owner cuz her English is pro. Price is reasonable.

Absolutely fabulous food the brussels sprouts were scrump-delicious the green salad was fantastic with candied pecans  and the margarita pizza was wonderful. Do not under estimate the serving size. I  order way-more than I needed to eat but  plan on eating every single bite.  Definitely worth a try.  I will be back.
The Ice cream was regular icecream, the service was great though. It seems like I pretty popular spot though. They serve ice-cream and coffee!

Made mistake of going to restroom first.  It stunk like a sewer.  Realy bad. Yuk! I have to say the restroom looked great, like newly remodeled.  My friend went in after eating.  Same response from her. Had to stay and eat because others were hungry.  Never again, even though grub was good.

Awesome unique and tasty food, beautifully presented. Crab noodles, beef dish, and chicken gyoza and ginger creams brûlée were excellent. Brocollini was a bit too salty. Choc cake tempura cake was ok.

Such a fan of this place! I've been twice now, the most recent being with a group of friends for happy hour, and both experiences were amazing. Happy hour starts at 4 and offers half of the carafes of wine. In addition to ordering a few different wines, we also shared several small plates including the duck fat fries, olives, and vegetable flatbread. Everything was delicious, reasonably sized for a medium group, and a good complement to the wines we ordered. 

While the food and wine (on tap!) is definitely worth a trip, their outdoor patio is PHENOMENAL. The live plants and simple, but rustic seating makes an intimate "getaway" from the hustle and bustle of the CBD/downtown area. The crowd is professional, sophisticated, and relaxed. Definitely worth a visit!
Awesome food, great service! The tuna stack  amazing, also exceptional poutine and the Ybor egg roll.

I ordered food through Uber eats and it was inedible. The salt content was soooo high, we literally could not eat the food. $60 later and there was no response from the restaurant. Poor customer service and crappy food. It used to be amazing. I guess they've joined the others in microwaving because this was not fresh at all. The Bolognese had no sauce and the big tortellinis were filled with salt like the topping. They've definitely gone downhill, and the fact that they wouldn't credit anything? Unacceptable. I was starving but would not touch it. So I paid for crappy food I couldn't eat but I will NEVER do that again.
Excellent food, phenomenal drinks, superb service, delightful atmosphere.  We had Wonderlust cocktail and margarita pizza with crab deviled eggs and tuna salad all was delicious!

Enter through the courtyard on the corner of Poydras and O'Keefe. Go through the first door on the left to find host stand inside. Had the happy hour tuna tartare w/caviar and bacon wrapped dates. Both were good. 5 stars for service and gorgeous plant covered courtyard. Hostess was welcoming and my server Cemile was a sweetheart. Bonus: They have easy touch-less QR code pay option.

Presentation of the Place: The Bathrooms are nice. It reminds you of  an overpriced hotel that you can feel fancy in while taking a dump. The inside of the place reminds me of an amalgamation of the sets of Cheers, Sex in the City, and some French Noir.

The Food: 

Starter:

Jumbo Lump Crab Deviled Eggs

So, this is the first of many dishes were the common complaint is the lack of salt in the food. From the egg, filling, and crab itself, everything was void of salt or seasoning except for what was a little paprika. The textures are boring and 1 dimensional. For 8 dollars, you are getting 3 deviled eggs at the lowest effort of innovation and care. It is something with less flavor and passion than the ones you are partaking in during Thanksgiving at your grandmas.

Brussels Sprouts with Garlic Aioli and Grated Parmesan.

The Brussels sprouts are cooked exceptional well, which is rare. This is ruined, by the lack of salt and seasoning again. I assume this is due to the amount of Parmesan shaved on top of the dish. This gives the dish an overwhelming umami flavor, and it forces you to reach for the garlic aioli to counter it. After about 10 bites, you begin to realize how white you are because you are essentially eating cheese and mayo. 


Entrees:

Ratatouille with filet

No salt on the filet on top. No salt in the dish itself. What is on the Filet is a lot of balsamic vinegar, which is overpowering. The tomato paste hasn't been stewed long enough, so the dish is really acidic especially with the amount of balsamic vinegar being used.  

Quail and Boudin

This dish is weird. If you ever had a fever dream and was wondering man I wish I could eat that, this is what it taste like. The portion of boudin and quail you get is actual small for the price. Guess what the quail doesn't have on it? The fry on the quail isn't good and the breading breaks offs. The chicken gumbo taste so strange like they almost put soy sauce in it and also has notes of sour. The boudin is really good and is the oasis in this odd dish. 


Drinks:

1 Bottle of the Smith and Hook. Your standard Cabernet nothing flashy.
 
Service: 

I usually don't critique service. I understand that we all take breaks at work, but man no water refills, the restaurant isn't busy, and people from the pass are having to bring our food. This is happening while you and your bartender friend are talking the entire time. Not a good look hombre.  

Verdict: A Salty No

If you want to have a glass of wine with the girls or boys, while you look out at Poydras St. I guess this is the place for you. In my opinion, there are far better options location and culinary wise for you to go to.
Fantastic dining experience.  Knowledgeable staff helped us make menu choices.  Everything we had was outstanding.  We need to come back so we can try more.  Great atmosphere.  Highly recommend

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. TLDR; this place has steep prices for the drinks and sushi so if that's a problem, go elsewhere. There is a happy hour, but we went for dinner. 

Super nice trendy decor. My date made a reservation and we're were seated at a nice two person booth by the sushi bar. 

Drinks are steep. Like $10-15 a drink. But the drinks were strong and super creative. Since I was on a date I didn't take pics, but they were super pretty. We got the lychee (vodka, lychee, lemongrass, and sake) and the winstons heat (gin, wasabi, lemon and cucumber). Both were super refreshing. 

For the appetizers we got the creamy rock shrimp and the brussel sprouts. The shrimp portion was small but these two were probably my favorite of the night. We ended up getting a regular tuna roll along with king salmon, bluefin, and yellowtail sashimi. 

By the end I was pleasantly full and buzzed haha. A great end. Anyway, for two people, we hit the $130s range. Expect to pay that much for dinner with drinks.

Excellent spot! Definitely get the menu run down!! 

We tried a few small plates!
karaage (fried chicken- small plate- so yummy!)
sui gyoza (pheasant dumplings- when in Rome)

spicy crab noodles- spicy and super delicious! 

kaisendon was my main dish! It was very tasty but needed a balance with some crunch. 

Overall great experience- SUPER friendly staff and not a big wait time in food. Definitely check it out if you are in the area!!

This was our first time at Twin Peaks. We were visiting from Chicago and we've heard a lot about this restaurant. Don't be scared away by the parking lot...they have plenty of seating even if the parking lot appears to be full. We were greeted by a group of excited girls at the door. They were able to seat us right away. We wanted to watch a football game that was not the colts. The manager came over right away and asked which tv would be best for our table. 

We ordered an appetizer, sandwiches, and burgers. The food is reasonably priced and comes in large portions. The bloody Mary's are awesome!!...but the price is a little high at $8.75. 

They have a great patio with a ton of TVs. This will be great place to hang out in the summer. The garage doors open up to the restaurant. 

The service was ok but not the best. We would go back for the drinks and to watch a game. Overall...good restaurant with a great view!

Fail. Went in for my girls birthday.  I've never been before.  Service was ok I guess lots of going back and forth for food. My place setting had old food stuck on it and when I got my salad it came with the wrong dressing I asked for balsamic I'm pretty sure it was rasberry or something definitely not balsamic.
