During this whole exchange, Tyler and I looked on uncomfortably. While M was off terrorizing this family over some meat slices, I coached him through my meatball marinara. He did a truly stellar job - maybe make him shift lead as his customer service skills were fine.

Brentwood I expect better from you. Looking at other Yelp reviews I sense a theme of an employee with a bad attitude. I have no interest in bringing business to owners who choose to look the other way with this beyond poor display of customer service. Needless to say I won't be coming back to this location. I only like drama when it's being shown on a rerun episode of Vampire Diaries.

The whole ordeal still has me gaping like Patrick Star. Tonight Tyler not only learned how to make a meatball marinara. He was also taught how not to treat a customer.

Found this cute wine tap bar while visiting New Orleans last month.  This is my second time here and I love it even more than the first time.  

Drinks to order:  Cucumber Gimlet and the Sangria Roséé is one to die for.  

Venue is modern but still has that New Orleans feel.  Great location and amazing patio.  5 stars!

Relaxing Ambiance. Jazzy Aesthetic. & Wine On Tap... What else does a girl need! I really wanted to get dolled up and enjoy a nice vibe. I had the opportunity to have dinner here and it lived up to all of my expectations. I booked a reservation through OpenTable. Upon arrival, our table was ready as soon as we walked in!
Our server Chris was phenomenal. Since this was our first time, he took the time to thoroughly explain the menu offerings. Also, he had great wine recommendations and allowed me to sample them but fully committing. 
For my entree, I tried the new cornflake chicken sandwich and it was delightful! I highly recommend this place for brunch with friends or date night with bae!

We are so happy we found Mike's Ice Cream. It is so fresh and delicious--no ice crystals in any of the flavors. We tried Chocolate Peanut Butter, Tennessee Fudge, and Mint Chocolate Chip. I was hesitant to try vanilla with fudge throughout--TN Fudge. I'm not a fan of fudge marble. The TN Fudge was amazing. What they didn't tell me was the fudge was FUDGE like you could buy at a candy store spread throughout the vanilla ice cream. Will go back when I'm hungry for amazing ice cream.

We had a wonderful meal here with attentive service. The food was all really flavorful--my favorites were the spicy crab noodles and the broccolini. A great place to come and share plates with everyone. We will absolutely come back.
Absolute delight from the atmosphere to the divine food. Very welcoming of dogs and very good service.

Joe's Pizza provides late night food when you need it most.  Located on N Dale Mabry, they cater to the crowd partaking in the strip clubs, but with drive though pizza it definitely beats the usual fast food late night options.

Joe's pizza is NY style, so expect a slice you can pick up and fold, with a nice crunch to the crust.

Shrimp po-boys are one of my must have meals when in New Orleans. If heard some good things about Mahoney's and their location in the Quarter made them an easy choice for a weekday lunch.

I decided on their onion rings (more like straws) and a Coke to complete the meal. Mahoney's does a light, crisp batter on their plentiful portion of shrimp. Gorgeous tomatoes and fresh lettuce were an excellent addition to the sandwich. I love pickles on my Po-boys as they bring a terrific crunch and acidity. The local bread was crunchy perfection but cut a bit oversized. If they created a trough in the bread, it would have made life a tad easier keeping the fillings inside.

I was very happy with my po-boy, but the onion straws (rings) were on greasy side and arrived at the table tepid. I was too hungry to deal with sending them back, but only ate a quarter of them. Had they been hot, and drained some, the side would've been excellent. My server was friendly and attentive. My meal came out quickly as did the drink refills. 

This location has free parking, according to my server, which makes it convenient when driving in the Quarter.

On our way to SLO we were starving so of course I went on Yelp to find our first stop on our adventure. So glad that we stopped here! Walked in and found a nice open space with plenty of pastry options to please anyone, plus a few breakfast options. Well, let me tell you, nothing here disappointed. The person taking our order was patient and helpful and the blueberry lemon scone and fresh squeezed OJ was the perfect beginning. Then we got our breakfast sandwiches and boy oh boy were they top notch! The biscuits were so fresh and the flavors blended perfectly together. If you get the chance stop by and grab a pastry to go and/or have a breakfast sandwich that is filing, but doesn't make you feel stuffed!

This is a gem of an ice cream shop/cafe, their menu is varied and balanced. Their ice cream is fresh n creamy! They carry some of the best flavor combinations for ice cream I've seen yet! Their milk shakes are divine! During winter they have traditional hot chocolate and offer exotic variants: Hawaiian coconut HC and Swiss white chocolate HC amongst some. The cafe offers fresh coffee and espresso beverages. This is the perfect place to top off the evening for a sweet conclusion.

Fine for what it is. A chain. Had very limited time, so chose this because we were already in the parking lot. Seated immediately. Kind and engaged waitress, Jennifer. Bread warm, a little overcooked, but rosemary flavor was nice.  Took longer than expected for a lunch order which was too bad. Thank goodness for the bread. Half order of butternut squash pasta with quite good if too rich. The calzone substitute was something I will not order again, not offensive though. My partner's soup and salad were definitely adequate. And bottomless.  No IPA. Overall a decent mass market American restaurant experience. Under $30

It had only been a few weeks since my last visit here, but I had the night to myself and decided I felt like traveling to Tuna Bar for dinner.  I'll admit to being a creature of habit, so no one that knows me would be surprised that tonight, absent the prodding of my wife or friends, I ordered items that I had before.  

I started with Grandmom's Wonton Soup because I needed something soothing.  I believe I tasted a very slight hint of vinegar in the broth.  I'm not exactly sure what it is, but whatever it is, it provides a modern flare to the broth, to go along with the delicate and very tasty deconstructed wontons.  The dough used for the wontons is extremely light, and the sausage is more significant with great flavor.  My second course, the Wok Kampachi Ceviche, was not only as delicious as before, but this time the kampachi was a more generous serving than my earlier experience.  

Rather than a number of smaller dishes, tonight for my third course, I decided to order a larger entree.  The Salmon Shokiyaki proved to be just the right choice.  I like my cooked salmon to have a warm pink center, yet a slight crispness on the outside.  This dish was perfectly done with a warm pink center, slightly crisp, along with a glaze on it that I think may have been miso based.  I'm not sure about the glaze, but it doesn't matter because I'd order it again anyway.  

Between the food and a sampling of a few sake's, it was a great way to spend my free time.  At this restaurant, the only other thing I really wished they served might be an assortment of robatayaki.  Are you listening Ken?

Forget about the ambience.  If you are looking for authentic mexican tacos, menudo and quesadillas, this is the place to go.  If your one who is not too picky about restaurant appearances this is the place to go in the Wilmington, DE area.

They have a nice selection of soft tacos from bistek, lengua, al pastor, tripa and my favorite... chorizo!

Those of you who are like Tex-Mex stuff may want to go to a chain resto, this is the real thing.

The people who run the place do not speak English that well.  Nevertheless, when you see that there are a lot of hispanics frequenting the joint, you know the food must be authentic and good.

They have very high quality homemade ice cream with tons of flavors. I really liked the blueberry cornbread flavor. The shop is near Broadway so you can get ice cream before bar hopping, super convenient location!

I am baffled to read all the 5 star reviews, if I could I wouldn't even give it a 1 start. This place is very nice inside and reading the reviews I expected a good meal. 
First, we ordered Gyoza for appetizer and it was awful. It was like eating a day old gooey pocket of fish. I told the waitress I was in the mood for ramen and she recommend the "most traditional" which was the shio wontonmen. I can't even describe how tasteless this ramen was, it had no flavor at all. It was cold noodles in a watered down wonton soup. I didn't finish either one, got our checks and left. 
The host gave us a "parking validation" that took off .54 cents from the price of the parking. 
Will I go back?
No thanks.

While taking a morning bike ride along the beach and into town we stumbled on this super chill spot. Was great for a lazy breakfasting morning with my best girl friend and enjoy the slow morning start with good coffee and excellent food.
Delish!!! Worth every calorie!! Can't wait to go back. We had multiple Items and the coffee was great.

Nice change watching a live hockey game and enjoying some nachos in the restaurant upstairs at the hockey rink.  The service was good and the nachos were excellent my husband had a flight of beer - IPAs and he enjoyed them. The atmosphere is good for families.

Amazing white chocolate banana pudding ice cream!!   Will go back just for that before our trip is over.  Tried the blackberry cornbread and that was also good.  Kids has a great time taking pics with the displays in front as well!
The Brussels sprout sautéed perfectly, with the surprised sweet and salty twist. The amount of the vinegar fulfilled the taste buds, will definitely recommends.

The only thing that attracted us to this establishment were the two Ford GTs they had on display. The man who checked us in seemed annoyed we asked to sit by them. The waitress told us we caught her on a bad night because she forgot the side of ranch I asked for, the oysters we ordered sat out on the bar for a good 30-40 minutes before she brought them over. At which point, we didn't want them any more since our appetizer and entrees had already come out. The fried pickles were good but nothing noteworthy, same with the po boys. (Alligator sausage and angus pot roast beef.)

I literally came here twice in one week because I wanted to try more things on the menu. Everything is DELICIOUS. My personal favorites are the Walu and the Tuna appetizer. Expect to spend some money on this food but it will be worth it!

Mike's is a nice old time looking spot in the middle of busy Broadway Avenue.  There isn't a lot of room inside to sit and eat, and on a hot day you will want to squeeze in there to finish your soda or ice cream.  

A bit of a smaller draw is the Java bar that is also inside.  Small soda stands and ice cream joints like this have a real hard time surviving in today's high-rent world, so supporting them makes you feel as good as the feeling in your belly when you are done eating there.

No complaints! We stopped in at 4pm. Early bird just started but we chose to have appetizers  and wine. We had the Tuna Martini (saucy), St Jacques (cooked to perfection) and Creme Bullee (yummy)! Great server from New Orleans, Rod! He was very professional and kind. Ty Rod!

Seated on the back patio, we had heaters to warm us up on a cold winter night... I loved it! 

Anyways, drinks: beer selection is weak, but I went into this understanding this is a winepub so no need to dock points there. Additionally, I was still able to find a great beer to satisfy me. We also ordered two carafes of wine which was top tier.

The food! Bacon wrapped dates were incredible and rich, the burrata and eggplant caponata was bright and light and paired with some fantastic bread, the LA crawfish grilled cheese was also rich and quite tasty while paired with a side of Cajun carrots that were unique, truffle fries were your run of the mill truffle fry experience, and the cornflake chicken sandwich was uhhhhh bland and not seasoned and the only bad part of our meal.

Pros: our waitress (I wish I could remember her name), the decorations, music, outdoor patio, the burrata and eggplant caponata, wine selection, the zony mash sour beer I settled on

Cons: that poor chicken sandwich

Closing notes: absolutely will be back, as I already have a list of new menu items I want to try

What has happen to this place? I should have opened a jar of spaghetti sauce at home and bought Trader Joe's meatballs. It was awful. My lobster bisque soup tasted like it was cheese soup. Our waitress forgot our ice tea, forgot I wanted more olive oil for the bread, and never offered parm cheese for my husbands spaghetti. I was so disappointed in the food, I use to really like this place

Came to this location late on August 3rd..
Ordered the large Oyster Poboy with remoulade instead of mayo  to go..
Got back to my room,(which was about 4 blocks away)Got about a 4 or 5 inch Oyster Poboy with 3 oysters on it for $20.95!!....
Tasted good I guess..
Was just to mad about the size, price and walk to get there and back, I just couldn't enjoy it..

Not sure about Copper Vine yet.  This was my first visit and the food was ok (a solid B+).  The service was great and the atmosphere was very inviting, but the food didn't quite hit the spot.  Granted we were some of the first customers in the restaurant this morning and there were a couple of larger parties already seated for brunch.   So, I don't know.   We'll try them again for a dinner service and see.  Hopefully this was a one time situation.
I bimbimbap that was already mixed, loved the flavor i just added a little bit of soy sauce because i like salty thing but I highly recommended.

I barely ever right reviews but it seems like this place is new so it doesn't have too many reviews yet and guys...this place is AWESOME! Very inexpensive and so delicious. I got the chicken, shrimp and steak hibachi and it's SO much food for such a reasonable price. It's so tasty that I can't wait to get it again.

I have been here twice...once to carry out some of their fresh bread for a friend's wedding and once for a scone with a dear friend going through a break up. The bread was delicious and the scone wasn't dry like a lot of scones I have tried.  The counter help was cheerful. I want to go back and try more items on the menu. The whole area makes you want to go back...

The food here is amazing. The flavors are tasty. We had went right before lunch time and we didn't have to wait in line. Our waiter was Dasheen and he was amazing. His service was excellent and made us wanting to go back. He was able to recommend delicious dishes and drinks.

This place is an awesome spot in Glenolden! They have excellent take-out meals that have been on our regular rotation since the COVID-19 pandemic. The restaurant has designated take-out parking spots and a convenient pickup window. Great food, obtained safely :). The food quality is exceptional; and they always have great daily dinner specials.

I ordered a Calzone. The online website states: "Zio's pizza dough stuffed with Ricotta, mozzarella and toppings of your choosing, folded and baked to order.." I ordered a calzone with sausage. They asked spicy or regular, I ordered for spicy. They called back and stated they don't have Italian sausage. So I ordered it with pepperoni. My co-worker got a side of Italian sausage. Turns out they misinformed me when they called, since they had regular sausage, just not the spicy. I can forgive some incompetence like this. However, when my calzone arrived it did not have any ricotta in it at all. I called to inform of them of their mistake. The lady became rude stating that the pepperoni calzones are pre-made and do NOT come with ricotta. I stated the online menu says that they come with ricotta, and the lady informed me they do not. I was told they are pre-made. I stated they should have told me on either of our prior two phone conversations that the calzone would not have ricotta because I added pepperoni to it. The lady gave me even more attitude. That makes two lies on their menu. The calzones are not "folded and baked to order" and do are not "stuffed with Ricotta". I will never order from here again. I suggest you don't order from here either.

The place is very very small and cute. The service is pretty quick. The food was good. All of this cost a little over $34 and it was pretty filling for two people. The soup was very meaty and great. 

The menu is limited but that's great if you are  indecisive. It's definitely better than the ones down town but around the same price. The bibimbap stone pot was very good and fresh!

The Pearl food was good but when it came to the check we where hoodwinked. The bill was 48.00. I gave the food server (Kelley) a 15.00 dollars tip in cash. When the bill came back with our we didn't even look and just signed it. Later on when.I got back to the hotel room a ten dollar type had been added after we have them.our credit card. Our server Kelly didn't mention it. She could have said the tip is already added. I will never be going back there again.

Solid pizza. I stopped in around lunch time for a quick slice of pepperoni pizza and got just that. The service was quick and the pizza was pretty good. Thin style with just the right amount of cheese and sauce. The crust was crispy and the pepperoni was tasty. I'll definitely be back.

Yuck! Not what I expected at all (not even close) especially after being impressed with the food pictures (tuna dishes are my favorite). Granted I couldn't get over the dirty feet and locker room smell so I didn't even stay to get seated, I highly doubt the dishes look or taste anything like the ones posted. The decor was very minimal (minus the ok bar) and it looked as if they specialize in pizza and wings. I'm not an ice skater but thought it would be a cool place to start a friday night with friends. NOT.. Guess it would be cool if you're into ice skating (and use to the musty smells of old socks) and wanted to watch a game while the kids were skating....its a place to grab a beer but definitely not the environment I expected considering the name and pictures posted here. Oh well atleast I visted the hockey facility I would have likely never gone into otherwise.
Florentine omelet and smoked jalapeño grits were very good! Not so much for the coffee.
Wonderful.  Every thing we ate was awesome.   $301. For four people,  great drinks and food.   Apps etc.  very nice.

Everything I expected.  Awesome.  Po-Boys.  Top notch.  Red Beans and Rice a must.  Gumbo on point.  I ordered delivery as well.  Which usually isn't as good as going in.  Not Mahony's.  It was amazing tasting.  They even give you a little extra.  Bread and sausage.  Why?  Because they love what they do.
Service was great, but aside from that, nothing positive to say.  Po Boy was average, fries were below average and the ketchup was gross.  Again, the service was great...very friendly and attentive.
Great crowd great service, nice shot and beer place, There food is really good too. Nice environment and they always had an outdoor section

This place is absolutely amazing, my friend and I wanted to try something new and we found this place online. Favorite part of the night was the special duck appetizer, best duck I've ever had in my life. Our waiter Greg was knowledgeable and gave great recommendations. Overall very leisurely night and we enjoyed ourselves.

If you're looking for a solid meal at a reasonable price, then this is where I would stop.  The staff here is quite personable and friendly.  They can guide you to the right po'boy, sides, and beverages if you're feeling unsure, and they're great to just chat with when they have a moment to spare.

Don't sleep on the crawfish etoufee.  I always end up eating too much here because I want a poor boy, but I can't not get the etoufee, and it's not like I would ever take anything as a leftover because my mama raised me as a part of the clean plate club.

I brought a group of first time tourists here and they wanted to come back two more times before they left.  They had fun sampling a variety of po'boys from the menu, and by the time they left, they were all stuffing themselves on the etoufee, too.

Great portions and food with a convenient location.
Calamari burned, Bibb salad contained rancid walnuts. Spaghetti not tasty. Terrible food. Won't return.

I came into your dump of an establishment a while back and one of your waitresses kept giving our party dirty looks. There was also a gentleman at the bar who kept staring at my wife. Whoever he was definitely a creep that should not have been in the restaurant. I like to dine and be able to enjoy my time while not having to worry about creepy men staring down my wife.

Doc Magrogan's is an oyster house specializing in seafood. They're in downtown West Chester, so parking's cake: street metered parking is free after 5, and on weekends too.

Friends and I met up here to take advantage of their attractive Monday specials[1]: their "Buck-a-Shuck" special meant raw oysters were a mere $1. We indulged in half-off appetizers, $4 classic mojitos - surprisingly good, with a kick - and $1 PBRs.

At the bar, bartender Mario[2] paid a lot of attention to us. Shared a huge, awesometastic assortment of thirty (30) oysters, trying about EIGHT different varieties, freshly shucked in front of us, and were some of the best I've had in recent memory. While sklorking them down, we watched the Olympics on flat screen TVs, then washed everything down with a few oyster shooters full of vodka. Mmmm.

Doc Magrogan's has lots of seating, and outdoor tables too. As more folks showed up, we were corralled into a side dining room. Meghan, our brave, sole server, somehow managed to serve the twenty of us.

I'll be back to Doc Magrogan's for their oyster specials, just not to sit at a table - at least, not with such a gargantuan party. Check them out, and tell them Dave sent you[3].

[1] Certain happy hour specials run from 4-6pm, while daily specials run until midnight. See their web site for the latest!
[2] May have his name incorrect.
[3] They will be thoroughly confused if you do this.

UPDATE 28 December 2009: Apparently they don't have mango mojitos anymore? Call to verify availability...

Stopped here with a bite to eat before a meeting with teammates. There was six of us we were seated right away. We did wait a while to get our appetizers and when I ordered the Poboy the bread was hard. I did enjoy the gravy on the fries. If you're in a hurry and you're in that area I suggest it but I don't know if they were having an off day but I wasn't impressed.

Update 2/12/2020: The owner reached out to me to extend an invite to visit again. Thank you for your reply and I will return soon!

A huge bar seating area , food, and children playing, what an interesting combination.  I went with a group of friends on a Sunday.  It was a light crowd in the bar area but had about 3 birthday parties in the center seated area and towards the children's play area.  They have reserved seating and the parties were for children and adults.

The bar area was pretty quiet until about 20 min before the Eagles game.  It became packed with folks ready to celebrate the eagles!  The tv monitors were strategically placed in perfect location and the game was on full audio blast.  So if you're into watching the football game at a bar this is the place.

This place serves brunch so we all had the opportunity to order brunch at the bar as well.  For a large party it's perfect because you don't have to split a bill.  You order at the bar get a number and sit anywhere, they will bring the food to you.  Well, that's great but the food wasn't the best.  Not horrible but nothing to write home about.

The woman's bathroom is pretty smelly due to the dirty poopy diapers being tossed in the trash after they use the changing table.  Not sure if the men's bathroom has this odor.

A great place, BUT the service was absolutely appalling. I was looking for a fun place to go out and celebrate and a lot of my friends recommended this place. The atmosphere was super cute, food was good our server, Matthew was atrocious. We had to ask him repeatedly for multiple things and one of the most important things was water. Water is one thing you shouldn't let run out with customers. 
It took them a significantly (20 mins) longer time to bring out my friends food and she ordered the same thing. Then when it was brought out, wrong might I add, he had an attitude about it and did not offer another option or apologize about the issue. 
Overall I'm not sure if I'll come back to this restaurant let alone recommend this place to anyone else. Now when people ask me about it, the first thing that comes out is food was good, but the service is terrible and that's such a turn off. Very dissatisfied. 
I gave this place one star because the food was good but all the other stars get taken off for the poor service. Come on Nashville get it together!!

I stopped BAP one random walk to Whole Foods because it looked like a nice little joint with a good review rating. 
What I found was that this place was a nice little mom and pop joint where there was a sense of simple foods but in a contemporary area.
I've had my fare share of korean food while in philly, Los Angeles, New York and houston.
Honestly speaking. . . It is a standard price for korean food. A little higher than other joints. In all I spent over 15 dollars for a bowl of beef bibimpop and veggie pancake.
First the pancake. I didn't like that it was very eggy compared to all that I have tried. It lacked crispness and it lacked. . . Flavor. It was as if it was reheated, although I'm not sure. It wasn't hot and it wasn't crunchy and it wasn't tasty.
As for my bibimpop I wasn't impressed. It was very standard for 11 bucks. The veggies were assorted and it tastes exactly what it looks like, if you want the crispy bowl it jacks up to 12 bucks. I've been to many joints and I would say this caters to the not so asian crowd.

This was a bit underwhelming. I ordered ginger salad, dynamite white tuna roll, and the old city roll. I also also had the winstons heat and rave street cocktails. Here are the issues, the winston's heat could have been more strain for a cocktail. While I love cucumber, there were way too many bits in the cocktail (see photo). The service was subpar. The waiter explain that he had "forgotten" about our salad order after nearly 35 minutes of waiting. My part visited during lunch and there must not have been more 10 people attending during our time. Ironically the salad was the best part of the meal. The ginger dressing was delish but maybe a bit over dressed. I found the rolls to be entirely too fishy and not too flavorful. Also call me skeptic, but I don't like the boxes that the sushi is served in. The little wooden rates and obviously hard to clear because we could see debris under our rolls. That is inexcusable especially during a time for a heightened need for cleaning. I was hoping this would be a new sushi gem in philly but it was just underwhelming.

Why is it that I order the same pizza biweekly, and sometimes it has a generous helping of toppings and other times I find myself LOOKING for the toppings I pay generously for....food here is good unfortunately what you order on wednesday, EVEN THOUGH YOU ORDER THE EXACT SAME on Thursday..your food will not be the same...some cooks, cook...some cooks skimp...MAKE UP YOUR MIND

Absolutely beautiful interior. 
The customer service is good. 
Food is mediocre. 
- Black and blue sandwich was very good
- flatbread was way too greasy 
- chocolate cake was SO dry
First time here...its was cozy and very welcoming.. didn't have reservations but they made room.. Food was delicious..

So I've tried ALOT of pizza around the Tampa area, I love pizza, who doesn't?! If I must add I am from Long Island so I know what good pizza tastes like... anyways I have been hearing people brag about joes pizza for a while so one day I finally went through the drive through and ordered a large pizza and I FELL IN LOVE it's my new favorite place in Tampa for pizza!!! It's so so good irresistible good, mmmm. So I went again a week later and added a order of garlic knots to try and it was delicious (not that I expected any less) and the marinara sauce served with it just as good. Try this place out! Highly highly recommend.

Talk about a fresh, modern, and most importantly delicious take on Japanese cuisine. I was very surprised to find such a gem so close to the heart of Honky Tonk, Nashville, Tennessee. The interior and service were astounding. We were promptly seated and given warm, damp towels to wash our hands at the table. That's something I've never seen before but apparently it's a custom at legitimate Japanese establishments, especially higher budget ones. Our server was very polite and the whole place gave off a formal vibe. I definitely wouldn't come here on a whim in your Wednesday Worst but don't feel pressured to come in a suit or dress. Anyways, the menu items were expectantly  priced for the type of venue Green Pheasant was. I don't think anything was below $10 and one of their entrees was around $25 per ounce (minimum of 4 ounces per order) for examples. Even though the price can be a bit steep, the food was well worth it and tasted delicious. You get an adequate and satisfying portion unlike some more higher end places so you don't feel like you paid for one little piece of meat or lettuce. I recommend the Jidori Chicken and Fried Chocolate Cake. Overall, this is a great place for a casual-formal date or nice family dinner!

Not only is the food delicious but the staff is super friendly and the place itself is stunning the way they have the bakery on one side and the wine bar on the other. Wish I lived in Santa Barbara so I could enjoy it more often. Will be back! And thank you to the employee who sent back my hand brace that I left by mistake. Cheers!

This is one of our favorite places to go in Reno for lunch when we're there. Our last experience there was lacking though. Service was pretty slow and the waiter never asked whether we wanted the soup or salad with our meal so we go neither. If James is working make sure you sit in his section because our experience at this Macaroni Grill has always been awesome when he's waited on us.

I've never eaten anything here I didn't love. The food is fantastic.

Ambiance was amazing, the food was delicious and I loved my wine.. however the service was HORRIBLE!! It took 20mins before anyone even came to our table. I had to flag someone down, they took our drink order then took off before we could order our food. Waited another TEN mins and I had to flag down another server to place our food order but he couldn't take it since someone else took my drink order  seriously, I shouldn't have to hear why the servers can't handle their section or be managed properly... by the time we got our food, we were the only ones on the patio so I'm not sure why they were so "swamped" and would have loved another glass or two of wine but couldn't get anyone to take our order. Get better management and training to the staff if you're gonna charge those prices

Food was delicious, could've used just a little more given the total price but not exceptionally expensive. Service was also very friendly, seemed to cater to more locals than tourists at the time which was refreshing.

Pros: good food. Decent drinks. Nice neighborhood location. 

Cons: the two male bartenders that were on were totally inattentive. They were pretty boys so I am assuming that's the reason they were hired. Seemed like they kept catching their reflection in the mirror and were too busy to help. Had to literally call out to them if you needed anything. I would rather have slightly less attractive people who were good at their jobs than have the pretty boys in there ignore me. Service is everything, it doesn't matter how good the libations, the service is what brings people back or keeps them away.

my friends and i were on the search for the best hong kong milk tea today. while st honore's version wasnt remotely as close to the best i've tried, it is by far the best in philly. give this place a go if you are on the hunt for some good hong kong milk tea.

A great little spot for some coffee and treats! Small outdoor area but quaint. Inside decor is rustic and done very well. The family and I shared an avocado toast and a sticky bun and both were fantastic! We will be coming back and trying the Huevos Rancheros next.

There comes a time when it's simply time to cool off.... Mike's Ice Cream downtown Nashville: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup and Tennessee Fudge Ice Cream. We're talkin chunks of goodness here folks ... CHUNKS.

This my first time coming and the food was great and the service was amazing. Our server and the other servers were super attentive and on top of our drinks and making sure we were good the whole time. I will definitely be back. Nice environment and great music as well.

I can not give this place any stars because it was such a terrible experience from start to finish
My husband tried to drive thru for lunch at 2:00 pm - no one came to the window and there was not even a bell.
He then went inside to find a huge ace with two tables occupied .
He approached the counter and mentioned to the waitress that he was at the drive thru bit no one came
She could not have been less interested in the customer experience 
Undaunted my husband ordered several items including a Cuban sandwich that he had to ask for it to be pressed- the fact that they pressed lettuce and tomatoe on the sandwich was terrible
When we asked for the check , the waitress had an incorrect total that we pointed out to her.
The reply was negative and as my husband had a copy of the menu in his hand !
The waitress was huffy and unfriendly because she had to redo the check 
I can say we will not be back!
The only reason they got a star was to post this

For the last 9 years I have been dreaming of a comfortable space where you can take your kids to play, have a drink and some food while you relax with friends. So loaded up the family in the minivan and made the pilgrimage to the city and met up with two other of my girlfriends' families. This large industrial building is spacious and has a convenient location in Delaware Avenue and had lots of free parking around.  Outside they had some outdoor seating and a chicken coop, rabbit hutch and a little garden area with tables. 

Inside was ginormous and there were many large tables for big groups available to choose from.  We easily found a table for 8 kids and 6 adults.  The lower level had a play area for the kids and another bar.  There was a play structure to climb on, basketball game, tetherball, some video games (Mario, Kirby, etc), mini skew ball, a telephone booth, picture booth and a broken pinball and  broken shuffleboard table.  The kids area was definitely fun but if you look closely it didn't seem very safe or thought out.  Like the basketball game near the slide opening.  My daughter got nailed in the head.  The metal tether ball on a stage surrounded by concrete seemed a bit sketch.  I was a little anxious letting my kids play there.  

I did not have any beer on this visit but the group's consensus was that the beer was just OK.  We did order fries, pretzel with pimento cheese, the mussels, some pizzas and some collard greens.  Food was good for brewery fare.  They do have a kids menu.  The service was not that great on our visit either.

The food is delicious, and the prices are good.

The online ordering was a bit clunky as I had to create an account and get up to find my credit card rather than using the saved info in my phone. It was also confusing because there aren't descriptions of the menu items. I looked at some photos and ordered anyway. 

I got there, and the open sign was not on, but I went in anyway. My food was ready on time and tastes fresh. The place is clean and the staff is friendly. 

I got home, and the extra zucchini I ordered seemed like it was a replacement for the other veggies. I thought I was ordering extra, but that is ok. The food is really tasty, and I was able to get lots of yum yum sauce. Hibachi is my favorite and it's nice to find an affordable place that does it well.

If you like bland tasting & looking food with terrible service this is the place for you. We had a group of 13 adults with a week or 2 reservation at 3 PM on a Sat. (we were basically the only people there) so it wasn't like they were swamped, & they only had one server there to do everything. John our waiter tried his best, but with no staff to help him at all, our meal was served in different shifts, so everyone was eating at different times. I had the lamb shank & was the 1st to be served & it was Luke warm at best, & instead of mashed potato's, I got potato soup. No salt\pepper on our table because at one time supposedly some kid threw & broke 8 salt shakers, so I guess everyone must be punished. We had to wait for desert because they said they had to wash our dishes for our desert (which by the way was very good) for the 1 star. This is all because of bad management. When I tried to talk to them, they seamed very uncaring, but they did give me a 25% discount coupon for 1 entree lunch, WOW how generous of them. Now I know why they only get a over rated 2.5 star rating. I will never go back there.

Kaylee? Kailey? Kayleigh? Might still have the spelling wrong but this girl is super woman! As someone in the restaurant field I would hire her in a second for her above and beyond hospitality. I missed their hours after driving up from Santa Monica so didn't get anything but my savior was there with a warm and comforting approach that left me excited to come back. She even tossed me a baguette for my troubles and gave me directions to a great spot around the corner. A raise is in order and kudos for Helena for having a great staff and amazing looking set up.

Food was good but not warm. My French toast was cold for some reason. Cute court yard setting but you can hear 3 different musics going on from the restaurant itself and from two other restaurants next to them. It's quite pricey when breakfast items don't service with any side but maybe because they use quality ingredients.

Totally, 100% worth every single penny.  I planned a surprise birthday dinner for my best friend here, and everything from the moment I called to inquire about availability was flawless and above average customer service.  Karah, the manager I spoke with, worked closely with me to make sure all details were handled, down to prepping the hostesses not to mention a party when I arrived with the birthday girl.  Karah not only helped me the day I called (a week or so before the party), but reached out the day of to go over final details.  She was enthusiastic and thorough.  In fact, she even came by to wish the birthday girl a happy birthday and stopped back a few times to ask if everything was going well. 

Our server, Duane was flawless!  He gave us an enthusiastic overview of the restaurant, it's food and suggestions.  He explained everything extremely well and made our experience personal and exceptional.  He always had a smile on his face and gave wonderful suggestions, i.e. the onset egg on the wagyu steak!  

The FOOD!  THE FOOD THE FOOD!  We spent roughly $1200 for a group of 13 and there wasn't a crumb left on any of the plates!  People made NOISE while eating.  The food is so well prepared, came out in waves (never allowing anything to get cold, it came out immediately when ready), very well presented and perfect for a large group to share.  The cocktails were delicious as well.

Overall, the wait staff, the managers and every single thing about our experience was top notch and well worth every penny.  I highly recommend The Green Pheasant!  Thank you so very much for making a special occasion even more special and completely positive.  Cheers!

We had the shrimp poboy, a shrimp/oyster poboy and onion rings.  The food was really good, had to wait about 15 minutes for it to come out, just enough time for a beer.

The server was really nice and was fairly attentive.  I would recommend this place.

Great vibes, friendly people, casual, and amazing breads and breakfast... what more could you ask for? Enjoyed two different toast items and some coffee. Great atmosphere and everything was so fresh and carefully prepared. The ricotta and honey toast is kinda next level. Also got a few loaves to go of their incredible artisan break. A great place for a mid morning casual breakfast.

Literally the most delicious ice cream in town 
Each bite is perfection 
The waffle cone is life
Best bloody mary that I ever had. Very flavorful and spicy. Got try it

Not a great experience. The food is mediocre, the service is maybe a 3 star but on a  night with only 7 table of people in a large restaurant the service should have been great. When waiters come to the table ask a question and star walking away before you have time to get the answer out it may be an indication that they know the food is not great and have no answers. Bread set RVers in an Italian restaurant with olive oii l and no Balsamic vinegar unless you walk down waiter and ask for it is different. Overall it just felt like an Italian food experience at a mall or airport Food court. Macaroni Grill used to be so much better.

Hello. We purchased our meals last night from the 36th & Chestnut location. Ticket number 485. My wife makes amazing meals but we decided to stop there after our Kelly Drive walk. Imagine our surprise after longing for chicken quesadillas oozing with gooey goodness only to find goo. The tortillas were uncooked/untoasted, the chicken was undone and the bacon was soggy. Wife tried to salvage hers bug putting it in the toaster oven but then she just felt sick and lie faint in the middle of the living room floor. We love Wawa. The lemon muffin with the perfect dollop of cream ever so tastefully placed in the center...the sweet cream cheese of a warm stuffed pretzel...We just wanted that same sensation last night. Something enjoyable, which we did not receive.

Went for the 1st time since the Re open, cool atmosphere. Ordered the BRISKET Poutine because it just sounded gooood!!! Unfortunately it was just EH! When I asked the server if they normally don't put brisket on the BRISKET poutine she said it's chopped up real fine, it's there. I said I'll keep looking however none was found Also I would recommend working on the portion size, French fries are cheap more than a measly handful would be nice. We did not order anything else as I saw other food walking by and was skeptical.

Great food. Awful service. 
I came in at 6ish December 18th and sat in the bar area with Jayme. The host and food runner were polite but the server never checked in on us besides when she got our drinks and gave us the check. She forgot an order and our bread and never came back for a refill. Good food however not worth going to with the inadequate service and price.

What a great break from eating at home! I stopped here this afternoon in between (annoying & surprisingly crowded!) errands. I think there was only one server for the whole restaurant so the poor guy was running all afternoon, but I think everyone understands that most restaurants cannot afford to keep a full staff for a small customer base.  Food, as always, was wonderful! James was a great server. Thank you James.
If you are looking for yummy comfort food in a great location, I highly recommend Macaroni Grill!

Great ice cream for a great price. We came in on a Saturday night & were attended to really quickly. My mom got the turtle sundae & I got a chocolate dipped cone. I got Pralines & cream & red velvet cake. the pralines and cream was amazing. my mom got mint chocolate chip, peanut butter cup & birthday cake. her favorite was the mint. i would recommend!

I'd like to give this restaurant another try. I have a feeling they just had an off night because a lot of the reviews I have read were raving about this place. Fries didn't come out with the meals, hostess was not very friendly, waitress was tired but sweet. The black and blue burger was very good though as well as the wings. It's located on the second floor of the center ice skating complex. It's cool because you can eat there and watch some of the hockey games going on or ice skating practices. I will give this place another try and update my review.

After coming from New York I knew I'd have to go through trial and error to find my go-to Chinese bakery in Philly.  After trying nearly all of the bakeries around Chinatown, this is probably my favorite.  First of all, the staff is very nice and helpful.  I wish I knew their names because I'd like to give proper credit to the staff, but the lady who speaks English without an accent is so friendly.  Every time I stop in she'll say hi and ask how I'm doing with a big smile.  I really feel like I'm a regular at this point.  I once came with my mom and now she's always asking how my mom is and when's the next time she'll be back.  

On to the buns.  I've tried most of the items available at the bakery.  There's a wide assortment of sweet and savory buns, desserts, and prepackaged steamed buns ready to go.  I'm really obsessed with Chinese style dried shredded pork, so I always have to get either the 'pork over bun' or the rolled up bun with green onion and dried pork any time I walk by.  To someone without much Chinese bakery experience this may sound weird but you have to give it a try, such a great balance of sweet, salty, savory, decadence.  Everything else for sale is also top notch.  I was lucky enough once to grab some egg tarts that were literally straight from the oven and I have to say at that point they were the best I've ever had in my life.  

They also have an assortment of hot and cold drinks available, but I don't have much experience with those.  All in all this is a must-go if you are wandering around Chinatown.  Stop in for a bun or a dessert.  It's a great treat, from an exceptional staff, and it definitely won't break the bank.

Good option if you want a po boy at a sit down restaurant.  The prices are a little on the high side for what you get, but I think that's due to the location and it being a sit down restaurant.  Had shrimp po boy and pimento cheese fries.  Would recommend both.

Isabelle or Isabella, I lost my receipt, was our server. She had excellent recommendations and even guessed what we were searching for in the menu. I was between the philly and one of their signature burgers. She said the philly was her favorite and you got more food for 2$ less than what I was looking at. The fries were awesome as well. I've never been to philly but heard the bun should be moist/wet from the meet and fixings and it was which I love.

This place is an absolute home run! Have you ever imagined putting banana bread with bacon, peanut butter, bananas and maple syrup? Well, these guys have and DID! It's out of this world delicious! The avocado toast was amazing to the last bite. My husband had the bowl and added an extra egg. He explained that he's happily eat that every day for breakfast

Is it possible to give this a zero?  It is a terrible experience from the front door.  Food, drinks, rude wait staff. I couldn't believe that there were children allowed here!   Some of the Wait staff was nice but also paid to be nice and trying to get big tips. 
Go somewhere else - or at least to a strip club if that what you are looking for...

Basically just paid $45 for snacks. I went in and they had no gluten free bread and did not validate parking. I couldn't eat a salad so I just had to get meat and cheese on a plate. All I got was that, chips, and a lemonade and it was $37?? And then even more for parking. It's supposed to be "trendy"? The staff is nice but slow and don't care; they just hang out and talk amongst themselves while customers are waiting for their orders.

Best Po Boy I had on my trip...hands down!  They had so many varieties and since calories don't count on vacation I had the chicken liver po boy...OMG!  Chicken livers can either be amazingly good or just gross...there is no middle ground.  This sandwich will haunt me, in a good way, until my next visit to NOLA.  AMAZING!!!!

I'm sad they changed their menu! I really miss the huevos rancheros! But the food is still great and I love the vibe. It's a cute little spot.

In re a note I received: The food wasn't as flavorful as I remember. I did leave and come back to SB so I could be remembering wrong. The egg in the sandwich I had was HUGE. Took up most of the sandwich and was dry with no seasoning. Then the bread (brioche which is usually dry) had nothing to wet my mouth. It was just huge unseasoned egg and dry bread. There may have been some avocado spread somewhere (it was noted on the "in this sandwich is" but I couldn't see it) and I asked for chilis to be added, but they weren't. I always try to go to local spots and I will definitely be giving it another try at some point.

Very welcoming and the food was incredible! Started was ettoufe fries.  We couldn't get enough, the flavor was spot on and highly recommended. I had a po boy with alligator sausage..slightly spicy but had a very robust flavor. My wife had the crawfish ettoufe and loved it. Overall a great experience while in Nee Orleans

Quick service for a group of 11. Seafood was freshly fried. Drinks were strong. Crab étouffée was legit and I was thinking about it an hour after dinner. May be a little more tourist than its neighbors but that comes with polish, preparedness and patience (for folks who aren't from around here)

Was recommended to visit this fine establishment from a local we met at LA Jackson while having an afternoon cocktail. Booked our reservation on Opentable for 8:30....

Upon arrival the restaurant was dimly lit and smelled delicious. We were seated at a table by the window. Our server, Jason, promptly brought hot towels. I thought it was a nice touch.

After reviewing the wine menu we decided to go with a bottle of Italian red. 

For an appetizer we ordered the pheasant dumplings. These things were AMAZING. Tangy and not to filling, we absolutely destroyed them instantly.

For the entree we decided to go with the Japanese wagyu with a side of roasted cauliflower. I highly recommend these delicious cuts of beef if you decide to come here. It arrived on a slate platter with 4 optional topics. We sprinkled the salt and pepper over the top and began to enjoy. The wagyu was everything I hoped and dreamed for it to be. Thinly sliced with a charred exterior, we went with rare plus, every piece was savory and delicious. It was like candy. The pictures do not do it justice!

Would go again next time we're in Nashville.

JM
Wonderful ice cream shop. They have a lot of flavors, they let you try before you decide. I got mine in a waffle cone, it was one of the best cones I've had, with rocky road in it.

My friend and I came here after waiting to try for so long. Needless to say, the customer service is beyond poor. We sat at the bar, the young lady came and assisted us with a drink. She never came back there after. We had to ask someone else ten minutes later can we order our food. He then proceeds to respond with "we're back up and we make drinks for everyone in here but I'm here now." Okay. We ordered. Twenty minutes goes by (no food) the young lady who first assisted us comes over to us, takes a drink menu from us to assist someone else and doesn't say a thing. This was beyond unacceptable and disrespectful. No "excuse me" or anything. Mind you, she never came back for our food order either (we asked her for a food menu.) I asked for a manager at that point since it is rude to reach over someone without saying anything for one, and two, she never even acknowledged us since then. Manager came over to remedy what was left of the situation which did nothing because I was ready to completely walk out. The young lady came over (because of the manager obviously at this point) to check on us. We completely ignored her. The guy who we gave our food order to came over more frequently as well to check on us. Had we been told by either of them, "we're very busy, but we'll get to you as soon as possible," we would have completely understood. However, that was not the case. We believe this is happened to us because we are African American women and this establishment is served predominantly Caucasians. Regardless, we have NEVER been treated in such a way and will never come back or recommend anyone we know to come here. If I would be able to give this review zero stars, I would.

What a great find in New Orleans on a Monday evening. We slid in under the Happy Hour expiration and my husband had three local brews at a fab price. Our food selection was all from the starter section of the menu but the entrees sounded amazing - will be back to check them out. Fig & goat cheese flat bread, truffle fries and a charcuterie board are highly recommended. Shoutout to our server Chavez for superb service and great conversation.

Great addition to the quarter. As a frequent visitor it is great to see places like this that embrace the traditional food of the city while innovating with new twists, such as the peacemaker po-boy. Best onion rings in the city. 
As a student of such things it is great to see the teamwork and enthusiasm of the staff. 
Great place to visit.

Great steak burger, and friendly service


Our son plays on his high school's Ultimate team ("frisbee football")


This season, the Alton High School joined the league, and they were home team, so we got to play the game there.
Both teams played well.

Afterwards, our son needed food.

I hadn't been to Alton for a while, so we used the phone to guide us to downtown, and we found a place to park.

As we walked around, Tony's looked like a good place.


Our waitress, Jasmine, was very helpful and friendly.

She brought very tasty bread and butter to hold us over.

Our son was in the mood for a burger, and Tony's has their great steak burger every day.

Our son likes his simple - meat and bun.

His comments - 
"Good burger.  Good meat, well cooked."
Big smile!

I had had a big breakfast, so I just nibbled our son's french fries... they were very good!

We will definitely want to go back next time we are in Alton.

Great atmosphere and great location.  Good food but the roast beef is not my favorite.  They put something in it that tastes sweet.  It's either in the cooking of the roast beef or something in the gravy.  Not my favorite roast beef Po-Boy in New Orleans.  I'm local and lived here all my life.  This is not a good representation on a good local roast beef Po-Boy.  Sorry Mahony's.  Keara is an excellent waitress.  Ask for her!

This place is just fantastic! They have the best Po-Boys I've had in New Orleans and the drinks are super tasty. I love the ambiance and the people watching. Definitely recommend to everyone that visits Nola. Check out the restrooms; especially the women's. Random I know but the mural in there is so fascinating.

So amazing if you have kids!!! And the food was great! You order from the bar and have a number then they bring the food to you !! They have parking and they have a self service area for condiments and water... great place to come watch games and hang out with the kids  they also have a more adult section which is cool because it's ok a different level !
If you're in New Orleans give this place a visit!! You won't regret it. Great food, great ambiance, all for a great price.
Finally some good food in downtown Santa Barbara.  Everything on the menu is great and could not recommend more. Will be back again and again.

Vibes: simple, casual but refined, dark wooden tones, candlelit; a bit reminiscent of Double Knot's aesthetic

Menu: short, curated categories of small plates, sashimi/sushi by the piece, and rolls 

Tasting notes:
-Wok kampachi ceviche: fish was thinly sliced, lightly seared on one side, a means for picking up the strongly ginger, salty sauce; this was very much of a light but absolutely lovely appetizer
-Lobster fried rice: tender pea shoot leaves among extremely umami shiitake mushroom slices and bite-sized chunks of sweet lobster; rice was not too oily and on the chewier side; a very shareable dish
-Mai fried rice: small pieces of sweet, meaty sausage contrast with the refreshingly crisp chopped snap peas and surprisingly large, full shrimp; mixing in the runny fried egg added a subtle creaminess; cilantro is the garnish, an fyi for people who might be like me and not love the flavor
-Yellowtail house roll: kept simple with yellowtail and avocado with a little bit of garnish, very clean-tasting
-Fishtown roll: basically a rainbow roll with crunchy, sweet, firm shrimp tempura wrapped inside with a mayo sauce; the size of each piece and the ratio of fish on top to the rest of the bite (rice, shrimp) was perfect for me

Noteworthy:
-Server was very attentive and friendly and great at explaining the night's specials, down to where the seafood was sourced
-Booths good for groups and cafe-style round tables for date nights

Will be back for: the A5 wagyu beef sushi-style (because last and only time I had it was in Japan a couple years ago!), happy hour, lunch when they get around to it, because I'd love to dine when natural light flows through the giant windows!

Worth the wait. While the egg was a little overwhelming the flavors and way it was cooked was perfect 
We also had their blueberry scone which was so fluffy and light

Coppervine 

 Looking for an intimate space and a good time? @coppervinewinepub is located right on Postseason. This sleek spot is very comfortable and up to date with a beautiful, fun courtyard.

 For cocktails, I ordered the lavender sprits with Magnolia vodka, elderflower liqueur, lemon, lavender simple syrup, and Lambrusco. Simply put it was a lavender and tonic lol.

 For lunch, I started with the " Jumbo Lump Crab Deviled Eggs". They seem to have a strong mustard and pepper taste. I also ordered the "filet mignon brochette" which was cooked very nicely and accompanied with wild mushrooms. The sweet pepper whipped garlic forest glaze was the perfect pair.

 For my main course, I ordered the Wagyu burger with Brussels sprouts! Listen the burger was extremely juicy, with the perfect choice of gruyere cheese and served on a soft burger bun. I was so happy ! The brussels sprouts were cooked great and the garlic aïoli was awesome. I even put a little on my bun!

The cultured chef, Amy Mehrtens, has traveled and lives all throughout the world and the menu gives you a hint of what she has experienced. 

If dining in, beware that you may have to pay for parking and that it is on a very busy street! 

Server (Rebecca) 4/5
Food 4/5
Atmosphere 5

Really good ice cream!!  The cones were a little stale but not a deal breaker. 

The shop itself is pretty nice and in the perfect location. The staff did their job; a little complacent and short but did what they're there to do. I understand when it's a tourist attraction and hundreds, if not thousands of people are coming through the store everyday. 

In the end, fairly priced and good ice cream.

I'm hungry just thinking about this place. Best fried rice I've had in my lifetime, I can't believe we just discovered this restaurant. Amazing atmosphere, like an upscale sushi bar. Really nice wine selections and truly to die for food. Even if we hadn't been starving at the time of our dinner, we would have devoured it just the same. We will be back!
Had the Angus Pot Roast Beef and it was just right for lunch.  Cooked and seasoned perfectly Nd as for the service? they were very friendly and fast service.

Heard that they had really good food and obviously expected a huge male population however I downed 4 waters and I was still so thirsty because the food was so salty. 

We had three servers in a 3 hour period. Our first waitress was nice but informed us she was finishing her shift and that we could transfer or close tab. To benefit her getting tips, we closed. However we were here for the game and it was clearly not even halftime. So we went without a waitress for 30-40 mins. Finally, we flagged down one and she was very good while we had her but so busy that we were left unattended to several times. 

Everyone got wings for the most part and I have several that had broken bones and dark meat. The beer was probably the highlight of the whole experience. Served at 29 degrees. Tasted great ice cold.

This place is seriously awesome. The decor is u unique  and the service is great. They just opened and still adding new thins to the menu.

We asked for a tasting menu which isn't featured on the menu and worth asking! The chef recreated his grandmothers soup recipe and had fresh fish right off the truck from Japan. It was unbelievable.

Dessert was awesome. We had dark chocolate ice cream and green tea ice cream with pieces of cheesecake. 

The experience was so wonderful and I highly recommended this place!

This was a great breakfast spot that was quick and easy. We were able to walk there from our hotel and they had various alt milks to chose from for our lattes, and really tasty pastries to get us going that morning. The seating is nice too because there are a lot of open spaces and I grabbed some gluten free snacks for the airplane later that were delicious!
Slowest service ever, two hour to get diner half a hour to get water with only half the restaurant full. Manager was not helpful food was below average and orders were forgotten.

TOURIST TRAP! Do not engage! Everything is overpriced and below average in flavor and quality. The grilled shrimp remi is decent, but the serving size is hardly worth $22. The pot roast roast beef poboy is so below average, it's not even funny. Poorly seasoned and incredibly dry, not to mention a shameful portion. For $22 the oyster poboy is by far the most skimp portion I have ever encountered. The onion rings are a pile of floppy, over salted, greasy, onion shreds. I came to Mahoney's French quarter because it was close to my house, but I will never go back.

Had to try their award winning Po' Boys. Their Peacemaker and Short Rib Po' Boys were both large and delicious. Both were so loaded, you could hardly pick them up. The side of Creole Slaw was some of the best slaw we have ever tasted. Our servers, Cookie and Gigi were both efficient and fun. The place was busy and loud, but that did not deter these two from rendering the kind of warm service we have come to expect in the Quarter. Cookie, Sugar to her friends, made us feel like family. Highly recommend.
Had dinner last night. Fantastic food, great service and the house Red Wine blend on tap is a must try!

Great restaurant right in the heart of downtown Nashville! Perfect as a date-night spot or for drinks & dinner with friends! The service was wonderful and I loved that we were able to book the reservation the day before using the OpenTable app.

I kept hearing about this place and oh my goodness, it lived up to the hype. Tried it for the first time Tuesday night and it was so good I had to bring back more friends for dinner Wednesday! First of all, the location directly across from ascend can't be beat. The ambience is super chic and exotic. The signature cocktails are inventive and completely out of the ordinary. But the food--my goodness, the food! The walu appetizer made with escarole sashimi and fresh jalepeño was just delightful. The kinoko mushrooms are exotic and flavorful. The biggest surprise was the chahan--this is not your usual fried rice! It is so incredibly rich and creamy and indulgent! They call them small plates but the portions are quite generous...you'll want to share so you can order a little of everything! And, the servers were so knowledgeable about the ingredients and the origins of the dishes. Our dining experience was simply ideal...twice! Ready to book a third time!
This is a great little ice cream shop right in the heart of downtown Nashville.   They have an excellent selection of ice creams and cone types.

Let's wine about this place, copper vineeeeee. We took our pick and explored right off of cbd central, something I don't usually do... but hey why not! 

It was as hot as the first crawfish boil and the cement was sizzling, we did have reservations but it took the server, or hostess,  some time to configure where we were sitting. But always, mask up. 

This is def a "let's catch a drink while we're downtown" or pregame here! Or def, drink before football game kinda vibes. There's no parking, so off street it is! M there is a paid parking lot in the back if you choose to park. 

They handed us our handy dandy QR code so we can scan them into our phones and view the menu that way. Very nifty with what society is coming up with during Covid times. We got good snacks and awesome truffle fries! There's something about truffle that's makes me feel classy every time I consume it. The outside is decorated very nice, and so is the bathroom. 
I def. would like to return just to grab drinks before to make sure my liver knows it's time to function in over drive.

Hip, mid-century modern decorated sushi spot with some hits and some misses but overall a good time. 

Came with a party of 7 to celebrate my mom and aunt's birthday. We opted not to bring a cake because they have a $45 cake fee. 

The drinks here were strong and I quite enjoyed them. I tried the Winston's heat, which was very much cucumber-y and refreshing, the NORI-Grets, which basically tasted like a margarita, and the Yuzu sour, which was a bit too sour for me. 

We ordered a bunch of dishes for the table, which came to around $400 with tip and tax. 

Things I'd recommend:
1. UNI: the uni here was surprisingly fresh (compared to a lot of their other fish). While MP was $12 a piece, I'd say it was pretty worth it. Not sure if the UNI is always this fresh, but we definitely came on a good day. 

2. Vegetable fried rice: I'm sure all the fried rices here are good (they have 3 different choices in total, a sausage one, a crab wasabi one, and a veggie one): We opted for the veggie rice and it was delicious - Super simple, but full of flavor. A bit greasy, but definitely a delicious and straightforward dish. 

3. Grandma's Wonton soup: I didn't try this, but this was a dish ordered for my grandmother (we thought a grandma soup would be good for a grandma lol). She really enjoyed this! These are Fuzhou style wontons so they're super small, but she ate this entire dish and that doesn't happen often - so they must've been authentic and delicious! 

Things I thought that were just OKAY: 
1. The rolls: We ordered the eel avocado, California, avocado, and peanut avocado roll (lots of avocado lol). While they were pretty solid (was personally not a big fan of the peanut avocado roll), I'd say it really wasn't anything special. I guess they presented it in an aesthetic way, but definitely not any better than the regular $5 lunch special rolls at a random sushi joint. If you're a fan of sushi rolls, their rolls are definitely a safe option to order but again, they won't wow you. 

2. Oysters: My mom actually really enjoyed the oysters, so this might be a preference thing. They weren't bad by any means but I definitely didn't like that the oysters were pre-seasoned and flavored. Whenever places do that it naturally makes me question the oyster freshness. We ordered 12 oysters in total, 6 East coast and 6 west coast. The oysters were around $3, which I thought was pretty pricey - especially because dollar oysters are pretty easy to find. I pay for $3 in NYC when I've missed happy hour and am REALLLLLLLY craving oysters, otherwise I can't really justify the price - especially in Philadelphia and for the size/taste of these oysters. Again, not bad but not worth it in my book. 

3. Seaweed salad: We ordered this for my grandmother who's pretty picky with what she eats. It tasted like standard seaweed salad. Not really sure what else to say about this one. 

Things I'd skip: 
1. Tuna tartare: My cousin mentioned this was a dish that was pretty popular here so we decided to try it. Tuna didn't taste very fresh. 

2. Big tuna sashimi: Tuna, again, didn't taste fresh. I'm confused why this place is called tuna bar when their tuna doesn't seem...great. Our waiter described this as an "omakase" but we chose to order and share with the table. The best part of this plate was the tuna rolls. The sashimi slices were fishy and honestly the color of the fatty tuna made me feel, for lack of better words, A BIT FISHY, about this place. 

OVERALL, this place is a fun time and has a great atmosphere. Their fish and tuna truly is...whatever, but I'd still recommend this spot for a nice date or hangout with friends / family.

What a cute restaurant and fresh delicious food! We sat on the balcony in the sun, even with their shades it was a bit hot, so just be aware of this. I had the Tuna Niçoise salad which was so fresh & well balanced. The restaurants has many different sections, floors and outdoor seating.  I love the blue paint and green plants that really give this place a cozy welcoming feel. Service was great too. Itll be on my list to dine again when i return to visit Nola!

The only reason I even gave one star was because the waitress was very friendly but I should have known there was a problem when she didn't ask me how I wanted my ribeye cooked, when I asked her about it she said that they all are done medium well to well, needless to say my steak came out well done when I like medium rare so it was like eating a hockey Puck, my wife got clams and spaghetti and I've never tasted a dull clam in my life until this place, no taste and the wine sauce was bitter as they come, the vegetables I had with my steak had a nice explosion of water with every bite telling me they were obviously frozen. Such a disappointment.

Ate at the Pearl last weekend while in Treasure Island.  The service and meal were fabulous. There were 4 in our party.  One had the rack of lamb; one had the pork chop special, one had the duck and one had fish with tag one sauce.  Everyone loved their meal.  Even nought some salad dressing to take home.

Here for brunch.  The eggs Benedict (Just a Benny in the menu) were perfection.  The shrimp po-boy was also delicious...lightly breaded shrimp so you can taste the seafood.  Great service! Friendly and funny!

Came across Mike's while we were exploring Broadway on our way home. We were craving something sweet and the line was out the door so it must be good right!? Even though the line was long, it went by fairly quick (waited maybe 10 min). We got the Nutter Butter which wasn't creamy like other ice creams but the flavor was still great! Their scoops are HUGE also! We loved this local gem!

My one and only time in there sucked. First off, I was annoyed with the lack of beer knowledge by the bartender who recommended Coors since it's her favorite beer at college *eyeroll* when I ordered one of their signature beers(which are subpar btw) I was asked if I want a " man size" or a "little girl size" beer(obviously something corporate tells them to say because I heard another bartender say it too). Wow! How sexist! I can drink most men under the table so screw you basically. ...ordered the "buffalo chili burger" I asked if it was actually buffalo meat, she said yes so I ordered it cooked medium so it wouldn't be so tough. It came out cold, well done and stiff as a hockey puck. I sent it back. ..30min later it came out hot and well done like a hockey puck. Management came over and informed me it wouldn't be cooked Medium because they are in fact PRECOOKED beef patties that are topped with 'buffalo chili'. Wow. So I didn't get to eat anything and was so frustrated I had to wait an hour total just to be informed of that.  So I won't be back.  Too bad because the bones of the place very much remind me of the old Loon Lake and they have a very nice patio.

Started off the Birthday Boy's day with some Brunch at Cooper Vine.

First off, service was outstanding by John. He knew the menu well and gave us suggestions on what to order. We ended up getting a bunch of items and we all shared and every was delicious.

Must Haves IMO are:

Jumbo Lump Crab Deviled Eggs
Chef's Charcuterie Board with 3 meats & 3 cheese
Brussels Sprouts 
Wagyu Burger
Chicken Salad Club
Chicken Fried Duck w/Cornbread Waffle (THIS IS A MUST TRY) 

The ambiance was beautiful with an attached patio that is super cute!

Absolutely loved the atmosphere, staff and food and drink beyond what we imagined. This was our second time there and both times were awesome. Highly recommend the  Beignet fried with dark chocolate dipping sauce! Yummy!

This place is hands down my favorite happy hour go-to spot. The staff is super friendly/cool, and the food is delicious! Wide variety of yummy drinks for really good prices during happy hour. Definitely recommend!
As expected! Unique and tasteful experience. Kids loved it and the peanut butter cookie was Ohmazing!

I popped in her because I had to drop my car off next door for service.    I didn't order any food so take this review with a grain of salt.

I went straight to the bar and was immediately greeted by a friendly bartender.  The beer special on this day was excellent ($2.90 tall Miller Lites on Wednesdays) so no complaint there.

I ne er had a chance to visit this space in its previous life (as a wild game-themed restaurant) so I don't know what ki d of renovations have been made.   However, from what I saw, it is a pretty neat building.   All alpine-themed to go with the name. 

The bar crowd was pretty chill.  It was primarily (male) professionals having a cold one after work.

Next  time I come here I'll have to try the  wings as there is a separate wing menu (a sign that they're good).

Ordered a large 1-topping pie and it was about the size and quality of a DiGiorno frozen pizza.  Dense, doughy crust, not enough sauce, generally unenjoyable even though I was starving and excited for pizza.  $20 with tip from an unfriendly delivery guy.
Great food and atmosphere. The Debris Fries are fantastic. The Po' Boys were good as well. Very short walk from all of the hubbub of Bourbon Street.

Recommended by friends who visited before me, and blackberry cornbread - how divine! Tried a sample before getting a cone, and it was perfect for the super warm Nashville night. It is a heavy flavor, and we all couldn't finish half of our ice cream. It was really tasty though, and would definitely come back!

After getting a less than desirable meal last week I was sent a message from a Google review.......when I went to macaroni grill website and submitted a survey ........I have not heard a thing and will not EVER give them any of my business again!!  Can't respond to a complaint and I won't frequent this establishment???

A wonderful concept that delivered in every way. Great atmosphere, great decor, friendly service, and creative food and drink menu. The bacon, wrapped-goat cheese stuffed dates were unique and delicious. Will definitely be going back. If you haven't been you must try!!!

This has been my 2nd time here. The first time was for the Mike Tyson fight.  The waitresses are very nice, and the food comes out very quickly.  Yesterday when I went I noticed alot of families are there to eat. There are a ton of TV's with different sporting games being played. If you order an appetizer wait a minute to order your meal because the food comes out that fast.  I like to take my time eating my appetizer.  
The food so yesterday I got the loaded potato soup and it was so, so good. I asked for green onions on the side to add to my soup.  That soup was so good not salty at all.  It had fresh bacon, potatoes and cheese.  
We also order fried pickles which was enough pickles to feed 4 people.  It comes with ranch,  and they were not greasy at all.  They were a mild flavor pickle so not tart.  I had the cheeseburger and added bacon for .99 cents.  The bacon is a nice thick cut of bacon.  The burger comes with lettuce,  tomato,  grilled onions, and mustard. The bun did break apart on the bottom for some reason. The patty is a thick piece of meat and it was very good.  
I will definitely go back I would like to try their Cuban sandwich.  I was going to get it but she said it's on a hoagie bun.  I would like to see if they can do that sandwich on their Texas toast they serve with the soup.  
Lastly,  I would like to see this restaurant have the tables/ bar top table more spread.  It's like part of the restaurant is social distancing and part of it is not. They are located in Marion County so the capacity should be less according to the Governor rules.  The restaurant both times has been packed with every table filled.  People do wear there mask to the bathroom,  and around the restaurant.  When seated our table was not clean so I asked to sit some where else.  I will definitely go back,  but would like to see either less people or the covid cases be less.

Staff was nice, but the food was overpriced for what you get, the serving sizes were great but the presentation was pretty bad and all the food was soggy covered in what tasted like stewed tomatoes in can. Couldn't cut through my Eggplant Parmesan and the bottom was soaked in juice... appetizers were yummy though. I just feel like for the price it was a let down. Very nice and classy atmosphere though. They just need to step up the food a little bit. Even Olive Garden tastes way better.

Stopped by based off of Yelp reviews on our trip up the coast.  Our GPS took us to the address, which is kind of the back of the building.  You won't see the bakery from here, it is the parking lot.  The bakery is kind of in a shared building and you actually enter from the other side.  
I had the green eggs and ham biscuit which was very good, I loved the the very thinly sliced ham.  My wife had the avocado toast with the egg on top and she loved it too.  Pretty busy place.  Good stuff.  Nice job guys.
Such a cool Asian fusion restaurant. Pretty great deals at happy hour, and a really lovely staff. I had the Wagyu beef brisket, and it was really delicious

YUM!!! Copper vine not only has a great atmosphere, but their food and cocktails are delicious as well. We started out with apps for the table: the truffle fries (cannot recommend enough), Brussel sprouts, and the fog and goat cheese flat bread. All were so yummy! I had the crawfish grilled cheese with sautéed veggies for dinner. The best grilled cheese I've ever had!

Twin Peaks is your typical guys bar, way above Hooters, and on par with tilted kilt.  The thing that puts it over the top is the ICE cold beer served at 29 degrees.  Servers are attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.  Jade is a true sports fan, we chatted about the World Series and she quoted stats about both the Dodgers and the Astros
