Popeyes chicken has better po-boys than what I ate last night. My sister got a shrimp po-boy and there was barely any mayo on it and the shrimp was so hard and dry she couldn't even eat half of it. The only good thing we're the drinks. The fries were unsalted and not even cooked all the way. The waitress even said it all depends on what cook they have cooking in the back. I guess we came on a night where the cook didn't do very well. Very unpleasant experience.

Was floored by the cleanliness and service of this restaurant. Spent last several days in NOLA and realized we didnt get a Po Boy. We were in a hurry to catch a flight out and told our server (named Cookie) so when she came to the table. She had a handheld device that out theborder in as we said it. I kid you not, it was out in 11 minutes!! Awesome taste, great slaw and further note..the bathroom wa step cleanest we'd seen all week. Will go there first in our next visit and make sure your waitress is named Cookie! That girl rocked!

My first trip to New Orleans on 12/28, first stop was copper vine. We were seated outside and after 15 mins of waiting and no service, I finally went inside to speak with someone. I went up to the bartender and explained i had waited 15 mins and had not seen a server his response was "well did a hostess even seat you". I explained that a hostess did seat us and he proceeded to brush me off. I ended up just saying i would leave and the response was "okay bye". I have never seen such poor customer service, not to mention it was my birthday..if you're a first timer to New Orleans I would recommend going anywhere else!!

I feel like this place needs a Gordon Ramsay makeover...lobster bisque - nothing but heavy cream and NO lobster at all, not even a nibble. House salad was cold, moderate fresh, but Asian dressing...did not go with representing flavors. The days special: Chilean sea bass...the sauce was delicious but everything else on plate bland. Fish not cooked well. Server was gracious and representing restaurant well. Felt bad for her and paid the unfortunate bill $130: 1 bottle of silver palm Cabernet (would not recommend) and 2 entrees, you will have to read my husbands review about the lamb...he gave 2 stars for atmosphere. Very disappointing because we traveled for a romantic evening and got terrible food. :( there's always tomorrow.

Have looked for over 30 years for Pilot House Fried Chicken...and finally found it here where the family operates this incredible restaurant. 
Parking?  Close, free and available! 
Decor?  Gorgeous!
Service? Impeccable!
Food Presentation?  Beautiful!
Serving Amounts?  Generous!
Pricing? More than reasonable for what you get!
Only wish we would have found them sooner!

In Nashville for a few days, craving some ice cream on a hot and muggy night in June. All homemade ice creams. A lot of choices. Went with the mint white chocolate Oreo and the coffee fudge. Both were amazing. Highly recommend this place.

Cool wine bar located in the CBD. They have a unique selection of wines on tap, the snacks are good, and it's a great atmosphere for drinks with friends or a date. I especially love sitting in the outdoor courtyard area, which is great for a warm spring afternoon. I've tried a variety of their small plates and really enjoyed the Brussels sprouts (obviously) and the flat breads. Copper Vine is a great spot to grab drinks and snacks after work for people who work in the CBD or before a show at the super dome/ smoothie king center. I highly recommend making a reservation if you are trying to get a table before a popular concert because it gets very packed. They also have happy hour on their bottles of wine (I've heard that they have happy hour on some snacks but that wasn't the case when I visited). I'll definitely be back!

Food - 4 stars
Wine - 4 stars
Price - 3.5 stars 
Service - 4 stars
Atmosphere - 4.5 stars

I've only tried the roast pork buns/char siu bao and egg custards here, and both were solid. I've tried bao at a few of the other Asian bakeries, and I think this one is my favorite thus far. The meat isn't too sweet and is tender and flavorful enough, and the ratio of meat to bun is such that the bread doesn't fall apart while eating. The egg custard was also enjoyable. I liked the consistency and flavor of the custard, but prefer a flakier crust. 

For now, this is my go-to place for bao.

The place is beautiful,  the food was so good and the service is great! Chance did such a wonderful job at getting our drinks and recommending us food. He was very friendly and attentive. Will definitely come back again.

Never even knew this place existed or had heard of it before. Not bad for an average sports bar with sports bar food. The ladies look very nice in their "uniforms" which are very short shorts with their cheeks showing and crop tops with the "peaks" showing hence the name twin peaks! 
        We had mozzarella sticks, chicken wings, and sandwiches with fries. Nothing to write home about but it was good. The service was nice and attentive. No complaints just not rememberable either.

The food was excellent- we had a fried shrimp poboy and etouffee. The service was terrible. The waitresses had a great time playing, laughing, hanging out in the back room together while leaving their tables unattended. We loved the food and it's walking distance from our hotel, but we won't be back.
Delicious food, great sushi and great drinks! This place is so cute on the inside and out. Located in a great area of the city - it is a must if you like sushi!

Wow... simply speechless. Tuna Bar is hands down the best restaurant for sushi in Philly. 

5/5 STARS!

Food: First and foremost, their food is amazing. I have been to many sushi spots in the greater city and Philadelphia area but Tuna Bar's sushi has the best overall quality and taste. Their speciality rolls are to die for. My personal favorites are the Sindy Roll, Rittenhouse Roll, and Hurts Roll. As for favorite appetizers, it is definitely the tuna flatbread and their oysters. Yum. 
 
Drinks and Cocktails: The best part about going to an amazing restaurant for food is having an amazing alcohol and drink selection to complement the meal. Personal favorite cocktails are the yuzu sour and the race street. If you're a sake fan then definitely ask them about their wide variety of sake. Cheers! 

Ambience: The ambience and the atmosphere of the restaurant is amazing. The "vibes" are great. They are always playing great music that sets a positive mood for everyone. Big ups to whomever created that playlist! 

Service: Last but certainly not the least, their service. Simply wow. Tuna bar has the best service. I have to give Ken, the owner, a thumbs up for creating such an amazing establishment with an amazing team. Their General Manager, Tina, was phenomenal. Her professionalism, positive attitude, and seasoned experience can be seen from a mile away. I remember on a busy Saturday night, she was juggling 5 things at once, but still managed to provide my family and I an amazing time. She was super friendly! The rest of the staff were A+ too! 

Would I go again? YES YES YES. 

Recommend to a friend? FOR SURE. 

Stop reading and book your reservation now.

Back and with a new menu...some old favorites still available and new ones like their SB Bowl.  If you are vegan, skip the egg (sub Avo) & skip the feta.  Would recommend they offer some non dairy cheese option here..non dairy feta is wonderful.  
As usual, fantastic lattes with oat milk! 
Great service...many familiar faces.  Thank you Sierra!
They do offer some gluten free sweets like a gluten free brownie (but do not think it is vegan...).  Really encouraging places to offer some gluten free vegan options when they can. 
The breads are amazing.  If you are not strict gluten free, their sourdough is a good option given how sourdough is made. And it is one of the few times, I will skip my usual gluten free needs and dive into their breads.  The sandwiches made on their breads take the idea of a "sandwich" and bring it to the next level.  So good.  
Still a local favorite spot mixed with some interesting visitors that have now discovered this treat!

oh by the way if there is a line, it moves fast (usually).

Tip: Order Online for Take Out in advance.  Then stroll to the beach for a nice walk.  Take the route along State street to enjoy some nice window shopping OR go the side street past Lucky Penny & Shopkeepers (great store), then to the beach..just a few blocks away.

If eating on site: only outside (and more tables yeah)...nice patio, but bring shades and a hat in case you do not get an umbrella table.

Excellent excellent excellent excellent! Our server was Derek, so attentive wonderful service. Went for a ladies birthday brunch and everything was great. Food, Ambiance, Weather phenomenal! Definitely will be back!
Came here for Breakfast and Brunch here. I absolutely loved smoked salmon here. Cooked amazingly.

Nice neighborhood bar with good food and beer. They have sour monkey on tap which is one of my favorites! Huge plus. We got 2 apps and 2 entrees to split: pesto deviled eggs, Italian spring rolls, cavatelli, and the spicy chicken cutlet sandwich. Would skip the spring rolls (they kind of tasted like taquitos) but everything else was delicious! Cavatelli was the favorite for sure

My friends and I were looking for somewhere quick to eat before leaving New Orleans and stumbled up on this place. They were opening in at 10:30, so we decided to wait. Although, we didn't have reservations, they were able to accommodate our large party upstairs. Once seated, our waiter greeted us and began taking drink and appetizer orders. A few people ordered mimosas, coffee, or sangria. I had the red sangria, which was so good, I ordered two! For starters, we ordered the black truffle fries and LA crawfish beignets. Both were really good, but the black truffle fries were definitely a table favorite. For entrees, a few people ordered the wagyu burger, the LA crawfish grilled cheese, and the cornflake-fried chicken and waffles. A couple of people had some issues with there orders from food not  cooked properly, lukewarm food, or simply not liking it, but our waiter took care of it right away. I had the LA crawfish grilled cheese with Brussels sprouts and it was pretty good. The Brussels sprouts were lukewarm, so not as appetizing for me; however I would be willing to order them again in the future. Overall, I think most people enjoyed their dining experience and would be willing to try it out again in the future. If you're in the area, check this place out!
Surprisingly good manicotti in a tasty red sauce. Came with salad and garlic bread. Not only tasty but a bargain.

Ordered takeout through Uber Eats. Good Wagyu burger and we also liked the deviled eggs. However, we each got the truffle fries with our burger for an additional $3/meal and maybe got 15-20 fries, which was super disappointing and expensive for what you get.

Great little bakery that has wonderful scones, muffins, biscuits and breads. They also have breakfast plates. There is an adorable little outdoor area if you need to bring your dog. We had the green eggs and ham biscuit and it was delightful not to mention the coffee which is excellent.

The food was great, the staff sort of ruined our experience though. Due to covid we were seated at a table put right next to the bar, the but the bartender was not waiting on us. Although he was very adamant about being apart of our experience. My boyfriend and I were celebrating my birthday and we just wanted to have an intimate dinner. Our server was hardly ever seen, one of our dishes was missing a component and the server didn't quality check us at all to fix the problem. The dish was cold by the time it reached our servers attention. The bartender wanted to "craft" me a cocktail then ended up just mixing two ingredients together and charging us $30 for it. Skip the cocktails. Go for the wine. Or just order take out.

My wife and I dined here on 12/17/11. We had a $20 birthday coupon that we received in the mail.  Let me start with the only positive I can offer. the waiter that took care of us ws very friendly and efficient through the entire meal. Kudos to this young man. Now the bad. I ordered 6 oysters, the special of the night as an appetizer. They were so small, I could barely find them.  For an entree, I had the seafood salad, again, so small, I finished in 5 minutes. Considering the prices in this place vs. what you get, it is way overpriced, and I will not return. Do yourself a favor, when in West Chester, go up the street from this place to either the Iron Hill or Ryans Pub, and get a far better meal for a more reasonable price.

Another spot that had been on my list of places to try for a while. Finally got around to going for dinner and was quite pleasantly surprised by the food. 

We ordered the crawfish beignets to start and surprisingly I loved them. I know you're thinking from the name, "Well, what's not to love?", but I have to admit I was a little skeptical for whatever reason. They reminded me more of a hushpuppy than a beignet, but they were divine nonetheless. 

I got the chochon de lait cuban sandwich with Brussels sprouts as my main dish and wowee was that sandwich good. After living and working in Tampa and the south Florida area, my hopes weren't super high, but I hadn't had a cuban in a while and decided to try it. While it wasn't traditional, it was damn tasty and that was good enough for me. The sprouts were also really delicious and the garlic aioli took them over the top.  

I wasn't the biggest fan of their cocktails, but the sangria was pretty tasty. 

I would love to go back and try the brunch!

One of my favorite stops every time I'm in New Orleans! The staff is so friendly and always ready with a list of recommendations. You have the option of indoor or outdoor seating (on a balcony with a view) or downstairs on a heated patio! The food is absolutely amazing with a great selection of wines and cocktails. I recommend their happy hour flight of wines and the crawfish grilled cheese which is my go to. The Brussels Sprouts and truffle fries are my favorite sides- the sauces are delicious!

I was on my way to Lankanau Hospital for a visit, and I was hankering for a cheesesteak. It's not a hard place to find just off Route 30. They have online ordering too, which is cool.

I got a cheesesteak with ketchup and some fries. The people working were very friendly. I wouldn't say the cheesesteak itself is anything to write home about. I could say the same thing about the fries. It still wasn't a bad experience. Both items together were a little over $12
Poor service, waitress seemed irritated.  I had the pizza, the sauce is REALLY sweet, so beware. Husband had the ribeye -overly fatty, roasted potatoes were flavorless giant steak fries

I got take out here the other day and was helped by Jaclynn who was really busy and still managed to help me in good time. The food was great and I appreciated Jaclynn's hospitality. Will be back for sure

Came here a few days ago,I had the chicken salad sandwich and my husband had the BLT. So amazing! Sandwiches came with home made chips.
We love this place ! Seating outside and everything was Covid safe

A chain Italian... yes 4 stars. I pretty much only get the Shrimp Portofino here, and its like $16 with tax. I like it, I crave it, I normally get it to-go. But the set up of ordering can be a PITA. They give you a time for when it is ready, you don't have a choice. I called at lunch one day, it was going to be over an hour before it was ready, umm no thanks. 

I will take this over Olive Garden any day though. 

Pro Tip: you can watch your order being made if you order it to-go at the restaurant, which is kind of fun.

A friend and myself decided to have an early dinner here about a week ago. The place was fairly empty on a Monday afternoon so we thought perfect, quick and easy service but no. Service was slow and the meal itself just wasn't good. Personally I ordered a create your own pasta with Alfredo sauce chicken and sausage while my friend had something very similar with chicken as well. Later on that same night we both had excruciating stomach pain which lasted another day. We called and told them this and they said sorry and that they'd do something special the next time we came in. Why would we return to a place that gave us possible food poisoning and all they could say is sorry?

The food was great and very unique however the attitude was not friendly at all. The service was good but you had to ask and no smiles whatsoever. The lady at the cashier who took our order was very short. Also not the most kid friendly place either unless your kid is in too that kind of food already. The blueberry jam though was delicious,  the avocado toast fresh from graden and the breakfast sandwich and bacon was really good.

Watched the Final Four last night here, was my first time visiting. Enjoyed the Tuna Bowl and a cold one. It was delicious and refreshing after a long week. Hats off to them for great service and great food! Loved the environment as well!!

Nice ambiance and dog friendly! I got the fried chicken for breakfast and thought the chicken was kinda dry and not too much flavor. I'd probably try something else if I were to come back here but the ambiance here is great!
Stopped in on a whim one morning around 10. Quick seating and service. Great omelet and fabulous Bloody Mary...and to go!

My girlfriend and I used to love going to this Macaroni Grill. We hadn't been there in a year and it has definitely gone downhill. Last Sunday I decided to order the dish pictured (the mushroom ravioli) via Doordash. Ordering went fin, but when it arrived, it seemed a little light for a dish that might resemble the dish featured on their menu, especially one costing $21. I opened it up and I saw this monstrosity. Only a few pieces of ravioli, burnt to the point of being inedible with a dash of (also burnt) mushroom gravy. I immediately called up the restaurant and demanded an explanation. I was told that the General Manager cooked this particular dish and that I would be getting a refund in a week. 
Well, it's been a week. I called and was told it might be another couple of weeks before I get my refund because the folks in the corporate office are only occasionally in the main office anymore. I did get an offer for them to remake my order. No thanks. Fool me once . . . 
I will never be eating here again and I don't recommend anyone else do until they either hire new management or, at least, banish the GM from the kitchen. They clearly don't know how to cook or about appropriate portions

Update: even though they told me to contact them on their website, I did and have yet to get any sort of response whatsoever. I even called the restaurant again. No call back. Two weeks from the original incident. Still no refund.

Thought I had written a review already but maybe I cut them some slack and decided against a bad review after my first visit.  Second try and this place just doesn't do it for me so it's story time.  Cause I'm in quarantine so this review is going to be a long one. 

Spark notes: Expensive bad food. 

I remember when they opened. So happy to see the skeezy place before it replaced.  Like a basic bitch I oooed at the thought of cocktails in the beautiful outdoor courtyard. 

If you're not with your gal pals, you're on a date.  That's just the type of place this is.  Like I said the courtyard is insta worthy and if you didn't happen to notice, the building preserved its historic charm.  Stand on poydras and admire those beams... 

Unfortunately, that's where my love ends.  The first experience, a date, was disappointing to say the least.  Not the date, the food. Which is worse. Bad date I can handle, bad food? No ma'am. 

You're in a beautiful courtyard what do you order? Charcuterie of course.  Let's feel like we're under the Tuscan sun surrounded by grape leaves... 

Back to reality, you're in New Orleans and this meat and cheese plate is nothing like Italy.  Forget fresh prosciutto or cheese from a sheep.  They can't even serve bread that's not stale.  Before you hiss at me, yes crostini is toasted.  I know the difference. My date and I agreed, this hard bread just wasn't going to do.  After waiting longer than I'd like for food that doesn't require cooking, we got more bread but there was no difference.  I'm sure we ate some other stuff but it wasn't memorable.

After first experience left me unimpressed, we never went back.  We would drive by and comment about our bad memory. Expensive bad food. 

Fast forward to Quarantine 2020.  I'm surfing IG because that's honestly all I do now. Some places are starting to offer family meals. We eat out often so more food for less money sounds like a good plan.  

20% off food at copper vine, let's give it another try. I called to place an order and the person answering the phone was not aware of family meals and when I asked about todays was told it's pork chops not pulled pork? Unfortunately I ordered from some where else.  This place upset me again. 

Is there a character limit on these reviews??? If you're still reading you must be in quarantine still. 

So I decide to say something about it. Cause I've never been one to keep my mouth shut.  Sent them a DM on IG.  Fast response. So sorry for the confusion. How about a free meal? Sweet! Yes please.  Never asked my name...Swing by to pick up my meal prepared for the worst.  Manager must have been expecting me.  Although my order was for a specific pick up time, I might as well have ordered when I got there. Ended up waiting 20mins and there were zero other people waiting. 

Time to eat. Fried Fish, Mac, green beans, bread pudding.  Edible. Certainly not worth normal price tag. Bread pudding was beyond dry.  This is where their stale bread could come in handy yet they somehow made it more dry... drench that shit in whiskey sauce and eat my free meal.  

The strong will (hopefully) survive this quarantine.  I'd be shocked if it's copper vine.

$129.77 later without tax or tip and 12,977% worth the money spent. Yes, baby, yes! Can I get an hallelujah?! I am screaming at the top of my lungs for The Green Pheasant. Alas, I have found my date night spot. Now, if only I had a date to take with me!

That was pretty exciting first paragraph, wasn't it? The breakdown is pretty clear. When you arrive, valet the car with the restaurant. Just do it and quit groaning at the suggestion. This will make your life a whole lot easier for a stress-free starter to your date. Go to the hostess desk where they will seat you for your reservation that you made 2 weeks ago. As they take you to your table, observe the ambiance. Will they take you to the upstairs with the quirky bathrooms? Will they take you to the main dining room where there is a central bar to people watch or are they going to take you to your private dining room with the awesome wallpaper of CCTV cameras and roses? Yes, you read that right. If you are able, take some photos in there because the wallpaper is totally worth a photo of. Most of the restaurant should find itself in a covershoot in Nashville Scene. Who doesn't love green and red velvet everywhere!?

Now that you're seated, take it all in. Check out the menu and inhale all of the quirky offerings on the menu. But before ordering food, get your sake order in and prepare for a toast! You can get that unique cocktail you were eyeing in the next round. This round is about sharing the moment you realized you're about to have one of the best damn dining experiences in Nashville. Kanpai! ('Cheers' in Japanese)

You've looked over the menu and you're going to order 4-5 items between you and your dining companion. They offer everything from vegetarian to what I'd consider a very large unsightly fish on a plate ready for consumption. I don't like whole fish, but the table next to us certainly did! Whatever you palette wishes is Green Pheasant's command.

The experience exceeds just the dining portion. Let's talk service. Carlos was exceptional. Beyond words, topnotch, never missed a beat, glowing service. He was hospitable, prompt, and very nurturing to our table. He never hoovered and we never had to ask for anything. He was like a genie who appeared when I had a fleeting thought of needing a beverage or another glass of water. We also appreciated his knowledge of the cuisine and his mindfulness of our spice-level tolerance. We ordered based on his recommendations and we loved every last thing he suggested.

After 2.5 hours of eating and drinking, it is time to go. Time to wrap up and get going. But, you do not exit without leaving a gigantic tip for the awesome server you just had, and you do not omit grabbing a couple of photos of yourself with your dining partner to capture the experience that will be ingrained in your culinary memory for a life time. Bask in the moment while you can. You'll return soon, but in the meantime, enjoy the moment at this moment.

Have fun? I know I did. Check it out and do it soon!
OMG!  Amazing drinks and food. Will come back again and again!!! BBQ oysters and po boys were out of this world!!!

If you can't handle a miscommunication and resulting frustration without resorting to mocking and laughing at your customers, you probably shouldn't be in business. 

We gave this place one more go after a couple inconsistencies throughout 8 or 9 orders (missing ingredients a few times, wait times for to go always seemed like our food had been sitting way too long - plus usually nobody out front, they all hang out in the kitchen)...honestly when the food was good, it was really really good, ya know? 

Too bad we chanced it again and had the same issues today, thankfully we caught it at the car and went back inside to recover 2 missing ingredients. They took care of the quinoa for my boyfriend's salad but said the avocados they had weren't ripe enough yet, and both entrees listed avocado. Somehow this wasn't noted by anyone or relayed to us while ordering. My boyfriend asked for some sort of compensation for that and the instances before - not a full refund, just to help with the repetitive inconveniences. Note that we never asked for a full refund, at any point...

Somehow the manager could not comprehend this. He offered to take back the food and then grabbed the bag from me, and I snatched it back because we had already paid and he refused to hear us out. I simply didn't want to return my food after being told a 25 minute wait time that seemed horribly inaccurate given the sparse state of the restaurant. 

What resulted was a bit of chaos and confusion. Everyone got more frustrated trying to get to the source of the problem then he began mocking us as I explained our experiences in the past, quoting my words back and laughing. He couldn't understand why we would come back if we had noticed anything wrong to begin with. The reason was me giving them the benefit of the doubt because anyone who's worked in restaurants knows that it can be variable and stressful... Joke's on us though as proven by his incredulous laughter, followed by "I'll just get you the full refund. I know what kind of people you are and what you want." 

At that point I felt we're dealing with a personal bias more than anything else. He would rather pay $30 back to us to be rude and unapologetic, rather than admit any fault or discuss the matter logically. Also, when someone says "I've been in the restaurant business for years" as a defense tactic when I ask why I'm being laughed at... it doesn't give them credibility. It feels like pulling at straws because they don't know the right way to handle a lack of communication from their employees. Terribly unprofessional, and a horrible experience, but maybe that's why they're in a place with guaranteed business from the sports rather than trying to make it on their own.

I was really excited to check this place out. I was sad that my cake cone was stale. I had to throw it away. I ordered the Tennessee fudge which is a chocolate chip ice cream with better tasting chocolate. The black berry cornbread tasted like it had freezer burn and was mostly like vanilla which small parts of raspberry. Also, the worker just handed me my cone touching the cone. I would expect them to put it into a cup and place the cone on top for COVID reasons but I wasn't happy. On top of that it costed me $6.
After the remodel they are really good, the service was good, food tasted good as well. The placed is clean, and their prices make a meal for 4 affordable.
great place on Poydras Street.  Make your reservation because they ate always crowded.  The food was great. you gotta try the eggplant appetizer and the crawfish.

I just loved the Bloody Mary bar with the fried shrimp Po Boy! Very cool setting here in the French quarter with more selections that will become your favorite. Since thIs was my first visit I went with their staple sandwich and I was not disappointed. I only wish that they would've let me drive the Ford GT they have parked in the restaurant

4.5 stars for this chain Italian restaurant. Sign up to be on their email list and they have many generous take-out and dine-in offers.

Large, clean restaurant making Covid standards easy to adhere to. The servers, though, need to walk far for their drinks and plate pick ups.

Large square rosemary bread given with EVOO. 

Got the chicken parmesan and it was thick and huge. Mild on the sauce, good on the melty cheese! All the tables took home leftovers!

This location does a lot of curb-side and to-go orders.

Super friendly and generous service.

This is the worst sonic I ever been to. They seem to be frequently out of items, it's a 50/50 chance the food will cold by the time you get it and forget trying talk directly to them, they will more than likely not be so friendly. Despite this, its convenient so I keep going back. Today topped the cake. I sat there for 15 mins... Only for them to turn it off my little red button off in stall number 10 without ever taking my order. I am now at Krystals up the street trying to salvage what's left of my lunch break. I think I'm done trying here. Lol.

Cuban sandwich was delicious and well priced for the value. Sourdough was perfectly baked. Flavorful meats and melted gooeyness of the warm cheese made it all work together well together with bits of pickles. Perfect sandwich to split with someone if you don't want to eat too much! I love that it is steps away from local wine tasting rooms and not far from the beach.

We liked this place because it is comfortable, decent service, consistent dishes and great ice tea. We also like the salads because they have lots of goodies in them. Except today, both our chicken salads arrived with no chicken, the chicken was brought out later  for us to mix in. The other ingredients were in such scant portions that we couldn't taste them and had to hunt to even see traces of them. Very boring salads, very disappointing. We complained to the  waitress who was apologetic and  went into great detail about training a new person in the kitchen. Not the customer's problem. 
Did not offer to take anything off the bill either. We left feeling cheated.
Amazing biscuit breakfasts, highly recommend.  The cheese board was also fantastic as you drink wine in the sister/shared collective tasting room.
Stop by for brunch. I was disappointed. I got the biscuit with butter and jam. The biscuit was hard. I ordered a latte it had no taste to it. The pastrami Ruben was very good
Love the atmosphere and service!  Awesome bartenders!  Excellent food as well, great background music, friendly service.

Went to Tuna Bar last week in person, and then had for takeout tonight. It is my new favorite sushi spot in Philly. The rolls are all unique/delicious, and most importantly the quality of the fish is unmatched- where you don't even want to use soy sauce because the taste is so good. I recommend the fishtown and king ghidorah rolls. You really taste the unique touches like shishito and hot sesame oil. Already looking forward to next time. Highly recommend!

Tuna Bar is a new sushi joint located in the Old City neighborhood. Modern with retro inspired decor, I felt thoroughly welcomed by the warm staff the second I walked through the door. I would definitely recommend making a reservation, especially on a weekend, as the place was pretty packed when my dining companion and I arrived. 

The menu is relatively small, but from our experience, everything was made with thought and care. We started off with cocktails, the tequila for us both. While the smell let us know it was a generous pour, it was easy to drink and not overly sweet. We split 4 rolls in total: Fishtown, peppered tuna, dynamite tuna, and spicy salmon. The presentation was beautiful, and every roll was delicious, although my favorite was the Fishtown. It was clear that all of the fish and other ingredients were fresh! Our meal a bit pricey, which we expected, but worth the splurge for great sushi!

As others have stated, the service at Tuna Bar was simply outstanding. The owner himself even stopped by before the end of our meal to inquire how we were doing. A lovely dining experience overall!

I am especially appreciative of restaurants and small businesses for still providing us delicious food even during this crazy time. Ordering by phone was quick and easy, and the contact-free payment + pickup with the owner was smooth and friendly. We were hungry after a day of shopping, and BAP hit the spot! Ordered a beef and tofu bibimbap. The veggies were fresh and diverse, the sauce tucked away in a corner of the takeout container, and the protein well cooked and tasty. I liked the pickled cucumbers provided as well! I do wish there were more vegetables/protein to balance out the hefty portion of rice. Otherwise, grateful to BAP for a nice home-y meal in these trying times :)

Came here on a Saturday night for our date night and we were left very unimpressed. I really wanted to like this place because of friend's recommendations. The interior of the restaurant itself is very nice. The host greeted us and we told him we would like to sit at the bar, which is just first come first serve. We sat down and it took 10 minutes (I timed it bc it was taking so long) before the bartender even came up to us to only hand us food menus and walk away, didn't even get the drink one I had to grab one near me. Even then he didn't greet us or smile and didn't even say he would be right with us or if we had any questions to let him know. It was a very unpleasant beginning and start to our date night. We just felt unwelcomed to be there. I don't know if it's because he was the only bartender or if it was that busy, but I think he could've at the very least acknowledged us when we sat down right in front of him or told us he would be right with us. I was trying to give the situation the benefit of the doubt the whole dinner, but nothing got better because it did eventually slow down. He simply took our orders and handed us our orders. However, there was another employee who was standing in the corner of the bar who helped us get pepper flakes and had a nice conversation with us. We would like to try this place again because I see really good reviews, but we will not be sitting at the bar. I was mostly upset with the experience because the food was good.

The atmosphere here is wonderful. We went to Copper Vine for brunch after a long night out. The host/waiter made us feel super welcomed, they went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of. The food was good, although the flavors were all different with my chicken & waffle it was still a good quality meal. The presentation of the meals we each got was great.
Went in for skinny iced mocha and it was the best one I've had!  Perfect blend.  Started to skip by here and head to Starbucks but really glad I didn't!

I eat here probably twice a week... I love that i can fax my order in and it be ready when I arrive because there is ALWAYS a rush! I don't stray from my usual so can't provide many options, but will say get you a soy surprise smoothie! Yummy!

Trusted our yelp reviews and we were not disappointed!! 
This place has amazing homemade ice cream!!
We sampled a few and then picked two scoops of another flavor...ALL were delicious!!
Very reasonable price for the size of scoops you get!!
Can't wAit to go back again!

Close but lacking in the essentials...

I love seafood and because I am a foodie, when I think seafood, I think wine...the perfect pairing of a crisp white...any white..any red...I have never seen such a horrid wine list.  If a beer and shot and fru-fru umbrella drink is your thing, great.  Docs is your place.  If you love to wash down your oysters with something that does not make you wretch...consider-you have no options.  The wine list is, well, insulting.
I admit, my frustration comes with emailing the restaurant today and them telling me they had a great NZ Sauvignon Blanc by the bottle.  We arrive and are told they have been out of that wine FOR DAYS.  
Our waitress, though adorable, was spotty and did not get our orders correct.
  The food?  Solid.  The ambiance? Great.  The wine and "touches" of extra?  Nope.  I don't think I will be back...unless I am drinking bourbon on the rocks and sitting at the bar.  Everyone has their thing.  A nice glass of wine to go with great food is mine.

Food was good but there were greasy  finger prints on everything,  including my plate and my martini glasses.  Nice waitress,  but it's disgusting to have greasy finger prints on the glass I drink from and on my plate of food. 
Don't think we will be back.

Today was my first time coming and I will be back.  John was a very friendly and attentive waiter.  We had a bottle of Pinot noir, crawfish fritters, Brussels, and duck debris fries.  We enjoyed everything!  I would recommend sitting on the patio.  Great experience!

So this is the pizza joint my son and I hit up. Here's what  they do right, they make the pizza per instructions listed in all Domino's. They get your order right consistently. They have a drive thru so I don't have to get Covid. I feel like Kevin from Home Alone when I come here because I'm always getting a cheese pizza, but the cheesy bread dipped into some marinara is also dope. If you've seen my other posts, you know that the wife and daughter are GF, don't do this option here they can't comprehend cross contamination, and I don't expect the teenagers here to either, BDP! (If you know you know), save GF option for Molipazzo. Domino's keep being you and I'll keep patronizing your fine establishment.
Loved my visit at Twin Peaks! The food was delicious and my server, Jamie took great care of us! Wonderful service!

Ate waaaay too much here and I have zero regrets! Helena is a delicious spot for breakfast. I came here on a Sunday morning at around 10:30 and it was PACKED - line was well out the door. I live within walking distance so I turned right back around to go home and placed an online order for pickup ~45 min later. 

We got the elvis style banana bread, wildflower honey ricotta on sourdough toast, and the green eggs and ham on a biscuit. I was most pleasantly surprised by the elvis because it's not something I would have normally ordered but the flavors complemented each other so well and the banana bread itself was great. It was a huge chunk of bread so it was also a more filling dish than I expected. We both loved the ricotta toast, which was light and more dessert like. The sourdough bread was very impressive - very soft on the inside with lots of crunch on the outside. Lastly, the green eggs and ham was great with the green harissa sauce and there was a huge piece of fluffy egg. It's not a sauce I've had before on a breakfast sandwich and I was a fan! Sadly it did not come with a biscuit like the online website says, but brioche instead. That might be the new default and you might need to specially request the biscuit, despite the website description. The brioche was good but we were looking forward to trying out the biscuit - next time!

We stopped here for a lunch and we were so positively surprised - food, drinks, service and especially the restaurant ambiance. I felt I could spend the whole day relaxing in the indoor space! Copper Vine is definitely a place we recommend and  we want to revisit.

Opted for a few take out rolls for lunch. I tried the Miso; Hamachi Avocado; Spicy Scallop; Spicy Tuna; Shrimp Tempura; and Broad Street rolls. I'm glad I tried the miso soup, which packs an interesting sweet flavor with buttery soft tofu. My favorite from the order were the Hamachi and Broad Street. Overall, everything was tasty and fresh. Would love to try dining in next time for sashimi and appetizers.

This was our final dinner in Nashville.  We didn't have this one planned out, rather looked at online reviews for nice Asian because we had already had so much heavy, fried cuisine.  This place was a gem!

I called ahead for a reservation but they were booked up for most of the night.   I was told we could sit at the bar and it would be best to come early.   We actually arrived before their dinner hours began, so we sat at the bar and ordered from their small plates.  

Mike was very friendly, helpful, and welcoming.  He concocted a great non-alcoholic drink for me, which I ordered a few of over the course of our meal!   I can't remember exactly what it was, I believe it was made of cranberry juice, soda water, and a generous sprig of rosemary (picture attached).

We started with the edamame, yaki gyoza (pheasant dumplings), tuna tartare, and lobster shumai (lobster and corn dumplings).  Everything was nicely plated and tasted wonderful.

Next up were the famed spicy crab noodles.  Upon arrival of this dish, we quickly realized: a) that it was so good that we had to order another, b) that it was so good that my spouse was going to eat it all so we had to order another, and c) that it was so good that I wasn't going to want to share the dish with my spouse, so we had to order another!  So, we immediately ordered another!   

Also--interesting find--the toilet seats were heated!  

This is a very unique establishment and we were glad to have the opportunity to visit it!   We were happy to find such a friendly place with fresh ingredients and very unique selections for our last big meal in Nashville!

After hearing about this place a few times, I decided to give it a try today with my wife, mother-in-law and three kids. Simply put...it is a rough experience! Here are a few of the drawbacks:

1. $4 parking (0-60min)- No validation
2. Dining area had too much furniture and was not clean.
3. The shelves with drinks, chips, etc. looked like they were having a close out sale. Empty.
4. Rude employees...
5. Trash cans were overflowing and they didn't even have openings big enough to accommodate the containers the food was served in.
6. If one of your family members order a salad, and the other a sandwich, you can't pay for them together. It's weird.

The food was decent once we got it but honestly, not all that great considering the hassle you have to go through to get it and eat. There are a million great places to eat in Nashville...I'd put this low on the list.
I hate to agree but the new owners have made this place sub par! Won't be ordering again and will give sun valley my money

Went there for lunch and had a great experience. Staff was knowledgeable and very pleasant! They recommended a special - fried cauliflower marinated in coconut milk and coriander Po-Boy - And it was excellent. Bartender was so nice!! Will be going again before I leave NOLA to sample something else.

I was soooo happy with Sunset 44's curbside service, from when I called in my order, to when I picked up. They were so courteous and accommodating! And, knowing Bob, who came to my car to deliver, was part of the process, I knew safety was important to them. I ordered one of the specials, two entrees and a bottle of wine, added on a wedge and a dessert and I was in the neighborhood of heaven! Delicious dinner, great people! You can't go wrong with Sunset 44!

Amazing, never disappoints. Coffee is fresh and delicious - same goes for their food. Adorable little patio that is dog friendly and they share the inside with a wine bar. Great spot to meet friends, go on a breakfast/lunch date, or get some work done!

Holy Grail of Cinnamon Rolls!  Best I've ever had!!  

Coffee is legit too, and lots of little retail goodies to keep you occupied.  

A bit tough to find, but who cares, go here!!

Not the Romano's Macaroni Grill that we used to come to?  It has changed over or the chef left.  We got seated and waited....Finally, another waiter noticed us and came over and asked if we had been helped?  Of course we hadn't!!  A waiter came over and asked if we were ready to order we said yes since we had been waiting quite some time!  We ordered an appetizer and our meals and drinks all at once.  No bread came, waiting for our appetizer, I finally asked our waiter if our appetizer was coming out?  He left and came back and said it would come out with our meal, if that was ok????  NO, it's called an appetizer.  Food comes out, meatballs are missing from the create your own pasta, we pointed it out, asked again for bread.  He brought the check and we weren't even done with our meals, he was quick for that!  I told him, please get our meatballs, reluctantly he brought back 4 meatballs in a side dish???  The food was not as I remembered and not as tasty.  The service was awful!  Unless you feel like asking for everything twice, don't bother going here.  I don't know what the problem was with this place???  Won't be going back for awhile.  Oh, the manager said I'll take care of the appetizer for you, no he didn't, the full price was on our bill.  For the money we paid it wasn't worth it.  REALLY DISAPPOINTED at the whole thing.

Today we tried this place for the first time through a DoorDash order. We ordered chicken & shrimp hibachi, and steak & chicken hibachi. What we got was steak & shrimp hibachi, and steak & chicken hibachi - so one of the orders was wrong. That wasn't a huge deal, but when we opened them up, the meat portions were sooo small! It's mostly just all rice. I was also confused by DoorDash because I thought we would be receiving mixed vegetables - but it wound up only being cabbage. Overall disappointed, not worth the $50 we paid.

This place is a gem. I stopped in by chance 1 Friday for a beer and a sandwich.  I was really pleased with the food.  But al of a Sunday this guy starts singing Sinatra, Buble, Bobby Darin.  He blew me away.  I ended up stayin there for 2 hours. I called a friend and told him to come over because he is a musician.  We stayed and enjoyed.  The guy said he is there every other week.  I'll be back.

We decided to spend our pre-Thanksgiving Tuesday at the Green Pheasant last night. We were not disappointed! The space is sleek, cool and comfortable. The nonstop "house" music was a bit much, and made it somewhat hard to hear dinner conversation, but we understood the vibe that they were shooting for and took it all in stride. The menu is a fantastic mix of classic Japanese izakaya dishes with some larger plates that are great for sharing. I'm not a big fan of menus that list the name of the dish followed by all of the ingredients without an actual description of the preparation, but our server was very familiar with the menu and talked us through everything. We had two of their craft cocktails; they were spot on perfect. Each was a great mix of sweet, sour, bitter and refreshing. 
We ordered Dan Dan Shishito peppers; very reminiscent of Dan Dan Mian,  without the heaviness of the noodles. A great started. That was followed by lobster and spot prawn shu mai; unlike many restaurant dishes that claim to feature lobster, the succulent crustacean was very present in this one. Then a riff on okonomiyaki; a hash brown pancake with traditional okonomiyaki toppings and sauces. It was like an asian latke; perfect for this time of year. We finished with the whole trout, fried and served with thinly sliced cucumbers, asian slaw and steamed buns. The trout was cooked perfectly; it was silky and juicy. One thing to note; for a restaurant that features a sharing menu, a puzzling number of items came out in odd numbers. 5 shu mai, three steamed buns with the trout; Management-how about 6 shu mai and 4 steamed buns so a pair of enthusiastic and hungry diners don't have to fight over the "odd bun out"? 

In any event, the food was fabulous, and the bill for the meal, with 2 craft cocktails, came out to less than $100. Do yourself a favor and get to the Green Pheasant early and often!

Great service, tasty food, and cute restaurant: a must in NOLA. First the service: our waiter (Rose) was very attentive, funny, and made our night an even better one. Most of the food was pretty good, the menu offered a good variety of items, and a good wine selection at reasonable prices. The short ribs were tender and full of flavor; the pork belly was very good and went well with the corn pudding; however, the pork belly demi glace was a bit overpowering. The crab deviled eggs were a bit disappointing- heavily sprinkled with seasoning which overshadowed the egg batter flavor plus there was hardly any crab.

I've had dinner here on several occasions, and every time was a great experience. This is my first time trying their weekend brunch and it did not disappoint! Food was terrific, service was incredible, and atmosphere is very casual and fun! Terrific menu and appropriate for all ages. The only reason I did not give them five stars is that I feel they are overpriced for the type of restaurant. I highly recommend this place and look forward to going back!

Food, service, and ambiance were excellent. The staff is extremely welcoming and gracious. Everything that we ate was simply wonderful, flavorful, and delicious. They have over thirty varieties of wines on tap. We will definitely be back the next time we're in the area.

This place is awesome! My boyfriend and I are huge fans of sushi and decided to come to Tuna Bar to celebrate Valentine's Day. We were so glad we did! We ordered the creamy rock shrimp as an appetizer and it was small but fantastic, highly recommend! We shared the Rittenhouse roll, Fishtown roll, and Broad Street roll. All were fantastic! The place had great ambience and was a perfect date spot.

I went to Helena Avenue Bakery early on a weekday to grab some breakfast. They have an outdoor patio area with seating, but it was starting to get crowded by mid-morning. I got a latte, green eggs & ham special, and the blueberry scone to go. 

For me the blueberry scone was a surprise hit! It was very flavorful and not dry at all! The green eggs & ham sandwich was fine - the biscuit was good, but I'm not a fan of spongy baked eggs. I'll still come back again though to try more items!

Came into the restaurant a little over a month ago, Brittany and Kelsie were very rude. I was the only woman at the bar and I have never been treated so poorly by a bartender. I have been in there numerous times for the excellent drinks and normally have a good experience, but not this time. These bartenders were too worried about it being lingerie week and being checked out by the guys. It was truly disturbing. Do not recommend for women to go there. Strippers will even treat people better than these chicks do. Go to brad brass flamingo before twin peaks
Excellent Poboys!  Extra sweet staff. Got sandwiches to go for lunch but wished coulda stayed. Great atmosphere.

Went for brunch. Very affordable & well made sushi. Bottomless mimosa for $20 is a good deal. Large fresh juice selection. Sake selection is very nice as well! Will definitely go back & recommend you everyone for well made fresh sushi at a great price!
Absolutely delicious coffee and pastry! Lovely place to sit and relax with a cup of joe. Highly recommend this place.

Good chain food and giant portions.  Thats what makes it great for a birthday party and a large group.

Its pretty much like all the other Macaroni Grills I've been to across the country, but this one is in Reno.

Sup Everybody..,Soooo Yeah...Today's Experience at macaroni grill was...Meh! First we waited 15 mins to be seated when there was 3 tables open and no one else was waiting ok no biggie it happens..we get seated our waitress comes takes our drink order brings us bread so far all good right..she comes backs to takes our order all good once again everything is good....THEN....15 mins past..all we get is our refills..then our waitress comes back and asked me what I ordered? ...she said I just wanted to make sure..so I said Chicken paramsan..so at this point am think A she forgot what I ordered B she didn't take down my order considering she took my order first..what ever I let that go as well it happens they were busy..now 25 mins have gone no food yet...the table behind us party of 6 got sat after us a good 10 mins after us..got their food before us..now am starting to get irritated not cool..so a good 35-40 mins later we get our food and it's luke warm..at this point am done I don't even want to eat nor did my niece and sister in law..I took a few bites and I was done same with my niece and sister in law..now we are home and having Actual dinner...That's all folks
Had an oyster po boy, and my wife had a eggplant parm po boy, daughters had etouffe, tasted awesome

Driving through the West Chester area on a lazy sunny afternoon, I made an early dinner stop at Cheeseburger In Paradise in Exton, a Jimmy Buffett theme restaurant and bar. I like the very laid back and relaxed atmosphere here. The inside of the place is decorated like a tropical beach house with a straw roof bar area, surf boards, and painted fish and palm tree murals. Background music with rock music and Buffett tunes resonates throughout the place. There are colorful wooden patio chairs and there's outside seating with flaming lamps and a spectacular view of the traffic out on Pottstown Pike and the Kmart across the road. 

I sat up at the bar so I could watch the sports highlights on the TV. There are several beers on tap including Landshark, Miller Lite, Coors Light, Sam Adams, and Yuengling Lager. On Monday nights, it's Raingutter Regatta when there are drink specials on Landshark Lager. Since I still had a long drive left, I went nonalcohic and ordered a very fruity pomegranate soda. I went over the menu which offers beach fare including appetizers, sandwiches, burgers, sandwiches, wraps, bbq ribs, coconut shrimp, fish tacos, and desserts. Turkey and veggie burger options available at no additional cost.

I did not order a cheeseburger, but I went for the Fish Tacos ($10.99), 3 of them served with island rice. The fish tacos were stuffed grilled flour tortillas (soft and crispy) with spicy grilled fish, cabbage, and pineapple salsa, served with a tangy orange dressing on the side. The rice was lacking flavors, but otherwise a healthier accompaniment than fries. The service at the bar was laid back. My order was taken, the food brought out in acceptable time, and I was left alone to enjoy the food and the fruity soda. I skipped over dessert and I left pretty satisfied with the meal, still not quite the same as So Cal fish tacos, but decent.

What a disappointment, if not disgrace. There were four in our party and we ordered two filet mignons, one duck and one buffalo. The latter two were fine but the two filet mignons were spoiled and inedible. The waitress apologized and offered substitutions but because we had waited well over 30 minutes for our entrees we declined. The first in our party to taste the spoiled meat tried two pieces before giving each of the other three a piece try before complaining to the waitress. I had to discreetly spit out my sample.  Because the first 8 oz filet looked almost half eaten to the chef,  the restaurant agreed to deduct only the second,uneaten filet.
Great staff and service. Food is above average with a very laid back atmosphere. Prices are decent and the Bartenders know how to make a good drink.

I earned this chocolate ice cream in a waffle cone. I walked blocks and blocks and made my way through huge crowds of intoxicated people on Broadway just to visit this place. I earned this! And it was delicious. 

The ice cream itself had a very rich chocolate flavor without being too sweet and the cone added a nice balance. The only issue I had was that the ice cream started to melt kind of fast. I already had some drippage by the time I sat down at the table.

Neat place to visit when in Nahsville.
Go - to place for good food, great drinks, attentive and fun staff, and energetic bar vibe. Looking forward to enjoying the patio in the spring. The '44 (as we call it) is a winner.

After driving by Twin Peaks daily for months, we decided to finally pop in to see what all the fuss was about.  We had noticed that the parking lot was PACKED the first few months it was open and initial Yelp reviews were touting Indy's newest breast-aurant as the place to be.  Also, we were curious to see how the cool old Loon Lake Lodge had been transformed in to the new space.

We visited at about 6:30 on a balmy 89 degree Sunday night and were seated on the large wrap-around patio at a huge, tall, heavy wooden table.  There are TVs EVERYWHERE -- hanging back to back over each of our heads, 4 on the wall beside us -- just EVERYWHERE.  The tables on the patio are massive and easily sit 6, and some inside (inside it is HUGE!) looked to seat 10+ or more -- with several smaller parties divided up by a slider depicting an ax through the table.  There was a fire pit at the corner of the patio as well.  

Our scantily clad yet overdressed for the weather (more on this later) little teeny-tiny server was completely friendly, but lacked menu knowledge aside from "these 2 sandwiches have an egg on them and if you like fish we have trout and fish tacos".  We later learned that sweet "Bambi" had just been in training last week, so we cut her some slack.  

Beer options were surprisingly super limited (no local or craft beers offered), but I decided to give the Dirty Blonde house brew a try -- reminded me of Blue Moon -- served in a big ol' super frosty mug at 29 degrees. I must say it is really tasty with an orange wedge!  

We got the hand braided pretzel ($5) for an app -- served with warm beer cheese (made with the house beer Knotty Brunette) and grainy brown mustard.  Decent.  Greasy(?) but decent.

The food menu is not diverse, folks.  Healthy food eaters beware -- aside from 2 'loaded' salads (a cobb and one other), there were zero real options for a health nut.  Even the broccoli was listed as "sauteed" on the menu.  

I threw caution to the wind and for dinner I picked the fish tacos and subbed out the chips and salsa for the mac and cheese (topped with bacon).  The hubs got the Smokehouse Burger and fire fries.  While my fish had a good season on it, there just wasn't a whole lot of it, but there WAS a ton of the cabbage slaw on top.  The mac and cheese was just ok.  Hub's burger came with 2 patties even though he specified just one patty (it is an option for a few bucks less), so he took one patty off.  The patties appeared a little Mc-pre-formed and flat-top cooked -- not grilled.  Disappointing.  The fries were just regular thick cut frozen steak fries with some "cajun" seasoning on them.  Meh.    

Food aside, I do have 2 general gripes to share.  Uh oh... 
-- I feel that I need to advocate for the servers here when it comes to their uniform -- and no, not in the feminist "women are being objectified at Twin Peaks" kind of way.  What I mean is this -- it was almost 90 friggin degrees outside and you have these gals in thick knee socks and black Ugg boots?  Sure, the top 1/2 of their body gets plenty of ventilation, but seriously?  That footwear and sock combo? And as a former server I know that non-slip shoes in the kitchen were a must... what happened here, folks??  And is Ugg material even sanitary with food rehash and kitchen gunk on them?  Sorry -- just had to be said.

-- My biggest gripe of the whole deal is that they allow smoking on the covered patio while people dine and it is mere feet from the doors in to the restaurant.  There was a dirty ash tray on our table when we sat down and patrons from inside were stepping "out" around our table to smoke while we were trying to stomach a meal.  YUCK.  We even had to ask the young men at the table next to us to kindly turn off the fan mounted above their table as it was blowing their smoke directly at us.  UGH. This seriously put a damper on our meal and overall experience.

All in all, I would give our TP experience a one and a half star rating based on the pricey meh-esque food and the aforementioned gripe alone, but the beer was good and our server was really sweet.  I just don't see us rushing back to Twin Peaks for another $50 meal any time soon.  Perhaps to watch a game and have a beer, but not for the lackluster food.

We had a server named John who was awesome!! He was so knowledgeable and gave great recommendations on what we should order. The dutch pancake was delicious and my friends liked what they ordered as well. Shrimp and grits were amazing... We will definitely be back!

Everything about this location confused me at first. As an alum of the building across the street, I was perplexed at how such a massive building with so many parts would fit *right there*. Like, how would that work? As a result, I gave it some space for a while. Not that it did anything wrong. I just didn't understand the physics behind the construction. And then I ventured inside...

I don't know how they did it... I don't know what kind of witchcraft was involved but the powers that be managed to create a space that's light, airy and much more massive than I would imagine from the outside. This isn't Caviar & Bananas' first time at the rodeo -- and it shows. This is the perfect Midtown breakfast/lunch spot. With dedicated areas that fit whatever mood you're in, you're sure to find something to suit your needs. Want a gluten-free muffin? Do it. Need some frozen rose in your life? All the time! I mean, you can find that here. Feel like some bougie grocery shopping? Okay. Looking for some international candies? They have 'em. In the mood for a sandwich? They can do that.* Fancy a salad? Let's do that... and that's what I did. A very smiley and kind young woman walked me through the menu. She told me her favorite was the Baja, so I ordered that. I was planning on eating my salad there but she prepared it in a to go box. I don't know if that's standard (a set up like C&B seems that it should go hand in hand with cool plateware) but it happened. With the to go box in hand, I took the salad to go and made my way home.

The salad was delicious. The combo of romaine, cotija cheese, avocado, corn, tomato, cucumber, jicama, pickled onions, and pumpkin seeds was a nice, bright burst of health with every bite. I haven't had much jicama since leaving Miami so that was a nice plus and the pumpkin seeds added depth to what could have been a flat salad. I was particularly pleased with the sliced avocado on top of the salad because I love avocado and rarely get a full one in a salad. I asked for the chipotle lime vinaigrette 'on top' and the dressing came mixed into the salad so it was more of an element of the dish than a last minute addition. C&B is a pretty spot on fast casual ladies who lunch destination. If you would have mentioned the concept and location five years ago, I would have said you were crazy. After being there a couple of times, I don't know what took so long.

*I was in the mood for a sandwich but it took a little while for the gentleman behind the bar to approach me and when he did, he was wiping his nose. With the superflu making the rounds, I declined.

My husband and I have been longtime fans of Green Pheasant and Two Ten and recently took some friends. For context most of us are gluten free and dairy free and some of us avoid red meat.

The new layout of the menu made it super easy to make great choices. Our server, who was friendly and attentive, didn't seem to know what was and was not compliant but did make sure to talk to the kitchen for us and made a great sake recommendation. 

Outside our normal faves (Tebasaki Gyoza, tuna tartare and wedges), we loved the new cold additions, including the yellowtail sashimi. And the fries were great!

Fun vibe and great meal. It's our go to for whenever we are downtown.

We passed Copper Vine while en route to another restaurant and immediately said we have to try this before going home. It's so beautiful and inviting. We dined there the next day and enjoyed our server/bartender Britt and the drinks/food. The decor is gorgeous with touches of copper accents throughout. It has a sleek feel with greenery throughout. They also have Happy Hour from 2pm-6pm so that was a plus.

Food: Charcuterie Tray 

Drinks: Frose and HH Rose

Pros: HH Rose - not to sweet and it packed a punch, Charcuterie Tray - super tasty, the atmosphere 

Cons: Frose - it's overly sweet. Patrons should be warned of this or encouraged to pair it with something salty to cut it.

Overall: Fabulous experience and we can't wait to get back!

This ice cream place is very cute and tasty.  They were generous with the scoop sizes and overall, the hubby and I were happy.  I was a bit annoyed when the man helping us put a limit to the number of samples we tried between us to 3, when we ordered 4 scoops of ice cream.  It wasn't like we were not ordering each thing we tried.  I found this off putting as we were ordering scoops as we went.  I did not appreciate the attitude.
  
The hubby had the chocolate obsession and chocolate peanut butter in a cookie cone.  Both these flavors were very tasty, but the peanut butter stood out.  The cookie cone was not tasty.  It reminded me of that children's cereal, but much worse.  It was superbly hard and tasteless.

I had the red velvet cake and the birthday cake.  The red velvet was delicious.  I greatly enjoyed it.  The birthday cake was the 4th flavor that I was not allowed to try.  I liked it, but found it over sweet.  I still ate it all. 
We were filled with heavy cream and took off to walk it off.  

Overall, this is a good ice cream shop.  It is certainly not the best I have ever had.  The reviewers who felt this was the best ice cream they have ever had need to take a trip to Nantucket and Martha's Vineyard during the summer.  Here, the homemade ice creams shops line the street and each place is better than the next.

Worth the wait don't hesitate! 

We waited in line for about 15-20 minutes but I'm so glad we stuck it out. Helena bakery offers a great variety of local produce that's both healthy and tasty. 

We ordered four variety of dishes. All of which were savory. Avocado toast, farmers market bowl, tomato sandwich and the Turkey sandwich. They all came lightly seasoned but we asked for a side of the chipotle Dijon sauce and it was amazing. 

I'm not much of a sweet breakfast kind of gal but they seemed to have amazing pastries and they were running out fast. 

The outdoor seating was the perfect start to our morning. Loved having all the birds around and some rays of sunshine peeking through the trees.

Prices are a little on the higher side.

Love this fabulous place! The food is deVINE and Justin is our favorite! They say 3 times is a charm, so what is 10 times? The flatbreads are so delicious and the Brussels sprouts... lets just say I don't need chocolate for dessert because I brought an order of these crispy, caramelized beauties home with me.
The food is terrific, my bartender, Makinzie, was amazing....5 stars if someone for the love of God updates the music. Greatest hits from 1976 ain't cutting it.

I love this place..  I love their chunky fried dumplings, sesame balls, n more... never disappointed when I go there...  you even call them in advance if you have a  party , they can even make extra fresh bakery for u!

Love this place!  It's a locally owned business and part of our community.  We found them during COVID and ordered curbside on a regular basis.  We are now regulars.  My daughter always orders steak and she says it always cooked perfectly.  I typically order their specials and have never been disappointed.  Their indoor dining area is now open and there is a lovely patio in the back for warmer weather.  The food is always fantastic and the service is exceptional.  Make sure to leave room for dessert; the brownie pie topped with homemade ice cream is awesome.  They also have a great selection of wine.  Check out their website for special events such as wine tasting nights.  If you are in the Kirkwood area I highly recommend Sunset 44.

We discovered The Pearl during our evacuation to the Saint Pete Beach area during Hurricane  Dorian. We always look for unique food when out of town, and The Pearl hit the mark. The lamb, shrimp, cous cous, etc., were all fabulous. The vegetables resembled a magazine photograph. We loved the Moroccan decor, food options, service, wine list, and everything else about this place. Thank you for a great evening with friends away from home!

Oh man. Mahony's did not live up to the hype. 

My friend ordered the fried oyster poboy and this is where the trouble began. About a quarter way through, she found a tiny pearl in her poboy. When presented with said pearl, the waiter said this was a fluke and that this never happens. A few bites later, alas, another pearl was found. In the same sandwich. The manager this time apologized and comped the sandwich.

We ordered the fried pickles and a fries, which were both pooled in grease when they came to the table. 

The redeeming grace for Mahony's was that my fried shrimp po boy, alligator sausage po boy, as well as the service and the beverages were great. 

I'd like to think that my experience at Mahony's was a fluke.

Stopped in and its like the old Yards times 300... Just a way cool industrial space with various sitting / standing areas. There is a fireplace area, a bar area, a plant area, an open table eating area, and then a huge play area for kids with swings and slides,,, what a concept,, so basically you can come with a bunch of friends with kids and let the kids go wild in the play area while you have some home made brews.. full kitchen which looks ok, but didn't see the menu, but knowing Avram Hornick he knows how to satisfy everyone's taste. This place is the bomb.
You don't have a sitter for the night, I'd take the kids here and let them go hog wild while you go hog wild ,, i hear though kids have to clear out by 9PM, but who's really watching...

This gem is hidden of a side street on Helena ave. Amazing avocado toast and chicken panini. The bread is definitely home made and the espresso was on point. Parking is minimal so you have to uber or find a far away spot and walk like we did   But worth it!

Will never return.  I must have been to Tuna Bar at least 10 times last year.  However my last experience was the most atrocious experience I have ever had.  I understand that it was the first opening day and some hiccups are to be expected, but Friday is quite beyond.  First we arrived at our reservation time of 7:30.  Once we arrived we were told by the very disheveled matradee that they were running about 30 minutes late.  No issue so we took a walk around the block.  We arrived back at 8 and were told we were the 2nd table to be seated after 1 couple and they were cleaning 2 tables at that moment.  We sat on the bench at which point I watched him seat 2 couples.  Then another customer who showed up later than us went and said something and he sat them at a 4 top.  At that point I went back up and he looked at his computer and couldn't find my name. He eventually found it and looked confused.  He said I'll be the next couple and said here's a $25 gift card.  It was only $15 when I opened at home.  We waited another 15 minutes at which point a waiter started going to everyone including us to tell us they were out of food.  

There were multiple chances to tell us they would be out.  Instead we waited and waited, watched other people be seated when we were due to be next.  I rather write to you directly then putting my review on social sites as I think you should know about my full experience.  The waiter did give us a $50 gift card as he did with others for running out of food.    I emailed the restaurant direct with no response.  DONE

My girlfriend & I stopped in here one night before our reservation at Ralph's. We had an hour before dinner and decided to sit and have a drink here. Oddly enough, we checked their reviews and decided to give it a try. We got to talking with the bartender and she informed us that Ralph's owned Bar One. We glanced at the menu while we had our drinks and both agreed that we had to come back here. 

Fast forward a few months and we ended up back at Bar One for brunch. It was around 12:30 when we got there and I believe their brunch is 11-2:30 Then the kitchen closes for an hour and they start dinner at 3:30 PM. My girlfriend got Eggs Benedict that she really enjoyed. I ended up getting the cheesesteak omelette with their special wiz sauce on top. I didn't ask how they made their sauce but I suspect it's a mixture of wiz cheese and heavy cream; it was to die for. The entire meal was phenomenal. Their menu is also very eccentric which, as a foodie, I really enjoy. 

The staff is very friendly and informative. They also have a lot of drink specials. If you love Bloody Mary's you'll love it there. 

They seem to be a new bar so I wanted to make sure I gave them a good review to help spread the word. I definitely recommend Bar One and I'll be back.

Delicious and nutritious rolled into one! Try the Cuban sandwich or the turkey ham they're the best sandwiches I have ever tried! The avocado and bacon gives it an amazing taste, the sourdough bread is really delicious!

I was in town visiting and wanted to try this Mike's ice cream due to the high reviews. Unfortunately I did not have as pleasant of an experience as everyone else. I ordered a black cherry shake and it tasted awful. The shake was too runny and the flavor tasted like cough syrup. I don't recommend this place and I will not be returning. I'll try a different ice cream place next time.

We stopped in for dinner at around 5:40 pm on a Thursday night. We were relieved to see that most of the tables were empty so we assumed there'd be no wait.
NOPE!
The un-enthusiastic host stated the wait would be forty-five (!!) minutes because they were expecting two large parties.
I said, "oh. So they have reservations?"
Him: "no."
Okay so we went into the "bar" to regroup, and apparently said bar is not open despite two employees behind the bar doing SOMETHING all while desperately if not frenetically trying to avoid making eye contact with us.
What a miserable experience at a restaurant I USED TO enjoy a lot.
We took our business to an adorable little Italian spot called Pasta Fresca (6135 Lakeside Drive) where we were treated like valued guests, not annoying inconveniences. And the food is INCREDIBLE! (Review to follow!)

So me and my buddies come almost daily when we're in Indi today we had a waitress named Imani beautiful girl but my god I had never had a worse experience in any restaurant this shit sucked she made us wait for hrs to get a check drinks anything we never saw her or could find her I know other waitresses her do a great job so it sucks that one person can ruin our experience of the place

I took my 14 year old daughter there the other day, Bailey was our server and she was awesome !!!! The child is picky and Bailey was super patient even though they were busy allowing her to ask questions and get answers. We definitely will be back!!!!!
Best wings in the area hands down! Tried three sauces and all were delicious. Great service, great food, great atmosphere we will definitely be back!
We came here last night for a girls night and had such a great time! Our bartenders were Chance and Josh, and they went WAY above and beyond to make our night wonderful

I paid for bottomless mimosas and it was not bottomless. Server was disrespectful and not trusting. I am disappointed in the service. I asked many times for a refill and didn't get it while other tables did. Very expensive.

It has been a year since i went back to this place because of poor service. Tonight was beyond words. Our waitress Christina (tina) was one of the best i have had in a long time. From the minute she came over to our table she had us laughing, talking and just having a great time. She took her time with us snd treated us as though we had been friends for a long time. So refreshing, I will come back again and ask for her. Keep up the great service. You deserve a raise.

Atmosphere - 5/5 

Beautifully designed space, with a nice ambience to it. Music is neither too loud nor soft. Logo is simple and nice. Menu has a nice feel with minimalistic approach in design. Overall, the interior design is one of my favorite things about this place.

Service - 3/5

Host is friendly and the waiters are nice. Nothing extraordinary. The only thing I thought (and maybe it wasn't appropriate for me to expect?) was that there would be an introduction to the sushi sampler/omakase we ordered. I'm clearly not a sushi expert so I had no idea what I was eating, but I kind of wish I did. I guess I was used to an intro/story typically offered at other sushi places for an omakase.

Food - 3/5

What I ordered the few times I've been here:
Rittenhouse Roll, J&J, Omakase/Sushi Sampler & Fried Oysters 

The rolls were great. I enjoyed the Rittenhouse Sq Roll thoroughly and the J&J was good to taste. The fried oysters and sushi samplers weren't my favorite. The fried oysters were too sea watery for my taste, and the sushi samplers didn't feel too fresh to me.

Price - 2/5

For the price of the food, I would expect a little more from the food and service itself. The interior design matches what I would expect in pricing. 

Overall I would give this place a 3.5 if I could. Thank you for the experience!

Service was great - trendy spot in Old city! They have plenty of seating for any size group. There's the sushi bar as well as a full alcohol bar with seating to be at. There are small 2 seater "booths" that would be cute for dates  as well as large tables that have a mix of a sofa seating as well as chairs. 

They do take opentable reservations! However, when we got there, it wouldn't have been an issue to get a table - but we also went at 8 Pm on a Wednesday:) 

Starters:

Blood orange fluke - best part of the meal. The fluke was so gooood and went really well with the capers, blood orange, and radish pieces! I couldn't get enough! A must ORDER!! 

Rock shrimp: this was good as well!! I liked it because it wasn't coveredddd in sauce or heavily fried. It was the perfect balance of sauce and batter  - there was radish pieces as well - which I loved! Gave it a nice, refreshing crunch to your bite. 

Lobster rice - this was just your usual fried rice ... with lobster and mushrooms. Some at my table said it was too salty - I think it was the mushrooms - but the rice itself was decent. I'd order it if I wanted fried rice ‍
