Soba noodles with shrimp - this was good too. My pick over the rice, actually. However, we had this after the rock shrimp and fluke - and those seemed to be the best! 

Sushi: 

Sushi was decent. But nothing heavenly delicious. I have yet to find a good sushi place in Philly  however, the starters were really good, which would make me want to go back and try the other dishes besides the sushi. Sushi wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing either. But good place to go to take care of that sushi craving! 

The sushi that we tried....

J&J : this was the best out of the 3 we got. It tasted fresh and flavorful. It had a bit of a rich taste which made you feel full after 2! 
Broad street: this was okay. Too many ingredients made the sushi feel soggy and the flavors didn't seem to have .... flavor. Just wasn't a good combo, in my opinion.
Dynamite : your typical rollllll- which isn't a bad thing. Smaller than the first two, good to have a traditional roll with your specialities!

This place was terrible!
The ambience was great. 
But!!!
Our waiter had a lumberjack flannel shirt with a baseball cap.
Our appetizer was a smoked Bok Choi that was extremely watery and had a terrible taste.
Also had the spicy crab noodle dish which was very small with mediocre taste.
The Sui Gyoza we are very small and handle very little flavor.
You have to pay your bill at the tour and we had to actually find somebody at the cash register.
Very pretentious and expensive with small portions.
Great food, good atmosphere. Loved the fried buffalo oysters and the crawfish etouffe was a hit also. Brandon, our server, was friendly, attentive, and had some good recommendations.

How can an order of pho take an 1 hour and 15 minutes to make!!!!! No thank you. They had no system for getting the food out. People were flustered and they over sold on items. Terrible. Lesson learned. drive to pho Quyen, it will be faster and cheaper.

Another gem in Santa Barbara! Love the location, walking distance to the beach. My first time here it took me two walk arounds to find the place. Outside seating is perfect way to get your day started. I order the Breakfast Sandwich on Brioche and the Ricotta Toast with Strawberry Jam. Both were delish!! I was blown away with the fluffy egg on the brioche. The egg had a fluffy light texture which was contrasted by the crunchy bacon. I really enjoyed the ricotta toast which had the perfect amount of sweetness, crunch and creaminess. Can't wait to visit this gem again.

Good flavor. The shredded beef soup had no beef in it, just onions and leek in a tasty broth. The beef mains was really light on beef as well. Chicken mains wasn't as light but still not that much. It seems like they're trying to keep their prices low by using less meat but I'd rather pay more and enjoy the flavor they bring.

I have been here a couple of times, the most recent being yesterday for dessert after a ho hum lunch at Margaritaville.

I highly recommend the Red Velvet Cake ice cream as well as the Chocolate and Banana milkshake!!

Great old time ice cream parlor atmosphere!!
Our hockey team walked in after the Mrs Hockey testing and they totally took care of us! Brookie "Cookie" and the kitchen crew rocked it!! And, with a smile!! #DreamTeam ! Will be back!

Tried just about every sweet bun available. This has got to be the best brioche dough I have tasted in a long time. The fillings, while delicious, were a bit skimpy in some of the buns. Red bean and crispy coconut were standouts. Taro was lovely but could've had more oomph. Sesame balls were the one thing I didn't like: fryer needed an oil change, so that was all I could taste. Would return for the brioche goodness, great prices, friendly staff.

Hidden gem that's beyond 5 stars! Wish I took pictures but will definitely be going back. 

One of the greatest bbqs I've had! All the meet was so juicy, tender, and flavorful. We got the bbq tower which came with thick Texas toast that tasted like a thicker cornbread, with pickled vegetables, pickled onions, pickles that tasted like bread and butter pickled mixed with horseradish, and coleslaw. We got the jerk rubbed chicken, ribs, and brisket and the ribs were my favorite with the chicken a close 2nd. 

They also had specials on a Saturday night! $5 wings and pork poutine fries, both of which were delicious. The wings were better than expected, very juicy and flavorful. 

On top of that, very friendly staff, extensive beer selection, and really spacious with a cool interior. 

Highly recommend!

Last night me and my wife ate there and the food was very bland, no taste. Wife ate the mama trio and I had the chicken parmesan . Sorry that's the second time we been there over a 10 year period. The only good thing about our experience was we had 2 mai tai's and they were great. Our waiters were great also. For $80.00 we can get way better food.

I have always liked Macaroni Grill. I know COVID has taken a toll on the staffing, but the excuse is getting old. It took 10 minutes to get a hostess to take our name.  She told us it would be 10 minutes. Well, after 30 minutes we were seated. Our server was pleasant and quick to take our order. She was attentive.  She was good, especially since it was only her 2nd day working here. As you can see from the picture, the edge of the table was damaged. I wouldn't have mentioned it, but I  kept catching my sleeve on the jagged edge.

Many of their specialties are pretty good and the toppings are generously applied. I feel like the ingredients they use are fresher than what you get at other places. Surprisingly they offer no deals or promotions, so you have to live at all times with their "regular" price, but, in full honesty, their   price is not crossing the decency's limits.

Wow!  You definitely must check this place out.  I just had the best ice cream ever.  There are so many unique and fun flavors.  I LOVED the Blackberry with Cornbread.  It sounds weird but it really hit the spot.

I'm not usually one to leave reviews, but I really did not enjoy my time here. Stopped by on a Sunday night. Place wasn't packed at all. The food we ordered was pretty awful, not really worth any of the money we paid for it. Drinks were overpriced and small in size. The atmosphere inside this place was awful, there wasn't even music playing except the occasional song that someone put on the jukebox. No sort of entertainment at all. The bartender working that night had to be chased down numerous times, and she took our orders by screaming at us from across the room rather than coming over to us. Her friend came in at some point, and we were entirely ignored from that moment onward as they sat at the other end of the bar and gossiped with each other. Sadly, I will never be back here. I love a good dive bar and I'm all about supporting small businesses. But this was by far the worst experience I've ever had in my life.

A perfect, intimate place to get a bite of authentic Korean food! I came on a weekday evening for dinner. There are many people ordering takeout, but I sat in an ordered the dolsot (stone pot) chicken bibimbap. The menu is simple, and specializes in bibimbap, as the name indicates. The ingredients are all so fresh and there is the perfect amount of sauce pre mixed in. The owner, Francis, is so gracious and I am excited to come back.

My mom loves this joint. A trip to chinatown is not complete without some  egg tarts. They are delightful even two days later.

They are also insanely cheap and take credit cards.
I really enjoyed myself here for the first time and server Emily was great if I come back to Alton I'll definitely come here

Very disappointed last night. We ordered the mama's trio. The chicken parmigiana was Burt through and through. It was a charcoal brick with some sauce on it.  They weren't that busy to not check before it went out of the kitchen

I went there a while back with my wife and was disappointed. We went there specifically to sample a pasta dish. I had spaghetti with meat balls. The sauce was watery and the meatballs were so dense that I had to use a knife to cut through them.  Additionally, we weren't thrilled with service. We were not told of any specials or asked about wine choices. However, a larger group came in and got better service as the waitress appeared to have known the group. In the past I've had a much better experience. It may have been an off night and also the server. I was very unimpressed with pasta dishes we were served at an Italian restaurant.

This place has a great Yelp reviews, but after having dinner here I would not give it four-star at all.  We ordered the Daily specials of Shrimp Pancake and Japchae. The Pancake served with six tiny slices at $6.95  was pretty pricy and could not really taste any shrimp inside. Japchae does not have any protein and it was priced at $9.95. The rest of the party ordered Beef Bibimap, and it was decent.

Went to this place a few days ago for lunch with coworkers, as our office is right up the block. Couldn't be more disappointed. For the price, it was atrocious. Paid $14 for a rice and chicken dish, which had absolutely no flavor at all. Had to douse it in chill oil and soy sauce to get any flavor. Worse part they charged us for the soy sauce, chill oil, and spices ($2-3 each). If you're in the mood for a flavorless $20 lunch, come here. Otherwise, keep walking. Can't believe I'm saying this, but even the food in a Broadway honky tonk is better than this sad excuse for a restaurant.

I loved my culinary experience at Mahony's so much. If it's the weekend come early or get a reservation to avoid the wait. My partner and I sat in the back, which was away from the hustle and bustle. Ask for seats: near the hot sauce wall if you want a little privacy.

'Taste of Mahony's for 2' was great for trying a bit of everything. Spiced potato salad was small and should have more included but man, that was good. The alligator sausage was sweet and went well with all the sides. Gumbo was on point. I loved the short rib and French fries. Salty, but their short rib with French fries.... mmmmm yesss. My only meh was the pimento cheese because it didn't accommodate well with the rest of the dish. I'd much rather have more of the potato salad. 

Service was great and overall I liked it so much I returned but with an hour and half wait I chose another spot. If it's in route to your stay or you're a local, I would definitely give them a visit.

We attended an Italian wine tasting here recently. The restaurant and bar decor is very traditional and well maintained. We arrived early and ordered a glass of wine while we waited. The bartender made us feel at home. The bar filled up quickly and it was apparent that quite a few customers were regulars. We moved on to the tasting in their event space where we we served a nice selection of Whites, reds and one sparking wine. The wines ranged in price but none were outrageous and the Barolo, while the most expensive was spectacular for less than $50 a bottle. The Pinot Grigio was one on the least expensive but was also quite good.  There were plenty of appetizers and they were generally tasty but not spectacular. A really fun event.

The Green Pheasant is a fantastic addition to the Nashville food scene! 

Food: We had the Kinoko Mushroom Medley and Dandan Shishito Peppers -- both were fantastic. The broth/sauce in the mushroom dish was perhaps one of the best things I've eaten this year.

Bar Menu: Good selection of sake and other liquors. The staff are knowledgable and willing to help you find a sake that suits your palate. We had the whiskey barrel-aged sake which was served in a jar that you open yourself -- fun! Bartender Mike was friendly and remembered me the next time I came in.

Ambiance: The mid-century vibe meshed with Japanese culture seems a bit odd when you break it all down into individual parts but together, as a whole, the place is totally Nashville and just works. The decor is hip and on-trend while still sending out a warm and inviting ambiance. I LOVE the die-cut booth dividers which still let in light but create a nice division of space. 

My only wish would be for a more diverse Happy Hour drink menu, which currently features sake and beer. How about bubbly and whiskey?

All in all, The Green Pheasant is a wonderful date night, after-work light bites, or a classy kick-start to your Broadway tourist experience.

Great array of flavors! Super hospitable staff. Fair pricing considering the location. My wife said the chai tea latte was awesome. I really enjoyed my two scoop sundae with butterscotch overload and maple butter blondie ice cream smothered in caramel sauce.

My family and I had Macaroni Grill yesterday for lunch. I highly recommend the chicken parmigiana. I substituted angel hair pasta with Alfredo instead of the spaghetti that normally comes with it, and it was fantastic. The calamari appetizer was cooked perfectly. The customer service was excellent, even though we got our food for carry out, there was no shortage of bread and dipping sauce. The manager on duty personally delivered the food to us and she herself made sure that we got everything we ordered before we left. I recommend macaroni grill on south Virginia to everyone. 7 out of 5 stars. We will be back.

This was my first and definitely last time. I would not recommend. I was being generous to give it 2 stars the only good thing is that it was clean. The waitress was very slow and inpatient. She was unprofessional in sharing her feelings about my disappointment to her co worker!!. I said that my wings were not done. They were hot wings and the skin was soft and wet as if it was not cooked hard enough it was still light no color besides the sauce. In addition, the other 2 orders that were brought out at the same time had the same complaint from 2 other tables. She frowned up her face and said a thermometer was stuck in them and they are done. When she took them back ,it took another hour before the new ones were brought
 The lamb burger was seasoned great but had toooo much salt. To top it off, the pasta had a peice if hair in it. We did not complain or say another word. We just packed up and left

Overall, I enjoyed Helena Avenue Bakery.  The atmosphere was great, and it was fun to watch the bakers make the bagels and other food through the large window.  I ordered the bacon, cheddar, and egg biscuit.  I was hoping it would be flavorful, but it was pretty bland.
Very clean environment and friendly staff! Lots of seating options so wait time is very minimal! Delicious food

Amazing sushi. MUST TRY. And worth the drive from center city.
Also tried the dumplings, fried rice and rock shrimp. Ended up ordering seconds of the rock shrimp. Can't wait to go back!
We stopped here for lunch. Great atmosphere and location. Lots of windows.  Food was fantastic.  I had the shrimp Po-Boy and it was great.

I heard Baskin Robbins has 31 flavors of ice cream? Well, Mike's has insane amount. Their flavors are funky and fun, but also classic. I love how their flavors exclude artificial taste and texture. It is creamy and think, yet not overwhelmingly sweet. Wait, but did you know that they make amazing hot chocolates? Their gourmet hot chocolates are must try as well. My favorite is hawaiian hot chocolate. Perfect when it's cold.

We met our Son and his family there for Brunch on Sunday, we had the shrimp and grits, it was the best I have ever had!  We also got the wings because I cannot go there and not get the wings, they are the best around also!  Plus I got a free beer from Checking in on Yelp, can't beat that!  I am ready to go back soon.  The wait staff was so friendly and helpful.  After we ate we got to watch our Grandsons play hockey!  Great place to eat and watch hockey!

ok this place is really weird the exterior is super pretty and it gives off rich person brunch vibes but it is essentially a cafeteria??? there is a salad bar, a deli area, a bakery, and then you can buy chips, drinks, etc at a cash register. i got the buffalo chicken salad--it was pretty mediocre. the lettuce and chicken was good but the dressing was super bland and there was way too much cabbage. this is a place to grab a salad or something on your way to your job, don't expect a brunch place or sit down restaraunt really--I thought it was just a cafeteria for Vanderbilt at first.

FOOD: 3/5
SERVICE: 5/5
ATMOSPHERE: 3/5

This place has a good selection of breakfast items. I stop by sometimes on my dog walk loop. The green eggs and ham sandwich is amazing. Pesto pairs nicely with everything on it but the best part of their sandwiches is the delicious biscuit it comes on. I also recommend the fried chicken sandwich. It can be kind of greasy but that helps hangovers (or so I've convinced myself). If you like a little kick in the morning, go for it! (Ask for extra napkins). Would give five stars but I got the impression the restaurant isn't as dog-friendly as other places around town.

I think the food is good however my problem is with the lack of anywhere to change a diaper. This place offers high chairs so they welcome kids but they don't have a changing table in any of their restrooms. There is absolutely nowhere to change a diaper other than on a booth bench in the restaurant. The owner or manager didn't seem to care. This place has a banquet room which hosts large parties like rehearsal dinners and possibly other family events yet you can't put a cheap plastic changing table in the handicap stall???

I had had dinner at Tuna Bar less than one week after their opening and was extremely impressed! Upon arrival I was glad I had made an Open Table reservation as every table was reserved and the last bar seats had just been swiped. At first glance, you notice the stunning and modern decor. This place is gorgeous! From the wood bar to the cool fans, you get the trendy ambiance that is often missing from sushi spots. 

The bar menu was small but each drink was really interesting. It's clear that they are committed to craft cocktails and keeping an upscale bar. Our waiter also informed us that a lengthy sake menu will be arriving soon.  

The food was delicious! Started with the rock shrimp. Perfect. Moved on to the lobster fried rice which was extremely flavorful and not at all greasy. Had a few rolls for our main course all of which were extremely fresh and with a good rice to fish ratio. 

The service was friendly, knowledgeable and not at all overwhelmed or (seemingly) stressed considering it was open weekend. Overall, I left already thinking of when I would go back. 

You can't go wrong checking out this new old city gem!

Stood in line this morning for take away.  Line was really long (Saturday morning so it is expected) but couldn't wait for my sourdough toast lol!  As always, the strawberry peppercorn jam is just amazing!  Ordered also a breakfast sandwich on brioche, french toast, avocado toast with a 7 minute egg ($3 extra), an olive loaf, and a pomegranite iced tea.  I would have given this a 4 but the wait was ridiculous after ordering.  The people behind me in line were waiting for 4 coffees for over 20 minutes and my food took 1/2 hour.  With nowhere to sit, only a place to stand by the dirty dish drop off, 1/2 hour is an eternity.  Got home and no egg on the avocado toast to boot.  The brioche sandwich is a bit bland... I only ate 1/2 of it and left the rest on the counter for anyone else to eat and it is still there lol.  My son LOVED the French toast and my daughter said the avo toast was good.  Bummed about the egg though.  Will try again and hopefully it will be not so long... the kids in the kitchen area have no sense of urgency lol but again, good.  (Also, the guy taking the orders was SUPER sweet!)

Recently met with a large group of friends for dinner at Sunset 44 Restaurant and had a wonderful meal of  Cedar plank smoked salmon with vanilla sweet potatoes and vegetable medly.  Yum!  Many appetizers were shared among the group: toasted ravs (better and bigger than most, and very tender & tasty), crab cakes, and chicken bites with sweet chili sauce were my favorites.  Other diners at our table ordered entrees of bacon-wrapped sea scallops (huge!), steaks that looked mouth-wateringly good, pasta and chicken.  Everyone enjoyed their meals and we were served by a wonderful young lady, Crystal who was a very attentive waitress and entertaining, as well.  We thoroughly enjoyed our evening and were not rushed to vacate the table, as some places do.  Would definitely go again.
Nothing serious, just a super rude attitude infested wrist-tattooed manager with no regard for customers.

Stopped in here for my birthday a couple of weeks ago. Great quality fish and delicious ingredient combinations. A lot of the special sushi rolls that sounded good were mainly tuna though. I would like to see more choices with another type of fish, but can't complain too much hence the name, Tuna Bar. 

Although the food was amazing, the service could be better. It took a little longer for our server to come check on us after the food came out. It was later in the evening, so I figured they were busy closing out on a few other tables - fair enough. However, we were then not checked on again for another 30-40 minutes after we were done eating. We all kind of just sat there with empty plates and water glasses wondering if we should ask the hostess to track them down. The restaurant was not busy at all at this point...maybe four tables throughout the whole restaurant (with 3 or so servers working) and a few people at the bar. Nonetheless, we will be back as the location and food outweighs the hit or miss service.

Such a fun place! The cars were a blast to look at, the service was excellent, and the environment was stellar. The waitress recommended the hot sausage poboy. I don't usually love sandwiches, but this was to die for. Highly recommend!

Way pricier than I thought it would be and some of the front staff were not pleasant, but the food is absolutely amazing and so is the ambiance. I would definitely return for a drink and an appetizer or something but not again when I'm starving because I'm just too poor to fork out a few hundred dollars for a meal with one other person. Portions are very small.

While I understand how some places can be wary of dogs in their establishments, craft hall's website encourages bringing service dogs! But Josh rudely kicked me and my family out - this type of discrimination is illegal under PA law. Even if he was confused or misguided, it really doesn't make up for his aggressive behavior. We had children and my elderly parents with us! This wasn't the family friendly atmosphere the place was going for.

Admittedly, it's a cool vibe interior and the location is conveniently close to my office, but no more visits here because this restaurant has lost any attachment to reality getting so expensive that it pissed me off.  I've always appreciated that this bakery has nice treats in a space where you can watch production. However it was charging $1.50 for a coffee refill which was already the most expensive coffee refill in town.  

Now, you'll pay $2 FOR A COFFEE REFILL.  Nope...no mas! I'm done with these clowns regardless of how cute or convenient it is. Businesses can certainly raise prices per some supply and demand curve or supposed ROI or other factors as if they are just spreadsheet driven choices, but there comes a point when actual human beings will be so outraged they'll write the business off completely no matter the justification, and they'll tell everyone they know. Helena Avenue Baker crossed that line today. 

BTW it's not just the coffee refills. You'll find poorly conceived sandwiches don't even start until $11 for a baguette with a couple of pieces of meat and cheese thrown in between. To this business and the Lark's other properties which have gotten wildly rich on the revitalization of the funk zone, "How much money is enough for you? At any point, do you feel a responsibility to provide a fair priced service to the community?"

This place was amazing . Great drinks , great food . Friendly staff members . Made sure everything was ok with our meals . The atmosphere was beautiful. Defiantly a cute spot to enjoy lunch or dinner.

I've been to the restaurant before and the wait service as well as the food was definitely good at the time. However, last night we had a very unmotivated waiter and a very bad seafood meal. I ordered the special of the evening which was Hogfish. I wasn't told that a salad was coming and wasn't told even what came with the fish so I had to turn the salad away when it came. When the fish entree arrived it looked very, very small and it was overcooked. The waiter came about the time I was finished the overcooked fish and then asked if I wanted something else. No apologies, no discount on the ticket and certainly didn't express any concern. The waiter really didn't care what I thought about the meal! Very disappointing! Even though I have had good meals here before, I think there are so many other places that have great meals all the time.

The best thing about this place was their drinks!! The service was good and it's a quaint little spot but I was totally unimpressed with the food. The shrimp on my po'boy was small & rubbery (hard to chew), not to mention there was only 5 on the whole sandwich. We chose this spot due to location and we could get a table without having to wait over an hour. Would we go back?? Likely not based on the food quality alone.

My friends and I went to Mike's Ice Cream after an eventful evening on Broadway! We walked in on a busy Saturday night around 10:30 pm yet the Mike's staff were quick and efficient! They still let my friends sample the options and quickly served us. The portion sizes at Mike's are fantastic and a great deal for the price. It is cheaper than other ice cream shops in town and there is more variety. Each of the flavors that were tried/bought were great and made us all happy to end our night there (:

This is the most straightforward name for a business you will ever see. However, don't forget their delicious smoothies and protein shakes! I love this place for a healthy lunch. All of the salads are huge and under $10. I got a make your own salad with spinach, grilled chicken, feta, beets, sundried tomatoes, and carrots for only TEN DOLLARS! Plus, it was a large and kept me full! If you do not want a side of bread they give you a banana which is great for those watching their carbs! 
Salad toppings are extensive, and include all your standard veggies, cheeses, and lean proteins. There is also a pasta salad you can top your salad with. To make things even better there are about 20 different dressings, including multiple fat free dressings. There are tables to sit for lunch and meter parking is outside (I never have trouble finding a spot). 
The couple working here is so nice. If you come here for lunch you will have a great meal and experience! I love supporting this local business.

I can not say enough good things about Copper Vine.  It is very comfortable.  They have a gorgeous patio for outdoor seating and a balcony with fantastic views of the city.  They just added umbrellas to the balcony seating to provide shade and an even better dining experience.  The Charcuterie board is my favorite to start, and they have a great variety of wines and artisan cocktails.    The shrimp and grits, and the duck confit gnocchi are my favorites.  They also have great salads if you are looking to eat healthy.  Also, bottomless mimosas for brunch Saturday and Sunday!  I highly recommend this place!

A friend was celebrating her birthday at happy hour here on Friday night. I arrived around 6:30 and was happy to see happy hour specials were going on until 7pm ($2 domestic beers, $3 craft beers, $4 wells, $5 (heavy pour) glass of wine, and half-price select appetizers). I knew I would be staying awhile and was very happy the bartender allowed me to double-fist in an effort to save some cash! We split some appetizers, fried zucchini which was breaded to perfection and served with chipotle and a cheese dipping sauces. We also ordered margharita flatbread which was a huge portion, toasted ravioli the size of your head, and the crab cake. The appetizers came out quickly and were a welcome change from normal happy hour bar fare as the chefs at Sunset 44 definitely stepped them up a notch. With the comfortable and "homey" bar atmosphere happy hour turned into leaving at 11p and we had a fantastic night! I would like to go back and try the restaurant next time, but the bar is somewhere I can see myself more often!

When the food, the atmosphere, and the service are so great that you want to return a second time in the same day, you know you've got a winner.  Such is the case with Twin Peaks.  I was so impressed with the food and the service at lunch (Arielle was my server) that I had to come back! From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with friendly smiles and a courteous staff.  While the place was very busy, there was no long wait.  Almost immediately after I was seated, Arielle was there checking on what I'd like to drink and answering my specific questions about the menu.  While I've had people at other restaurants seem irritated when I ask questions, Arielle seemed eager to answer my questions and came across as very authentic and helpful.  Her service was over-the-top, too  (not once did I go lacking for anything), but two other things stood out in my mind as well.  While Twin Peaks is a sports-bar/restaurant, they're very family friendly.  That's unusual for many sports bars/restaurants I've visited. Singles, couples, families, and sports enthusiasts waiting to watch the games were all present. And I can't begin to describe how delicious the food was!  For lunch I had "Mom's Pot Roast," but to be honest mom never made it this great.  My dessert was a Twin Peaks Sundae that was amazing.  For my return trip at dinner, I specifically asked if Arielle was available.  I was informed I was in luck.  She had worked a longer shift than usual today.  I wanted to eat lighter, so I had a cup of Blonde Bean with Bacon Soup (delicious!) and asked Arielle specific questions about the items on the dessert menu I still hadn't tried.  (Again, there was no impatience or indifference.  She was warm and friendly and seemed eager to assist me in making my decision.) I decided to go for the Mini Apple Turnovers with Ice Cream and Caramel Sauce.   They were fantastic, but for something with "mini" in the name, I wasn't expecting such a generous serving.  My whole experience (both visits) was fantastic!    As I'm scheduled to leave Indie in a few days (work trip), I regret I won't be able to try many of the other items on the menu until I get back into town.  I can wholeheartedly recommend Twin Peaks to anyone looking for great food, great service, fantastic atmosphere, and great value!  I'll definitely be back!

Formerly I gave 5 stars.  Food & staff are 5 stars! I tried the cinnamon bun, take-out today.  Couldn't taste the cinnamon, bland tasting, pricey! I couldn't eat it...threw it out. Bummer as it wasn't inexpensive! Everything else I've tried is delicious. Hopefully I'll hear back from management!

I ordered Christmas dinner to be delivered at 4:00.  Order was over 30 minutes late and half the order was missing. Called the restaurant only to have a very rude lady tell me she could remake what was missing but I would have to pick it up. Nice customer service. I understand she is away from her family, but I have to leave mine during Christmas dinner to pickup what they forgot. Never again will I order from them. ZERO stars!!!!
Toasty coconut and butter pecan. Absolutely refreshing and creamy. Ppl behind the counter were really friendly.

While visiting good ole St. Petersburg, my cousin invited us for dinner since he was making some ribs. I let him know I would like to bring something because I hate showing up empty handed. Well the weather was not being kind so we just went straight there and I asked my cousin to come with me to the store so we could get something everybody would like and spend some quality time together. We headed up to Publix to get something from the deli but when I saw that their deli no longer makes it fresh, he made a call to his mom and she recommended Cesarina. 

When we arrived, there was a line but OMG did this place smell good. I looked around while my cousin waited in line. The cases were loaded up with some sides, meats, sausages, desserts and olives. I thought I died and went to heaven. I even found some dried pasta that was hand made that I have not been able to find locally. 

I bought some of the potato salad, tortellini salad, two varieties of olives and some marinated artichoke hearts along with 2 bags of pasta to take home to Orlando with me. The ribs my cousin made were lip smackin good but those sides and olives were ALL incredible. The next time I am in Largo, you can bet I will be stopping by this place to grab a few things to take back home to Orlando. 

If you live in the area, you really need to check this place out!!!

Yum .  This place has GIANT portions at affordable prices.  I ordered the hibachi chicken ($7.99) which came with really good cabbage, veggies, fried rice and 2 sauces. I also added mushrooms and zucchini for an extra $1 ea.  You will definitely have leftovers. 

The staff is very friendly and the restaurant is bright and clean. Everything is made to order, so hot and fresh.

I had trouble using their online ordering system, I'm sure that will be fixed soon.

While Sapporos remains my favorite hibachi in Indy (and are twice the price as Hibachi Express), this will remain on my list of "go-tos" for quick, affordable, carryout hibachi. Give this place a try!

The Green Pheasant was probably one of the worst dining experiences I've had to date and I dine out frequently, globally, so I feel I've got decent perspective. It started with check-in and seating. When we arrived, the two hosts, clearly flustered and whom I felt badly for if I'm being honest as they were overwhelmed, were arguing with each other over a table that had been somehow mis-seated. They audibly (and in front of other guests) tried to work this issue out but meanwhile let other guests linger in the very small waiting area in the front without explanation. 

After checking-in at 8:10pm for our 8:15pm reservation, we were told our table wasn't yet ready and when we asked approximately how long the wait would be, we were told "tables are just lingering, so please head to the bar." Anyone who's worked in the Industry understands occasionally this happens after check drops, especially on weekends, however to my surprise upon walking in the dining room I observe multiple open tables/tables that need to be serviced and flipped. 

We are forced to sit at the bar (where the service was really less than stellar and/or quick) until 8:45pm and I'm convinced the only reason we got a table is because a member of our party kept continually checking in with the host to inquire about our reservation. 

Once seated (and starving), we received a brief apology from our server and he noted that this "happens around the 8pm reservation time sometimes," so it seems like this seating delay is a common problem Green Pheasant is aware of. We immediately ordered some dishes because we were starving. Since the first two were raw foods, they were delivered to us fairly quickly. The rest took FOREVER. We were told the kitchen was very backed up and they'd come out as they were ready. To say this was frustrating after our wait to be seated was an understatement. 

I observed a manager on the restaurant floor in our area only once throughout the night. He never did a table touch to ask about or experience in general, or to apologize for the wait for the table or food delays. There was no good faith gesture of any sort or acknowledgement from the restaurant regarding our experience beyond the very brief apology from our server, who obviously doesn't control the kitchen volume. 

The food was decent but to be honest, I was so hungry by the time any food came out, I would have eaten just about anything. 

To summarize, I would never return to The Green Pheasant and am baffled by the positive reviews of this restaurant given what I experienced, observed, and discussed with fellow diners while at the restaurant. What an extremely disappointing (and pricey!) experience.
Some of the best icecream I've ever had! The staff were kind. Homemade icecream was creamy and FULL of flavor!!

The only decent thing here is the Pizza!!!! It's delicious! Other than that you can keep their peppercorn steak and crappy hostess. Last time I actually sat down and had a dinner in there was about a year ago...I was so turned off by how snotty the girls at the front are...they act like you are asking them to tug 700 pounds weights to the table with you. The salads are a huge disappointment, but the pizza...fantastic! Their price for the pizza is very decent!

Tony's menu says "Please let us know what we can do to make your experience unforgettable." Well, they definitely accomplished that.  We went for dinner on the recommendation of a friend.  It was a Friday evening and we didn't have reservations so I was prepared for a wait. I was shocked when the host said it would only be 10-15 minutes. My husband and I stood up front for a few minutes until another hostess asked us to wait at the bar "at the end of the hall". 

We strolled down the hallway past a good number of banquet rooms and finally found the bar through an old swinging door. We stood waiting for about 10 minutes and finally decided to have a glass of wine.  The wine list is mediocre at best.  My husband went to the bar to order and the bartender had no idea which wine on the list he requested.  The bartender's quote was "all I know about wine is red or white". A waiter finally showed him where the bottles were.  After another 15 minutes, we wandered back up front to check on our table.  The host remembered us and said we were next.  We were seated in a cavernous booth after about a 35 minute wait.  

Our waiter came over and seemed immediately disappointed that we already had drinks.  He walked away and came back 15 minutes later to take our orders. I requested a glass of water at that point.  We both ordered pasta entrees and salads.  I got my water pretty quickly and our entrees were close behind.  We then asked about our salads that we hadn't received.  The waiter appeared pretty embarrassed and proceeded to tell us that he was so busy he was sweating and that if we wanted drinks to order now because the table next to us had been waiting about 20 minutes for another round of beers.

The food itself was okay. It was filling and the portions were well-sized, but not something worth a trip back over to Alton. In fact if we are driving through again, I would go out of my way to choose another restaurant.

Easily one of the best restaurants I've been to in my life. They lobster corn dumplings are single bites of some of the best food you could ever have. Their chicken, shrimp wing is incredible. I dream of eating here again.

Had a pretty amazing breakfast experience here last week. We had one of their breakfast sandwich on brioche which came with a thick square slab of egg which looked pretty cool and a breakfast bowl which was pretty tasty. The patio had a nice ambience and the area where it's located is pretty hip.  Will definitely return again when I'm in the area - wished we could have had breakfast there every morning.

The Food: Stopped in with a few co-workers. We ordered the Margherita flatbread and Brussel sprouts for apps. We also shared the Milky Way dessert. I ordered the pick two option, which consisted of 1/2 fried shrimp po-boy and gumbo. 

The flatbread, brussel sprouts and dessert were off the chain! I highly recommend and would order again. The crust of the flatbread was crispy. The red sauce was perfect, not too sour and not too sweet, but jussst right. It was cheesy and the fresh tomatoes were on point. I love brussel sprouts done right and these did not disappoint. Firm and roasted in olive oil. Is that bacon I taste? I don't know, but I wanted seconds. The presentation of the Milky Way was too cute. It had chocolate fudge and blondie/brownie bites, popcorn and honey roasted peanuts, on rings of caramel. All surrounding a center of orange chocolate ice cream from the Creole Creamery. I don't remember the exact name of the ice cream, though. 

My fried shrimp po-boy was good. The bread was toasted and the shrimp were seasoned. The pepper jelly glaze was a nice touch. They applied it with restraint, so the flavor wasn't overpowering. I would opt for the full sandwich next time. The gumbo was earthy with a dark roux. It reminded me of the gumbo my high school served. It was missing the rice and grilled cheese sandwich like the high school version, though. The andouille was good, but they were a bit stingy with only one piece. I think the meat was mostly turkey, which left a lot to be desired. I would've preferred smoked sausage, shrimp or more andouille. Overall, it was a good meal.

The Ambiance: This is one lovely restaurant. I would use it as inspiration to redesign my family room. The colors--navy, copper orange, tan--furniture, fabrics and decor were all breathtaking. I felt at home. It was bright and airy. They also have a cute and sizable patio for outdoor dining. 

The Service was great. Our server was attentive, enthusiastic and knowledgeable. He was passionate about the menu and spoke highly of different dishes.

I'm giving Ardmore Pizza 4 Stars not because their pizza is my favorite, but because the service we received when we went in was so exceptional. Everyone we interacted with was kind and friendly, and even though we didn't call ahead, they put our order right in and we only waited 8-10 minutes for our pizza, while browsing a magazine at their one table.

Ardmore Pizza is not someplace I'd sit down and eat (there's no tables), but I'd get their take out. If the level of service we got in the shop was any indication, their delivery guys are probably awesome, too. The pizza we got was fresh and hot, with tons of cheese and a crispy crust. The sauce was a little sweet for my taste, but I could dig it. I'd be curious to try other types of pizza, since I had gotten the BBQ chicken, and thought that may have influenced the sweet flavor in the tomato sauce a bit. I've also heard their cheesesteaks are killer. More to try!

Thanks for the great service, Ardmore Pizza!

I love this place!  The cakes are always beautifully made and very fresh!  The buns are also very delicious! My favorite bun is the pineapple roast pork bun.  The mixture of sweet and savory is yummy to my tummy!

A Sunday off from work? The perfect opportunity for me to enjoy brunch for once! Weather strikes again and my courtyard reservation had to be moved inside! I arrived early to my reservation, and while many tables had recently been moved indoors because of the weather, the hosts were happy to acknowledge my table would be opening up momentarily. At the bar, I ordered the Gentle Sage (gin, grapefruit, sage) that I had seen online and the manager ensured my drink would be added to my tables tab. I was really impressed by the staff's hospitality and flexibility due to the weather and how an event like that can really throw a wrench in the gears for a small place. 
The dining room was LOUD! It's definitely a hot spot for brunching babes, so I hope to return when the weather isn't so spotty to sit outdoors.
Our server Rebecca was attentive and upbeat, happy to share personal recommendations and ensure our drinks were plentiful.
The menu is expansive and it was hard to choose, so I kept my paper copy to check off the things I had tried, and want to try. A nice detail were the notations indicating vegetarian, and gluten free options! 
We shared the bacon wrapped dates (slap yo momma!), tuna tartare and the sunflower seed salad (I really delighted in the toasty seeds and shaved cheese-not a salad I'd pick outright so it was a delight!)
For mains, we tried the truffle and thyme frittata and the small mushroom pasta with added lump crab. My runny egg was hard boiled but thankfully not over cooked and there was no way I'd be sending my dish back just for the egg. If they are sous vide poached eggs, I hope they recalibrate.
The wine was delicious and the variety of pour sizes was a nice option if you wanted to bounce around and try your palette out on several varietals. However, the standard 5 oz pours are pricey and I didn't see any drink specials that might assist your wallet. Definitely save up if you plan to go bottoms up at brunch.

Got a turtle sundae with 1 scoop each of Tennessee Fudge, Pralines and Cream, and BlackBerry Cornbread. The topping they put on it was a little too rich for my tastes and they forgot my freakin' cherries on top. I still enjoyed it though.

Didn't even get to try the ice cream because I went by the hours posted online stating they are open until midnight. 

Because the hours were listed incorrectly our choices were to be dropped off in a sketchy place at 11:20 at night and then try to find another ride service home or triple the cost of our Uber to take us back to the hotel. Spent $90 getting there and back (only a 10 minute ride each way) just to walk away empty handed. :(

Mike's Ice Cream was a perfect way to end our Nashville trip! I wish we had gone at the beginning of our trip because it is some of the best ice cream I've had.  The line was long but it moved quickly.  The staff was very nice and let me try a sample of one of the flavors I was thinking of eating.  Price was good and it was convieniently located.

They plaster coupons all over S Tucson and the front of their restaurant.  We chose to use the crab puff coupon valued at $4.50 if you order $30 bucks worth of their way overpriced Chinese food.  the fine print gives the expiration date.  The waitress proceeded to tell us it was not valid on the $15.50 per person Chinese dinners even though no where does it state this on the coupon.  After that ordeal we were given the worst service, very small portions, and an uncomfortable overall experience.  The mu shu is very salty to the point I could not eat it and brought it home for my animals.  The General Tsaos chicken is not fried and has zero spice.  They give you a half scoop of rice like your being rationed and the soups were horrific, so thick, salty, with no vegetables to speak off.  the Egg flower soup had no egg in it, and a Bright yellow color like they use food coloring!
Twin Peaks is your typical guys bar, way above Hooters, and on par with tilted kilt.  The thing that puts it over the top is the ICE cold beer served at 29 degrees.

If you guys close at 11 on a weekend.  Maybe you should change the hours on here to the correct ones.  Got there at 11:30pm and she tells me there no longer taking orders. But then turns around and takes another cars order.  Will be calling a manager in the morning Bc they didn't answer my call tonight.

We had a large group of 11 people, so we were able to try almost everything on the menu, and I would definitely eat it all again. Some standouts: sunomono, broccolini, curry udon, tebasaki gyoza (so crispy!!), ikinari steak. Everything was so flavorful and we were all so pleased with everything by the end of our meal. Leave room for dessert! It's definitely worth it! And on top of a delicious meal, the restaurant is gorgeous!

Update: 

Finally got around to visiting for brunch a few weeks ago and it did not disappoint. We were able to sit in their cute courtyard and enjoy the nice weather. All staff were masked and the tables were decently spaced out. 

The brunch options were most pleasing; it was a little hard to choose. We decided to start with the jump lump crab deviled eggs which were light and a great way to open the meal. The crab was fresh and it was a great twist on a classic favorite. For our meals, I settled on the Apple Fritter French Toast and my friend got the Cochon De Lait Benny. 

That french toast? *chef's kiss*. The bread was thick and held up really well against the caramelized fruit and syrup. The pecans offered a nice crunch that broke up some of the richness of the dish. If you're into more sweet/dessert-style brunch options, get this! I wish I could have eaten more but I didn't want to overstuff myself. The Benny was equally as delicious. I loved that their take on it with using a grit cake instead of an English muffin or biscuit. The pork was tender and flavorful and the greens were rather tasty for a restaurant. 

Our service was awesome! Our server, Justin, took really great care of us. If you're ever in his section, please show him some love!

Wait staff and manager were so sweet. Sandwiches were great. The cocktail they brought was so delicious I wish I would've gotten ingredients. Fries were yummy!!  Waitress answered my million questions and got excited about the food herself which says so much!!! Place was very clean!

Got the smoked wings, they were delicious...the "blazing" sauce definitely needs to be amped up a lot, couldn't even get my eyes watering.
McKinzie at the bar was terrific.
Great patio, wine and food! Will for sure be back to try more dishes on this amazing menu. Happy hour 3:00-6:00 and a dog friendly patio with great service!

LOVE that the old Maylie's space has a restaurant that is as beautiful as it was... OK Maylie's (which closed in the 80s was kind of run down but it was still beautiful and that wisteria vine was gorgeous in the spring). Definitely a 5 star space especially considering the last incarnation that was here.

My review is for the brunch menu only. The menu was interesting and had some variety to it. The winner was the dutch baby pancake... that lemon curd was to die for. Even my friend who isn't into sweet breakfast was swayed. One friend had the crab cakes which she said were good but was raving about the duck fat potatoes underneath. The other friend had the couchon and grits. And I had the smoked salmon and egg. So here's the thing each of our dishes had a poached egg and none of the eggs were poached properly. All the yolks were set and for one of us the yolk was set but the white was somehow undercooked. It was weird. 

For my salmon dish, it was tasty and the salmon was well cooked and not overly salty, but the hollandaise (of which there was maybe a tablespoon) was only on the egg, when the salmon could have used the moisture. I think the dish could be excellent with a bit better plating and egg cookage. 

Our drinks were tasty (mimosas and an old fashioned). And they were offering a Veuve special which we did not participate in. One of my friends has been to their happy hour and said it was great but they don't have any information on that on their website. 

Service brings this above a 3 since our server was hustling especially after the restaurant filled up by midday. They've only been open since September so I hope they find their footing.
We had the Banana pudding and Berry and cornbread ice cream, these were awesome! Cool place to sit and people watch.

I'm sure the bartender is selling drugs. She does not want to get you a beer. I think her name is Lisa she drives a black Jetta. The only reason I know that is I saw her seller selling drugs in the parking lot across the street. Avoid this place unless you want drugs.
Service was not the best for the price of the tab, but a pretty interesting place to go to! The inside looks amazing

We needed a quick bite before meeting up with friends, and Helena was walking distance from our Waterman Hotel.  My Americano was a great pick me up, hot and smooth.  I got the biscuit with lavender jam and butter.  The butter and jam taste a bit sour and unfortunately the biscuit was cold and dry. I did not know this til we were eating it down at the beach.  

But - the life saver was definitely the breakfast sandwich in a soft brioche bun.  It has the thickest and fluffiest baked egg in the middle with 
a big slice of bacon. It was simply delicious! They also had a other pastries and sandwiches we wanted to try however just not enough time to come back with our friends' weekend destination wedding.  But to our happy surprise the newly bride and groom catered from Helena for our weekend farewell brunch. We got to try everything else and more!  The chicken sandwich, the Elvis style banana bread, the avocado toast, and the cinnamon roll. The cinnamon rolls was bit thick and dense, but everything else was delicious! Whoa, a breakfast at Helen's will keep your stomach very happy for sure!
Amazing. Wow! Soooo goood. If you are downtown you must stop by. They have a wide selection of sweets but the ice cream is some of the best. They have a great selection.

We've been a month away but the crew remembered us (haha we are hard to forget). I asked our waitress why the crowds were small with pandemic lifted. The food is great, prices in line, staff is exceptional (that crack got me a free bowl of soup!!!). She didn't know. She was thinking the same thing. Within minutes 20 people walked in the place. 

It's obviously not a secret. We all know it's huddled in with barnes and noble but I never see them jammed to capacity. Thank you. I hate to wait and this has been our best experience in Italian since coming to north Nevada!
06/01

Loud, over-priced, very slow service make for a lousy dining experience especially when there are two better options within a couple of blocks. If you want trendy with people looking down at their phones this is the place for you. If not, Tomo and Kisso are a much better experience.
Worst coffee I've ever had for a price $2.50 higher than the almost adjacent Starbucks. A passable but overpriced omelet though.

Unreal and incredible food. We did 4 apps and the skirt steak along with the yakisoba. Flavor in everything was perfect. I wished we weren't in a hotel for the week and we could have taken left overs! 
Highly recommend.

Our first stop in NOLA to get one of these Po-Boys I keep hearing so much about . Decided to get The Peacemaker: was NOT disappointed! It was freaking amazing! The onion rings were only aright; my girlfriends cheesy grits were spectacular though. Might have to stop by for desert before we leave .

Came here for brunch w 5 others. We weren't tended to right away which was kind of annoying bc it seemed like there were several people down there that could've helped us but anyway we were eventually seated upstairs which we didn't mind. Our server Chance was probably one of the best servers I've had. My friends did the bottomless mimosas and I swear their glasses were never empty at any point...

For food we started off w deviled eggs, Brussels sprouts, duck fat fries, and fried oysters w pork belly. No complaints with any of the appetizers we got. Everything was seasoned well and the garlic aioli the fries and Brussels sprouts come w...SO good. For my entree I got the fried duck and cornbread waffles omfg the duck was so juicy and a lil spicy. Loved that they blow torch the rosemary it comes w and the rosemary infused gravy was amazing as well.
Insanely amazing, all the way around. Service, drinks, appetizers and dinner? Gulf shrimp, okra, cheesy grits? The best meal my husband and I have ever had. Izzy, our server was AMAZING. Go now.
For a bakery they didn't have any baked goods!  This was our first time eating out since Covid and it was a big disappointment

They are still open and fully stocked during this pandemic! :) Stopped by on a Saturday mid-day and they had everything. The lady who helped me at the counter was very friendly. She informed me what pastries just came out fresh. (Their egg tarts are very popular by the way.)

Other times that I've come here, they've sold out on the pork scallion roll. I was so glad to see they actually had some when I stopped by!! Finally got to taste it and I was not disappointed. The bread is so soft and tasty. It has the light taste of pork and scallion. I honestly expected a little more scallion to be in it, but it still tasted delicious. For those not familiar with this kind of roll, forewarning to those who don't like mayonnaise: it has a mayonnaise-like spread inside. I personally think it enhances the roll.

I also tried their roast pork bun for the first time. Do not miss out on this if you like roast pork !! This is a great combination of sweet and salty. The bun itself has the sweet topping and it's filled with the roast pork inside. I regret not buying more than one, especially because it's so affordable. :(

If you're looking for some cheap and delicious asian pastries, definitely stop by here and check out what they have. I'll have to try their desserts next!

Reno location-- poor ...It's not the food, it's the service and management.  Last time I went there on July 10, 2021, I walked in at 3:30pm -there was no hostess, just one female waiter. The place had two customers. The rest of the place empty like 50 open tables--yet she informed me it would be a 45 minute wait!! What? She said "we are understaffed and one of the chefs just quit!"   Ok I said then put a closed sign on the door and reopen when you get your S... together!  For a well known chain, this is just horrible management!
The coffee and pastries are excellent. The staff is friendly. The location is very clean. Great decor. The only down side is parking is limited in the area.

The best breakfast in Santa Barbara. The bacon is perfect, the breakfast sandwiches were gourmet with carefully crafted ingredients that explode in your mouth. The biscuits are enormous with homemade lavender jam. We came for breakfast two days in a row because it was so good! The staff was so friendly and helpful.
Good homemade  ice cream.  You can really taste the natural flavors. Blueberry cheese cake was very good. All in all, great ice cream!

The hostess greeted us warmly, but the waiter treated us so cold that he completely ruined the dinner. When we ask him questioned about the rolls, he answered with unmistakable contempt, very short and quick answer, no smile, aloof. We were shocked. We won't come back.

I do not understand the 5 star reviews. We really wanted to love this place. The restaurant is beautiful and the concept is admirable. However the food is very disappointing. 
We started with shishito peppers which turned out to be the best of what we had tonight. Good but not so great I would return just for that. We had the tuna tartar which had a decent flavor but was warm and chopped up so much that one would wonder if they were trying to hide that they were using poor quality tuna. Imagine room temperature cat food on top of warm rice cake. The whole thing did not work. 
Then to the entree. The steak was good but salty. The spicy crab pasta which is their signature dish came out cold and way after the steak. When we told the waiter it was cool, we were told it was because the noodle was rinsed and would never be piping hot. I'm sorry but a bit warmer than cold doesn't cut it. This was also very salty and I was told it was because I asked for spicy and they added chili sauce. Really?  The chef does not know how to make things spicier without making it so salty you can't eat?  So to save time and by this point my husband had already finished his steak so I asked for some plain hot noodles to be added. 
They brought some dumplings while waiting which was a nice touch but please don't bother ordering. They are less than tasty. 

Finally the noodles came out and they added garlic butter which made the plain pasta salty again. JAPANESE FOOD DOES NOT HAVE TO BE SALTY. 
By now we were ready to get out of this pretentious place. The bill came out and they had charged us 14 for the noodles. So they charged 26 for salty lukewarm entree that was not edible as it was, then charged 14 more for what I had hoped to be warm plain noodles. So basically we were asked to pay 40 for a mediocre dish. We complained and they took it off the bill but that should have never happened. 

My prediction is that the place would not survive if they do not improve the quality of their food. You cannot survive on looks and cool vibe alone.

Absolutely amazing. The service was great. Every server we had was so friendly. The wine was delicious. The French shallot soup was out of this world, and the best I have ever had. I got the mushroom pasta with shrimp, the small portion was perfect. I have 0 complaints. We even made reservations for the wrong night and didn't realize till the last minute. We called and they managed to work us in. I was in town visiting a friend, but when I am back I will definitely be coming again. My friends I'm visiting will definitely be returning.

I went here this past Friday might for food. They have a simple and straight forward menu, which my group loved. We ordered a few apps (onion rings, fried pickles, cheese fries). Be aware their portions are HUGE. Which isn't a big deal for most people but it was for me. 

Overall, I liked the food. I just wish I would've known the portions were so large. Most of the meals can be split between two people if you have a small appetite like me. The etouffee is OFF the chain! The fried pickles great! The gumbo is rather basic in comparison to the etouffee.

The only reason I am giving this 4 stars is because of the saltiness. The food was hella salty. Good but too salty for me.

I can't believe what a truly terrible experience this was all the way around. I am still reeling over the awful brunch my fiance and I has this afternoon. The fish dish was entirely flavorless, "charcuterie" salad was basically uncooked bacon that was slimy and cold and the deviled eggs were so bad, I ended up coming home and making my own. To make matters worse, the place was crawling with bachelorette parties which totally crunched the vibe and when the manager did come by and basically made me explain why I wasn't eating the salad, he didn't even bother to apologize. Instead he said "oh, you don't like MY pork?!"... I was blown away after having that experience discussing it, he didn't even bother to take it off the bill or bring over a glass of champs to apologize, as it was flowing down the gullets (for $20 bottomless) of everyone in the joint. Extremely overpriced for the less-than-flavorful experience and wouldnt come back after that. Oh yeah, and the waiter tipped himself 20%, which is typically what I would tip except sort of presumtive considering we went without waters or drinks for long lulls and watched a beer sit at the bar for over ten minutes. So watch the tab process. Or take my word and just don't go. There's too many other good restaurants in New Orleana.

This place was amazing!! The ambiance was amazing. We sat at the bar because we didn't have reservations. The craw fish beignet were top tier and so filling. The chicken sandwich was probably one of the best we have ever had. Also enjoyed the mushroom pasta. The bartender was amazing.

Yummy yummy in my tummy. Bibimbap so delicious, give me more chances to eat these dishes. Veggie, tofu, chicken or beef; dang these bowls good beyond belief. The veggie pancake is worth a taste, get over there and try it, make haste.

My Movie Club (6 women of a certain age!) dine here every month after movie at Plaza Frontenac. The service is excellent, and menu offers everything from wraps and salads to dinner entrees at reasonable prices. Comfortable place to visit with friends without feeling rushed.  A nice neighborhood choice for good food in quiet, but casual, atmosphere.

We were all in the mood for good seafood and Doc Magrogan's did not let us down!

We ordered the calamari, New England chowder, and fresh Oysters for appetizers. The chowder was one of the best I've tasted- ranking among those tried in Boston. As for the main course, we ordered the lobster roll with fries and Oyster Po Boy with fries. Both were delicious! 

The service was great. Also, the atmosphere was very relaxing in the outside seating and we were able to enjoy the food in beautiful weather. 

The only downside would be the dessert. They only had various mousses to offer. I was hoping for other dessert items other than mousses.
We had an wonderful lunch outing today. This Denny's location always has great service, their facility is clean, and the food is always cooked to perfection.

What a gem!!  Our rehearsal dinner was nearly half of our wedding guests and so finding a place that could accommodate and be reasonable was a challenge around St Pete Beach- until I happened upon The Pearl! 

Catherine was wonderful to work with, worked in our budget, put together a wonderful menu and checked in on our party constantly.

Our guest count was between 35-40 and we hit 42, which was not a problem at all with The Pearl. it worked perfectly as my husband and I got a table for two so we didn't have to pick where to sit!  the room was separate and very comfortable for our amount of guests. it was great for us- and the rest of the patrons- to have our own space. 

The service was excellent- as mentioned Catherine came in so many times to make sure all was going well and the rest of the staff did great with the big loud crowd- even having our dinner covered by my FiL and drinks on their own tabs. 

The food- delicious!!!  Everyone raved about the dishes they had- all starting off with a nice salad with a tasty vinaigrette and house rolls. 

The selections were a petit filet with a bordelaise sauce- cooked perfectly and cut like butter. There was salmon which was tasty and had a great lemon dill sauce. Chicken with saffron lemon sauce and Mediterranean pasta rounded out the menu. I ordered the filet which was great, my husband had the pasta which was cooked al dente and had great veggies, and we managed to sample all other dishes. 

We will definitely return- minus the 40 additional people!  So for dinner or a group, I highly recommend The Pearl.
The manager Emilio cut us off after 1 beer. Stay away from this place. Food was decent, but told us we could only order 1 beer.  Terrible place to stop after a Pacer game.

Great concept but needs some work for sure. 
1) The menu is insanely expensive. Our sandwiches were pretty basic and came with zero sides--on average, a sandwich costs $15. I should have just ordered off the kids menu which at least includes fries. 

2) Tables by the play area are only high tops. This means the chairs are too high for small children to comfortably and safely sit. Babies in high chairs look absurd as they are so low compared to the adults and thus don't have any table surface for eating. 

3) Service needs help. The waitress wasn't familiar with the menu and then messed up my order. 

4) Play area is pretty cool. Definitely much better for walking kids who need less supervision. 

All in all, it's promising. I won't be running back but it's better than nothing. The space is large so I hope they come up with creative events,
revisit the menu, and rethink some of the table choices.
Service and atmosphere are great but the food was awful! We ordered several cold/hot options and all left hungry and disappointed. Definitely not worth the price!
Nailed it. Great breakfast spot and super cute. I loved our visit here. Everything was taste. I want to come back again and try the other things on the menu.

Met my cousin here tonight for dinner. We got seated and waited on right away, we started with a glass of wine, she had Cabernet and I had a pinot gregio. I ordered the lasagna and my cousin had the pepperloin with salad and baked potato. Of course the pepperloin was cooked to perfection.  She said the Caeser salad was good.  My lasagna was really good, it was a huge piece, ended up taking some home for lunch tomorrow, great flavor lots of meat/Italian sausage throughout, and we were served bread and butter with our meal also.  For years the food at Tony's has always been top notch and this meal was no exception. Of course I'll be back.

We were in town for the Saints/Cowboys game so of course French Quarter was crowded. This was not our first choice, but the wait was too long. We decided to try Mahony's, the service was great and so was the food . I had the reddish, and hubby had the fried shrimp platter, both were delicious. The fried shrimp reminded me of the shrimp I fry at home, and the cornbread was awesome. We will definitely return.
Great Sunday Brunch with the best service! Our waiter was attentive and the food was delicious.
I yelped a lot of places to visit in Nashville and definitely enjoyed going to Mike's delicious ice cream please check them out when you in town

I love its atmosphere! It was stylish. I had a cup of ice moca and one chocolate croissant, which were delicious! I sat near the outside, but it was nice temperature, so I could focus on my task. I wanna try different dish next time. One thing I wanna demand is I wanna it to clean the desks up because crumb of left tends to be left them.

My complaint drew a wonderful, gracious response from the general manager.  A good apology and a willingness to correct the problem means a lot. Everyone has a bad night. Thanks for being attentive to this customer.

A jewel of a cafe and bakery we found on our last day. Definitely seemed popular with the locals which we try to find whenever we travel. The morning bun was tasty and crispy and the coffee was good. Neat space too.

We stopped in after a day of shopping and our bar tender chance was amazing. He went above and beyond with recommendations about food and wine. He was such a sweetheart. He truly made our day and we hope he does amazing in nursing school. I cannot recommend this establishment more. Such An a amazing time! Chance was just the best!!!!

This is how my experience went..... first I order my drink which took 30 minutes to come, by the time the waitress showed to take my order I had been sitting for almost an hour. It took an additional hour for the food to come, by the time it did I had finished my drink leaving me nothing to have with my meal because it took an additional hour for my second drink to come. By the time my second drink arrived my meal had gotten cold because I was too thirsty to have finished it and was waiting on my second drink to arrive. The only thing that came at a decent time was my check. If you have a lot of time to waste sitting around this is the place for you.

overpriced mediocre food and rude mediocre service. we waited 50 minutes for one of our dishes while the other was delivered after 20 because it was forgotten (had to ask waiter twice). would not go back.

Very cute aesthetic and spaced out tables inside. Cute little patio we didn't sit out on because of incoming rain. Very good happy hour deals. Got a wine flight and beer flight for good price and found one of my new favorite beers! Lavender spritz was really good as was the rose sangria! We were told the debris fries had been recently added to the menu and they should definitely stay because YUM!!! Loved the brussel sprouts, def a big portion to share. Flatbread was nothing special but I really want to go back for a dinner because if the apps were any indication, dinner will be just as good. My waiter was so helpful helping me pick out the drinks I wanted to try

Good enough to go back twice in one trip. 
Sampled the Nutter butter, Tennessee Fudge, Three Berry Sorbet, Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup, and a couple more. 

Ended up going with the Tennessee Fudge and the Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup, but all of them were delicious! I would have been satisfied with any of those flavors!

This place is HORRIBLE. It is so sad how downhill they've gone. The food is not fresh at all, I have no idea how they can call themselves gourmet and the employees do not care that they are giving you a half filled sandwich with week old chicken salad. The kale salad could be sitting there for three days and they would still serve it. The breakfast wraps are served cold and with a microwaved egg. All of the ingredients in the salad bar are not fresh. I am scared to order any of the meat because it looks so suspicious. I don't know how they get away with serving the food that they do and it's unfortunate because the food used to be great, but now I always feel sick after eating here.

I've been on a search for a good, under $20, pasta option for a little while. Bar One isn't it.

     Let's start with what it is, though. Can you go have a beer with your friends, and watch a little of the game? Yes, you definitely can. Do they have a beer list which comparable to other crafty, Philly spots? Yes, definitely. Is it crazy expensive, or crazy crowded? Nope...it's ostensibly a neighborhood bar.

     By no stretch of the imagination is it an Italian restaurant. Frankly, I'm not sure why Bar One even bothers to pretend it is such...perhaps the neighborhood, or proximity to the market...but at any rate, fine Italian cuisine it is not. Excited to try a new spot, stopped in on a brisk Friday in November and, ordered the cavatelli with Gorgonzola sauce and sausage. The most notable issue was that there was no sausage. Strike one. I could not identify the flavor of Gorgonzola in the pale grey sauce either. Let it be know that I love blue cheese, and a little goes a long way with said ingredient; it's a strong flavor. This, however, tasted more like a bland rue. The pasta itself was stuck together in clumps, which made me wonder how it was prepared...pasta doesn't do that in a sauté pan.  It was thoroughly underwhelming. 

    It's also worth mentioning the staff...or at least one bartender.  My gent was fine. He seemed to have a little trouble getting around, but was courteous enough, and managed my order with no issues. There was another, much ruder, gent who spent the evening - or at least the time that I was there - trying to recruit customers into belittling the other bartender (the one serving me). "Can you believe he has a degree in music?!?!...in MUSIC?", he asked me with his absurd Thomas Shelby haircut and manicured beard. "Who does that?!?", he continued in his effort to impress himself. I absolutely did not take the bait; nor did most of the other customers, in what I can only expect was everyone trying to extend common kindness to a man just trying to do his job. 

     Let's have a reality check here. 1. Publicly belittling others lacks both character and professionalism. Full stop. 2. I have a degree in music, and what has been (so far, thanks be to God) a lasting & rewarding career in the Arts. So, what was meant only as unnecessary posturing between staff members, deeply offended your clientele. I chose not to engage the argument, because that is in no way what I'm looking for in a dinning experience...an argument with an arrogant, yet poorly-informed bartender. The phrase "service industry" springs to mind...SERVICE...since we like to repeat ourselves. In conclusion, the food was edible but not good; yet it was the utter pretension of Mr. Shelby which will ensure that I will neither spend another singular dollar, nor recommend Bar One to any of my friends or readers. #Service

Trying to satisfy that perfect level of garlicky and just the right consistency white pizza craving... just when i thought I might strike out, I struck gold.  The only problem is it's the perfect size to eat it all...

1st. time here for lunch, . The hostess & waitress was very good, I was seated in the area I asked for, waitress was on point. I got excited to see chicken & waffles on the menu so I ordered it. It came with 1 large waffle & 6 small chicken strips looked good, it went down hill from their, the chicken strips was a half chicken breast cut into small strips noooooo.. seasoning not even salt, the waffle outside was nice and brown & hot the inside was ice cold it is served with a to-go pack of syrup (McDonalds type) the cost is $10.00. sent it back & ordered something else. I have been waiting 15 minutes and the manger have not come to speak to me. I opted to order  the stuffed catfish... O my it's frozen fish or Swai not LA/ MS or no other fresh catfish it's awful. I'm out of here & will never return. I arrived @ 1:00 and the place have 3 other guest. Let that be a Red flag. Don't open a new restaurant and think the community will accept poor quality food.

Super cute bakery and breakfast spot in the funk town district of SB. They have a super open indoor area as well as a great patio area with outdoor seating. Their pastries all looked amazing but we went with the blueberry lemon scone (cinnamon roll was a close contender) to start and it was up there with the best scones I've ever had. There were actual blueberries inside and it was fluffy with a hard outside, 5/5. For our meals I got the yogurt bowl with blueberries and their homemade granola which I was a huge fan of! It was also a pretty hearty bowl so was filling. My friend got the avocado toast which was also delicious, fluffy bread with feta cheese and a good portion of avocado. Overall, great ambiance and loved all the food we tried!
Love Tony's!  Great food and service.  Love it!  Pepper loin is my favorite.  Great ceaser salad.  It's a family favorite for us.

Amazing service great bottomless options and THE FOOD omg so good.  Took a little while to have the food come out but the sangria and mimosas were great and everyone loved the food. And not an understatement the food was amazing definitely worth checking out

This place is always busy on Broadway. It is open late and has a large selection of ice cream. Mike's also serves hot chocolate and pretty good coffee. I had a latte with a gorgeous design. The latte was really good. This is the perfect place to get warm with a cup of joe in the cool months or get cool with ice cream in the warm months. The staff is super friendly and this is a great place to strike up a chat with out of towners.

Buffalo Mac!!! Need I say more? 

Okay... their other food is delicious too!

Beer is cold, atmosphere is pleasant and the staff are super nice!

Buffalo Mac with grilled chicken is the bomb!

Did I mention the Buffalo Mac???

The lines are super crazy long, all the time. The smoothie I got was really good but the men who made it didn't seem to be in a good mood. The line is out the door at all hours of the day so just a fair warning! The ice cream flavors are super eclectic and there's always something to choose from.
Beautiful space with great unique eats and coffee. Will definitely be back. The salad was fantastic. Beautiful, fresh coffee. Had a great chat with one of the staff members. Bravo.

Best dining experience we had the whole trip... and the night before, we went to Restaurant R'evolution! 

Charles is by far the best waiter in New Orleans. Forget the 3 waiter system at Commander's Palace and the like... Charles is the real MVP!

Get the fried green tomatoes (sliced thin, perfectly seasoned, and lightly fried)! The pot roast po-boy was excellent.

I give the food 4+ stars, and the service a 3 at best. The vibe is as inauthentic as a Bubba Gump's, and the whole dining experience is just a cut above high-end fast food. The food was delicious however, so if you don't care about a milquetoast atmosphere and just want to get on with your evening then this place will work for you.

If you're a tourist and spending the weekend in Santa Barbara, I'd recommend to give this place a go for sure. If you're a local, then not so much.
